Reviews: Love the "CHEERS"  everybody knows your name type feel you get when first walking in, but it seemed that you had to be a regular in order to get quality service.  I'll admit, they do have some unique, creative meals thrown together like the Bacon Popcorn and a good variety of items to choose from. We tried the Handcut Fries, which comes with an assortment of dipping sauce (wasn't to fond of, couldn't taste a difference), the Shrimp Po' Boy (basic ingredients but very tasty!) and the Gumbo (a little bland).  Overall the food was mediocre, if I lived a little closer I could see myself returning to visit the bar and maybe try the burgers.  They also do have a couple of flat screens setup around the bar to catch the game.

We found this place while trying to eat at the Rum house next door and decided we didn't want to wait 45 minutes for a table. So glad we did. It was hard to choose from the menu because everything sounded so good. I ended up with the salmon and it was perfect. The cherry bread pudding was pretty yummy as well.

Not our first time at this long time, well known location, previously The Striped Bass, but first time to Butcher and Singer.  Still truly a special decor to enjoy a delicious dinner. Surprised it wasn't busier for a Friday night, but still somewhat early, 7:00. From start to finish, we couldn't have been more satisfied. Without a reservation, the hostess happily greeted us and we were seated immediately. Awesome and efficient service. Two steaks could not have been better. Although a lot of competition in the city for steak houses. For embiance, service and great food this is hard to beat.

Went in last night it was the first time we have been in since the renovations and it looks great! Our server was very sweet and attentive. Food took a little long but we ordered a lot of food so I'm not going to take a star off for that! The best thing is I left my receipt and needed it for a budget and the bartender personally sent me my receipt while I was on the phone with her after she tracked down where we sat and who took care of us. I'll come back repeatedly for this reason. Thanks ladies for doing such a great job!

In all fairness, this place is good for a certain kind of diner and customer. If you like a party, a loud atmosphere and drinking--you will probably rate it much higher. That said, the food wasn't great. Again, if you like heavy, greasy, deep fried food--you may like it more. I went with spouse and a friend on a night when the place was hosting a live talk-radio show. It was insanely loud, and very dark. The waitress had to bend down so she could be heard. I don't get what's so wonderful about not being able to talk because a restaurant is SO loud. Anyway, the cornbread was good. The hush puppies were overcooked, the jambalaya was serviceable, and my salad had sand (or sandy dirt) in it. There was nothing relaxing or satisfying about the experience. If you dislike loud restaurants and overrated food (especially if you are from the Louisiana area) avoid this place. Why it is has such high ratings is a bit of a mystery but I suspect it's the type of cuisine and bar scene combined...plus there aren't many (or any?) other Cajun options in Tucson. Maybe we just went on a bad night in the kitchen, exacerbated by coerced listening to talk radio.

Oh scratch biscuits.. We tried this relationship out twice and twice you've betrayed me. We came when you first opened and the food was good! But there was serious issues with your workflow. We attributed that to growing pains.

We return today to find exceptionally dry biscuits, topped with extra dry and under-seasoned brisket. I'll give you the one star for the fried chicken. The fried chicken was good, but again, the biscuit made it tough to eat. We also ordered the "demolished" yam fries. I can't believe we spent an extra $3 for a small dollop of pimento cheese. 

I was really looking forward to your banana pudding but there wasn't any available.

This visit made me very sad. I really wanted this to work out between us.

Been to this place twice and had fun both times. 75 cent high life is something you can argue with. Even though there's not much seating in the front, I ended up at a table both times and the waitress that served us was very friendly and fast. The DJ was good enough and kept our crowd moving and the night going. The crowd is definitely college-aged, but nothing seems too rowdy ever (aka it doesn't seem like a frat party). I'd recommend it.

Ok, I admit...I got really excited to go here after seeing it on Diners, Drive Ins, and Dives.  Seeing the show was actually a blessing, because I would have never ordered cheesesteak empanadas had I not seen how awesome they were.  What really makes them amazing is the flying fish sauce that comes with.  Heaven.

After watching several amazing-looking Good Dog burgers come out of the kitchen, I finally decided to try one.  I was so disappointed!  The burger was really really dry and did not live up to my expectations at all.  So sad.

The menu does look really interesting and I would definitely go back to try more things.   Something good/intriguing about a place that's dark inside 24 hrs a day with at least a few people posted up at the bar by 11:00am...with dog photos all over the walls...and a simultaneous tattooed hipster vibe...

I usually don't review chain restaurants but I've been curious about Joe's Crab Shack after seeing countless commercials on TV so I was a bit excited to try it out.  I LOVE seafood & sometimes I make the journey from Philly to DC just for some good crabs so I ventured into Joe's not knowing what to expect.

The wait is long!  It seems to always be crowded there - they text you when your table is ready.  I do think they need to reconsider their brand image bc their decor just seemed off to me.  When you walk in, it has a big open fish market feel w/ cafeteria style seating but then a moderately fancy bar?  ehh I dont get it.

Waiter -- super friendly.  He suggested their sampler appetizer which mehh I don't recommend.  Crab dip, crab jalapeno poppers, & calamari -- not impressive.  Joe's offers individual steamed pots full of an assortment of crabs, lobsters, clams, mussels etc depending on which one you choose.  They look huge on the menu but I suppose in the good old American way -- one person can def devour one if they were hungry.  

The 2 of us ordered the Sam Adams & Diablo pot.  Sam Adams -- too salty but the Diablo - nom nom good!  It's quite satisfying to have this giant pot full of steaming good seafood in front of you.  

You may not beat my beloved Maryland crab shacks but you're not bad Joe's.

I decided to go to this place for lunch after reading so many rave reviews. I'm not sure if it was what they were serving that day, or if it's just me, but I was very disappointed!!! The fried chicken was very good, but the sides and desserts were bland, and reminded me of a cafeteria for geriatrics. The guy that runs the place is Italian, so I would expect a lot more flavor! The mac n cheese was watery (didn't eat it at all), the green beans were ok, and the mashed potatoes and gravy were pretty good. Everything needed salt and pepper, which I don't normally add extra to anything. The rolls that they serve are delicious, and the fruit tea is on point!!! I think the meat and drinks are good, but the sides could use some improvements. I will definitely visit this place again to see if I just hit it on a bad day. :)

This place was fantastic.

We went because my husband was craving a burger, and I wanted to try a local, non-chain restaurant.  What a wonderful surprise!

The best part of the place was the amazing service we received.  Our waiter was constantly checking on us (in a non-obnoxious way) and refilling drinks.  More impressively, the owner came to our table multiple times, remembered our names, and even comped us dessert.

I had the fried pork chop sandwich, and it was wonderful.  I went with the super spicy sauce, which had the right amount of kick for me.  Apparently most people find it too spicy, so even after the waiter insisted that I order the sauce on the side, the owner came out to make sure that I didn't want to switch to the normal spicy sauce.  Whatever.  Oh, the fries were perfectly crisp, and I loved the spices.

My husband had his cheeseburger, and he enjoyed it.  He had a cup of chili instead of fries, and he said that he'd happily order it again.

As I mentioned above, dessert was on the house.  The owner insisted that we try the orangesicle cheesecake, which tasted very orange-y and rich.  It was great (if you love oranges -- and I do), but next time, I want to try the neapolitan cheesecake.

The homemade chips and ranch dip were phenomenally simple yet tasty.  I'd go back to EATS again just for the chips and a beer.  But, of course, then I'd want the cheesecake.  And a fried pork sandwich.  

Oh, be forewarned: on Tuesdays, kids eat free, so Tuesdays are crowded with kids.  That might or might not be a positive in your book.

My boyfriend and I decided to have our date night here. To be honest, I was not expecting much. However when we went in we were immediately greeted and seated. The waitress Rachel, she was AMAZING!!! She was social and attentive to what we needed! I got the burger and I LOVED it! It was cooked correctly and was very juicy. My boyfriend got the pepper jack pasta.. it was delicious! Everything was amazing here and we will be coming back here again. - Krystel H.

Nom nom nom.  I didn't even care that the service was slow on a packed Saturday during football season because my wings were so good.  I love wings, but somehow I'd never been to Ale Emporium.  Huge miss now corrected.  I tried the hottest sauce available, and while it wasn't super hot for this heat seeker, the wings were huge, crisp, and flavorful.  Great beer selection (Quaff On Strawberry Blonde!) and a friendly staff... we'll be back when we're up for a drive or need a spot with amazing TVs.

I wanted to like this place- so much. The coffee is good (roasted in house), the food- great  , the staff helpful (they show you how to slow drip your own coffee), alas, there is a "limit" to how long they let you use their wi-fi. My main reason for going to coffee shops? To work. I was almost finished with a blog post and the Internet was disconnected. All my work- gone. The barista told me there was nothing he could do, there was an automatic limit for the wifi password to prevent people from sitting there all day without buying anything. I bought coffee AND food, and I was about to buy more coffee!!!! Now I'm leaving, and I won't return. What's the point? And it's not like the place was packed. There was hardly anyone in there. Way to go Roast. You lost a potential loyal customer. I'll be hanging and working at (and promoting) The Well instead...

This is one of my absolute favorite places. This is a staple in the West side of Indianapolis.  From the food to the drinks and the live band, it is a entire mood and sets the atmosphere.  On a nice day it is absolutely beautiful to sit outside on the deck.  If you are a seafood lover I definitely recommend Rick's.  I've tried several items on the menu and have not yet been disappointed.  It's a great venue for private events as well.  A friendly staff and great food go a long way with me.  I'm also a lover of live bands and music.  So that is just the icing on the cake!

Have-A-Burger is consistently delicious. Even when I order delivery through GrubHub, the burgers are still awesome and hold up really well. I get the Philly Burger with cheese whiz and fried onions and am never disappointed- fries are great too. A very solid fast food style burger!

Went there for dinner Friday night after getting into the city. The staff was incredible. A definite compliment to the incredible food we ate. Watch out for the pineapple infused cosmos..they pack a punch but go down very smooth.

it was our 1st time and had made reservations got to check in the Host said we were 11 minutes early so okay we can wait...but at 6:30 after 2 walk up parties got seated we ask the Hostess if our table was ready. She took us to our table but still went to check to see if it was ours (it was). Our waiter promptly came over took our drink orders ( loved my Bloody Mary) then when he came back with our drinks we ordered food. It took a while for our dinner and when the gentleman delivered it we ask to see our waiter (needed more drinks) i had the Pork Shank which was so so so good and husband had Short Ribs said they were really good. We look forward to going there again as i noticed a lot of good food coming out of the kitchen, and when it gets warmer we will eat outside. My husband loves planes and really enjoyed watching them.

How have I not reviewed this!? Been here a couple times. Amazing happy hour, draft beer selection, and food. Get the chicken fingers!!! The wings are good but occasionally they mess up the sauces (we ordered hot and it was not hot at all) but the chicken fingers are huge and so tender and delicious. 

Also good - jalapeno poppers, irish fries (loaded with cheese, sour cream, bacon).

They have 2 full service bars and a takeout area. And the service is always great!

I have tried a good amount of there menu and I've never been dissatisfied with anything I've ordered. I dunno how people can rate this place poorly based on the wait. I'm pretty sure that if the food wasn't good people wouldn't be waiting an hour or more to get a seat. No matter what location you go to your gonna have a wait especially in the KOP mall because of its popularity. 
Personal favorites would be the Shepard's pie, chicken and biscuits, factory nachos with spicy chicken and the pork tenderloin! Desert favorites are the Original cheese cake with strawberry's and the Chocolate Truffle cake. Both are to die for.
The Cheesecake Factory is good for any occasions especially after walking abound the KOP mall all day.

I'm always raving or talking about this place. So, one of my friends who had never been with me made reservations.

We sat inside, because it was quite humid out. Our host/waiter gave us the option of outside, inside, upstairs.

One of the things I love about eating out is bread and butter. Because really how often do you eat bread and butter at home?

We shared the pate maison, which if you love pate like me it could easily be a dinner in itself. It comes with cornichons and toasted baguette, because you really can't have pate without cornichons. It's like apple pie without ice cream. The waiter and I gushed about the pate he told me he had it for dinner!

Next the fresh crab salad. Luscious lumps of crab and grapefruit dotted the salad. It was divine. It's a seasonal salad so go quick!

We shared an order of the Chicken Dijon which I have been eating there for years. I love the perfectly cooked chicken and the amazing mustard sauce. I could eat it once a week and never tire of it! What was great is that they sent it out on two plates since we were sharing! They served it with mashed potatoes and the most wonderfully cooked mustard or collard greens. Yum

Their desserts are all made in house. She had the chocolate mousse pie, (which is great to know they make since White Dog is now owned by Moshulu and I refuse to go there!) which was rich and lovely and too big to finish. I had the creme brulee....i love creme brulee and order it wherever I go. 

What I love most about FriSatSun is I always go knowing I will get great food and service.

What a find!  We stayed in Ozona for vacation and our host said that Ozona Blue was just down the street.  We started going there in the late PM for apps and to listen to music.  The food is outstanding, try the flat breads, they're amazing.  Service is very friendly and prompt and you can't beat the atmosphere.  It's one of those places where you never have a bad experience.  You'll love it.
Service was excellent.  Food was yummy.  Food was nice and warm.  Love returning to this place.  I got my Axxess discount.  Definitely returning and taking my friends here in the future.

I was in the drive through at 8:45 pm.  They close at 9pm.  The vehicle in front of me ordered and drove to the window to get their food. I had 2 cars behind me waiting.  The KFC employee came over the speaker and told me that they were now closed. OMG !!!  How lazy are people these days ?  Worst KFC ever !!

I'll be brief and get straight to the point. My girlfriend and I shared the halibut, burger and polenta fries. They were all delicious and I would highly recommend them. We also had a couple cocktails that were terrific (unique and well made). We sat at the bar and both bartenders were very helpful and attentive. The atmosphere, decor, service and food are all top notch. It was evident that the front of the house was bit disorganized, but they had opened just 2 weeks prior so I assume that they have worked out the kinks by now. 

You would be remiss for not visiting this establishment for a meal and/or drinks.

Our spring vacation last year was to Nashville Tennessee where I got to try some of the local, authentic favorites for Nashville Hot Chicken. Since I always put tabasco or some kind of hot sauce on fried chicken anyway, I was in love with the idea as soon as I heard about it.

While there are plenty of places around Indy that serve great fried chicken, I usually have to bring my own hot sauce with me. So I was really excited to hear that we're getting our own branch of a proper southern chain. And Joella's Indy location didn't disappoint.

Of course, the main interest is the hot chicken. While not quite as flavorful as Hattie B's in Nashville, it was darn good. I got the "Hot" level, and even my well-seasoned palette could feel some burn. If you're not into spice, keep the heat level low. But I love spice and was pleasantly surprised to find that the Hot was actually hot. And the chicken itself was juicy and well fried.

The garlic parm fries were a little weaker. They're about the size of cut of Steak N Shake fries with big chunks of parm sprinkled on top. Good but not amazing. The vinegar slaw was pretty tasty, though, and I'm looking forward to taking my southern wife with me to see what she thinks.

Wait time wasn't bad at all for me--not for fresh made chicken. The staff were well organized and got my food right out to me. I was really happy with the service I received.

If you want some real spice and good chicken, I'd give Joella's a try. It's not quite up there with the best of the best in Nashville, but it's darn good!

We came by with our ladies lunch box club. We had not been here before but were quickly seated and given menus. I had half Roys Benedict and cheese grits. I enjoyed it. We also had half sandwich and Barley soup, she enjoyed it also. One other person had half salad which she thought was good. 
The restaurant was not too busy and our waitress was pretty attentive. Overall it was good, we may stop by if in the area.
Great place to eat with reasonable prices. Had great service and a delicious  Racy Tracy omelette. Bringing my dad from Las Vegas next time I go.
Not the best Wingstop that I've have ever been to. Customer service isn't the best either. Make sure you check your order before leaving they tend to mess things up from time to time.

My oldest daughter treated us to a lovely dinner here last week.  I have to say, I thought it was definitely NOT average.  By the time I had wolfed down a couple pieces of their awesome caramelized onion and rosemary bread with a yummy cheesy garlic olive oil dip, and my "Not Your Average House Salad" - (an absolutely wonderful salad with roasted tomatoes, blue cheese and a tangy lemon dressing), I was sold.  At that point, I had decided that Joe's was gonna be the kind of place where I would have a hard time not licking my plate!

My entrée - the Cranberry-Teriyaki Statler Chicken (pan-roasted chicken with house-made butternut squash ricotta cannelloni and sautéed spinach) - was very good, although the chicken was a bit dry but the tasty sauce made up for that.  The cannelloni was delicious and perfectly cooked, not to mention filling.  The spinach - well, it was good but there wasn't a whole lot of it.  I love spinach so I could have used more of that on the plate.  Overall though - an A+.  My family enjoyed their entrees as well - Sirloin Tips, Sage Pecan Salmon, Chicken Piccata, Spaghetti Squash Bolognese).

The service was good although we did wait quite a while for entrees, but I'm pretty sure that wasn't our waiter's fault, and the second basket of bread helped hold us off.  

Would love to go back soon just to have that bread and salad again and try out some of their appetizers.  Will have to start working on the hubby for that.  It's a bit on the pricey side for us, so I am gonna have to do some sweet-talking for sure.

Overall, it was a wonderful treat for us.  I'm glad my daughter introduced us to the place :)

The food is extremely mediocre.  It looks edible, yet it's still highly bland.  It went from hot to cold within 2 minutes, which means it's actually all microwaved.  Unfortunately I couldn't say I enjoyed it at all.

My friends and I came here for brunch and there was a 40-minute wait. We got the king cake (of course!) and some coffee at the bakery section while we were waiting. The king cake was delicious and I wish we had gotten a bigger slice to share while we were waiting but oh well.

We all ordered the mimosa bar to celebrate my friend's bachelorette party and that was super cute. We also each ordered our own entrees: shrimp and grits, hangover bowl, artichoke dip, boudin biscuit, the chicken and biscuit and the croque madame toast. The portions were huge and the food was definitely filling. The flavor was good, but after multiple bites, the shrimp and grits, artichoke dip and hangover bowl became too salty and the toast was a bit bland. The boudin and biscuit was a good flavor and filling so my friend wasn't able to finish that and had to ask for to-go. 

Service was not the greatest. The hostess was not friendly when we checked in and our waiter seemed exasperated with us whenever we asked for something and wasn't friendly at all. When we asked for to-go boxes, he only gave us the boxes while he had previously offered to pack up the leftovers for the table next to ours. Not sure what was going on but it left a bad impression after we all left.
Went for Sunday brunch the other day. I got their breakfast burrito and it was absolutely delicious! They coffee was decent and the staff were pleasant.

We wanted to try out Bar Louie's $5 Burger Tuesdays, and we were not disappointed at the Bellevue location. It seems like this particular place has several regulars, but we didn't have trouble finding a table at peak dining hours around 6-7pm. We decided to opt for porch seating, but I recommend dining inside if you don't appreciate the bright street lights. The manager was kind enough to move a gigantic umbrella our way to block out most of the brightness, but just a note if you want to avoid the hassle. 

The food came out really quickly, and we began with their spinach and artichoke dip. While the chips were pretty flimsy for the hearty dip, the creamy richness of the sauce certainly made up for the tortilla chip vessels. I ordered the gastroburger which has caramelized onions, queso, provolone, and a garlic aioli. It was delicious but extremely heavy. I also don't think the kitchen cooked the burger as I specified, but the well done burger I had was still pretty good. 

I would come here if I as pressed for time, as the staff seemed to be adept at navigating large parties with several orders in rotation. There's also plenty of parking at this outdoor shopping center, so you shouldn't struggle with finding a spot before going to this location for dinner.

My new favorite breakfast spot! Food is great! Big selection and good prices. We've order a couple times at work and everyone has been happy with it. Highly recommend you try it! I'm looking forward to trying their lunch menu!
My fish tacos were solid - fish was not offensive but undistinguished. tried a few veggie dumplings that were OK as well. ambience is nice.

Again we decided to take our chance and go to the Waterloo IL KFC/Taco Bell and again our experience was disappointing.  How hard is it to complete the order correctly??  We ordered 2 Mexican pizzas, not a small item, we only received one.  If you go to the Columbia IL location it is a world of difference and yet they're separated by 8 miles.  We will never go back to the Waterloo location, we'll drive the 8 miles to Columbia, at least we'll know our food will come out correctly and the tables will be clean, another issue at the Waterloo location.

My boyfriend and I went to Another Broken Egg over the weekend for breakfast. The mimosas were pretty good, and the biscuit beignets were yummy. My entree, however, was not. I love smoked salmon and decided to get the smoked salmon avocado toast on the lighter/sensible fare part of the menu. I've had smoked salmon toast at many other restaurants in the city and have been delighted every time, but this one was awful (and I'm not a picky eater). The bread was soggy, not toasted properly. The "avocado" was just premade guacamole spread on top of the soggy bread. The salmon and capers were on the side, as well as a boiled egg and pickled red onions (I prefer fresh red onion on my avocado toast). The salmon was okay. The pickled onions were not good. I managed two bites before giving up completely- it was that bad. To their credit, the restaurant did take it off my bill, but the dish needs some serious revamping. Also, a note about the layout of the restaurant- in order to order a drink at the bar while waiting, they have you go into the corner of the bar where the servers' computer is also located, as well as silverware, etc, so while waiting for a drink you end up having to shift and rearrange and move every five seconds to accommodate everyone in the space. The bartender was also unusually slow and didn't pay much attention to the people waiting to get their drinks at the end of the bar. I'll probably skip this restaurant next time and go to Ruby Slipper, where the food is always delicious and the service is great.

There is a saying in the restaurant business....

"Great food can save bad service but bad service can't save great food"

After my experience at The Pharmacy, this could not be more true!  Before we get into the details, let me begin by saying, this is a really cool place.  They did a fantastic job with the design and the beer garden is unbelievable.  Great concept that was well executed.

Our party of 11 sat for over 20mins chatting while waiting for a server to approach us to take drink orders. Not a great start.....  Once we finally placed our drink (and food, since we had so much time to look over the menu) orders, the drinks SLOWLY came out.  In all seriousness it had been over 40mins from the time we sat down until the first couple of beers hit the table.  And that is the best part, nothing came out in any sequence.  Literally, 1 and 2 at a time even though all the orders were placed at the same time.  This continued all night, to the point that several of us opened tabs at the bar as well because you were more likely to hit the Powerball than get a drink in less than 30mins.  

The food was great, but please refer to the quote above.  The service was so laughably poor that the great burgers were lost in the shuffle.  Some serious work needs to be done in the FOH service model here.  What a shame.

Went for Happy Hour because Tippler had private event and it was raining. Service at first was attentive--bar was pretty empty for 530 pm. Drink specials were decent--2 for 1
Local beers and assorted 5 dollar well drinks.

Ordered a few of the HH appetizers and things went down hill. Portions were minuscule like two or three bites tops def not possible to share.

To top it off service slowed considerably because of computer issues--not bar staffs fault at all--but still annoying.

Despite a Vandy locale I would rather walk further even in the rain to grab a drink
The food was very good, especially the waffles. Be prepared for a little bit of a wait, there is usually a wait. Could easily be double the size and keep everyone happy.

Absolutely disgusting. We were looking for barbecue which the sign screams. We ordered the pulled pork. It was not smoked simply boiled. They served it with baby Ray's barbecue sauce. I can buy that at the grocery store. The mac & cheese tasted worse than kraft mac & cheese. And the coleslaw was runny. The band was good however the fan base is awful loud obnoxious creepers.

Owner Chef Kevin gets it....great combination of spices, with fresh center of the plate presentation. A BYOB with a warm welcoming atmosphere. Our accomplished server Dean was delightful and his wonderful suggestions were right on....the calamari was absolutely one of my favorites and the mussels and clams ...... Yum yum yum. We finished our awesome dinner with deep fried Oreos .... It doesn't get any better. Thank you Entree for a wonderful evening to share with my wife on her birthday!

We were in town to see Longwood Gardens and stopped here for dinner. It was delicious and we would definitely come again if we were in the area! For appetizers we got the grilled octopus, slow-roasted baby back ribs, and bread. The octopus was cooked well, the ribs were well-seasoned, and the butter that the bread came with was to die for. We split the mushroom pizza which was pretty good. Wish we would have tried the pasta. The lemon bar for dessert was AMAZING. Service was great, definitely recommend!

Eaten here a handful of times. Pretty decent every time. Nice spot for some hearty barbecue. Great ribs and chicken. They have good specials. Really good homemade iced teas and lemonade. Good pricing. The last time we showed up, we didn't know we walked in right before closing. But they kindly served us and we were able to enjoy our meal there without being rushed. And they consistently made sure we were satisfied until the very end! For that, we always come back.

We went to Freddy's today for a low key Mother's Day dinner with Grandma and a few of the little kids.  The shoestring fries are fun and delicious.  The fries have a little bit of seasoning on them and yummy with ketchup.  I didn't see any of the house sauce around so we didn't get to try that.  The chocolate shake was thick and spoon worthy.  It is a little more expensive than your typical fast food joints but this isn't a typical fast food joint.  The cost of three adult meals and one kids meal was over $30.  But because two of us are moms, our meals were comped because it is Mother's Day, bringing the total down to under $15.  I meant to get myself a shake for the ride home but I totally forgot.  I want to go back and try the mint oreo shake!

Management is terrible.  Waited 40 minutes for food with no check in.  Waitress said food was coming up - another 20 minutes I left. Other people were getting up and walking out because they were not even helped.  Table next to me sent 50% of their orders back as food was not cooked properly.  0 star if possible.

Haven't been here in over a year and thought we would give it another try. Very disappointed. Food was bland and overpriced. $17.99 for tilapia dinner which was 3 small tilapia fillets that were overcooked and very bland. Service was rushed and unimpressive. My husband did not enjoy his dinner either.

Because of COVID, I'm going to update my review with some current notes. First, let me say that this is still my favorite beach bar restaurant in the Tampa Bay area. My experience last Friday night was hopefully not indicative of normal service going forward. That aside, all staff wore masks & social distancing was evident.

We arrived on Friday evening, 09/25/2020, around 5:30pm. I was disappointed to see they now have parking meters, instead of a guy collecting $10 to park & giving a coupon to be applied toward food & drinks at Caddy's. Also the meter was a bit confusing so we ended up only paying for an hour, thinking we'd just come back & add more money later. After walking in, the hostess offered to seat us inside downstairs. Hubs asked if the upstairs bar area was open - the hostess advised that it was, and we could seat ourselves. 

We went upstairs & realized the slowly setting sun was rather blinding so we found seats straddling a far corner of the bar, quite a distance away from the other groups clustered around the large square bar. Almost immediately, the bartender came over & admonished us about something, though I couldn't quite hear her above the crowd noise & music. Some of the words I heard: she didn't want us to get in trouble, she'd been a bartender for 18 years, and she asked for our drink order. So we kept our masks on until our drinks arrived, because we weren't sure what she'd yelled at us & she hadn't pointed or given any other non-verbal clues. 

Several minutes later, she asked if we wanted anything else so hubs asked if we could get food there or if we had to go downstairs. She said we could get food, so we ordered the grouper nuggets appetizer to split. After our food came, and we'd been eating for a few minutes, she came over & told us that she had gotten in trouble for us eating at the bar and we had to move away from the bar. So we slid our bar stools back just far enough that we could still reach the bar, since we were still eating & drinking. Right about then, the couple on hubs' side, about 8-10 feet away, had left, and the same bartender waved over to a couple of guys that the spot was open & they could move there. Then they ordered some food. Right after the food arrived, she yelled at them about eating at the bar. One of the guys asked to speak to the manager - she pointed across the deck, and he went over to talk to him. Then he came back & continued to eat his food, without moving his stool. A few minutes later, she told us we weren't supposed to be eating at the bar and reiterated that she'd gotten in trouble. We were so confused at that point, and felt very unwelcome, so we asked for a to-go box & our check, and just left. Side note: the women's bathroom smelled horribly, and I informed the manager on our way out.

I've been to Caddy's so many times over the last 30 years that this one experience will not affect my likelihood of visiting again. However, it was uncomfortable enough that I want to warn my fellow Yelpers. Also, it was my birthday, which we never had a chance to mention in any context, but will be memorable. I still don't know if the bartender was having a bad afternoon, or if Caddy's has some rule(s) in place regarding congregating and/or eating around the upstairs bar. The square bar was huge, maybe 20 feet on each side, with at least 7 separate small groups around the bar, all adequately distanced. Our corner was empty, AND IN THE CORNER, 8+ feet away from any other person, so I'm not sure what we did wrong, if anything, but the whole hour there was simply weird and I regretted not sitting downstairs at a table. Those fried grouper nuggets were outstanding, though.
The food was cold and the service was subpar.  Food was overcooked.  I would never return.  This was a total waste of time.  I was so disappointed.

I was here for brunch and the food was amazing! It's located inside the Omni hotel where I had family staying. Everything was cooked perfectly and tasted delicious. Service was great and the place is open and beautiful. The brunch buffet is worth it, great options.
This is our favorite spot in St. Pete! Great food, live music & cocktails that make you feel like you're in a little paradise! Can't go wrong with the rum runners & blackened mahi

I live nearby and have been going here since it opened under the name Princess Monaco. The garden is beautiful, the food is very good but not excellent, the service is great sometimes and so-so other times. Maybe it was just my party of friends, but we all found the chairs extremely uncomfortable and the tables flimsy. Don't know when they changed, but wish they would go back to the old type. All that said, I will keep going back from time to time just because of the ambiance

Came into it not having any expectations and left full and insanely happy with eating here! Did the grazing experience with my friends and the scallops were literally an 'out of body' experience - keep in mind, this coming from a girl that lives on the cape in MA, can't recommend them enough. Waitstaff was on point.

That, was fun! Admittedly, I went in hopes of simply having an "adult beverage," but their signature burger called out to me. "Nicholas," it said, "don't be sittin' there actin' like you don't wanna wrap yo' lips all around me. C'mon over here and show me some love." Well, I was forced to submit. The vodka martini was dirty and perfect (thank you Paco) and their signature burger was perfectly prepared (medium-well - and I don't wanna hear it) #yumminess for sure. Had hoped to have a Chef Justin Swain sighting, but alas, that did not happen. Maybe next time - after all, I know for sure I'll be back - you know, with that burger calling out to me and all.

Breakfast quesadillas are massive and amazing! Loaded with scrambled eggs, tons of melted cheese bacon and some pico, they are more than a meal; the breakfast quesadillas are a feast! Very tasty too. One order is more than enough for one person and the perfect size for sharing. The great thing about them is that they hold well while you are waiting for your flight in the Nashville airport and you can bring them on the plane if need be.  Nashville airport is notorious for delays and cancelations so if you get stuck, like I have many times, head here for a good bite! They also have a full bar and a good looking lunch menu. The customer service was ok.. I won't say it was bad but I won't say it was stellar.  All in all its a good place to go for tasty food in the Nashville airport terminal.

My first time here was great!! The food is fantastic!! We had the pull pork and it was so good. The service was awesome! The server was extremely friendly and helpful. We will definitely be coming back again!

Finally got to try this place out! The lady, Anita at the counter was awesome! She was super helpful in navigating the menu, even though it was very small and simple. "Cheeseburger" is actually a double cheeseburger. "Little cheeseburger is a single patty. We each settled on a cheeseburger and shared a regular fry. I will say we felt the prices were a little steep for what it was, $7-9 for just the burger, $3-5 for fries alone. The food was really good though. Not as greasy as I expected it to be. There are also two vegetarian options, veggie sandwich and grilled cheese, which is nice. Otherwise, the menu is pretty much burgers and hot dogs, and a blt. They also have shakes. There are peanuts to munch on while you wait for your meal, which doesn't take too long. Check it out!

Great food, nice atmosphere, polite staff. Would return when in town again. 

Good location. Little tricky to find but we kept our eyes open and found it.

I've always been a fan of Emeril (he grew up in the same town as my parents!), and we were excited to try one of his restaurants while in New Orleans. Sadly, NOLA was very disappointing. I got the roasted oysters to start, which didn't have a great flavor - I didn't even finish them all, and there were only five on the plate. For the main (which took ages to come out of the kitchen), I had the "famous" fried chicken, which was a big let-down. The crust was light and had a nice flavor, but flaked off the second I cut into it, and the chicken underneath was either not cooked well or just not good quality chicken. It came with a side of mac & cheese, which you normally can't go wrong with, but these were overly cheesy/creamy/rich, and I could only eat a couple bites. We didn't even bother getting dessert.

The service at NOLA was also slow and impersonal. It felt like they were just going through the motions at a large restaurant. I would highly recommend skipping this place and going to one of the many other great restaurants in New Orleans instead (like Brennan's, where we'd had an amazing meal the night before!). We were only in New Orleans for two days, and I was sad to have wasted one of our few meals on this place.

Me and girlfriend went here as a change from the south meadows pegs and wow what a difference in service. I know this place is busy but so are squeeze in and the other pegs. The service was horrible I ended up waiting 10 mins to order and had to walk and get my own to go box. Go to the other pegs avoid this one

This was such a great find, located at International Plaza. We sat outside on a busy night. We got there just after 9, so it was happy hour. Everything is just about $6, food and drinks.

For drinks, the guava gimlet, it is a must have. I am a sucker for anything guava and this definitely did not disappoint. My husband had the old fashioned, his favorite, which was equally delicious. 

We shared a bunch of small plates. We had the mini local board, the pimento cheese was dangerously good. The hummus and veggies/bread was so flavorful. It wasn't your typical hummus, you can definitely taste the turmeric. We also shared the bacon and egg salad, which was great. 

Last but not least, the whiskey cake. This is my new favorite dessert. It was amazing! The cake was soo delicious and the vanilla whipped cream was amazing. You have to save room, I promise you won't be disappointed.

Came in here on two occassions. Once in the drive-thru and once as a walk-in. The drive-thru was painfully long. Today, I went in and nobody acknowledged me at the door for a few minutes so I tried sitting at the counter. 5 minutes went by and nobody said a word to me so I walked out and went to Qdoba.

The shakes are good, the burgers are okay but you can get decent burgers anywhere. I dont plan on returning unless I have an hour set aside for lunch

This was my first time eating at this Marathon and it was a better foodie experience than at others! Very much enjoyed my Marathon Burger with subbed-in sweet-potato fries. Glad that they're doing reservations for indoors and outdoors seating and, from what I saw while waiting for the rest of my party to arrive, doing a great job enforcing the waitlist/honoring the reservations.

Higher prices, smaller hoagies. 

If you order a meatball hoagie, know that it's $10.49 and you're getting four (4) meatballs. 

Italian diablo (also $10.was pathetic in quantity of meat with no oil or spices as I requested.

This is not the Primo Hoagies of years past. Two stars is generous; I'd give them a one but the cashier was wearing a mask and the place looked to be clean. 

Updated 8/20: based on previous visit I received $10.00 in Primo Rewards.  Ordered two hoagies. Oh, did you know that hoagies are served dry unless you ASK FOR OIL/MAYO? I learned this when I tried ordering online (which incidentally I was unable to complete through no fault of mine).  So I did in fact ask for oil, along with hot cherry pepper spread on one of the hoagies.  No oil, no pepper spread. Hoagies bone dry. So now they get that one star they rightfully deserved all along. 

And to the owner since I know you're reading this: do not call me with another line of BS. Remove me from your text list, too. Let's see if you can do one thing right.

Very quick seating, great service and food was amazing. Would recommend this to anyone traveling through we were not disappointed. The eggs were poached very very well and my son absolutely loved the bacon.

Hey there... just a couple of girls out for a Saturday morning breakfast, enjoying a pancake the size of a hubcap!!  After circling a few times to find a parking spot on a nearby residential street, we finally made it.  Beware.. the parking is a nightmare... and this place is super popular!  Go early!!  Once we parked, the wait was only about 15-20 minutes.  The menu is big and varied, but we were there for breakfast which is served all day (FYI).  My eye kept wandering to the breakfast shrimp & grits, but I opted for the BST Eggs Benedict.  I can't help it... I'm a sucker for all kinds of eggs benedict!  The BST puts the poached eggs on crispy Fried Green Tomatoes instead of an English Muffin, and topped with big, thick bacon crumbles. Seriously delish!!  I got a side of the cheesy grits (creamy, cheesy, and yummy!).   My niece got the corned beef hash, with 2 eggs over easy (perfectly done), (homemade?) sour dough toast, and a side of crispy home fries.  And, of course we had to split a pancake, that was huge and hanging over the edge of the plate!  AHHHHH... breakfast is the best.   BIG SHOUT OUT TO KEVIN, who kept our coffee mugs full!

I agree with previous reviews that this restaurant is sort of in the middle of nothing else.  We waited 35 minutes for a table for lunch, which tells me I'll remember to make a reservation next time before I go.  For appetizer we ordered a tomato basil soup - good; fried calamari - comes with olives and capers, good addition; fig flatbread - glad I tried it but don't think I'll go for it again.  For an entree I ordered a boston bibb salad, nothing really exciting about it except for the toasted walnuts.  My niece ordered a tuna salad - tuna steak and string bean salad, looked good.  My other niece ordered the Italian grilled cheese - grilled cheese on panini bread - the bread was a bit too hard but the chips were delicious!  

It's a place suitable for business meals, and certainly provides a very nice cozy atmosphere for a night out, or a nice lunch.  I'd come back again for sure but won't get the boston bibb salad!

I take people here for shock value more than quality. The food is good, diner quality (including the occasional VERY greasy experience), but the jaw-dropping size of the pancakes makes it worthwhile. Big food is usually not good, but these are as good as any smaller pancake. The place itself isn't the cleanest or brightest. It also gets VERY crowded.

My daughter and I visited during Indy Wing Week.  The atmosphere and decor was nice and open and the service was good, but we were unimpressed with the under-seasoned wings.  I tried the special, Sweet Chili Wings, and my daughter had Buffalo Wings.  Both lacked flavor.  The chicken itself had no salt or pepper, or any seasonings, taste at all.  The sauce was also disappointing.  The Sweet Chili had no heat and the Buffalo was dull.  We'd driven past the place several times and saw them advertising their Crack Fries, so we ordered those, fully loaded.  The fries themselves were reminiscent of Rally's fries....and quite delicious.  We ordered them with everything, so the chili sort of made it a soupy mess.  It was still delicious, but I'd prefer a thicker consistency.  I ordered a pear cider that was on the menu and I must say, that was my favorite part!!!!  I'll come back for drinks with friends.

I went to Cheddar's a couple of weeks ago and it was awful start to finish. The service was mediocre at best, I asked for no lemon in my iced tea and she delivered and had to go back 3 times because she kept putting in a lemon (citrus allergy). When the food arrived 3 out of 5 of us sent it back because it was bathed in salt and was inedible. When we sent it back the server was obviously annoyed and avoided the table the rest of the evening. From the hostess to the server to the manager everyone who worked here looked annoyed and snotty. This restaurant is a real miss and I won't be going back, I tell as many people as I can to avoid it.

I've heard people rave about Sabrina's brunch when I lived in Philly and still long after. I'm happy I finally got to try it last time I was in town.  Ill have to say that I did enjoy my experience but I will always call Honeys my favorite brunch spot in Philly!

We went on a Friday afternoon at 11:30am and it was packed. Luckily we only waited five minutes for a table b/c we packed our party of 6 into a booth. 

3 of us ordered their famous huevos rancheros. I was actually nervous to order this in Philly bc I love my spots in Cali. Although it doesn't beat my favs, it was still pretty tasty and I enjoyed it so I'll give it 3.5 stars 
1 bagel with cream cheese - standard 
1 veggie omelet for the vegetarian with a side pancake. The pancake was huge and delish, glad she shared ! Every table should get a pancake. 
1 egg white spinach omelet- she looked like she enjoyed it but Im not a fan and didn't need a bite. 

We should of tried the stuffed French toast, which looked fantastic when it went by our table. 

Went here with five of my close girlfriends so overall the experience outshines the food. The waitress was pretty funny and kept refilling our coffees and didn't seem to mind that we stayed longer than most, which was also a plus.

Arrived at 12:50 slower than expected progress to only register open. Upon arrival at register, nice young lady asked if I could wait a moment. She went to make several Milkshakes. She then went to bus some tables. Only one other person not in kitchen was trying to manage answering at least four different people pointing out issues with their meals. I probably should not have waited the five minutes I did until the cashier came back. I did. I said , "wow, did someone call out sick"? She seemed taken aback and said no, "Everyone always asks me that" Hey Smashburger Central, you might want to take a look. Forty minutes waiting for order, cashier is LITERALLY hiding in the back. A businessman who has been here a few minutes less than me is going to jump the counter any minute I can see it in his eyes.

Just came back from there and after standing there at the upper bar for 20 minutes like an as&hole, I finally left. WTF on gods green earth is wrong with you people. Sad that I'm a local too, hate to see this happen to anyone. I've been there before and not so bad was not even that busy. I do t know if they don't want to serve my kind there or what. Get your s$&t together and do your job.REALLY pissed off right now!

Wow! We had a lovely time at Harvest! We had fantastic service, and the food was so good. We sat outside, which isn't much to look at (next to the parking lot), but our experience wasn't diminished at all. 

We were just in time for the change to the fall menu, and it was phenomenal. We started with the local cheese board- you really can't go wrong! I ordered the pork chop and my husband ordered the chicken. Wow. Both dishes were so good, I wish I could eat them every single night!

Craving a home cooked meal without the effort or mess of your own kitchen-look no further. The steer in is known for the tenderloin and beef and noodles which are a sure fire bet to a savory meal. 

I'm sure it's common knowledge by now, but the Steer-In was featured on Diners, Drive Ins, and Dives with Guy Fieri. Inside it's a total throwback to the 90s diner feel and the servers are very accommodating to the customers. 

The only complaint I had was that the gravy on my potatoes tasted a little tangy and I just added some pepper to balance it out. Overall was very pleased!

The service here is generally very good.  The bartenders really have to hustle when it is busy serving both food and drinks.  Most of the food is really good, but I was disappointed in the burger I tried recently.  It was supposed to be a mushroom burger, but barely had any mushrooms or grilled onions on it.  The kitchen sent out a tiny cup of mushrooms to throw on top, which was better than nothing.  I finally tasted the burger only to find out it was overcooked.  In the interest of time I didn't bother with another complaint.  Anyway, there wraps, salads, wings, pizza, and other sandwiches are very good and I will stick with those in the future.  The location is excellent because there are so few restaurants anywhere near the Brickhouse.

In my never ending quest for great BBQ I finally decided to try this place on the recommendations of a few friends. I ordered what I consider to be the most important meats in true BBQ: pulled pork, brisket, and ribs. I also got their Mac and Cheese, "famous" mixed bean baked beans, and their corn bread muffins. Let's start with the brisket, bland with no visible smoke ring. It tasted more like it was roasted in the oven with liquid smoke added in. The pulled pork was decent but nothing to write home about. Again needs more smoke flavor. The ribs were the best part of the meal. The rub was good and flavorful, they fell apart nicely and had a decent smokey flavor. The mac n cheese seemed a bit Kraft Mac and Cheeseish with bigger noodles. The baked beans were good but seemed like they were just Bush's baked beans with some pulled pork thrown in for good measure and authenticity. By far the star of the sides was the corn bread muffins, they were great. 66 dollars later and I'm feeling a bit underwhelmed with the meal I got. Now I'm no Myron Mixon but I have been a sous chef for the last 18 years and focusing on southern BBQ for the last 12 years. I personally like my BBQ with a heavy smoke flavor and deep smoke ring penetration. This is hard to find in a restaurant but my search will continue till I do. Overall I give this place a 2 star rating due to the lack of smokey flavor in their food and seemingly inability to create truly flavorful original recipe sides. Opening a can of food distributor baked beans and pouring them in a pot and heating them or just mixing cheddar cheese and noodles and calling it Mac n Cheese is just unacceptable to me for a place claiming that they are a true BBQ place. BBQ is food of the soul and should be treated that way, created that way, and served that way.

This place is so lovely for a daytime meal! We arrived here a few minutes to 11 a.m. (when they open), and unfortunately, the hostess was pretty bitchy about letting the line of people waiting to get in know that it wasn't happening until 11 a.m. She just had an attitude about the situation which was in stark contrast to all the incredible service we received during our time in NOLA. We had made a reservation about a week prior for brunch, and as soon as they opened their doors we got a great seat in the courtyard. Gotta say, the metal seats are super uncomfortable, but the atmosphere is really nice and relaxing. We ordered fig preserves, goat cheese, fruit and nut bread. It was out of this world. We also got the jumbo shrimp and grits. So, so dope. Tomato and mozz salad was okay. Only thing that we didn't like was the creamed spinach and artichoke with oysters. It looked and tasted gross. Was watery. Overall a great place. Would recommend.

Was finally here for the first time. Amazing pulled pork sandwich and drinks. Italian based wine menu which I love but tried the Zen Master cocktail. To die for! Cucumber vodka, green tea, and club soda. So refreshing on a summer evening!

Called after DoorDash didn't deliver. Person on phone could care less. It's DoorDash's issue not theirs.  I love how businesses give up to help resolve issues and just point finger in someone else's direction. I love it so much that I'll never order another pizza from Rozati's or ever recommend them to anyone.

Was very excited to try this place out.  Came here early on a Sunday and was told that due to 2 weddings and an evening event, no parking was available.  SHAME on you Bongo's.  Despite seeing a ton of parking, we were told we had to park elsewhere. 

While I totally get having weddings, offer a shuttle for the passengers.  Why would you operate restaurants on a property that's also sharing parking with other special events?  Why is it ok to inconvenience restaurant patrons because you have a wedding?  Or, offer no solution other than "find parking elsewhere but spend your money here!"

The lot attendant told us we could try to find metered parking nearby in the lot (good luck - weekend near the beach?) and honestly I wasn't going to drive around, when there were tons of free spaces right here, to then patronize a restaurant that clearly isn't concerned about inconveniencing their customers.  

I loved the idea of a live band and average bar food and having some drinks, but it wasn't meant to be.  

Bottom line: Won't return.  Too many other places to go and not worth a parking hassle to spend my money here.  Shame on the owners for not taking better care of their customers and valuing one customer over another.  Horrible business plan.  

Read the reviews.  You're losing customers and you lost one more.  Will they care that I don't return?  No, but then again, I won't lose sleep that I won't be back either.  But I do believe people have a right to know how they'll likely be treated.

Burgers are always good with lots of options.  Not crazy about the homemade ketchup but the fries are good.  I go to the one in Carmel, seating feels crowded to me.  Too many people squeezed in to that space.

We were in the area for a convention and we stopped here for dinner. Our server Ryan, I believe was his name was great. My husband had spicy chicken sandwich that he liked, and I had french onion soup and a turkey avocado blt. Drinks were and a beer and a bloody mary. Everything was good served quickly. We also had the chips and guac. This is a great location and a good place to eat if you are at the nearby convention center. Clean and friendly. Thanks!!!

A great addition to the Clayton food scene. Monday happy hour has totally great deals. So many great wine choices and a very nice small plate menu. We will be back often for the Pork tacos and the calamari. They were so good. The atmosphere was really great. I can't believe it used to be Tani and long before that an Arby's !!!

People go to Bonefish Grill because they know the food will be consistent and delicious. This location is no exception and it's nice to have a higher scale option in the little plaza this place is located in.  I will say don't get tunnel vision looking at only the Bonefish if you are staying nearby, because there are some great restaurants a little further west down 54.

Food was great (with the exception of the steamed Kale which was a little too bitter for me).  I really enjoyed the French Onion Soup and the Beet Salad.  Everything else I had was wonderful.

The only complaint I have was that I felt I was being rushed.  Everything came out basically at the same time.  I could not enjoy one item before the next item came out and one dish that was supposed to come out with the dinner meal came with the appetizers and soup.

I'd go again.  But please don't rush me.

Casey helped my group and I get lit as a tit. She did not fail on the job of keeping my marg bottomless. She even went above and beyond by bringing me a BIGGER CUP *gay gasp* I would give her 100 star rating if I could. And her highlight was on POINT. Period. Catch her while you can before she moves to Florida. Xoxo #givecaseyaraise

Atmosphere was great! However, their mimosas are straight orange juice. We were told they pre make them and they can't add anymore champagne. I got the French toast and it was hard as a rock drenched in sugar syrup. The crab dip was a great appetizer but everyone else's entrees were average. 

Don't recommend. Plenty of other brunch spots in Tampa to try out.

With movie theaters closed in Philly, I ventured to NJ with my girlfriend to see a movie and then stopped at Uno's for dinner afterwards to satisfy a craving for deep dish pizza. The Chicago classic deep dish is called that for a reason. You can't go wrong with a Chicago classic.  It's a sausage deep dish pizza that came out pipping hot and was delicious. The crust did seem to be slightly overcooked, so it wasn't perfect. But I was still very happy when the waitress actually took the time to run outside and hand me the box of leftover pizza I accidentally left at the table. That is great customer service that I truly appreciated!

We will not be doing business here anymore. We came in, seated ourselves per the sign, ordered drinks, received drinks, and were abandoned. Waited for 20 minutes and no one ever came to take our order. So we left. And I had to pay for for soft drinks that we did not get to drink.

Several flags warned me this was going to be bad.   First the server complained that people would not stop coming in to eat.  I recommend the manager fire this person as she obviously hates her job and doesn't want to work there not to mention she is driving business away with her complaining attitude.  Second, the table next to us had empty glasses (they are huge too) with chins in palms looking absolutely bored to death, i.e. they had been waiting a long time too.  Third, a server brought refills to a table still waiting for their order to arrive.

I tried to wait for a server, for anyone to show up, to settle my bill properly but it was obvious they were not interested in serving us.

After hurricane Ida, not much was open & left to eat in the area. I've lived near this place for 2 years & never tried until today. I went in & was fascinated that it was more than just fried chicken. They even had daiquiri options. The purple rain wasn't as good as Cajun daiquiris which is my favorite local spot. It tasted like watered down purple Kool-aid with barely a hint of alcohol. (Or maybe I'm just an alcoholic, so idk) 
I had the catfish wrap. It was good but I feel tho the catfish was missing. My husband got the wings & fries. Now the wings were fire especially since they were all flats. The fries were damn good too but only the top layer got the toppings. 

I will add that I was dangerously hungry so all of the food was eaten but I don't always go based on first time experience. I will give this place a second chance before editing/updating my review. 4/5 for effort after the storm.

This is the first time that the humor of a Yelp review motivated me to go to a restaurant. Ben P wrote "if you want to drink with the 50+ crowd that drinks like the 30 and under crowd," this is your joint. I was both offended and amused by the comment in that I am in my 40s and didn't know I was supposed to behave a certain way. I may have grey hair, but I have maintained my youthful immaturity. So, Noir sounded cool because I would be among my tribe of oldsters and cougars. 

I went for dinner on a weeknight and did notice the crowd was a mix of ages, which was nice. Although a mix of ages is pretty common, but this time I noticed it more. As other people have said, the restaurant was an overpriced gastropub. My dining companion did not like Noir at all because she wasn't impressed with the food. And neither was I. But I can definitely see myself coming back so that I can let my freak granny flag fly.  But next time, I will stick to the bar and skip dinner.

If this place is on the way and you really want some mediocre overpriced ice cream that you can taste for hours later, then by all means, stop here.  It's fun watching kids who can't make change without a calculator try to take care of the crowd and there are crowds there all summer long.  I can't figure it out.  If you want to go out of your way a short distance, head south on 206 for about 5 miles and stop at Evergreen.  Now that place is worth going out of your way!

Great little brewery/bar/restaurant right in the heart of downtown Yardley. We enjoyed sitting outside and trying a bunch of apps, entrees and a few pitchers of sangria. Highly recommend the buffalo cauliflower, and pizza. Definitely recommend this place!

A great restaurant with great prices. I enjoyed the veal special with braised cabbage and sweet potatoes. Very delicious all around and less than $25. I have been to ZEA three times in two weeks of travel to NOLA, because it is just simply good and reasonably priced.

Been here twice now and both times my experience was the same....solid food great location mad brutal service. At the end of the day it's built for tourist so it is eat it is. If you want a beautiful location to watch a sunset this is a good one just don't expect attentive service.....
Freddy's is always delicious no matter the location and this new location is doing a great job!! From the signature Jalapenos fry sauce to the delicious custards.

Wings were nuggets, service was very intermittent, sticky table. Prices are good, food selection is good, location rules. Overall food quality isn't there and service blows. I had boneless wings and tots. The tots were good but wings were more like nuggets...their hottest sauce was also very mild.

This place is almost like hidden gem. Unexpectedly located in the back of a building. The people were very friendly and chatty. I got the poboy and gumbo special. Surprising good. Delicious shrimp poboy and my goodness... That gumbo! I almost wish I could bring a jug of that home with me. Amazingly good and amazingly cheap!
Best wings period! I've been eating here since he was in Madison and its always good. Yeah it takes a little time to get ur food but its worth it

I heard great things about their breakfasts so I stopped on in for lunch. The waitress kept running from our table as soon as we paused speaking and on two occasions I had to call after her to complete our order. Our wine flights were delivered in dingy glasses and we had no clue which wine was which, so even if I wanted to I couldn't order another glass. For someplace that people tend to rave about I was less than impressed by their French American fare, the food lacked dimension and flavor. The highlight of the dinner was the muffins of the bread basket and the dessert assortment. I don't recommend going here if you want good service or good food but baked items are ok

We chose this restaurant based on customer reviews and boy are we glad. The food was outstanding and a great value for the giant portions. The service was also superb, our drinks were refilled before we even knew they were empty. Super tasty food and a great variety.

David and I decided to stop in here on St Patrick's day, of all days, to try something a little different and get a bite to eat. First of all, I love the layout of the space. Plenty of light and I can see myself sitting on the gorgeous patio outside on a nice spring day.

David and I both got the hamburger and we got an order of the mac and cheese to share. The hamburgers were fantastic! I think David complained that his had a little too much onion on it, but that's an easy fix. The mac and cheese was out of this world. Very creamy and I like the big noodles they used.

I saw someone at another table yet a amazing looking bowl of French onion soup, so that's definitely on my list to try next time.

We held our welcome party at Dat Dog the night before our wedding and we loved our experience working with the Dat Dog team. As a Brooklyn, New York-based LGBT couple planning a wedding in New Orleans, we needed vendors who were accepting, organized and responsive and Victoria and Mario from Dat Dog delivered. Our 213 guests had plenty of space in the Freret location and our guests loved the hot dogs, fries and bar selection. We'd highly recommend the alligator and duck options. We also had a few guests who are vegetarian and vegan and Dat Dog was accomodating. The atmosphere was relaxing, yet organized and it was the perfect way to kick off the weekend. We'd highly recommend Dat Dog for your wedding welcome party.
Needed a quick dinner before a show and I'm glad we decided to try this place. They have breakfast all day and their biscuits are awesome! Everyone around us seemed to be enjoying themselves as well.

Ground has a pretty good burger and some of the best hand cut fries around.  Like many places in the Nashville, they cook their burger patty all the way through...well done.  I've tried to order my burger 'medium' three times now, and every time it's cooked through to a nice even gray color.  This is disappointing, because the really could have a great burger if they tried.  That said, it's still A-OK and considering the options in the area, still a good choice.  Did I say 'some of the best fries' ?  Yes, and a generous portion.  Somewhere between 3-4 stars....leaning towards 4.

I can only speak to my experience at the bar, but I stopped by Pub 1922 during happy hour and it surpassed my expectations. Bars and restaurants in Sahuarita have a tendency to all seem to be a step below the quality of service and food found in the city, or they're overpriced because there are not many options in Sahuarita.
I'm pleased to say that, from my experience, Pub 1922 shirks that trend and offers affordable drinks, especially at happy hour. The bartender was friendly, quick and happy to offer advice on their drink selection. 

Pub 1922 also has a pretty good selection of discounted appetizers and nibbles during their happy hour. If you're living in Rancho Sahuarita, I think this would be the perfect place to grab a few too many drinks and stumble home safely. It is within walking distance of most of the developments (save for maybe the ones close to the casino) and is affordable enough that a drunk night here won't break the bank. Some of their house cocktails are $9 - $12 a drink but that's really the going rate for a good house cocktail these days, the rest of the beers and well drinks are well made and priced like I'd expect most places to be in Tucson. 

Overall, I was impressed and satisfied with my experience. I'm glad I took the chance to check this place out, I'll definitely be back again.

If there was ever a time where I need to record a bite this would be the place.  Brunch at its best!  Super cute locale with modern and trendy decor.  The food was Out of sight.  Something for everyone on the menu.  And their array of baked items def has your sweet tooth covered. Fantastic staff very friendly and helpful with  the menu.  Prices an average for a place of its caliber.

I know Dickerson Pike scares most people away, you need to stop by Charlie Bob's.  The food is always great!  They have the best, cheap breakfast on the weekends and their grilled chicken at night is one of the most tender, flavorful pieces of chicken that I've ever eaten.  This place has an old diner feel and the staff are always nice and helpful.

We went weekly for months specifically for the filet sandwich which was phenomenal. However, a few weeks back we found out they had  substituted hanger steak for the filet, and it was chewy and totally unsatisfying. When we brought this to the new owner's attention he led us to believe he would change back to the previous meat supplier and make things right again by the next weekend since the filet had always been a top seller. The next Saturday we returned only to find out it was STILL hanger steak and the menus had been changed and the price raised for the sandwich. Such a shame. We won't go back. We'll miss the regulars and the staff.

I didn't love my dish, but that is because I should have ordered the following delicious things:

1.  Buffaloaf - I mean, can you really go wrong with a name like that.
2.  Pumpkin Bread Pudding

We had the exotic mushroom appetizer which was oookay, but there weren't that many mushrooms.  And there were soo many dried cranberries, and lots of bread, which was unexpected.   I would have loved just a huge plate of mushrooms.  We also had the crab dip, which was pretty yum.

I ordered butternut squash ravioli.  I mean, I love butternut squash, but maybe this is the place to get a BUFFALOAF instead.  A couple people in our group ordered this and it was great.  In addition, the pumpkin bread pudding was probably the best pumpkin thing I've ever had in my twenty-five years.

cheers to the mushroom capital of the world!

hmmmm where do I begin.....  well if they have "best burger" award it must have been voted that back in the '70s around the time the place was last cleaned.  
They didnt take our resturant.com certificate but offered to comp us $10 for the inconvenience.  

We visited this resturant 8 years ago and since we had the certificate we were trying to remember why we never went back... well there was certain reason.  My engine 53 burger (ordered medium) blackened w blue cheese, was completely tasteless and some were around well well... my hubby's cheddar and bacon burger (also ordered medium) was completely the wrong burger and when we sent it back they merely took off the onion ring and sent it back out, completely overlooking the fact that perhaps we would notice that the burger has BBQ sauce he didnt want.  They were kind enough to make up for it by removing our burgers from the bill which left us paying for chicken fingers that were standard bar fare and WAY overpriced onion rings (8 rings for $5.99).  All in all the rings and fingers were decent so my 10yo was happy but we left remembering why the last time we were there he was two!

oh i forgot... the kids speghetti and meatballs... my 8yo daughter loved the meatball (she is not very discerning) and we had a hard time finding the noodles in the over abudance of sauce... but for $3.79 was a good value since she ate it, but that is about all I can say about that!

Service, ah... but they did have some staffing issue they tried to explain.

Love this little coffee shop/cafe! it's quaint and quirky at the same time. The monkey themed decor really got my fiance and I excited! We both got the banana monkey (not sure if that's what it's called, my memory isn't the best anymore! But it was a banana flavored mocha) and since it was so hot out they made it a cold brew. We really appreciated that since it was like 100 degrees outside. The place was super busy and had the feel of an old house being converted to a coffee shop, which you don't see in Minneapolis (where I'm from) a lot. Except on Grand Ave in Saint Paul. The people there were friendly and the service was timely despite them being really busy. They seem to be able to accommodate all the people they were getting with both indoor and outdoor seating.

We didn't eat here, but the people who were sitting next to us did, and their food looked delicious, so I'm excited to try that the next time I'm in Nash!

Drinks were on point. Staff was above and beyond the norm of our hood, but it's a pleasant surprise to get a CC level of attention and communication in Fairmount.  I mean maybe that's why so many frikkin places FAIL around here.  

Nice work Lemon Hill. I saw a general manager (that looks familiar, but I can't place him) looking stressed and noticing everything that happened at the bar and in the dining room and somehow that was comforting that someone cared. 

You say, "but Big Texas, you review Fairmount...it's what you do, yet I don't see any reviews of these places with the awful customer service."  I'd say you are correct, but I don't have the heart, in a small hood, to create enmity.  If I haven't reviewed it, that should say something.

So back to L.H. in terms of everything else...I mean everyone else talks about everything else.  If you have an imagination and liquor, you can craft a tasty cocktail and they do. 

We had a full dinner and It was fine.  I'm not big on comfort food so while the quality of the food was clearly high and presentation was nice I wasn't excited about it.  We'll be back though.  Lots and lots.  I might have gone into the place that was here before twice in three years.

So first of all their Cold Brew kept me going from 8am-2pm. It was one of the most productive work streaks I have ever had on a Friday while also jetlagged from a trip. A++++

Also, I love the fact they have veggie sausage that doesn't taste like sawdust. It's super delicious. Pop that baby in your biscuit and you will find no better way to start you morning.

The biscuits aren't so big that you need a nap afterwards (like 5 Daughters or Barista Parlor breakfast sammies). They are a perfect way to start the day, I am in LOVE.

The greasy spoon of St. Petersburg. Extremely cheap. I came here for years and saw the same faces over and over. I especially loved coming in high school. My usual was one (very large) pancake and a side of home fries. Sometimes the pancake is too dry or too buttery. Sometimes the home fries are cooked perfectly and other times there are several burnt ones. Is the food horrible? No. Is it an awesome breakfast joint? Not so much. But it's decent and cheap, so you can't go erin is that's what you're looking for.

I'm so glad this historic building has found new ownership....nothing this steeped in history should be idle for as long as it was. We only drank tonight and there were a ton of selections to be had. For the beer connoisseur, this place would be more than adequate. As the perpetual DD, I have long ago lost my ability to have more than 2 of anything....so I can't really speak to the beer. Hubby liked all of his selections, however! We glanced at the menu, which was reasonable in both price and variety. When we left at 9:30, the place was full and buzzing. Hope it succeeds.

Arno and Leo said Hi as we walked in. We were escorted to our booth by Arno. He asked for our drink order. Brought our drinks and took our order for grilled Cheese steak and onion sandwich with a bowl of clam chowder. Clam Chowder served first, added some parmesan cheese instead of salt. Almost as good as Dad made in the good old days.
Sandwich was well packed with meat, grilled onions and sauce. I added a little French's mustard, slice it in thirds; much easier to hold. Best sandwich I have had in a while.

Dottie had The 55 sunrise with bacon, hash browns well done, Eggs over easy and a single crepe with sweet cream and strawberries. Scrumptious. We eat at this IHOP or the one on State and Valerio twice a month or more. 

Always good service, never disappointed in the meals. Good friends serve Dottie and I well.

This is actually called Capricco at Cafe Cret. The service is super friendly, but they seemed a little frazzled and I went late enough in the day that I was the only one in there.    Enjoyed my drink (but I'm not a coffee snob so who knows).  

They've got a lot of outdoor seating, it's a shame that they opened up in the fall.

We were visiting town and tried for Sunday jazz brunch at Commander's Palace, but were turned away because we were wearing shorts. Oops. Found the newly opened Ruby Slipper in Uptown. The pain perdu was so so delicious! I'm still thinking about it a month later... The restaurant is spacious and comfortable and the sevice was great.

I had PJ's bacon blue cheese burger 3 days before my son was born.  I was pregnant, fat and hungry.  It was the best thing ever.  I still love to go for that burger even though I am no longer pregnant, still fat and always hungry.  The fries are really good too.  I can't tell you how anything else is because I can't bring myself not to order the bacon blue cheese burger (well done.....I know, I know)

The pork belly potatoes and hot sauce are a must have!  Bacon is phenomenal as well.  Definitely add yourself to the waitlist at prime time so you're wait isn't too long.  Overall, this is one of my go to places.

AMAZING! Look, I am hard to please when it comes to burgers. Places such as "Burger Up" just don't excite me. Where they leave off, The Pharmacy Burger Parlor picks up. The Pharmacy has a laid back environment that isn't so trendy that it comes off as pretentious.
