I was surprised to see that the burgers are decently priced and have a lot of varieties that I can't wait to try. My first time in, I decided to keep it basic with a cheeseburger. Let me be the FIRST to say this is NOT your regular cheeseburger. This burger has 4 different types of cheese that is almost too cheesy at times, but hey since when was that a problem? The burger is perfectly cooked to your liking and very well seasoned. the bread adds a warm, soft, yummyness to hold it all together. Even on a busy night such as this past Saturday when we went, the bartender still took time to make great beer recommendations. I'll definitely be returning here!

I used to love the bar but unfortunately I no longer feel comfortable here. My friends and I personally got stolen from at this bar from Corey. He only steals from people, lies, and deceives. It's disgusting. I encourage everyone to no longer go to Yard of Ale if Corey works there.

Red Robin has been a good chain of burgers that are actually done correctly, they also recently added a Gluten-Free Menu items that are easy to ask for and the wait staffers know what is and it's GF. I've been here several times and never really had "bad service" during my visits, just slightly slow due to lunch and dinner rush times (11-1pm) and (5-7 pm) during the week days. Friday and Saturday nights are usually the most packed times, but Sundays are perfect places to have dinner; as they're usually empty or very low capacity of customers. They treat everyone nicely and make sure to respect the customers.

The owner is truly one of a kind and so are the people that work there. Every time I have been here, the service and food is exceptional! The wait for food is never a problem. The prices are low and affordable. The food never fails to fill you up. The workers are very kind and very welcoming. I highly recommend this amazing restaurant!!

This restaurant offers a variety of Americana type foods. It was a very clean, family friendly facility and the wait staff was very kind, friendly, and food was prompt.

I wish my food had been warmer and it was $9.43 for a chicken sandwich on toast with a very small serving of fries. (I ordered water so with a drink, it would have been more) IMO, not worth the price especially since it was the "lunch special".

Tonight was my first time here and I'm basing my score on overall experience. I made a reservation for 7, but the party was coming in multiple parts. My brother and girlfriend arrived first and were told that they couldn't sit at our table until at least half of the party was there. They were told they could go to the bar to wait. That seemed a little strange to me, but I figured each place has different policies about large groups. When we were finally seated at our table, two chairs were flimsy plastic fold-out chairs that sat much lower to the ground than the other chairs, making the table seem too high for me to eat comfortably. This was really odd and when the table behind us left, I switched the chairs out so we could all be eye-level. 
When we sat down we were told that the bread was in the oven, and we would be served as soon as it came out. 15 minutes later, my brother asked our server if the bread was almost done, and after another 5 minutes, a large pan was brought out and cut. We were given HUGE portions of bread right away and it was delicious. There was olive oil on the table so some of us drizzled some over our fresh bread. Nice touch! 
I ordered the beet salad with salmon. The salmon was VERY salty but cooked perfectly. I asked for the salad dressing on the side, but was on my salad when I received it instead. Others in my group got the veal, penne vodka, spaghetti and meatballs, and ravioli. The meatballs were homemade and delicious! My mom ended up getting cannoli for dessert and they were fresh and crunchy! Our waitress was very helpful and pleasant. I love the interior and definitely want to come back in the summer to sit outside. Overall this place is nicer than I thought it would be and I will definitely be back to try other menu items!

I was admittedly reluctant to go here due to being disheartened at the loss of Che's. The vibe here confuses me, but comes across as very clean, trendy, but with a 50s diner feel? Service was decent. I got the pulled pork sandwich with a side of brussel sprouts. The pulled pork was savory, but I'm not sure the sauce was a hit. It came across as a sweet barbecue mustard kind of flavor. Not bad, just different. The brussel sprouts were HUGE, and were pretty good. Expect to pay a little more than a classic diner. Decent and interesting food here. I absolutely love that they purchase produce form local farms.

I've been here a handful of times and I'm basing my review on all of my experiences.   Nothing has ever wowed me here food wise until....this trip and I don't think it was a desperate post apocalypse meal.    It was good.   We got the stuffed pizza pretzel breadsticks that were smothered in nacho cheese.     And they were delicious!   I see why there are only two to an order-no one needs that in life especially when you've ordered a jalapeño popper pizza, which had more of that nacho cheese on it and then some ricotta and mozzarella, bacon and jalapeño on a thin crust and yes! This pizza is amazing.    This one stop may rethink options for a casual
Dining experience.

The food is amazing! Although I don't prefer seafood, they have so many other choices! My family loves the oysters at half price on Wednesday. The service is great, but you should almost always expect to wait before getting seated. They always have great drinks, and you can keep their reusable cups! I highly recommend this restaurant!

Good food but a bit too noisy on a Saturday brunch.  Lemon ricotta pancake was delish.  Service was indifferent.  Once food was brought to the table our server never checked in or offered coffee refill, which I wanted.  Hopefully the noise level and service is better in Narberth because the food makes it worth trying.

Very sad to see atchafalaya slip so far. Went this morn for brunch. Coffee and all plates were cold. Cream was chunky. $17 for eggs atchafalaya which now don't even come with potatoes. $17 for 2 eggs over 2 tomatoes with some crab meat- very overpriced. When I asked waiter why they didn't come with potatoes anymore he said they had lowered the price and removed the potatoes. How much could frying some potatoes to put on a dish possibly cost?!But----Worst of all, guest who ordered truffled eggs and spinach got food poisoning - really! Very clearly and immediately caused by food. Only reason now to go is the awesome band. Very sad to see them resting on their laurels and ripping off clients, a far drop from the friendly place it used to be. Former 4-star reviewer won't be back.

A perfect atmosphere for the holidays! It's extremely cozy, yet classy, and wafts with smells of their homemade candles that benefit womens shelters. The menu selection is hand picked, seasonal, and extremely unique. I went with a corn bread appetizer (a must) and the beef cheeks.

My fiancé and I went there last week we both were very excited to see what all the hype was for social. The ambience and Decour were beautiful but that's where it pretty much ended.we were seated by the waiting area which felt a little odd .. Hungry people watching you eat...we ordered the Carolina fried deviled eggs as an appetizer when they came out they were warm at best we weren't sure if they were supposed to be like that so we didn't think too much. We were seated to where we could see in the kitchen and I noticed that there were two dishes sitting in the window that weren't being taken out but all the other entrées were.I was thinking in the back of my head please don't let that be our food still sitting in the window. And sure enough it was 18 minutes later our food that was sitting in the window came out.I had ordered Baja fish tacos they were extremely cold covered and the heaping pile of guacamole and avocado was runny. The fries that came with them tasted like they were a day old and reheated.my fiancé got the fried bologna sandwich and macaroni and cheese.The Mac & cheese was okay but the fried bologna sandwich was also cold to the point where we couldn't even finish it. Now I know some of you are probably reading this saying why when you just send it back... well the both of us have worked in the restaurant industry when we were in college and it's just a rule that you don't send food back. The line cook was not wearing gloves and was touching all of the food while wiping the sweat off of his head. most of the cooks seem to have duck dynasty beards and those were not covered. But aside from the food what bothered me was as a new restaurant and designing a restaurant you would think that there would be more than one server station we noticed that there was only one server station and multiple servers were waiting in line to put in their customers orders.it wasn't all that busy when we were there and we noticed that the server station is right by the hallway where they take out the food to the customer so the servers were bumping into other servers pretty regularly. I normally don't mind paying $20 for an entrée if the food is great but I was pretty disappointed that our bill was $50 and I left still hungry.

the food and service is great. Owner Bruce even came by our table to ask if the food was accommodating. Place was very clean, romantic lighting, outstanding servers, and chefs. I asked for a good sushi place and he also directed me to a great place at the outback plaza. Overall great experience and great referrals. Place does get busy so its best to go at an off peak time.

Some places are great. Some places suck. Some places really are...just average.

What stood out the most from our visit to Moe & Johnny's was the food. I had a wonderful chicken salad sandwich -- which had a really funky and new (to me, at least) dill flavor. And, I'm gonna say it: "really good french fries are getting harder to come by"; M&J's has some. I also found the food an overall good value.

Our server was...loud....and, sadly, kinda dumb. This may seem crass and/or mean, but having to repeat and clarify multiple requests can get old.

They get a slight bump for their beer selection -- which is pretty good. Atmosphere is informal...not super cozy, but comfortable.

All in all, I'm on the fence, but willing to go back. A great experience could make me a fan for years; a bad one would put them in the doghouse. I say stop in and see for yourself.

I took  my wife here on our wedding anniversary. That's when I found out why this place is number one and steaks in the City. Our server was so on point like a scoreboard. We didn't have wait long for our food I swear it took no time.   Great food ,plus they have bar and screens for Football 
Plus if you know to Pokemon go they have two pokestops outside 
The only con I see with this place is if you have a 
Big party you have to wait.  
Great Food and Service !!!  Date was. 
8 /13/,2016

Came here almost everyday for the last 1+ years and they never even bothered to remember my name even though I chatted with them every time. Came in the other day to get a salad, and it was like it had been frozen the night before- the cucumbers were  disintegrating and gelatinous and the salad itself was in a bath of water at the bottom. Also misunderstood a woman telling me to use the men's room instead of the women's because she had to  clean it or soemthing and when the men's room was being used and I had to go I popped in the women's room to use the bathroom real quick, and hear her yellling at me.. Will not be returning to a place that yells at me for using the restroom and not caring to befriend customers.

Its dark with a good amount of seating indoors as well as out doors. The bar area has a nice feeling to it with a bunch of high tables and stools and then there is a general seating area in an adjacent room with regular chairs and tables. It's got the loud murmur of a bar that carries over because the two rooms are separated by a wall behind the bar with a large open window... so quiet it is not. 

This is a nice intimate place for a date. You couldn't tell from the unassuming store front, but it gives for plenty of privacy in the back. The tables are not on top of each other. 

Anyway, on to the food. It was a bit on the pricey side. The offerings had the choice of 3 or 4 sandwiches for about $9 - $10, then it jumped to like $15 - $20 for entrees. I ordered the fish tacos: $10 for 2.  Don't get me wrong, they were delicious, but not very filling. The fish was cooked well and seasoned perfectly. The kimchi was good and gave a nice tart spicy kick to it, but I'm not sure about the execution of the taco itself. It was messy. Kimchi is a messy and very wet food. I had kimchi juice dripping down my hands when I was trying to eat it. And there just wasn't very much food. I know the waiter said it was a bit light, but come on. 2 tacos for $10? for what I had, it was good, but next time I'll go with some heartier fare.

A good place for a good steak, and a nice drink.  The bartenders are always very attentive.  They have a very nice selection of Bourbon, and interesting cocktails.  The filet mignon is delicious.  The carrots that come with the steak are actually my favorite part. The bar staff will have to give you a key card for bathroom access if you're not a hotel guest, but it's definitely a nice bathroom.  A nice date spot!

Feels like family every time I walk in the door, but no one in my family can cook like this! The barbecue is delicious, the fellowship is 100% Nashville. Great beer selection, good cocktails, and some good people watching.

Pros: The coffee is really good! The food came out pretty quickly. In addition, the concept and ambiance was pretty cool. 

Cons: My husband ordered a coffee and it never came. Thank God we weren't charged for it. The service was mediocre as our waitress only checked on us twice. My veggie sandwich was greasy and my husband's bean burger hosted pasty tasting beans and fell apart easily. Parking sucked -- we had to pay for parking because we couldn't find a spot in the restaurant's lot. 

Overall score: C
I love the concept of this brewery!!! Came here with our California friends who moved to Carmel and highly recommended this place. The Confessional IPA was very tasty. Sausage platter was amazing!!!!
So...the tea was great. Period. Not a fan of dense pancakes, uncooked bacon & weird sausage. Eggs were alright, but in all not a good breakfast. Shame cause ppl were pumping it up. Oh well.

Their chicken is fantastic - especially the spicy. Lots of breading, very juicy and good sized pieces. The corn fritters...honestly, I could make a meal out of them! I will have to agree with several other people out here about the mashed potatoes - they leave a lot to be desired and DEFINITELY taste like potatoes from a hospital cafeteria or in a public school lunch. But, the chicken and corn fritters are worth it! FAR better taste and quality than both KFC and King Edwards on Watson. Porters' chicken breasts are one and a half times the size (and taste) as King Edwards! You get a lot for your money here and to me, it's worth every penny!

This the best Dominoes EVER. New to the area., we order from here once a week. Great service always. I'm not just saying that. THE BEST !!!
Don

Loved this place! It is located inside the Chase Park Plaza which is a gorgeous hotel. Valet parking or street parking available across the street. Ambience of the bar is really cool--very laid back with good music and service. Menu is small plates style. I chose to sit at the bar and have a glass of wine and a few small plates. Cocktail menu looked amazing. Bartender looked like he really knew how to make a good drink. Highly recommend the grilled octopus and Branzino dishes. Good portion size for a small plate. Disappointed that they ran out of the dessert I wanted but it was close to closing time.

Go to Wingstop if you're looking for snack wings. They are small and not as meaty as I expected, but they are not the worst wings ever. The garlic parmesan were ok. They had good flavor. I like spicy food, so immediately I ordered some atomic (their hottest) wings. The lady at the counter asked me if I was sure if atomic was what I wanted and suggested that I try the cajun instead. So I tried cajun and they didn't even phase me :-/

I have eaten at this establishment multiple times and at multiple locations throughout Philadelphia. Today I had a terrible experience. I ordered the Kitchen Sink and it came with potatoes and peppers that were chunky and burnt. Needless to say I didn't like it. The waitress was nice and went to get the manager Blaze who was a real jerk. He was dismissive and basically told me there was nothing they could do. I told him that's poor customer service and he told me to email if I had a problem. The waitress then informed us that the next day was Blaze's last day ( so that's why he had such a crappy attitude towards the issue). I have been a customer here plenty of times and have never had a complaint so I definitely don't appreciate the crappy service and the disrespectful management.

I'm a purist: Pulled pork on a buttered bun with delicious sauce. I was not disappointed, as it was phenomenal. Great smokey flavors in the meat. The hushpuppies were meh. The bbq sauces were varied and fun to try. The green bean/tomato salad was worth trying, but was a little heavy on the oil.

Waited in line for 20 minutes just to be told by the lazy careless employees that they were taking cash only. A simple sign posted would have saved me all my time and trouble. Sadly this is par for the course with Popeyes company they have the absolute worst customer service in the history of the restaurant industry.

Where do you begin when you frequent a local restaurant that you just love so much. 

First introduced a few years back when I met my best friend for breakfast, yes I said it breakfast!? They serve the breakfast until 12 P.M. during the week and brunch until 2 P.M. Sundays. 

They offer generous portions at a great value. My last visit was yesterday morning picking up my to go order. Corn beef hash stacker is my go to for breakfast and is always a treat! This particular dish is corn beef hash on top of their home fries, (these potatoes have bacon bits and are so heavenly) served with two poached eggs on top and hollandaise sauce and your choice of a side of toast or biscuit. I always ask for the hollandaise on the side as it can be on the heavier side if its smothered in sauce. This is available in the half order and full order. See my pic I posted a few weeks ago, I am just a little late on this review. Oh and if you like cinnamon rolls, try it at breakfast and they always go quickly so do ask your server upon arrival to ensure you'll get one. I promise you won't be disappointed! Served hot with caramel sauce and topped off with candied pecans. I meant to take a picture when I had it last Sunday, but it didn't make it five minutes! Lol
 
As far as lunch or dinner here, I have had their pulled pork, beef ribs, meat platters with dirty rice and cheddar grits as my favorite sides well and their delicious corn bread. They are famous for their "kick-ass" fries. I have had them for breakfast when I was pregnant with my daughter quite frequently, so good! Start a stamp card if you think you'll be like me and have them once every two weeks. 
 I'll never forget the first time I tried their beef ribs and beef brisket, the meat was so juicy and tender it melted in my mouth. The smoked flavor is a memory embedded in my taste buds, so good it keeps me coming back!  Say yes to their hot sauce, I usually will have the hot BBQ sauce then top it off with their hot sauce. This place is one of my all time favorites ever and I always recommend it to tourists in our casino when they ask me where I like to go to breakfast and lunch.

Just a tip tends to be busier on Saturdays and Sundays so expect
 some wait time, but I promise it will be worth the wait!

Had horrible service even after searching for a manager to help rectify why we were there 30 minutes and they still had not brought our drinks or taken our order.
Deviled eggs - nope!  Skip it unless you just really love eggs.
Korean short rib tacos - hell no!  Mostly the weird slaw.  Flavor and text8of the meat was off.
Tortilla soup - winner!  It was good.
Filet Mignon-  when they say peppercorn crusted they mean PEPPERCORN CRUSTED.  MY MOUTH WAS ON FIRE AFTER 2 BITES!
Too many places to pick from in downtown Indy to waste your time here.

Outback used to be our go to steakhouse. Sadly the quality has diminished at all that I've eaten at. This one my nephew's rare steak came out well done, my medium rare steak came out med well and my sisters steak was cold but cooked properly. My niece got Alice springs chicken and had no complaints. We returned the overcooked rare steak but dealt with the rest...we just didn't feel like waiting for the replacements. Food was good but inconsistent in terms of doneness. Not my favorite place anymore.
The food is always amazing here! The staff is always nice and warming. The prices are great and the amount of food is very generous!

Worst delivery service I've ever had (and I order 90% of my meals).  I was 0.4 miles away- even used grubhub to order bc they are awesome at making sure everything is right and on time.  They took an hour and half to get here, 40 minutes after the grubhub time which NEVER happens.  THen their customer service even called them and said they left 15 minutes ago- and my food showed up 30 minutes later.  Apparently it takes 45 minutes to go 0.4 miles.  Not to mention I had a VEry simple appetizer order that probably look 5 minutes to make (cheese fries and sampler).  Grubhub was awesome about it but this place won't ever get my business again.... Only wish john's place was open on sundays :(

Oh and if that's not enough- the food was not good at all.

As always it's an experience coming to this place. The LONG wait to get everything I don't want is amazing, and the reduced selection of soft drinks is staggering. So if you're into bad service, bad selection, and limited options, then this IS the place to go for your delicious meal.

I'm not sure, but I think the negative reviews are just people being extremely picky.  I had a pretty decent experience here.  The staff was attentive and professional and the food was good.  Most of all, this is a bar with decent food, that won't let you wear a Tank-Top or split checks ...so what.  Wear a T-Shirt, figure out your bill, and have a decent time.  No complaints here.

After reading lots of YELP reviews, I was willing to give Houlihan's on Mason a shot.  I hadn't been to a Houlihan's for years.  In fact, this is the only one in the area left. I was prepared for good food, bad service and specifically to wait forever to receive my check.  
Walked right in on a Friday night.  There was a healthy crowd but zero wait my party of two was seated right away.  Our friendly waiter appeared right away to get our drink orders. We both ordered the stuffed chicken breast...comes with mashed potatoes and an additional side. 
I asked our waiter how the garlic green beans were...you know they can be crisp or yuck and mushy.  Loved his honest opinion of, they are one step above the asparagus...but the face he gave said it all.  Now you might think, shame on him for dissing an item but hey...I asked and he was honest. Right there bonus points for him. I ordered double mashed potatoes and my daughter ordered sweet potato fries (boy, were they good - salty not sweet). 
Food came out hot and delicious. No way could I eat the second generous portion of mashed potatoes. 
Time for the bill.  Our area was packed at this point and I thought we would wait and wait.  WRONG. Our ticket was delivered, card run through and signed in a more tha reasonable amount of time. 
Did I just have a great waiter?  Maybe.  But I let him know his value with my tip and enjoyed dinner.

Tip:  Don't waste your $5.95 on the new apple dessert with ice cream and caramel drizzle.  It's not served hot so not worth ordering. 

Update:  Five people at my table.  All ordered stuffed chicken breast.  Two orders had golden fried chicken.  Three orders were somewhat black and burned looking on both sides and breading around all sides was light/not fried looking.  We should have sent three back.  0/5 had much stuffing (it is a stuffed chicken breast) and little seasoned butter topping. Where is the quality control in the kitchen?  Was really liking this place but probably won't come back....at least not in the near future 

Rating changed from 4 stars to 2.

So my last review of this piece of s**t bar got removed by the yelp community because it lacks a substantive first-hand experience.... 

I WILL say they have an excellent beer selection. 

I have been to this bar many of times until I woke up and realized how horrible it really is. It seems like all of the staff is trying to pick a fight. The bouncers are just plain rude and cant wait to kick someone out for no good reason. I have never been booted myself but a couple friends have been removed for some b.s. reasons. 

The only time you can enjoy a laugh and a beer at that bar is early in the night before the crowds show up. Its seems the staff have their guards down a bit more that usual. 

Over all this is the worst piece of s**t bar in Tucson. It seems like they don't want to make money!

The drunken stumble down the street to Tiffany's could only be easier if it was 2 blocks instead of 3.  I'm always happy to drop in and see the ladies behind the counter, especially Janet.  She's a gruff gus on the exterior, but once you bond with her, you BOND with her.  She's been working in diners almost twice as long as I've been alive.

Cheap greasy food.  Their chicken fingers are something like $2.49 for four, and they're taaaaaaaaasty.

Well we can't say to much about Cook and Shaker -- we only were there after a Fishtown Beer Runners run so our visit consisted of a couple free High Life's and we were on the road. 

BUT, since we're here. The space was great, albeit jammed with sweaty runners. As did the food, I noticed some smothered tater tots which  are still calling my name ... 

C&S has a solid and deserving buzz surrounding it ...

Came for some after dinner drinks. You can't go wrong with the beer selection here! The bartender was efficient, but not the friendliest. However, this place gets super busy on a Friday night and we never had to wait long for our drinks, so all-in-all, it was a win. 

The food is good, but I'm pretty sure I witnessed a burger that was sent back and then given to another patron...not cool. 

Definitely come for drinks though.

So incredibly delicious. BBQ NACHOS! So good we got another to go. Ribs... Delectable. Mac n cheese...i was totes jelly of my children. Not too thick and creamy, but just the right amount of milky with a touch of sweet. Perfect. BBQ beans were awesome, and the pulled pork sandwich was amazing with that slaw. Go there!
Love this place! They have fresh squeezed OJ and great coffee! Not only are they great for breakfast, but they also have some very unique and tasty options for lunch.
First visit to this new to Downtown St Pete joint, cool vibe, great staff and menu on the money for this kind of eatery.. all round solid experience, I'll be back

Recommend going here only for drinks. They brew their own beer, so warn your Miller lite preferring friends that they'll have to order a microbeer. But you're in luck, the beer's pretty good. Secret, their scotch selection is good and reasonably priced.

Food is not very good, in my experience, and took FOREVER to come out. 

I even ran into Mayor Nutter here. And you know he has good taste! So next time you're there, keep an eye out for Mix Master Mike!

M is a very nice higher-end spot for meals or drinks. Great for parties and groups, or just a nice romantic date. Can be a little weird after hours for access with the placement inside an office building, but Cummins Station is a kick-ass reuse of one of Nashville's most prolific historic buildings.

The food is fantastic. Try the Hot Chicken and Waffles. They also make a wonderful Black Walnut Old Fashioned.

Parking mostly sucks unless you grab a free metered space after hours. Otherwise you can fork over a lot more than they should get in that shitty lot.

They're right by the new JW and Westin hotels, and well worth a walk down the block if you're staying in town there. They have an excellent relationship with most decent hotel's concierges, so you can set up an outing with ease, from your hotel.

Honestly would probably give this place a 2.5 but since I love the decor I'll bump it up to 3.  I like the old black and white photos on the walls.  (And the pictures of Clooney, Pitt, and Depp in the bathroom!)

They have signs up around the restaurant saying WARNING: PIZZA IS WELL DONE!  In other words... your pizza will be burnt to a crisp.  Not really my thing, yet surprisingly yummy.  It's thin crust so burning it is probably a good thing.  Nobody wants to eat a limp, flaccid piece of pizza.  You heard me.

They don't have fountain soda which is strange to me.  They give you a bottle.  I had a lunch pizza (the one with the sausage and peppers and ricotta cheese)  It was described to me as "really spicy" but it really was not spicy at all.  But that's not the waitresses fault that spicy foods don't really effect me.  Apparently to other people it's really spicy.  Still tasted pretty good though

Stopped at The Stillery for lunch while on vacation in downtown Nashville and loved it!! Quick wait time and very friendly staff. Great lunch menu and everything we ordered was so fresh and tastey! WAY better than Honky Tonk food by a long shot.

On three occasions the food was not good.  1st visit, ordered chicken fried steak.. it was tough, overcooked and slightly charred.  2nd visit, ordered corned beef.. it was salty and didn't taste very good.  3rd visit, ordered biscuits and gravy.. gravy was good but the biscuits were dry and tasted stale.

I probably won't go back again..

Always good happy  and friendly. 
Great service great food. Never a bad meal 
Love  this little place outdoor patio a great 
Love  eating Breakfast here my special place.

Servers are always very nice but they seem to be understaffed every time I go. Because they are always understaffed, the service is really slow. Very reliable for a late night bite. The dining area is always clean. Prices are fair for the amount of food you get.

1st time visit this past Saturday with a friend of mine. I thought the overall experience was pretty good. I tried the Post Its w/Chicken Bacon & Ranch on the side. These were pretty good. I was impressed with this item. We tried an order of potato skins and a small sausage and pepperoni pizza. All very good, fresh and hot. I'd like to note that we ended up with the pizza after ordering the chicken dip and being less than happy with that. Given that it's a "dip" we were put off by the fact it wasn't creamy or cheesy and pretty much seemed like a bowl of shredded chicken with buffalo sauce. Perhaps that's how alot of folks like it, not knockin' it, but I prefer to be able to dip my chips, not spoon out the dip, ijs.
Great prices on the drinks! My Vodka Gimlet's were $4 and her Cherry Vodka & Club Soda were $5.

Had the good fortune to go here Friday evening with my man. I ordered the coconut prawns and he had the wedge salad. We mostly went for the wine and atmosphere which was lovely. Would love to go back.

This is easily the best,  most inventive, stimulating eating experience in Tampa. 
By far. 
And I'm speaking to all of you who think Ulele is the pinnacle of Tampa dining.

The level of creativity and originality at this restaurant is quite stunning.
You'd have to go to food-meccas like New York or San Francisco to find something even close.

There's a food-artist working in the kitchen. and if you're bored with the same old thing...what I call the "Grilled chicken and vegetables" kind of entrees, and the caesar salad kind of appetizers, then you should be making a reservation at Edison...seconds after finishing this review.

Rarely mentioned on Yelp is that there is more to The Pharmacy than the burger. There is an another entirely different restaurant on the menu other than usually expressed. They style themselves as Nashville's, quote," "Wurst-Burger" Joint is also its original biergarten, boasting an impressive selection of German wurst and bier". I go there for the sausages, kraut, potato salad etc. which are all very good. I also go there at odd hours, fortunately for them they have a booming business and the wait can be painful. If asked about a  wurst and kraut dinner in Nashville, this would be my recommendation.
Amazing price and yummy sausage. There's indoor and outdoor seatings. Their hurricane  is better than the bogo when we did the ghost and vampire tour -

Cheesesteak tasted like a half pound of salt was poured in it. The sandwich my buddy got had beacon so raw it could have been chewing gum. There were 5 waitresses and a manager sitting around talking to each other while we had to ask for our drinks to be refilled. Personally, it was better back when is was smoke filled and dark as night inside.

Pt 2 The Chicken Sandwich Wars. Recently I wrote a review stating the chicken sandwich wars was over. I was wrong. I stated Popeyes had won the competition hands down. Then I tried Zaxbys. My nephew and I pulled into the drive thru. What happened next totally blew our socks off. We were greeted by a young man who clearly had drank one to many Red Bull's that day. I'm kidding of course. When he greeted us "Welcome to Zaxbys home of the best chicken sandwich". My nephew and I looked at each other skeptically. We had ate many other chicken sandwiches. Some were good and only one tickled our fancy. The young man at the drive thru sounded very confident. He gave us what I refer to as the " The business ". If I could gave him a six star rating I would have. This guy will crack you up. We got to the window and picked up our order. Same guy waits on us. He continues to his hysterical spiel till we drive off. Now for the "CHICKEN SANDWICH". Unwrapping the sandwich the first thing I noticed is the size of the chicken breast Zaxbys gives you. Bring your fat pants with you because by the time you finish they will be necessary. Biting into the sandwich, it's well seasoned and has a light crunchy texture ( must be from the double breading). You had me at double breading. When I find a stellar chicken sandwich it's like an Al Green song just sit back and enjoy it. Trust me this is a chicken sandwich that eats other chicken sandwiches for breakfast. Zaxbys has 3 central Indiana locations. Go check one out and get this now! P.S. The crinkle cut fries really good too! P.S.S The restrooms were pristine too! P.S.S.S  Say hi to our new drive through chicken guru!

The Irish Mile probably doesn't actually go the Irish mile, but it suits me fine so far.

Prices are good, and so is the fried ravioli. However, for a joint that promotes craft beers, the offerings are a let down. Sure, they had Leffe Blonde around, but that's the best you'll find here. 

And, sure, the wait staff is a little shaky. But the bar has a nice set up, and the bartenders are cool. Plus, they have pinball!

My biggest complaint is that women have to go back toward the entrance into crazy bright lights to visit the bathroom. Counterintuitive when the dude's room is toward the back, dontcha think?

My husband and I with our daughter decided to try the Claim Jumper here in Reno. We were not impressed. From the very moment we entered the restaurant it was pretty bad. We waited for someone to greet us for almost 8 minutes, and when someone finally said anything they said this-"Have you been helped yet?" Us- No not yet." "Okay well wait a few minutes longer." Us- 0.o? It wasn't even busy.
Anyway we finally got seated and our server was very nice, but she was kind of slow and rarely came to our table-but still she was the only redeeming quality due to how nice she was. The first table we sat at had a horrible flickering light so we had to flag her down and move to another table. The table was sticky and unclean. I had to use wipes from my purse to clean off the surface. Our food came and was cold and bland. My husband ordered the filet and lobster and the 7oz filet looked like a 2oz wad of meat. The cheesy garlic bread was uncooked and tasted horrible. And lets not talk about the cesaer salad. Ugh.
I actually came home and got sick. All I ate was a Turkey sandwhich with avocado and it made me really sick. 
Due to the lackluster experience and terribly bland and unexceptional food we will not be coming back to this establishment. I have not been to a CJ in years and after reading that they have changed ownership, and since the change they've gone downhill it shows. For the price you should have a far better experience and we did not receive that at all.

Very modern and urban but cozy cafe feel. We got the sloppy joe (nothing special, tastes good if that's what you're looking for), autumn Dutch baby (don't get if you don't like bleu cheese) and the latke. I think the latke was the most forgettable thing, but the Dutch baby was definitely one of the most unique dishes, I've had. You can tell the recipes are very sophisticated and can take an acquired taste. That being said, I would recommend getting a pastry! I loved the lemon bar I got and I wish I tried the cookie. Its such a unique menu but don't get intimidated, it's all great. Be prepared to wait an hour if you go at popular brunch time!

The place is very tiny and vibey. The food is pretty good, but a little on the pricey side. The only thing I didn't like about the place was the food takes a long time to come out. 
We got the truffle fries and it was really good, we also got oysters (not bad) and then we got the citrus mussels. It was a little bit on the salty side .. felt like my sodium intake was 150% over what it should have been. 
I got the pasta with chicken- the chicken was super salty as well. So my sodium intake was 200% over. 
Other than that, the drinks were really good. I got the passion fruit tequila drink.. with jalapeños. Yummm  
I did enjoy everything- just wished it wasn't as salty!

If I could give zero stars I would. Not a fan. Staff was not friendly from the start. I had friends in from out of town and for absolutely no reason one of my friends was forcibly removed from the bar by the bouncers. I can only assume they grabbed the wrong guy but we weren't given an explanation. Or maybe these meatheads just wanted to have some fun and my buddy was the unlucky person. Whatever the reason it was totally unnecessary. Regardless I won't be back to this place ever again. I've been a resident of Nashville for 25 yrs and there's way better bars than this one anyway. My advice is don't go to Ole Red!

This bar advertised itself as having outdoor dining but a manager, Woody, was just very rude to us when our server sat us outside. He said no one is allowed out there but wouldn't provide an explanation. Our server was lovely though.

This place is awesome. Plenty of parking and seating inside. I loved their background musical selection. It was our first time there, I was in the mood for a hot open turkey sandwich and found this place on google with great reviews so I had to try it out. Well this place did not disappoint. Hot open turkey sandwich was amazing and the mashed potatoes where out of this world!!!  Great price, hubby had the meatloaf early bird special with the baked potato and soup, plus we took a slice of the mile high chocolate cake, which is also a must try, and we only spent less than $30 with beverages. Food came out quick as well. Very nice decor and great staffing. Definitely going back for more!!!

Was at our hotel in the middle of nowhere New Jersey and didn't  want to eat at Wendy's so I thought to come to Denny's for a classic cheap dinner. We were easily sat and got our food quickly however my husband got a burger with a hair in it and after we read other reviews on yelp about how terrible this place is. DO NOT RECCOMEND.

Treated my mom and my sister to lunch at the Yard House, we were so excited. I have had Yard House in Florida and always really loved it. However, our experience at this Yard House was TERRIBLE. 

The service was worst then most, our waiter Josh took our water order and forgot to bring lemons and then disappeared into the kitchen for at least 20 minutes!! When we were finally able to track him down he explained that he was in the kitchen for a staff meeting.  Any reason why this was going on during restaurants hours? We waited over 40 mins for just a simple lunch special - soup/salad and sandwiches. 

DO NOT order the French Onion soup it was tragic and there was no cheese on top, instead floating in it was a large piece of bread which pretty much made up the entire soup. To top it all off then they ended up bringing my sister the wrong order.  Kitchen staff made sure to fix the issue but Josh remained clueless as ever mainly because we didn't see him for another 15 mins. Once I took out my wallet and was trying to pay Josh walked away and I could spot him chatting with other staff near the bar.

The terrible service continued as we walked out the door, no thank you or goodbye as the hostesses faced their backs to us.  Don't come here unless terrible service doesn't bug you and you don't care about people wasting your time. Message to management - treat your costumers better and hire staff that cares!

Well I think they have new management. It wasn't horrible but it wasn't mind blowing like the old pizza with the sweet sauce and the yummy wings are completely different now as well. It's not worth a 15 minute drive anymore. And don't bother to ask for ranch. I'm sorry folks it used to be so good :(

We went for happy hour, expecting wonderfulness.  What we got was ONE drink (bartenders choice) and one that I detest, expensive, stupid "small plates", one of which was ONE scallop in a cream sauce.  Why bother.  We won't be returning any time soon

I had my first Husk lunch a few weeks ago and I keep going back. The lunch is simple but it is also simply good. I've never ordered anything I didn't enjoy though I prefer their lunch menu to the dinner I had. It's hard to suggest something as their menu changes daily but in general my favorites include the deviled eggs and the oniony, cheesy hamburger. The rolls and the butter are always worth it as is dessert. Just say yes to everything.

I love everything about Husk. I love the local creations, the thought behind the food, the old house, and the garden. It is one of my 3 favorite restaurants in town and I highly recommend it.

Green Eggs Cafe is my go to brunch spot for when my friends or family visit. The food is always delicious and they have a great selection of brunch items. The portions are also huge and you'll leave more than stuffed! 

They have a wonderful selection of sweet breakfast entrees, the most popular probably being the red velvet pancakes. I definitely recommend also trying their savory, and even lunch, options. The eggs Benedicts are incredible.

If you can, try to beat the brunch crowd. The restaurant can get very busy. Although the line moves pretty fast, I've waited for over an hour during the weekend lines.

Went here for the first time at the suggestion of a first date I was meeting.  Had no idea what to expect but I arrived first and sat at the end of the bar. Bartender came up and introduced himself as Josh and got me a blue moon on tap.  Date arrived, we moved to a loungey table by the bar and had a few more drinks while Josh remained the right amount of attentive.

I closed out the tab at the bar with Josh and mentioned I wanted to get a table and he ran over and got someone to bring us to a table in the main restaurant.  Cooper was our waiter and he was very personable and like Josh was the right amount of attentive.  Date ordered calamari and I got the crab cakes. The food came out very fast - maybe 10 minutes.  I'm not a calamari person so I didn't try that but the crab cakes were very good.

Overall had a really good time and would go back again.
Cute little place. HUGE menu. Everything I've eaten there is great- ranging from omlets to fried chicken and waffles to salads to burgers. Excellent food.

Ate at an outside table on my own, while visiting Philadelphia. The staff seemed very concerned whether I was alright (perhaps it seemed like I was stood up?) and chatted me up nicely. My couscous, kale and salmon salad was flavorful, thanks mainly to the pumpkin seeds (great salad topping!). The salmon was cooked just right. Nice meal, a little on the pricey side ($13, sans tax and tip) but I would definitely return the next time I'm in town.

Had one of my worst dining experiences ever here! Ordered the spinach artichoke pizza and found a half of green beetle with wings. Yes I had already eaten half of it. The half I didn't eat was probably the size of my thumbnail. Once I finished vomiting the manager spoke with me. She offered me some pasta and gave me my $10 refund. She said "it happens sometimes" and gave a half sincere apology. Not enough pasta in the world would ever be enough for me to come back here or suggest to any of my friends to continue dining there. The young man who served me my pizza had more sincerity than the manager. Puking at my table and then running to the bathroom to vomit even more is not how I prefer my dining experience. Absolutely disgusted and beyond disappointed. Someone clearly isn't washing the vegetables thoroughly or paying attention to detail. This is the second time I've found something in my food. The first time it was a bundle of hair on the underside of my rosemary  chicken salad. DONE with this restaurant.

Very good overall, stick with the starters and sandwiches, not particularly impressed with the entrees, great room, nice staff and service. Highlights include the burger, the French dip, the short rib tacos, they do nice fries but I miss the truffle sauce, didn't see it on the menu. Bar did a very fine job on the cocktails.

Stopped here for a quick lunch while visiting a friend at Temple University. On the inside this place looks like a typical college sports bar and has the wear and tear to prove it is a late night hangout. 

We were seated right away as it was pretty quiet on a Tuesday afternoon. The booth we were seated in was actually broken, and I had to spend my lunch straddling the board in the center of the seat.

The food itself was good. I ordered an Avocado BLT with grilled chicken and a side of waffle fries. The wrap was messy, but tasted good, as well as the waffle fries, so I really couldn't complain.

I just ordered take out which qas the smoky wings and the Buffalo wings. The smoky wings were salty and smoky, very good. The buffalo had a somewhat sweet flavor to it. Maybe pineapple? I had wished they were a lil bigger but an order gets you 8 wings. The blue cheese must be made in house. It tasted smokey with a ranch? Flavor to it. Also very unique and good. I think the reason I gave this place 5 stars was for its boudin links. The boudin is the best in the city. Hands down. I try boudin as much as I can bc I am boudin obsessed and a know what good boudin from the boudin capital (scott la) should taste like and this boudin is comparable to the best stops smoked boudin. It's spicy more meat to rice ratio and smoked so the casing snaps when you bite into it. The service was good, they even gave patrons a free sample of the thick smoky bacon they just cooked. That was fabulous and would love to buy 10 lbs of that! So very happy this place exists. Thank you!

I have been here a few times, and it has to be the best biscuit I have yet tasted in Nashville, possibly anywhere. Do not let the place fool you as it is literally just a tiny shack with a tiny window to order from. At first I was taken back by that, since I did not think it was going to be good, I was wrong. I have tried a few different biscuit sandwiches but oddly the classic bacon/egg/cheese is my favorite. The biscuit is soft, flaky, and would impress Paul Hollywood on the Great British Bake Show. They only negative which really isn't one, is that since they make everything fresh it takes a little while for your order, and there is practically no where to sit. This is not enough to stop me from coming back, but if I were them I would finish out the little sitting area they have on the side of the building. It doesn't need much, just a cover of some sort and some actual seating. Had I not been so impressed by the food I would probably have dropped a star for the lack of convenience, but I get the impression they want people to just order and go, which is OK by me!

Buffet limited: cafeteria style, as in no seasoning, meats with no flavor. Green veggies, only if you get a salad, otherwise too many starches. 
They do have breads & cake deserts, but if you are on a no grain diet, you are out of luck. 
The Farmers Omelet was pretty decent. They will let you have cottage cheese, instead of potatoes. 
Restrooms are questionable, they wash the bowl, but only have splashes of chemical on toilet seat surface & not wiped down. 
  TV lounge okay, but only regular tv.

Although it's been situated on Main St in New port richey for years many locals have never heard of this quaint eatery. A group of girls went for brunch and were happy with the outdoor seating at well as the menu variety. The service left a bit to be desired but overall we were happy with our food and would go back to try different dishes next time.

This was a large disappointment. My sister's hamburger was cooked with-in an inch of its life and had no bacon. Reuben sandwich presented dry corn beef with coleslaw and no flavor. Coffee was good, staff was attentive and the patio was enjoyable. Hamburger was comped. They care. I'm sure it will improve.

Nice menu with original items. I had the native chili and a burger. The burger was excellent although a bit overcooked for medium-rare. The service was excellent and the roasted corn on the cob was worth the trip. Slightly overpriced and loses the fifth star for that reason.

We stopped in on a Saturday afternoon for a drink and a snack.  I'm not a fan of beer, so I loved having copious options for hard cider (and cocktails, of course).  I tried the Flannel Mouth and really enjoyed it.  We ordered the crack fries, too, with some ranch.  Yummmmmmy!  Always a treat!  Service was great...once we realized the high tops don't count as being in the bar area (you have to be sat there).

Went there for dinner @4:30. Server was very nice.  Took a long time for the food to come out. My wife's chicken and shrimp was lukewarm at best.  My chicken fried steak was small, very greasy  and overbreaded.  They offered to replace my wife's dinner but they were so slow to start by the time they did I would be fine.  Manager came by and apologized and offered us a free desert or appetizer.  Honestly I don't know even with that I don't know if we'll go back.  The food was unremarkable.  But at least they tried.

Great breakfast place.

The family feel and comfort food! 

Definitely will come back whenever I'm in Tucson. These places have been closing in Tucson so I hope this one sticks around.

Try it!

Well let me see where can I start this place has the best wings  and drinks hands down.

But nothing tops there customer service it's the best thing to me they are A1 when it comes to that.

A fantastic place and highly recommended!  My wife and I vacationed in Santa Barbara for our 15th anniversary and had several dinners here.  The food and drinks are amazing!  Even better the staff really can't be beat!  The manager (Colin) really cares about every dinning experience and the staff always was delightful!  Highly recommended!

Great spot in the pernt! Grab a beer and some grub at the dry dock if you're in algiers for sure!

Beat way is to take the ferry there, be sure to get a beer to go and when you hop back on the ferry to head back to the east bank!

Good burger and really good fries and onion rings. Good size portions as well. Overall a solid option but it's a bit pricey- a soda was nearly 3 bucks for example. Not an everyday burger joint but it's certainly somewhere I'll go back to

So I am in Indianapolis with a client today. As most of you know I usually hunt out the local "favorites". As it turns out, I'm following in Guy Fieri's footsteps with Diners Drive-Ins and dives today. 
For lunch, I decided to head to the Steer-In Indianapolis, a local diner that has been keeping bellies full for 50 years. Guy did an episode here in March of 2011. Known for their meatballs (sandwiches as well as with spaghetti), their home made Mac & Cheese, and their home made beef noodles, I had to give this place a try. I ordered a meatball appetizer, with a side of Mac & Cheese as my meal. Talk about good ole home cooking!!  Can't wait to come back and try some of the other menu items, including the beef and noodles, which looked delicious!!

I've been here many times before, but this was my first time since outdoor dining was able to reopen. I went with one other friend of mine on a Tuesday evening. We were told the wait would be about 40 minutes, but it only ended up being 20 minutes, which was great! 

With the outdoor dining restrictions in place, I was very satisfied with my overall experience here. They were really busy, but they still were able to provide excellent service along with great food, which came out quicker than I expected! I got the Wicked Chicken Wrap with mild sauce, which was really good! Heather was our waitress and she was so nice and provided amazing service. I will definitely be going here again soon!

Great menu and atmosphere for a cafe in the airport but awful customer service & advertising. Their espresso machine and juicer was broken which means they could not offer half their menu. The sandwich we ordered was supposed to be on ciabatta bread but was not & did not have any cheese like advertised. The kale salad had more cheese than greens on it. I had such high hopes but was very very disappointed

This place should be much nicer given the primo location and prices. Our waiter was great but the food was sub-par on every level and came out crazy fast. Every dish lacked flavor or was boring. I think they're banking on steady flow of business given the beautiful views and location but I will not be eating there again anytime soon.

I'm so mad. I don't have a washer and dryer so I have no choice, I have to go to Melbas. At LEAST half of the customers and several employees were either not wearing a mask or had it half on and ZERO social distancing. I was there for 3 hours and not one time did I see anyone ask a customer to put their mask on or wipe down & disinfect a table, a machine, a door handle, NOTHING. What the hell??!!  Zero signs, zero enforcement, zero cleaning protocols, or any kind social distancing set up or attempt; endangering employees and customer lives. I've been to grocery stores, dr & dentist offices, Uber & cab rides, cafes and this was the first time I was genuinely scared I might get it. Gd I will be pissed if I get covid cause someone was being selfish and didn't want to wear a mask properly or at all. Or because the owners are not doing their jobs. Oh and ps to the owners of Melbas, maybe don't constantly advertise the "panty dropper" daiquiris on the loudspeaker on the side where children are. Just a thought.

Pretty standard sports bar. Does not do anything special for birthdays. Good for groups. Love the round tables for our group of 6.

Decent list of draft beers which is nice. Weekly specials too. Friendly service but the waitress didn't know much about beer except what people commonly order. 

Got the vodka pasta and it was good but very heavy. Definitely had enough for leftovers. Good location inside circle center mall and so it's easy to find parking since it's just the mall.
Service is awesome and very attentive, the food is very tasty and very well presented. Deviled eggs, meatballs and Avocado Toast with eggs are a must

When you stay in New Orleans you cant walk 50 feet without walking by a restaurant. WJ is not on the tourist strip of places but is worth a long walk or Uber to get there. Its really a gourmet breakfast experience that doesn't disappoint.

My wife and I love going to Epic Pizza and getting delicious craft beers from Itap.  If you like neapolitan pizzas this place will definitely satisfy.  The classic marguerite is so delicious!  The crust tastes so fresh and hand made, the sauce is so full of flavor you'll never want delivery again.  Combined with the craft beers of Itap, this is a favorite destination!

I almost hate to write this review (because I don't want this secret out)!!! This place is AWESOME.  The Eggplant Fries, the seafood platter (3 of us shared it), and OMG THE PIZZA.... Katie (at the bar) recommended the pizza and it was DELISH... I can't wait to go.  thanks guys, you rock.....

Absolutely the worst grilled cheese I have ever had. Wayyy over rated. Its bread from a bag and run of the mill cheese pressed. Nothing fancy nothing you go "omg" about. Wayyyy too expensive for a cheese sandwich. Gross...dirty bathroom shared. No atmosphere. Nerve the prices they charge for bread and cheese. YUK...oh...and the guy behind the counter NEVER shuts up!!

LOVE LOVE LOVE! "straight fire" - says my boyfriend. We love the food and the service. 

Owner/ Manager (?) with salt and pepper hair and accent is so amazing! He really cares.

Some very unique flavor profiles, that you might not think would pair nicely but create a harmonious symphony in your mouth. Where each instrument or flavor note shines beautifully! Literally almost brought me to tears it was so overwhelming! After trying 4 things on the menu, everything was delicious. It's a nice place you can come back to and order something different every time and be satisfied. So wonderful!
This is a cute little neighborhood corner diner. They have great breakfast pizza and really good omelets also. We usually sit at the bar to dine, and the service is always great!

I came here with a group of about 20 people for a post funeral luncheon. We had reserved the private dining room. The restaurant was very accommodating when we arrived an hour early. We ended up getting drinks at the bar while they set everything up. I tried the Bloody Mary which was made to perfection. I loved that it had a nice kick to it. 

I ordered the chicken blt for my lunch entree. It was delicious... and not to mention huge. I had enough leftovers for lunch the next day. 

Service was great. Everything was brought out in a timely manner. Our waitress was very friendly and attentive.

OMG...this is heaven on earth!   On our recent trip to NOLA...my husband and I stopped in for breakfast after several recommendations!    WOW...just WOW!   This place was so yummy...I wanted to lick my plate!     The biscuits are perfection...the food is PERFECT!    Please open a Ruby Slipper Cafe in Chicago!     I'm going to be making trips to NOLA just for the food alone!      YUMMY!    We also had great service here...I'm sad I can't remember our server's name, but everyone was great and catered to all the tables - not just their own!!       FABULOUS experience!     Thank You, Ruby Slipper!

Took my friend there for the first time. We ordered the Gyros, homemade chips & goat cheese/apple shake. DEE -LISH!! Unfortunately, it was a very quiet lunch. My friend was so busy stuffing his face he didn't say 1 word - he just made yummy noises! Maybe next time he'll talk but ... Maybe not. The menu is packed with a ton of stuff (salads, sandwiches, burgers, hotdogs. Ect). You could eat there every day for more than 3 weeks & never eat the same thing twice. Going back to get the Kosher, Chicago hotdog. And another shake of course!!
The employees don't seem to take customers very seriously and get off task with other employees. This has happened several times. I do appreciate the crushed ice and bread.
Lobster cheesesteak was amazing, The Cheesesteak was good but the creamy lobster on top just finished it off. Crabfries were seasoned well, and you just crave more of it as you eat more of it.

Craft street is the perfect spot for good food and great drinks. The food service is fast and the food is delicious. There is always something new with the monthly specials  that keep the menu fresh. The bartenders, mainly Stephanie and Matt are the best part, always busy but never too busy for personal service that keeps you coming back for perfect drinks. If you ever have a problem the managers will make it right. We'll above the competition

Overpriced for what you receive, I've tried to really like this place, but I just can't. 

Yes the wine selection is good, and yes their menu is interesting, but I can't wrap my head around how a glass of wine (with a tiny pour) and a salad without any type of meat, put me back $30.

Like I said, it's good but not worth the price.
Great food and drinks. Loved the atmosphere and band. I am short (5'3) and couldn't see over the edge of the rooftop bar. Other than that, everything was great!

We now go every Sunday for Brunch and just love it.  This is a gem and is probably the best food in Newtown - and no more expensive (if not less) than some of the others.  Very nice service, and young, fresh menu.   Fitting name as my palate is always pleased when we go.

Was a solid place. We needed a place to watch the Saints-Falcons game and also to kick back with our co-workers and get away from customer dinner. We tried all the apps and were really good. The egg or spring rolls were the best. Calamari great as well. Entrees were good. Service excellent and beers as well.

Disappointing experience at Joe's today. Came in around 1:15. They were not busy. Seated promptly and then we apparently became invisible. Not a word from a server. No water. Nothing. Waited for over 10 minutes and left. They were not busy, so no excuses. It'll be a while before we try Joe's again.

We stood in line for about 45 minutes in 30 degree weather but it was completely worth it. As the appetizer we got the Flight 33 fries with 13 ranches. Our favorites was the Asian Zing and Jack the Ripper ranches. As my meal I got the Chicken pesto sandwich with tomato basil ranch and as my side I got the loaded potato salad. It was amazing. My boyfriend got the grilled cheese burger with fries. And I didn't try it but it looked amazing. The staff was very nice and personal even though they were incredibly busy. They answered our questions politely without ever seeming to rush us. Sadly I did not get my waitresses name but she was very kind and likable. I seen her with other customers and was just as nice and caring. I can't wait to go again!

Stuck in the early 90's with plenty of gimmicks to entertain the businesspeople and yuppies who live a white-washed fantasy. As if the suppressed rocker inside the power suit or yoga pants can't wait to sip on a "Keith Richards". "wake up and live" with a "Bowl of Soul".
I cannot say they offer much in the pursuit of craft or ingredients, its like a really good version of Starbucks circa 1995.

I think about here is where the night begins to get blurry for me. After several bars we pass Winners and say "yes".  

As we walk in immediately to the left was the stage and much to our surprise it's karaoke night!! We put in our songs and pushed our way to the back where the bar is.  After reading several other reviews I understand why people come here for karaoke on the off chance seeing someone famous. We really didn't care we just wanted a drink and to sing a song.  

Once again as other bars on our stops the drinks were super strong and the bartender was cordial. The patrons were also friendly and this is where we heard about the one of the next bars on our whirlwind drinking tour of Nashville.

Back to karaoke, I wish we could have sang but there was so many people there that we could have been there all night and maybe sang once if we were lucky. We weren't impressed by the bar, just like any other karaoke bar in the world so time to move on the the next bar!

Very disappointed. I had the puttanesca while my date had the garganelli, and both were so salty we didn't even make it halfway through the dishes. The puttanesca was just plain disgusting - the chef sorely misused the anchovies. Additionally, it's nothing like having a meal where you have to SCREAM. Across the table to have a conversation. The noise was terrible. Terrible food and ambience, so many better restaurants around town!

Style over substance.  Oversalted food makes you thirsty for overpriced drinks, so if that's your thing, this place is for you.  I'd rather have perfectly seasoned food.

Good(s):
Crispy Calamari Salad - Tasty with good blend of textures.  By the end, the salad was starting to become bleh.

Bad (s):
Lobster Mac & Cheese - Orzo pasta was a big mistake here.  Seriously disappointing, if you've got a craving, you can get this almost anywhere these days.
French Onion Soup Dumpling - Salty, glue-y-ness.  Such a good idea imperfectly executed.

Won't be back here unless it's on the company's dime.

My husband and I eat here regularly and love it. The owners are husband and wife who take a lot of pride in the little gem they have created here. The ambience is great as is the food. Practically everything is homemade and wonderfully fresh and delicious. Many locals frequent this place because they know they won't be disappointed.  They are primarily a breakfast/lunch place and serve breakfast all day.  Let's keep them strong. EAT AT BENEDICTS!!!  You won't regret it.

Very entertaining concept, eclectic decor, friendly waitstaff but the food was just ok? I had the rib eye steak and it was very greasy and came with soggy french fries. Husband had the house special and it was so massive. Had a gift certificate and used it but would not be coming back anytime soon.

Took my kids there for the scary face pancakes. I inquired about getting a sandwich with grilled chicken instead of fried...i was told they had to use fajita chicken that was pre sliced. I after to that and we waited...and waited...there was maybe 4 other tables in the place and 2 of which came in after us...it was almost 30 minutes when i finally asked about our food as the kids were getting hungry and antsy...after asking my food appeared. The chicken looked mangled and was cold as was the cheese under it. I sent it back and was not only uninterested in getting it back or another one. The manner came out and tried to tell me the sandwiches they serve are all cold...i asked her how that was if they cook the chicken? She offered to warm it up...which i can only assume meant microwave so i declined...she comped my kids sodas...their pancakes were free...i tipped my server well as she was the only decent thing about the entire experience. Won't be back...

There is no need to go on and on about each item or the individual toppings or what the food looked like. The place is better than delicious, it really is. In fact, this might be the best burger place in Tampa. I'm open to suggestions if someone can offer up a better place! ;)

I got the pretzel burger (#1, Chicago Burger) because I'm a sucker for pretzel bread and jalapeño. YUM. I'm also a fry snob; this place does not disappoint.

AND THE MOST IMPORTANT ADDITION:
They do not sell beer, but there is a God and it's in the form of The Craft Beer Cellar a few doors down where you can sit and wait for your Burger and enjoy a tasty beer. Heaven. Enjoy!!!

Finally had the opportunity to try this place out. I heard about the chicken sandwich they were offering and was excited to try it, since I was in the mood for a chicken sandwich :-) I got to the counter, but didn't see the chicken sandwich on the menu, I was told the promotion was over, so only burgers to choose from. I went with their bacon burger and the regular fries. They gave me a buzzer which would let me know when my order was ready. I thought it was a bit strange that beverages weren't given as soon as you paid, instead I had to wait until my food came out to get it. 8 minutes later the buzzer went off, I picked up my food and beverage. The burger was cooked to done, not well done, not medium well, just done, which was fine with me. I took my first bite of the burger and the fries, they were good. The fries were nice and crispy, but after a couple of minutes the fries cooled and the texture changed drastically, I didn't finish them, they tasted like lard. The burger was good, but not filling enough. Long story short: limited topping selections, sub par fries,  ok small burgers. Maybe I should have just came here for a shake, I heard they're pretty good lol.

I love split rails large beer menu. We didn't have any problem getting a table near the bar during happy hour for discounted beverages! We went to eat during seafood night and it was AWESOME. I ordered the $1 raw oysters, and a lobster roll with huge chunks of lobster in it. My friends rave about the high-quality burgers and we never leave disappointed. I'll usually meet friends here for a drink in town when we're looking for a more laid-back atmosphere.

After walking around for what seemed like eternity, I pulled Yelp up and found the Mill! Lo and behold it was across the street from where we were standing! So 11 women went on in and I'm so glad we did! 

Everything was wonderful from the waiter, to our drinks to our amazing food. Two of us had a drink called Thanos and one had the Butterly Effect. Absolutely amazing! We ordered the watermelon bruschetta and spare ribs as appetizers and they were delicious. My Cobb Salad was amazing.

We were all so pleasantly surprised to find this place!

Love the 2 for 1 drink special and I honestly get the same meal each time I go! The chicken, shrimp and potatoes are always sooo delicious! It comes out piping hot and the seasoning is almost perfect. We also had a very nice waiter which always goes a long way with me when dining out.

Service, starting with the hostess stand for breakfast this am was poor! Restaurant had plenty of open tables yet the phone was more important than 3 guests waiting for tables. Took me 8 min to be seated in an half empty restaurant on a slow Saturday am! After being seated, I waited for over 5 minutes for a server to show up, all the while the hostess could see my frustration, but again a phone call was more important. I finally gave up and walked away from my free hotel coupon breakfast as this is a Hilton property as well! 
In fairness, I did have 2 nice breakfasts and a lunch and for those I would give them 4.5 stars but the last morning, maybe because it was a Saturday, the service was non-existent!

Pretty appalled that a manager of all people would put a plate down in front of someone looking like this. I had to use a napkin to pull the plate toward me because it was so gross. I shouldn't have even looked at the bottom...I started to question if the plate was ever clean. (At least my server Shannon was really nice...)

terrible. go here if you want to be bored and see young trashy landmines/grenades in the whoriest of whoriest outfits.

if you go: bring your whore wear, and a book. 

music: TERRIBLE! 

I thought I'd have a great time, WRONG! worst music! 

the little room in the basement would have been cool bc of the little tables n benches except it was about 90 degrees. 

another reason not to go: theres a cover, which is absurd bc its such a bad time. 

if you really want to go to mcfaddens, go to the one at citizens bank park. MUUCHHHH better

The complimentary bread is amazing.  It is is warm and fluffy and really tasty - definitely not like the plain white bread. I came hear for brunch on Sunday and got the buttermilk pancakes sprinkled with powdered sugar and fresh diced strawberries with a generous dollop of whipped basil ricotta for $13.  Three may (or may not) seem like a lot, but these guys definitely hit the spot. 

Mushroom soup and corn poblano soup is an absolute must-have.  Both soups are very creamy.  There's no chucks of anything (nothing wrong with that). The mushroom soup has creme fraiche and it's so delicious.  The corn poblano soup is topped with some chili oil and gives it a nice kick. Both soups have very smooth textures.

Lamb bolognese is also delicious.  I recommend the larger portion.  The small one is like a lunch portion. 

They also have unlimited Bloody Mary, sangria, and mimosa on Sunday's ...absolutely worth it. They make pretty tasty bloody Marys.

Service has consistently been great, except we often get cold truffle parmasean fries :( but when they remake it (which they've always been super nice about) , it's amazing.  They are thin cut fries.

2.5 stars.  

Unfortunately upon arrival we were told they were running behind on the reservations and there would be a 15 minute wait.  No problem!  We had plenty of our own delicious wine to drink in the meantime.  The 15 minutes became an hour.  Then they gave our table to another party that came in 15 minutes after we did and had a later reservation.  Still, we were in good spirits after clearing that problem up.

The meal turned out to be a bigger problem.   I love goat cheese and smoked salmon, yet somehow my appetizer was almost inedible.  Others in my party loved their apps and I have to admit the tortellini were very good.   The NY strip steak dishes were a huge ripoff (super small portion of meat)  The saving grace was the scallop dish.  If all I had was this dish, I would probably give the place 5 stars.  Dessert was pretty much a disaster.

The service was spotty and frazzled.  They were totally overbooked, so people were waiting all night for their tables.  After getting bad service they put on a 20% gratuity for our party of 6, which seems a little absurd.  I have no problem dropping cash at even pricier places, but I cant say that this place is really worth it.

My boyfriend and I went here one evening for a nice evening out, looking to really spoil ourselves. Well, boy did we! We had a wonderful evening here and shared in delicious food and wine. Word of the wise: they have a discount wine list, order from there. There are great deals and it's on the back of the menu. We had the ravioli for a starter, which melted in your mouth. Of course what meal wouldn't be complete here without some oysters?On to the next course....We had the red grouper for dinner then finished it off with some rich, dense Bete Noire. Everyone was very friendly here, which always adds a plus to the experience. For such a small place it had a wonderful atmosphere!

I go once a week for the beer and pub pizza happy hour. On the wall of shame a few times now. Good place to just hangout with friends and chat.  

Only bad part is the Wi-Fi sucks just don't even try and connect to it.

We love Portillos as a brand and visit every one we find in our travels. Like any location they always have a ton of employees working, the food is great, and it's a fun ambiance. For folks reading about slow food service this place isn't a McDonalds, it takes a little time to make the food but it's worth it. Give them some time to get fully on their feet and working like clockwork like any Portillos. If you give them another chance make sure you're trying what they're known for at least once - hot dogs, Italian beefs, burgers, cheese fries. This place is wonderful and we will be back when we travel through!

First time trying this burger spot in Nashville, and I must say I had a fabulous visit! I got the jack on piggy back with sweet potato fries, which were great. I also got 2 fried Oreos (at a $1 each) and they were a-mazing! The reason I am giving this review 4 stars instead of 5 is because of the limited parking that's available. And because there was no kind of direction when I first walked in. I wasn't greeted by anyone and there was no sign that said seat yourself, so I was wandering around until I finally asked a guest, "Do we seat ourselves?" And she replied "I guess, that's what we did." and went on to a vacant table. Other than that, I had a great experience! I will be back.

Went out to celebrate my bestie birthday, it was an ok evening. Didn't really care for our waitress she wasn't too friendly an was always in a rush. I ordered the shroom flatbread an the bread was a little too done. It had good flavor but was crispier then I thgt it would be. I also ordered the cheesesteak rolls an they had too much going on laying on a bed of ketchup an topped with some spicy chopped peppers along with being greasy. The drinks were good had the Americana an also the 5.00 fish bowls on Thursdays .. I will probably go back but the definitely need better menu items the food is so so..
Food was great. Staff was great. So full. There's a spot to play oversized games in the back. Full bar. Family friendly. Parking. What more can you ask for?

Our new favorite date place. Have been here so many times and cannot beat the food and service. Specials always amaze me with amazing food combinations. Sitting at the counter watching the chefs prepare is always interesting. I always leave full and happy.

The service here truly blows. Ordered three sandwiches and some wings. Wings came first and we are still waiting for the rest of our food. Ordered the wings ten minutes after the sandwiches. This place is actually terrible.  I would give ZERO if I could. Dirty plates slow
Kitchen. My kids keep telling me it is good but I just don't see it

This place would get no stars if that was even possible. Had a horrible experience there on Thanksgiving. First the way the layout and set up is your food is lukewarm or cold by the time you get to the table. On top of that homeless people wandered in begging for money as we sat and dined. Also worker went off on someone on the telephone right in the middle of the dining area. Thanks for giving us a horrible thanksgiving. Sorry for the delay of the post!

The atmosphere here is nice, service is frindly and fairly fast and the place looks pretty clean.   The food is good and they have some giant sized baked potatoes.  I got the lean brisket and it was decent.  You have to consider that I've been to Texas a few times and had some really good brisket in my days.  I've also had some good BBQ in general in my days and travels.  So I tend to be more critical in this area, especially with brisket.  On a side note, the corn muffins are quite good!  

Summary:  Good BBQ in general in a nice place with some big taters and excellent corn muffins

This place was amazing. 3 of us split everything- started off with 1$ oysters on their happy hour menu, along with French fries, pig bruschetta, and wings. Everything was delicious... Wings had a garlic butter Parmesan sauce on them with oregano. 

We split 2 things off their dinner menu- Clams and mussels that were in a spicy broth with chorizo, and a baked pot pie made with their homemade pig and topped with a savory bread crust. 

Our drinks were awesome too. They had a ton of good crafts, and wine on tap! 

I will be back.
