Reserved an area for our fantasy football draft last evening.  14 guys participated.
As soon as I walk in I can feel that the AC is not working and it's very warm in restaurant.  We had this large group and it was too late to make a plan B out of our situation so we stuck it out uncomfortably the rest of night.
Next problem was they WERE OUT OF DRAFT BUD LIGHT!! Who runs a wing joint and runs out of one of the most popular beers??
Waitress said they were working on fixing AC shortly.
Well night wore on and AC never fixed in fact waitress had fessed up later in evening that it had been out for 2 days!!!
No manager called out of courtesy prior or even cared to come by our group to apologize for being very uncomfortable or even offer to give us a break on meal or drinks for the lack of air conditioning.
I called to file complaint today and left number to call me back but no response. 
WILL NEVER GO TO THIS ESTABLISHMENT EVER AGAIN!
Advise everyone to stay away as well.

We've been in 3 times now, for breakfast, each time it's different. 1st time parked us under an open and running A/C vent, in the winter.  had to wear a jacket.
Second time was pretty good except for all the black, garbage potatoes in the home fries.
This last time, my breakfast was almost cold when served except for the scrapple which was smoking hot, she ordered a shrimp salad thing that was so over mayoed that she barely ate 1/2 of it and more crap in the home fries. After we sat for 10 minutes without MENUES!.
The only saving grace for this DIVE is the bar, so we can have an EYE OPENER.
We ate here in the past when it was a cash only place and the food was much better.
It's very hard to find a quality breakfast in western Montgomery County since the Collegeville Diner imploded.

Literally don't understand how or why a cheese pizza takes almost two hours to get delivered every. Single. Time. They always forget the sides of dressings (which they never forget to charge you for) and when I called to tell a manger after it happened a third time they mustered up a half behind "sorry." It's always disappointing ordering from here, the pizza doesn't even leave the store until at LEAST an hour after placing the order, and once you're notified that the pizza left the store, it's at least another hour till it gets to you. I wish there was another dominos that delivered to me.

The best bbq place in Nashville!! We've been I don't know how many times. Off-street parking for the most part (a few spots beside the building). You order at the counter and they call your name. The bar and food counters are separate. Lots of seating space. The bbq is moist, baked beans have just enough kick, and the Mac is creamy. I really like the dry rub ribs (which they recommend) but the hubby likes the wet, so you can't go wrong with either. I highly recommend!

Before writing this review I researched the menu online because we were given a pancake we didn't order and it confused me a lot when it arrived. The server told us it came with the meal. I think that may have been a mistake.

On Tuesday 2.2.21 my husband and I chose Black Bear Diner for our weekly breakfast/lunch date. I had smelled KFC about 10 minutes prior when I dropped my car off nearby and it made me want Chicken and Waffles. I just wanted to dip my fried chicken in warm syrup, that was all I could think about. We saw Black Bear and I knew they had what I wanted.

We called ahead to see the reservation situation. They do not take phone reservations, it is first come first serve. After we arrived we gave our phone number to the host and she let us know it would be 10 to 15 minutes. We waited in our car and it was about 10 minutes before we received the text to come inside. This was around 10am.

We were seated in the center of the restaurant. There was a lot of space between the tables and everyone was wearing a mask. We ordered coffee and water and waited patiently for the server to take our food order. Our server asked if I wanted cream and sugar with my coffee and I told her I didn't but she brought it anyway. I thought that was kinda funny. 

Since I already knew what I wanted I just had to wait for hubby to decide. Of course I ordered the Chicken and Waffles which comes with: A sweet cream waffle, 3 chicken strips,  2 eggs (any style), fresh fruit and syrup. I did not receive fruit save for the slice of orange garnish but I didn't know this was supposed to come with my food until today while researching the pancake. So no fruit, extra pancake. 

That was the best waffle! I don't normally get waffles because of the texture but this waffle recipe is by far my favorite. It's creamy and slightly sweet and it was evenly cooked and it had an adorable bear paw in the center. My eggs were cooked correctly. I asked for them to be on a separate plate and they obliged. I did not have leftovers. (Besides the extra pancake)

My husband ordered Bear's Choice (It's a BYO deal) with: bacon, a waffle, and scrambled eggs. Since we both ordered waffles I did not need to try his. I did get to snag a bite of bacon though. They have really good bacon. I didn't want to return his piece to him but I did because I'm nice.

Our visit was pleasant overall. We didn't use the facilities because there is an off odor coming from that section so we avoided that area. My coffee cup was never empty and we received our bill in a reasonable amount of time. 

I will return to this location for sure. I probably come here as often as I go to the one in Auburn. (Twice a year) Both locations are great!

This restaurant had pretty good food. The Brussels Sprouts were phenomenal and I WILL go back, if for nothing else, for those. The meatballs were also good. My husband and I shared the 4 Ball (Classic w/Marinara, Veggie w/Garlic Cream, Buffalo w/sriracha, and the Special). Honestly, my favorite was the Classic with Marinara - I would definitely get that again, and my husband liked the Buffalo meatball the best. Our three year old son got one of the meatball sliders which was a great amount for him. That being said...it was SO incredibly noisy in there. You couldn't even hear anyone at your own table and could hardly enjoy the dinner...instead we rushed through it just to get out of the noise. There was a large party in there with several kids, but still they have to figure out an appropriate place to put the large parties because it was way too much volume for all of the other patrons...it would be a 4 Star review if it wasn't for the noise.

Food was served promptly and hot. 
There were six of us for lunch and we were all happy with our order. New menus with higher prices but it is CS during the holidays.

Starting with the bartenders, it's the little stuff that matters. These folks really get exceptional service and between that and the incredible food as well as being in Webster Groves, I can rake this nothing less than five stars call you because there's no such thing as six starts. Great place!
The food looks great, the environment is awesome, also a cool place to come and enjoy a meal. The bar selection is also great. Make sure to check this place out if you are in West Chester, PA!

Considering that most people can't eat at the city's best restaurants every night, Smokey Bones is good for what it is -- a themed chain restaurant with food, service and an atmosphere that are good enough when you just need a bite to eat someplace convenient.  No, it's not the best BBQ I've ever had in my life, but I wouldn't expect the servers at Carrabba's to speak Italian either.

The food at Smokey Bones is pretty good, though the portions have gotten smaller so the meals can be a little pricey for what you get now.  The pulled pork and beef brisket are good, and the sauces are definitely worthwhile.

We'll probably go back the next time we're at the mall and cooking just ain't in the cards.

My sister and I went to this place. We ordered a pizza with no cheese because we are vegan. After eating less than half of the pizza we see white specs of cheese on the slices. We tell the waitress, and says there should not be cheese on the pizza. We showed her the pizza and she says "it looks like cheese." When our bill comes I asked her if we were going to be charged full price for half a pizza?? She said she would take care of it. The manager comes over to argue with us saying it wasn't cheese. Without ever looking at the pizza. He tries to tell us that it was garlic...uhhhh We know the difference between garlic and cheese. There was obvious cross contimation in the kitchen. He charges us full price for the pizza anyway. Without ever apologizing our acknowledging there was cheese on the pizza. They must have really needed that $12.00 sale. I have never had an interaction with restaurant management where there isn't at least an apology. The 'hand cut fries' taste frozen. Management sucks. I wish there was a negative star rating!! I guess there is no such thing as customer service or customer satisfaction at the Flying Fish.

This was hands down the best Raising Cane's that I have been to thus far. The service was fantastic and the food was amazing! I could not believe how attentive and polite the workers were. The food came out in less than 10 minutes! The chicken was crunchy and fries were done just right.

This bizarre island in the mall is All Right on your lunch hr once in a while. That is to say, only then are there few enough mall-walkers and other diners for it to be somewhat comfortable. Which is another way of saying the lunch menu is hit-or-miss tending toward good---

---my salad with steak, pears, gorgonzola, craisins, etc., was tasty but my colleague's tomato bisque & caesar salad both bothered her and left her still hungry---

---and can only result as it did for me in an explanation for disliking malls. An absurd feigned affect hung on the people eating around the counter. Teenage girls trying to look "hipster" and snobby stabbing at their food while flirting with the little waiter. A couple of awkward business coworkers. Even more awkward women who were obviously related. 

The stools had no metal to rest your feet on, appeared to be but were not soft, and of course were too short. Like seemingly all the other dining options, the waiters here are oblivious that sometimes people try to sit down to eat outside of work (which means beyond the parking lot also) on their one hr lunch! 

I have no interest in imagining how annoying and much less worthwhile a visit to this place would be during hrs with more mall traffic. Dinner descriptions don't sound nearly good enough for that.

Bar Louie is a cool place but nothing really original. 

Pros: Nice decor, outside patio, large space, attentive staff, and cool music.
Cons: Expensive drinks, probably going to have to pay to park, since it's an open air concept there will be flies buzzing around you even if you're inside, and it can get stupid crowded.

I'd definitely go again if someone else wanted to but probably wouldn't choose it myself.

My daughter and I went to Sabrina's for their well-known stuffed French toast. The food was great but the customer service was...should I say, so, so. It definitely could have been better. But, I would go back hoping to get a different experience

Amazing restaurant. Food is great. Really suggest the crab bisque. Loved the bread pudding. Staff was excellent especially the busser named Dylan. He was a delight and very responsive to my needs. Also was knowledgable about history of the building. Was very pleased with my meal. Will come back again for sure.

Came here for New Years. I had been wanting to try the chef's tasting menu. It was phenomenal!!  Worth every penny!!  The service was also fabulous. I can't wait until we can come back!  Also check out the drink that has tea in it from their cocktail list. So good!

Went for a lunch.  It should be a great spot for a quick lunch.  However, the place is severely understaffed.  our orders of a chicken sandwich and french fries (which tasted great) took about 45 minutes to arrive.  That is unacceptable during a lunch rush.
Portillo's is a nice restaurant to get Chicago style food. The staff is friendly and very comfortable atmosphere. If you like chocolate cake, theirs is delicious.
Very good food I had a vegan skillet as well as the kimchi Bloody Mary and the chai White Russian it was all great and my waiter was amazing.

This place was awesome. The food just seemed so fresh. It's hard to explain lol. I had a very large Greek Salad and man was it delicious. Everyone had something different and all of our foods were perfect. You will want to eat here often.

The Mrs and I stopped here for dinner on Valentine's Day after sadly being disappointed by 1-800-Balloons (please don't order from there)

Anyway... back to the excellent service and how well North Italia made up for the day.  We made reservations early to beat the rush and plus we have a reservation to see Fifty Shades Freed (Guys, if you want to get lucky, give into the sequels).  Because of the early reservation, they had a limited menu.  No biggie, Vito (the manager) more than made up for it with perfect wine pairings, a chef's board and amazing customer service. 

We enjoyed the appetizer and drinks until dinner was served at 4pm and enjoyed our time here at North Italia.   

Great service everyone... will definitely be back soon!

Cheers!!!  Or as they say in Italy--- Salud!!!

New to the neighborhood, this place is a gem, consistently delicious despite a varying menu, time and time again.

Last night we went with two other couples, and due to a lingering party, our reservation time was delayed. Our server more than compensated by bringing us THREE appetizers on the house.  Each more delicious than the other. The first was a generous array of Mediterranean olives, the second was a chips and dip combo and the third, my absolute favorite, was a steak tartar with savory crustinies. Out of this world.

Everything we ordered was delicious, dessert and cocktails included. With the exception of one malevolent male bartender, the service is ALWAYS professional and courteous. 

This is a laid back casual atmosphere that serves exceptional food with attention to detail.  And some of the best bread and butter I've ever had....

Food was unbelievable for a sports bar!  I has lobster mac and cheese and it was to die for.  Ordered martinis- two for $15 rounds.  Was a pleasant experience.  I will definitely be coming back to dine.

Milktooth is always a solid choice! Delicious food (especially the waffles!!) and great coffee drinks. I recommend getting a coffee while waiting for a table. 

There is a small parking lot out front of the restaurant.  If it is full, then there is street parking.

If you like beer and burgers, this is the place to go.  Daily board specials list current beer on tap selections, be sure to check these out on your visit. A must get on the appetizer menu is the Cheese fries with short rib gravy.  This is a great app to share with your crew on your visit.

For burgers, my favorite is the Second Coming, 100% dry aged sirloin, chopped overnight tomatoes, roasted garlic aioli, gruyère cheese, shoestring fries and a pickle.  This is the burger you want when your crav'n a Burger!  For those not into beef, they have Turkey, Black Bean and Wasabi Tuna burgers, all great choices.

If your not in a burger mood, be sure to try one of their awesome sammys, like the Grilled  Chicken & Mushroom sandwich with gruyère, candied bacon, sautéed 'shrooms, onion straws, garlic aioli, toasted sourdough or their Short Rib Melt sandwich with short rib, vermont white cheddar, pickled onion, garlic almond aioli, sourdough bread. 

Wednesdays feature buck-a-shuck oysters, they have daily app and beer specials and be sure to try the She Crab soup if you are here on a Friday.

Stopped by for lunch last week, and I was really impressed by the burgers and service. It's a cool dive-y bar, with good food and a nice patio. The manager mentioned they have karaoke on Saturdays so we went back at night and it was PACKED. The bartenders were all great. There's lots of great dives in town, and Bob Dobbs is no exception- I'll definitely be back!

Great little place. Nice atmosphere with friendly helpful servers. Food fresh and wonderful. Love their health drinks. Killer bacon. Great summer menu. Summer lobster is wonderful. The go to spot for breakfast and lunch.  Yum and yum.

I love miller's, this is my first time at the Plymouth meeting location. We had such a great experience, fast seating and a wonderful waitress, Jessica, she was amazing! Zingers are lifeeee make sure to get the sweet Thai chili! I promise it's finger licking great, oh and the potstickers.

We had breakfast fair here at the end of March. My husband had the Migas and loved it. Said the tortilla chips really added a good crunch to his omelette. The candied bacon was yummy, if you're into sweet; the bacon was thick rather than thinner like the regular strips. I had the Florentine omelette and that was yummy too. Service was okay.

I've been eating here for 3 decades! Absolutely perfect cheeseburgers! Impeccable service. The waitress always remembers us. Burgers are served fast and cooked to perfect temperature. Nice location. Exactly the same since the early 1980's, which, in this case, is GREAT! Jeans, T shirts, tennis shoes, scrubs, overalls, work boots... This is the place. Laid back, good way to end the work week. I'd eat a Ground Pati cheeseburger every night for the rest of my life if I could get away with it.... Yum yum yum!

Nice neighborhood bar & grill vibe.  Service is top-notch, but not overbearing.  The French Onion Soup (special) is divine; I wish it was on the regular menu. The charred tomato bruschetta skillet with burrata is wonderful and great for sharing. They have fried green tomatoes year-round and they are crispy and delicious on their own as an appetizer or on a panini sandwich. There is so much good-looking stuff on the menu that I want to try.  The desserts I've tried are a little too intense, and I usually regret ordering one, even to share, just because I've already eaten too much good stuff.

The food at cafe Patachou is always delicious and filling. We love going to here for the menu. The only reason why I didn't give 5 stars, is because the tables, floors, and opaque privacy "glass" parameter, were very filthy with grease and food that it made me want to order take out next time instead of dining in.

Decent place for breakfast.  We ordered 3 different benedict variations - pulled pork, fried chicken, and corned beef. They all had different sauces and the same biscuit/English muffin on the bottom. The muffin was pretty dense for breakfast. The amount of meat that was included in each breakfast really varied. They gave a lot of pulled pork, a piece or two of chicken tenders, and just 3 1x1 inch pieces of corned beef on each of the two muffins. Service was good and the servers were upbeat.
Friendly service and good food. Try the groomer taco. Not too many customers at 3pm just the locals. Had to wait for the ladies restroom to be fixed. Other than it was good place to eat.

My old college roommate recently start a "Tampa Bay Ladies Supper Club" and chose Ella's as the first dining spot. I've already read good things about Ella's, so I was super excited to have a group of foodies to try it out with. 

Ella's only takes reservations for parties of 8 or more, which means the wait can get a bit crazy on the weekends. We had 7 and just missed the 8 person cut-off. The place was a lot bigger than I thought it was from reading reviews (I pictured small and intimate for some reason?), two stories of table and a deck that's dog friendly. I found my group of friends at the bar enjoying some cocktails. The bar was long and great for waiting for a table by. I was in the mood for a beer, but was severely disappointed by the lack of beers on draft (only 3? really?). I ended up ordering a Cigar City Maduro in the bottle. 

We were seated after roughly 45 minutes and were escorted to our table in the loft-ish area upstairs.

The menu was amazing. I actually had a sneak peek at the kitchen as we were waiting to be seated and everything that passed by looked and smelled good. My stomach was grumbling and I was ready for food!

I ordered the Wino Burger, which was AMAZING. Definitely worth ordering again if I had the chance. The "bacon apple jam" on top? Umm.. yeah. Mouthwatering. Totally made the burger. Can I have more now, please? pretty please?

The sweet potato fries may or may not have been why I stuck with the burger page. I saw too many of these puppies pass me by - I had to try them. The fries were salty, not sweet, which I 100% prefer. I'm not a huge fan of sweetened sweet potato fries. These were more herby and spicy. They were perfect with ketchup.

The girls ordered a banana/ peanut butter/ chocolate churro with ice cream dish for dessert that looked and sounded delicious. If it didn't have banana, I would have been all over it.

Overall I was impressed with Ellas and can see why it's so popular - it totally met and surpassed all my expectations. My new goal is to return for their Soul Food Sundays!

I was pleasantly surprised when u walked in the door,  place was packed, I spoke with the host and was told 5-10 minute wait.  8 minutes later I was seated.  Great list of beers on tap, Wednesday was 2for1 on select beers, liquors and drinks, much enjoyed.  Had a burger which was tasty and perfectly prepared.

This Tavern is not a restaurant. It is a "concept." It is one of many eateries collected under the M Street Entertainment Group, which across their portfolio of concepts offers a wide range of cuisines: a boutique steakhouse, a Latin cantina, an Asian fusion lounge, Italian kitchens, and a couple of Southern American pubs. Tavern falls into this last category as a gastro-pub, but if you ask me, from the inside, it appears to be a dungeon.

The lobby contains decorative chains, gears, and possibly even a functioning drawbridge door. The interior is dark, no matter what time of day you're eating, and there's clean wood, stone, and concrete material surrounding you. The upper eating deck, which looks down onto the gladiatorial arena known as "the bar," has a curved wooden ceiling that looms over you and provides a tunnel-vision view of the world outside the window. It's fun! I like this dungeon aesthetic, this feeling of being underground with no entertainment but good music, fun conversation, and 14 plasma-screen TVs!

But none of that matters. Let's get to the fries!

There are three styles of Housemade & Hand-Cut Tavern Fries, and you know I'll be trying all of them! Each style as a large solo order costs $7.50,  the smaller side baskets that I sampled cost $2.50 each. The baskets and the plates meant to catch the overflowing spuds are the only thing that changes sizes with the separate orders. Either way, you can expect a bit of wait to receive your food, if you haven't waited to be seated already. But that's the way of this "Pub for Chefs."

First order of business is the neighborhood style Tennessee Fries. These are the only sweet potatoes offered, but despite the natural flavor they're served with brown sugar, sea salt, and jalapeno ketchup. These fries were warm, despite extended wait to receive them, and are cut into long thin strips that seem to basket-weave themselves into a pattern that makes it impossible to grab just one. The skins are lightly crisp and the insides are soft, but they are thin compared to other house cut fries. The brown sugar coating is sweeter than the taters and dominates any effect from the salt, but meets its match with the jalapeno ketchup. There's an instant heat to the ketchup that lingers through each bite without changing, so you won't have to worry about any surprise intensity. It's a really well-paired sauce for the sugary sweet fries, and you'll taste both profiles when you mix them together.

Next are the "Belgian" fries, with simply sea salt and a garlic aioli sauce. I think this is where the "concept" starts to unravel, since calling french fries Belgian does not automatically make them so. Sea salt is good and powerful even as a simple seasoning, and although I'm not a fan of aioli the sauce was acceptable. But these are some chewy fries. They're hand-cut to leave the natural skins on, but those skins aren't crispy, and neither are the insides, which only become soggier with time. To be Belgian style, fries have to be cooked twice in oil, with resting time allotted between dips. These fries are just twice as oily, with no notable inherent flavor. What appears to be more important to the corporate planners behind Tavern is the fact that "Belgian" looks fancy on the menu.

Finally, a style I've never encountered before: Tuscan fries, with garlic, parmesan cheese, and crushed red pepper. You've probably had garlic and parmesan fries before, and here they're pretty good toppings even though they make the dish wetter but better. The herby scent of garlic masks the cheesy fries as you first taste them, but the peppers come out of nowhere with a bitter hot flavor. Unlike the Tennessee ketchup, this heat is inherent to the fries, and can surprise you if you're not expecting it. Since there are so many layers of flavors mixed on, these fries can get away with being soft and oily, and I'd recommend just going in with a fork anyway instead of shoveling them down by hand. I can't imagine anyone getting through a large order of these though, the side size is plenty!

Final rating for Tennessee fries: 3/5 Spuds.
Final rating for "Belgian" fries: 2/5 Spuds.
Final rating for Tuscan fries: 4/5 Spuds.

I have heard about this place having the best fried chicken in the city.   SO I came in and ordered some.     I had some sweet potato fries while I waited, and I got my chicken to go.   it was crispy and crunchy, tasty and simple.   

I should have asked if they do spicy.     either way it was impressive.   she even said to not close the bag too tight to ruin the crisp on the chicken.

everyone in here looks happy, and joyful.   the service was quick, and she was very helpful with my order.    I want to come back now and eat there with the hubby.    maybe a few drinks, or beyond.   its all good to me.

This place looks like it has potential- looks nice from the outside (kind of resembles an old bank). It's pretty spacious inside with a big bar and seats surrounding it on the outside. Food is average and over-priced but that's just downtown Wilmington for ya. It is relatively empty in here- not many people coming through. 

Service is average- the waitress came over a few times to get our drink orders but for some reason didn't see my friend who was sitting on the edge and never asked him for his drink. I felt pretty bad. 

They have an extensive beer collection but the ambiance is just dead in there.

This was a fun restaurant, but the food was lacking. If I were to do it again, I would skip the entrée & probably just have a salad & cocktail or two. The magicians in the bar were just as good as the main act. But overall it was fun to dress up & go somewhere a bit different.

Disappointed.  I use to look forward to going to Cracker Barrel, it was my families place of choice.  But the last few meals I've had here have been miserable.  If its anywhere near breakfast time, I get biscuits and gravy, with bacon and possible some hashbrown casserole.  The biscuits are crummy anymore.. they are dry and bland. They use to be flaky, buttery and had taste.  Now they taste like something I'd buy in a package of 1,000 at CostCo.  

The service was less than stellar.. our waitress was just there to churn as many people out as she could.. Took forever to get my water refilled.. but she sure was quick to bring out our food and clear our plates.    

Hopefully I can find a local breakfast place that serves good, local food

Went with my family this weekend. It was good. I hadn't been to Red Lobster in years and I had never been to this location. Service was good. Food was yum. I got a steak that come out tasty. My daughter got the kid's fish n fries which was a good portion. We also tried the lobster and artichoke dip. I was surprised that I could see the lobster pieces because some places get skimpy on the actual seafood in the dips. Overall we had a good experience!

I love this place! This is one of my favorite restaurants in Edwardsville! The Cleveland Heath Tacos are my favorite! I don't really drink alcohol that much. However, they do have great creative alcoholic beverages here as well! I definitely recommend this place to visitors and locals too!

Bartender was  very nice with creating my sister and I a great drink. Ambience was unique and i liked it! However, our server never asked us how the food was, nor did she refill our drinks or come to our table after ordering. Not once. Biscuit appetizers were great. Family style dining is a misrepresentation.. the actual portions are standard size. Furthermore, food was bland.. steak was not flavorful. Will return for drinks and biscuits, not entree.

I walked in to meet with some friends and I went to the bar and ordered a beer. I asked him what drafts he had and he exhaled very annoyed and recited what beers were on draft. I ordered a beer and said "it's 7.50" immediately. I let him know that my friends were outside smoking a cigarette and would be in shortly and that he would be paying for it. He harassed my other friends about my beer and I continuously told him that my friend would be in to pay for my beer.  I had only been in there for five minutes and I was sitting at the bar -clearly not leaving without paying- before my friend came to pay for my drink; as he ignored me the entire time except to harass me about 7.50$. All throughout the night he was rude to me, made me feel bad about asking the prices about two different tequilas, ignored me and only paid attention to white people. I am Cambodian and my friend is black. I am very inclined to think he is racist. He kept asking who is paying for my drinks and I told him my friend and he told me "oh you're friend is paying for your drinks. Why do you care how much anything is? Can you afford anything?" He continued to take our checkbooks and yell at me and throw my beer away and kick me out because I left him change for being a terrible bartender. I am a bartender and I would never treat anyone with the disrespect he showed me and my friends. He ignored us and only payed attention to white people. I will never visit this establishment again and I will be sure to tell all my friends to never visit this establishment. This was Sunday night, white man medium long dirty blonde hair. His face was sour since the moment we walked in and he told me I was being difficult for asking the price of two different liquors. And he charged us extra and wouldn't tell me the correct price for anything. This man should not be employed at any customer service establishment, he will lose you business for being a racist, rude person. I advise anyone to never come to this restaurant again. You will not be treated fairly. He also told me I was embarrassing my friends when we are both bartenders and all work in restaurants and we felt that he was embarrassing himself by yelling at us and kicking us out because he received a bad tip. I would never yell and my customers and treat them with such disrespect due to the fact that they did not leave me a tip. The worst experience I have ever had at any establishment ever.

It's 10 PM and after waiting 45 minutes in a long line for french fries and two sandwiches realize they shorted my fries. 
I called and asked if somebody could possibly run the fries out so I would not have to wait in the line for another 20 minutes and then have them turn me away because it was closing time and they said I would have to come in. I asked why and they said they didn't trust me and they had to look at my receipt. Couldn't they have looked at my receipt when they brought me the fries? That would've been nice. Left with no fries

Check your bill!!!!!!
2 drinks-- we cash out & the bill is $49.00 
2 food items were placed on my tab

I notified the bartender. She changed it (still outrageous at $18 for a beer & a vodka) 

Checked my statement today- charged $49.00. I will be notifying my bank.
I love cookout but not a single person in the kitchen was wearing a mask :/ It made me super uncomfortable at the drive through when I was the only one with a mask on.

Service is friendly and attentitive. Prices are very reasonable. Downside....not very clean ... as far as floors, seats, and bathrooms.....I hate that! Not disgusting but not like they really are stickers about cleanliness.  Luanne, our server,  was delightful. The food is mediocre in quality, but is fine for a 24 hour greasy food joint. Not bad not stellar.

My friend and I have been coming to Pickles and Swiss every week since it opened four years ago so I feel bad we never left a review until today, but let me tell you some of the reasons we keep coming back to this place:

1) The service is great! Honestly, everyone is SO friendly and genuinely wants to be there or at least wants their customers to have a great experience. Mark, the owner, truly sets that tone himself. Despite owning the place, he does not feel like making a sandwich is beneath him and I always see him trying to please his customers 24/7. He recognizes me and my friend when we come in, immediately knows our sandwich order, and ultimately makes us feel like we are guests in his home instead of just ordering food at a sandwich shop.

2) The food is beyond amazing! Our go-to sandwich is the Chipotle Turkey Club (on sourdough!) and even though we've ordered other delicious sandwiches (I'm looking at you Pickles&Swiss and All-Day Brunch Dunch), we keep coming back to this sandwich week after week especially when paired with their tomato basil bisque (an original recipe). One time, they ran out of the chipotle aioli on our sandwich but what did they do? They spent time whipping up their own version with sriracha sauce! They could have easily said "sorry, we ran out" but they didn't want to disappoint us and went the extra mile. Bravo! Also they don't skimp on the pickle--I see the bucket with the pickles and they take extra care selecting a good pickle and leaving the lame ones. The pickle popcorn is also the greatest thing on earth--sometimes it goes missing making me wonder if someone ran off with the dispenser full of pickle popcorn like I sometimes daydream I'd one day do haha

3) The atmosphere is what seals the deal! The place looks nice, has some fun games while you wait but above all this location has been our sanctuary. My friend is also my colleague and we have some rough days at work and absolutely look forward to our walk from the office--rain or shine--to Pickles and Swiss because we know for the next hour we can unwind, eat some good food and talk. This place holds some of our deepest secrets and bonding sessions and we will forever be grateful to P&S week after week.
Good pizza, called and placed our order before walkin over- everything was fresh, salads are tiny and only 1 picnic table outside to dine on
the waitress and staff are awesome and very up on their game. also the bison ribeye or anything bison there are great to eat. you can definitly taste the difference.

Food was absolutely gross. We ordered a Caesar salad with chicken but after one bite of the chicken, we decided it would be best for our stomachs (and bowels) not to eat it.  Disgusting, undercooked chicken... Our kid ordered linguini with butter and cheese, instead, she got a bowl of dry, sticky pasta. Of all the seafood joints in Santa Barbara,  we walked into this one...

First time here. Was looking for breakfast/brunch place by the hotel and it had good reviews.  Small place but wait was quick on a Thursday at lunch time.  Waitress was very friendly and food was very good.  Great place for breakfast or lunch.

I've been coming to this spot for years. At first for the Man City games but just fell in love with the people and food. They really have great bar food and the coldest beer. Burgers are some of the best in town, chicken is always on point, but the wings are my favorite. There's plenty of flavors but the "Trifecta" always hits the spot for me. Check them out for a game, beer and some food. Great people that work and run this place!

I find this place to very underrated! 
I've been in St. Louis for 5 years and just now managed to come to this famous diner since I live in outside of the city.
The interior is bright, light, and clean. It is also much bigger than a transitional diner having 7-8 booths, not including the "carousel of love", and tons of counter seating with color changing LED lights, purse hooks, and charging outlets underneath the counter top. Our server was very friendly, helpful, and happy. She was patient, answered our questions  and explained to us everything about the Peacock Carousel of Love. The COL is an 8 person rotating booth that is reservable for $50. Most people use it for special events, get togethers, birthday parties etc. Once seated, the open area of the booth is turned and the booth becomes almost completely private, the staff opens a curtain to reveal a flat screen TV and a PS4 for our use. We are also given a free appetizer of our choice and you are encouraged to relax and spend time in your private booth, it's a very neat experience. 

They also have arcade games in the diner such as ski-ball, pin ball, and a claw machine. 


The Food - severely underrated 
The waffle was nicely cooked.
The syrup was good
Bacon was crispy 
Burger was good 
Fries are crispy and seasoned good 
Monte Cristo is fresh, generous in filling, nicely crisped 
Mac N Chz tastes house made - very good in our opinion.

I have no idea why people are rating this place low.
We really enjoyed ourselves and will return

Have been to Bonefish Grill before and as usual it is generally good.  Our waitress was friendly but service was slow due to several large birthday tables. Bang Bang shrimp were incredible!! Caesar salad was blah until I added additional dressing. Had the Tilapia Imperial which was good.  Tasted the kids fish plate which was fried but very light/prepared properly. We split a key lime pie which was tart but tasty. Would easily go back for shrimp appetizer.  Everything else was mediocre at best!

We are from West Texas in for a conference. We stopped here for a late lunch. 
Food:
We ordered the breakfast burrito and the Kitchen Sink. The burrito was not good. Neither of us could eat it. The habanero tortilla that was supposed to be spicy, was sweet tasting. The meat mixture was rather different and also had a sweeter flavor. The spices and other ingredients just did not go together well. On the other hand, The skillet was fantastic. 

Service: 
Did not have to be wait long for a table. All the food came out quickly. The table we sat at had ketchup on the underside of the table which got all over my jeans. The ketchup was also on the floor and not cleaned up or recognized by staff. Really gross. We waited around 8 minutes for a waiter to come to our table after we had been seated. Later after we got our food, we waited FOREVER to get a refill. 3 stars for the not so good service and semi-good food.
This is fast casual done right. Great burgers and fries. Very kid friendly. Now we just need one not in Green Hills which will have miserable holiday traffic for the next 2 month.

This is a very nice local steakhouse. Nothing super fancy but great food and great service. We went on a weeknight so it was not very crowded and we were seated right away. I had the ribeye steak and they cooked perfectly the first time. Very nice local restaurant if you want a nice family or date night out.   Better quality than the steak chain restaurants.

Fabulous little restaurant. I found the service to be super friendly and prompt. I really enjoyed the selection of cocktails, and my dad and husband were super stoked to try some new beers that they loved. My husband got a burger, which was gigantic and super flavorful. I settled for the chili relleno appetizer which was lovely. The bread pudding at the end of the night was the real show stopper. This isn't a cheap restaurant but the food was good enough and the portions were hearty enough to justify a higher price. I can't wait to go back!

Clementines is our favorite restaurant. We always feel welcomed and the staff truly loves being there. The food has always been consistently great-  their speciality is the fried chicken and no one does it better. It is a great neighborhood restaurant.

I liked this location as Agave but love it as The Banks Drinkery & Kitchen. The service is good. The food is good. The cocktails are good. And on top of that, the rooftop is a super cute place to chill and enjoy your drinks and/or meal. The owner was very helpful and accommodating at their grand opening despite all of the chaos. There was a lot of confusion going on and he handled it well. I tried to sample a little bit of everything. I had a few friends with me so we tried to get different things. The chargrilled oysters were very good as were the buffalo wings. The southwest rolls were okay. I ordered the blackened shrimp pasta for my entree but there was nothing blackened about the shrimp. Don't get me wrong, it was good but the shrimp were in no way blackened, quite pale. The pasta had good flavor though and I didn't need to add any salt. I also tried the blackened and fried crawfish pasta that my friend ordered. I didn't spot any fried crawfish on it but it was good as well. I tried a couple of their signature cocktails, all of which I enjoyed (the Crowley, the Elder Bull, & the Swamp Donkey). I also ordered a French 75 (my favorite cocktail) and it was made very well. I think this place has the potential to do very well and I really hope it does.

We've been three times (since it's really the only option in the area) and never felt excited to go or excited to return. The food is overpriced, especially for mediocre bar food, service is pretty good though. Location is the best thing going for it, and hopefully prices come down to reality once other restaurants come to New Pal

This is most definitely the clap back to Stephen Starr's Jones. Jones is definitely one of Starr's more tolerable ventures, but everything chef Marcie Turney does is gold. 

B&M's menu is eclectic and delicious. Think comfort foods with subtle modern twists. Decor is tasteful and not overdone. Service is friendly and attentive, but without mind numbing chit chat. 

Fried chicken is on point, as are all the sliders (especially Nashville hot chicken) a lot of the food has that satisfying sense that the chef went a little mad with butter, but in a pleasant way. You definitely leave that place feeling like an obese midwesterner. He'll, I left with a Minnesota accent. However, it wore off quickly, donchano.

Terrible service! When your 20 something server delivers food to her buddies five minutes after they sit down and you've waited 28 minutes plus...(that's after the 30 minute wait to get a table, and 10 more minutes to even find out who our sever was)!! I will never spend a dime in this place. Do not recommend.

Catering order - Hoods was very easy to work with and order from. Communication was great. We ordered lots of food, and everything was ready to be picked up on time. Hot items were hot, and cold items were cold. Everything was ready to be put out for our guests.

Pulled pork was outstanding, moist and tender with delicious bbq sauce.
Beef brisket was a hit, and was even better with a sauce added on top.
We ordered mac and cheese and cheesy potatoes - and of course the mac and cheese disappeared first. But I personally loved the potatoes more. Perfect bite sized pieces.  The salads were awesome. 

Thanks for helping us make our party hassle free and delicious!

Pretty good grub in a serene setting. Fair prices. Open for breakfast and lunch. Varied menu that shows imagination and effort. House made soup and pies daily.  Some dishes could use some work, but  overall better than the average food, especially for a golf course. Service is prompt and friendly. Worth a visit even if you aren't golfing.

This was my second time ever going to Elevation Burger, the first was in 2010 at the Wynnewood location where I remember the burgers being not quite as tasty as others I've had. But this one was a nice time. The atmosphere was nice and clean, and I had heard things about the Wynnewood location being a dirty mess (again, I went there six years ago and remember next to nothing from it), so it was nice to see that this one was well maintained. After placing my order, I sat outside because it was so nice out, and that's a definite plus at this time of year. My food came out to me pretty quickly, around five minutes - again, I had heard things of the Wynnewood location taking as much as at least a half hour for some orders. The burger and fries were tasty, moreso than I remember them being formerly.

However, I will agree with the people that mentioned that there was a lot of grease on the burgers, as there were a few times where it felt hard to hold in my hand. I also found it weird that the vegetables were placed below the patty instead of above them. And of course, I noticed how high the prices were compared to the likes of, say, Five Guys or Smashburger, but judging by the reviews here it appears that's a typical thing for organic items. So it wouldn't be my very first go-to choice for burgers, but I would definitely go back. Props!

This was my 1st visit here. It was my 1st time at any Shake Shack. I knew the burger would be good cause the scent coming out of the place was amazing. I got the Concrete (the chocolatey one) that was delicious. The burger was really good but the fries had a blah taste to them. I got the half & half to drink. It was good. It tasted homemade. With all that being said it has been too long since I've was there & I want to go back.

Freaking YUM!! I'm a total slaw snob... this kicks it canes in on a soggy night and the staff was absolutely amazing!! Food came up quick, and we had a good sampling of the menu between the four of us- all excellent!!

Waited over 50 minutes for our food. No communication from the waitstaff. Decent (although overpriced) food once it finally did come out; but I definitely wouldn't recommend to a friend. Zero social distance happening here. Bathroom was gross and didn't even have a mirror.

Cash only but I love this place. Freindly staff. The absolute best and nicest people. I do not eat steak so I order the chicken Philly. Absolutely wonderful. Also the fries are fresh. Not greasy and awesome. The place has ample seating. Did I mention the awesome staff. Also the place is immaculate. Must be all owners running it.

We come here for lunch and it's great. They change their menu every week and it's always delicious. The first tame I came I had a tuna sandwich on a baguette with a soup if I remember correctly was like apple and potato? It wasn't anything I've heard of before but I took a chance on the soup and I wasn't disappointed. Staff was friendly and they have a wine bar where they sell some unique stuff. They also do wine tasting and have an email list they update you with events going on. Highly recommended if you wanna eat something great. Oh, and they have a lobster bread pudding that's insanely good.

Trips tripped and fell. We had eaten at the one in Seminole Fl. often as it is near our beach place and were kinda excited to see them come to Tampa.

Wow, the execution was way off. Not sure if it was just a bad night. Lines at the door, empty tables. 

We sat at the counter. Food was ok. Sweet potato fries limp. Everything luke warm. 

The kitchen window was a bottle neck. Very bad. Food sat there forever with no one managing the window or delivering to tables. The manager seemed overwhelmed. Some food sat there the entire time we sat there. Ouch.

Many plates were coming back, or handed back, not cooked right,  missing garlic toast , wrong sides on and on.

The cashier was apologizing to everyone.  I don't know what the problem was but it was bad, real  bad.

Two stars only in deference  to the other Trips. This location needs to get it's act together, and they been open long enough now.

Won't be back anytime soon.

Great service and awesome omelettes. The Mardi Gras was about the best you could ever taste I imagine, but I will be back to try more of the selection there just in case there is anything nearly as good as that was.
Took a Red Hat group there.  Everyone loved what they ordered.  Best response to a restaurant I've gotten all year.  Great food and great service, you can't go wrong.

A nice alternative to the fast food chains on Canal St. and some other expensive options. The place looks a little divey, but the service is fast and friendly and the food is good fare. They had also just started offering a free Bloody Mary as a Yelp check-in offer so, I did opt for the morning serving of liquid vegetables! All in all a good value for the money.
There's a reason this place is so popular! It's because the food is ahh-mazing! The burgers, the fries, the beer, everything! Check this place out if you get a chance. You won't be disappointed.

I am a huge fan of the Cake Bake Shop, I always have ever since the Broad Ripple location was made. I have been several times and I seen that the Carmel location was now open and I decided to go for my birthday this year. (As every year since it is a tradition I do for myself with friends) Unfortunately my experience was not that good. I knew there would be a wait, it was for 1hr and 15min (WHICH I WAS MORE THAN OKAY WITH) so my friend and I waited until then and we received the text at exactly 1hr and 15min. Long story short the people there were SO rude. And the cake was not nearly as good as the Broad Ripple location, I had the Pink Birthday Cake and I seriously could have made it at home it was extremely disappointing, and the menu DID NOT even display all the cakes that were available?????? So after we ate our cake we went to go get macaroons to go from the to go section, THEN we noticed there were cakes available that weren't even on the menu ???? which I would have 100% rather preferred. I will NEVER be coming back to this location ever again. It was EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTING AND THE PEOPLE THERE WERE DISRESPECTFUL! Go to Broad Ripple, it is a way more better experience for littles and birthdays.

Very dissappointed to arrive at noon to watch Bills game since a backers bar.  Grabbed table by big screen, confirmed Bills game on big screen with bartender.  Game starts and we have Bengals game as he has to "please everyone".  Guess not real Bills bar.   Hear for rest of season and will pick another spot.

I went to On Swann a couple of months ago for the first time. A friend of mine recommended making a reservation, but I didn't. I should have. It was just two of us, so we grabbed a table outside. Chilly night, so the heaters were welcomed. Enjoyed a nice bottle of wine and the lamb meatballs outside.  This is definitely a restaurant experience I enjoyed, as most things on this menu I would never pair and cook for myself. We moved inside to a share table for our entrees. I had the Cobia with the risotto... A fish I had never had but really enjoyed the combination with the chorizo. Finished the meal with two different scoops of their gelato. Every aspect of this meal pleased my palate immensely.

I arrived to this New Orleans themed bar and restaurant with high hopes. It was a nice day, I was in good company, and there was a cute outdoor seating area. It became fishy when they were sold out of many items. First the beer, then the French toast. We prevailed on and settled with the purple haze, a New Orleans classic. Two of us ordered Benedict's and were very excited. Then to our alarm, the waiter informed us the chef just dropped all of the eggs. We then switched our orders (a Benedict with scrambled eggs) since basically everything else on the menu had a poached or fried egg. They were accommodating  and switched some eggs for a fried oyster. Then our Benedict's arrived with no hollandaise sauce. It then took a very long time for them to bring us some that tasted like raw eggs. My food was cold at that point. The pancakes were 10/10. Our service got slower and slower at the end. I see the potential but dont think I would return.

I like BJ's but don't love it. I wouldn't mind coming here for a football game to do some beer tasting, but as for the food, I think its just average. Not superb but not completely distasteful.  Our service is usually always good which is nice. Honestly when you give me a huge restaurant with a menu that takes me an hour to get through, I usually shy away. The menu is so big and the portions are huge, so if that's for you, this place may be a 5. For me however, it brings my ratings down.

Like I said, I'll come back for football!

Food is great but bartenders, except for the one guy on Sundays, are average at best.  I think they did not receive the proper training in terms of being attentive, etc.  with that being said, I don't think that's a problem that I hope management will address bc otherwise the place is a great sports bar!

This place is great. The decor is a little much but that is the point. The service was outstanding, food was very good and the pricing is very fair for what you get.  I had fried green tomatoes, elk sliders and an unsweetened tea, all for $28 - tip included. It was more than I could eat.

Terrible! Went there last night for the first time for dinner. Bar was busy, restaurant had maybe 5 tables. After being seated, the waitstaff would walk by us, never acknowledging we were there or asking if we would like a drink. After 20 minutes sitting at our table outside and seeing the waiter look at us 3 times and walk by us about 8 we walked out.

For a similar price, great view, and amazing food and staff, walk five minutes over to Jacksons!!!

It took a really long time for our server to get to our table to take our order which she never wrote down. Took about a half hour to get two salads and a combo platter and the salad was not what I ordered. The girl who brought our meals (not our server) pretty much slammed the food down and took off. It's a shame because I like going there, but this experience now will make me think twice...

I was very happy with the service we got here on a Monday night. We got there a little late maybe 45 mins before closing time. Our server was very polite. We apologized for coming in so late and our server genuinely told us he didn't mind. Flo's filet was amazing! The seasoning they put on their steak beats any steakhouse I've been to. Everything is made with great flavor. Overall very happy with my experience and will be returning.

Came in on a Friday night... A little bit of a wait, but it was well worth it. The best sushi I have ever had in my life. Our waiter, Peyton "not Manning" was one of the most charming and entertaining of servers that I have ever had! Big smile and even bigger personality. He was knowledgeable and truly passionate about the food that he serves. The next time I come back (and I most definitely will be back!) I am asking for him to be my server again!

My drink was ok, the waiter was good, but the meat and cheese plate was disgusting.  I've seen numerous meat and cheese plates in my life, but have never seen a "meat substance" as nasty as this.  I wouldn't have touched it with a 10 foot pole, but my husband tried it and confirmed my suspicions that it was bad.  Dare I say......it looked and smelled exactly like wet dog food.   If you are looking for a good, creative drink, head to Taste.

We sat down and ordered as soon as we got there, but a hour passed by and we still didn't have our food. People around us that came in after had their food before me and my friend. Our waiter was behind on many tables including ours. He never checked on us. Finally a manage came out and told us they were down 4 fryers out of 8 and would pay for me and my friends meal. The food came out cold. I got the wrong order of wings, I asked for boneless and received Bone-In. They forgot my queso also. Overall I understand yes it is hard with COVID but I am not pleased with my visit here today.

Well here we are again on a Friday eve enjoying our favorite food in St Louis! Currently sitting right beside the bar at a high top! Manager is walking around maki g sure everyone is satisfied and pampered as always. This place has a spell on me. Good to be back! Blessings to all of you for what you offer the public as a grand meal, and hospitality to boot! Had the house salad as usual and was fantastic! Oysters off the chart! And the aged prime rib was stellar! 
Peace and blessings ya once more twisted tree! It's all happening here! 
Thank you!

Welcome, it is about time that there is some new Places in our area, the older ones are not what they use to be..... We just heard about this place on Saturday, so we had some errands and decide to stop in. (Glad We did) It is only a Chicken Wings type of place and have a good selection on their menu, which is averagely priced. 2 for 1 Beers from 3pm - 7pm. We walked in and were greeted and seeded right away.It is nice and opened with lots of TV's, They will give Hooters a run for their money.  We endedup having the Sirloin steak encrusted with Blue cheese and Bacon......To die for........Perfectly seasoned, nothing over powering just right. We can't wait to go back I want to try some other things on the menu like the Mahi - Mahi. Most worthy to Spread the Good news that this town needs some new restaraunts.  Also, you kinda get paid everytime you go if you sign up for their rewards program.Once again WELCOME and we will be back often.

This place is absolutely terrible. The service is slower than slow. Probably the worst place I have ever been to. The people that work here are not very attentive. They messed up two out of the three orders we had. They also got the orders of a table sitting next to us wrong.

I wouldn't eat here if it was free. That's how bad it is. The food is bland. Nothing special. We tried to order two seafood appetizers, but they didn't have either. It's Santa Barbara, come on!?!

DON'T COME HERE! I don't recommend it at all.

Broad Street Diner serves yummy meals overall. I have been there a few times and each time they delivered. Their french union soup is to die for, definitely should try it. The staff is quite pleasant as well!

The couple of sandwiches we've had there were pretty good...a bit overly toasted rolls...they give you a sandwich ONLY...at around 9.00+ each that's a bit pricy.  They are the ONLY game in town...the ONLY place...I think they take advantage of that.  Nice wait staff...good iced tea too.

This is likely one of the worst places I've ever eaten.  I was here all week for training and this was our only choice.  I tried several different things all week and all of them were terrible.  If you have a choice between this deli and roadkill, go with the roadkill.
I cant stress how horrible this place was all week!  DONT DO IT!

Absolute trash. Service is horrible. Utter chaos. Food is awful.  Fish tacos were served on a tortilla that tasted like cardboard. And I thought it was horrible until I tasted the grilled fish that had the texture of leather. 

Never ever again.

So called in try this place and grab a burger and their sb fries. Was told i couldnt upgrade to the sb fries from regular fries. So would have to order a whole seperate order of fries or a wasted salad instead of just an upgrade. Dont get it,so they just lost a customer over poor customer servce.. girl who answered phone was not friendly at all... sorry to bother u so late,oh wait, thats ur job..

Terrible customer service. Picked up a salad at the carry-out counter and ordered a soda once I got there. Saw they charged $2.85 for what was supposed to be "16 ounces" of fountain soda. I told SARAH that I would rather get a bottle of soda instead. Sadly, this must have caused her an extreme amount of inconvenience. She responded with immature snares and a snotty attitude, and said "whatever". She never even thanked me for placing my order!  In fact, I said thank you to her and she replied with rolling eyes "yep". The salad was okay but with service like that I'll go elsewhere. Thankfully, there are tons of excellent eating establishments to choose from in Tampa.

Good food, good beer, nice ambiance in Mount Airy! Highlight items: the Brussel sprouts, the short rib, the appetizer sampler!

Also like the half off burgers on Wednesdays! 

Some foods are hit or miss, so make sure you know what you're ordering.

We love to sit upstairs here! The view is amazing and the atmosphere is bright and inviting. We will not dine downstairs due to the lack above mentioned features. The service is usually descent upstairs as well. We really love the ponzu scallop appetizer-it is not to be missed!  Seating at the bar is first come first serve although the hostesses can be funny about letting people go upstairs to check it out. They are oddly protective about it. ‍

Recently revisited the village pub and I am going to bump it up to 3 stars in consideration of their constantly rotating tap list.

Once again though the food was a disappointment. My girlfriend and I started with Calamari which came in a small portion and then breading was very light colored, usually an indication of being under cooked. This one totally missed the mark and was well below the quality large chain restaurants serve and no where near a mom and pop Italian place. Also the cost was on par with a level you would imagine something tasting good or passable with a large portion size. This is another example of just like the meatloaf in my previous review, if you can't make it good consistently or at all just leave it off the menu.

My girlfriend had a chicken salad that she enjoyed and came in a portion size large enough to take home as a snack later on. Pretty comparable to standard chain restaurant salads and she left pleased with that.

For my meal I had the roast beef sandwich. First off, please don't offer that disgusting cup of oil you try to pass off as Au jus for dipping. It was literally like dipping the sandwich in a heated cup of cooking oil. Take a hint from other local famous roast beef around the city of Philadelphia and just give some beef gravy on the side be it from concentrate or freshly made. Make a stop up to Ye Olde Ale house in Conshohocken to get an idea of what I'm referring to.

Fan of the fireplace, that is. Great location in Hyde Park. Met a friend here for lunch. My fish and chips was delicious. I liked the seasoning. And there were a few other items that sounded appetizing; hard to choose. I ordered a beer and it was huge! The hostess didn't seem to know her beers; for a pub, that stands out. but friendly, nice and overall worth a second shot.

I live right down the street and I can tell you that there will be issues occasionally, however, the food is decent, and won't break the bank. A lot of the servers are overworked, so I've been told, so I'd definitely take that into consideration. I come here late at night all the time, after a night out it's a great place for a quick bite. I was in here at 1 AM after Christmas day and had a great server, cool guy, and some decent grub. Don't knock the Big L, but there are clearly some management issues. I'd highly recommend a late night food session here at the Llanerch.

This place is a nightmare. We were sat right next to the kitchen where 2 managers were standing with a completely full restaurant. I myself am a restaurant manager and when my restaurant is full I'm on the floor and checking in with everything constantly.  It took 10 minutes for a manager to come over, fill our glasses with water, then walk away. In another 5 minutes another manager came, refilled our water, and then walked away again?? There are a ridiculous amount of people working in this restaurant and they couldn't muster up a way to properly greet us?? Founding farmers'  idea of good service is refilling my already 85% full glass of water. Another 5 minutes go by and a manager asks if we have any questions. Yeah, here's a big one, do I have a server?? I said to him we didn't have a server yet and he literally said "well I'm here aren't I". There was no apology, nothing. We put in our entire order with him. 2 servers came over within the next 5 minutes and tried to greet us. Obviously no organization or communication in the restaurant. In addition, it was my sisters birthday. I told the hostess stand and they said I would have to buy a dessert and they could put a candle in it.  I showed them where we were seated and they said they would communicate this with the appropriate staff. Definitely not to my surprise, no candle!! We got the check and not even the cheese on my burger was comped and not one single apology. I go out and spend $100 on dinner and don't even have a server.

I think if you're into american / western food this in an awesome choice. Their meats are smoked or grilled to perfection and melt in your mouth. They have tang to their meats. I hate sweet meats. Also their atmosphere is lively, new, and comfortable.

Really bad---beyond that, unreliable as it frequently closes long before it's advertised hours (9pm most of the week). If you come in at 7 or 8pm on a given weekday, there's a 50/50 shot the kitchen will still be open. Were issues over the summer as well with Air Conditioning failing. 

Beyond that, not sure if there was a total transition in ownership between Barbacoa and ArdmoreQ but the quality of the meat is really lacking (fatty, greasy, gamey flavor), substantially worse than I remember it during the Barbacoa era. 

Honestly, if you're looking for Peruvian Food, you're better off going to Inka Wall in Upper Darby, or Sardi's on City Ave. Neither is amazing, but still better quality than ArdmoreQ.
Happy hour drinks and apps were amazing. Jill, our server, was absolutely amazing!! She was so helpful with menu choices and very pleasant! She is an asset to the Bar Louie brand!!
One of our families favorite pizza joints.  It's a weekly stop for us. Pizza, hoagies and wings always taste delcious.  Nice family atmosphere and the owner is really friendly.

After a very long day of travel we ended up in St. Petersburg for dinner.  Friday evening fun - some of the street was shut down.  Very cute down town but we ventured to Datz for dinner.  Indoor and outdoor dining was available.  Service was exceptional and menu had some fun different choices - like a grilled cheese hamburger.  Would definitely return (just remember to put money in the meter:)

I had a delicious PB and J sandwich here. no complaints from me. Everything tasted fresh, good quality "homemade" peanut butter which was way better than your regular out of a jar stuff. 

Some other reviewers mention that you could just make it at home. Yea you can make a regular PB and J lickety split but are you gonna make your own fresh peanut butter? They had a bunch of other toppings as well. I had fluff on mine, I'm not about to buy a whole jar of fluff, use it once and have it sit there and go to waste. and ooh, $4 for a "fancy" peanut butter and jelly sandwich.. quit your complaining, its on main street in Wayne, which is full of Richy McRichersons. what are they gonna do, charge 2 or 3 dollars for a sandwich? how would they stay open? It's probably the cheapest food item in town.

So if you want a higher quality peanut butter and jelly and whatever sandwich, for a reasonable price, stop in PBandU

Well we wanted to go here on a Saturday in August around 11 am but it was an hour wait. The next day we figured there maybe a line being a Sunday morning but at 630 opening there was no line. The biscuits are not that great at all and we woke up at 530 am. It sucked but the vanilla latte was really good and luckily we got our angel wing picture since no line. Thank goodness we didn't wait an hour for a good coffee- I wouldn't wait only go here if you luckily catch no line.

I work nearby and ordered take out for lunch within the first week or two they were open. First, the inside is very nicely done. You can tell the owners spent a lot of time (and money) taking this plain rental space and giving it the appropriate nautical touches. Second the service. The staff here were extremely nice, although there was a bit of confusion with my order resulting in me eventually just pointing out what I wanted on the menu. Turns out I ended up ordering the fried shrimp meal instead of just the lunch sized "basket" portion I had intended on. This "mistake" was well worth it because the shrimp were delicious and I'm glad that I ended up with the few extra that you get with the meal. Also the fries were super crispy and absolutely perfect. Keep in mind, I took this to-go so the food was still spectacular after steaming off in the styrofoam container. Typically this equals soggy fried food, but somehow magically not with these guys! 

So the food was excellent, the service was excellent, (did I mention I ordered at the counter and waited inside and it only took like 8 minutes) the staff was friendly, the place is very clean, and the themed decor works well. This just leaves one thing left... The menu. 

While of course understandable, the errors it is riddled with are too much to ignore. I realize that this has nothing to do with the food, but when someone is shopping around, especially online, the menu is often where you get your first impression. I'm not going to go through it all but simple things like: "choice one" instead of "choose one" "mussel" instead of "mussels" "no spicy" instead of just "mild" then having the other options called medium and hot, etc. There are commas missing, capitalizations are wrong in places, some things are plural when they shouldn't be, and vice versa. "Not offer on holidays" should be "Not offered on holidays" or maybe "Offer not valid on holidays." I also noticed on a flier or mailer that showed up at the office "juicy" was spelled "juciy." There's more, but I'm sure that's enough examples to get the point across. 

Bottom line... The fried shrimp and fries I had were excellent, and I'm sure the rest of, at least the fried menu, is as well. My nitpicking the grammar is honestly just me trying to help them make the appropriate adjustments to look more professional, so please don't let that effect your decision. You won't be disappointed. Just remember as the menu says: "Have fun but please drink responsibility" (sorry I had to do one more)
Unbelievable customer service. This I s a real hidden gem.  Great decor fabulous service.  Food prepared to your taste.  I'll b back next time I'm n town!!!!!

I went to Black Bear diner a while back.  I don't think I will be returning.  Let me warn you, check your bread...mine was moldy and I didn't discover it until I took a bite.  I can't imagine they have moldy bread.  YUCK!

Drinks were delicious and food was too! Had a pasta with a lemon cream sauce that was surprisingly light. My husband had a lamb burger, it was tasty but could have juicier. Our waitor was awesome, sorry I can't remember his name.

I frequent this ABE among my regular breakfast/brunch rotations, but had to write a review today to comment on a fantastic service done with a highly custom request.  This morning I ordered a crab cake Benedict, but asked for scrambled eggs instead of poached, addition of sliced tomato on the stack, and regular hollandaise instead of the spicy andouille-infused version on the side.  I also requested goat cheese on the side to add to my grits.  

I know what you're thinking...just order the menu item as it comes.  I'm probably one of those hated customers among the industry, but I'm always pleasant about it.  Sometimes I want a particular flavor combination in my meal, but I actually expected some major screw-up with this request.

ABE blew it out of the water with this order!!!  They met all my requests without a single error, and even bonus added some sliced andouille sausage atop the bene.  This provided the perfect hint of spiciness to the dish without overpowering it in the sauce.  The tomato was actually sliced and served at the bottom of the benedict, under the crab cake and eggs but on top of the muffin, which made it much easier to slice up without destroying the whole benedict form.  All the sides were on the side, and everything was hot and fresh.  

I can't say thank you enough for making my morning today, and doing it in an efficient time and with a smile.  Kudos ABE!

Khyber is a gem in Old City. I've been here for brunch, lunch, dinner, drinks, And it's never disappointed! Their New Orleans style grub is fantastic- the PoBoys are a must have for new guests. They always have great specials and the beer selection is expansive. They are one of the few bars that carries my personal favorite beer- Mad Elf - during the holiday season. 

The divey atmosphere is comfortable and relaxed, not pretentious at all. The staff is always friendly! 

I highly recommend the shrimp POBoy, beignets, and any beers on the specials list!

The food is great especially their late night menu. I recommend  the tacos!!! Plus this guy Matt Bragg really makes it worth going to The Liquid for laughs. Plus you can get food from Solid delivered.

Underwhelmed by the quality of food unfortunately. I LOVE seafood and really wanted to love this place. I had a Groupon deal with 40% off, so figured I'd give it a shot. Ordered the lobster bisque soup..which really shouldn't be called soup. It was thick & slimy and the consistency reminded me of a canned mushroom soup. There were a few small pieces of "lobster meat" literally around 5 pieces. Mussels with red sauce were just OK. My entree included broiled shrimp, baked potato & broccoli. Shrimp were bland..lacked flavor. Broccoli didn't taste fresh at all..more like bagged  & frozen. My daughter ordered the salmon which again lacked flavor as well. Fries tasted as if an entire can of salt was poured all over them. The food quality is simply subpar...especial for the price. The staff was friendly...in fact a Manager(very young guy) came over several times to ask if we were ok. I feel bad for such bad review. This place just needs to be revamped...and quality improved

The Palace Grill is my go-to restaurant in Santa Barbara. Whenever I have friends and family in town visiting, it is the first place I think of! Food is amazing, and service is even better! If you have a SB Axxess deal, you can get discounts on the appetizers. It is a fun and enjoyable experience all around. My absolute favorite thing they offer are the baked oysters! YUUUM! Even if you aren't an oyster fan (which I didn't think I was) you will find these to be the best in town. I also enjoy their chicken marsala and of course their bread pudding! I encourage anybody who hasn't tried the Palace, make sure you do! The only thing to be conscious of is that you cannot make reservations, but even  if there is a wait, you can pop next to to Blue Agave or Joes to grab a cocktail while you wait:)

An accidental find. Walking around looking for a place to eat it's a Walnut Street theater evening. Tried to get into a different place but it was booked. Eventually worked out way around to talula's garden. Well my wife had the short ribs with their homemade Demi glaze that were awesome included with garlic mashed potatoes and a carrot mix. I had the exotic mushroom risotto awesome food will be back.

Nice place with excellent service.
Food was good. Great place if you want to get a good fairly quick bite to eat. I would come back!
Used to be very good, now it is due for an update. Last few times that we have been there, the restaurant looks and smells dirty.

In a nutshell: an upgraded Applebee's. I guess it's alright if you have folks that can't agree on a cuisine and are cool with mediocre food. 

Our waitress was awesome. Overall the front of house was great. But the kitchen needs some drastic work. It took over 45 min before the apps came out. Spinach dip--cold & chips were super greasy. We asked for another and they didn't even bother to put fresh chips on there. Lame! Calamari was standard diner expectations & delivery. Ahi tuna salad was way overdressed and the salad had been sitting there a while...all the produce was wilted and flat...I guess it was time for some inventory turnover. The salmon was ok. They did cook the Israeli couscous well but the asparagus was over cooked. Tacos were lame even for a diner. The personal pizza was what you'd expect...nothing special.

I guess it's an ok place if you have a bunch of friends that want a power hour at a bar with a bunch of drunk food options. If you plan on staying sober I'd steer clear.

This is my first time at this first watch. My initial visit was at one in Maryland, the food and service was excellent. Unfortunately, my visit to this one in Delaware does not deserve a second trip.
My server seemed to be troubled because I asked for the table to be cleared of some sticky goo. Once the food did come it was not prepared as per my request. Since it was still eatable I figured just eat it and call it a day. Well,  the idea of being served sausage pink on the inside is not acceptable. I had to send it back to be browned more, or cooked fully. By the time they were brought back to me, not only were they still not done. They arrived once my plate had gotten cold. Now as far as the service is concerned, it was terrible. Not once did she return to the table to check on progress, or concerns. She appeared to be too busy cleaning other tables. When she finally came to our table, not once did she ask us if all was well, or if we needed anything else. She just left the check and informed us that we pay up front. Another restaurant that I was happy to see come to Delaware only to be totally disappointed.

Great ambiance and really good food to go with it. I asked my waitress Sarah, who was great, what was good and she said the burgers. I went with her suggestion and she was dead on. Soft bun, perfectly done (medium rare) grilled onions and cheddar made it really flavorful. The fries were excellent as well. I had a cocktail and it was a very generous pour. I would definitely come back and sit either in the restaurant area or the bar where I sat.

I'm in absolute love with this place! Kind funny bartenders, wonderful food, and the other customers are always such characters. This place has to be special if it's the only reason I'll ever go to Delco.

Delicious!! We started off with the Meatball Marsala with cheesy bread appetizer. Very yummy. For the entree  I had the Pork Chop with the Bacon, Jalapeño jam! So good and would get it again!  My husband had the Chicken Picatta and really enjoyed it and the rest of my entree. Very hearty meals and would definitely go back again.

There is no restaurant I have a closer attachment to in Tampa Bay than Pane Rustica. Shortly after graduating college and getting our feet on the ground to  the point where my girlfriend and I could afford to eat at finer dining establishments, we visited Pane - it was the best meal of my life.
