At one point I even had the menu descriptions of the dishes we had (specials) saved on my computer, as if it was something to be cherished - and for me it was. 

I have always been intrigued by food since a young teenager - but usually I was resigned to whatever was available in the small town I lived, that with few exceptions was nothing special. This was the first place I ate that I experienced flavors that I had seen so many times in the numerous culinary programming I grew up watching on TV. Despite that Pane may have been my first, it has remained reliably one of the best restaurants in Tampa Bay as I have made my way down the list of established and new gastronomic workshops. 

At this point I have had nearly everything on the published menu (time for an update), and while I could dwell on the intricacies of each dish, there is no need, they are all exquisite. I will say though that I believe Pane is at its best when using seafood - but this is not a knock in anyway to their meat entrees. 

There are some restaurants that I greatly enjoy which have obvious shortcomings which I overlook due to the exceptional execution of what they do best - but Pane is solid top to bottom. There is not a selection they offer at which they do not excel. In addition to this, they're large offering of specials is often the best items on the menu on any given night. 

If you haven't gone to Pane, you must. It never fails to astound.
Well were do i start...first off the place looked run down. Then the food wasnt good no flavor bland. It was disgusting! Not ever again. Don't waste your money. You will get what you pay for.

Excellent food, excellent service and never been a time I did not see a manager asking if you need a refill or clearing your table. The pork is excellent, the burgers are amazing. The best bartenders around! You are in for a treat!

Do what you do, and do it well. This is the theme here.......
They make cocktails....only......and they make them very, very well...
(You can get beer and wine also)
This is a foodie's cocktail bar, with house made cordials and concoctions that result in very palatable drinks. In one of my favorite drinks, the Oaxaca Dry Sour, you will be treated to desiccated lime, habanero shrub, and absinthe...how's that for an interesting beverage!?
The vibe is refined, but not pretentious, fitting into the neighborhood perfectly.
Food is good. They are in dire need of replacing their tables. The finish is coming off, and I cringed this past visit over the cleanliness of the table.

A really cute place for brunch in New Orleans! I liked how it was a typical brunch menu, but with a Cajun/Creole twist - so I felt like I was getting some tastes of New Orleans.

The waitstaff was friendly - while we were waiting to be seated, someone was coming around offering to take our drink orders. Our waitress was honest about the menu, and recommended the St. Charles Benedict instead - fried chicken on eggs benedict (how could you go wrong?!). The chicken was juicy, the biscuit was soft and buttery, and the poached eggs over the top were cooked to perfection.

The only downside was the wait - which I think could be tremendously improved if seating was organized more efficiently and effectively. For example, we were a party of two, seated at a table for six. And there were plenty of outdoor seats and picnic tables, but those weren't being utilized. 

Overall, a great place I'd recommend for breakfast or brunch.

The Brass Tap is a great place to hang out and be a regular, it is my neighborhood go to bar of choice. I have been going there for almost 3 years. 

This location is at Wiregrass Mall (outdoor mall). They serve a huge selection of beer and wine only. They do not serve food, but you can bring in food and nearby restaurants deliver take out. Smoking is allowed in the patio area and cigars are available to buy. 

If you love all things beer, you'll love it here. The staff are very knowledge about the beers and brewers they feature. They will let you taste a beer before you order it if you're not sure you'll like it. 

They have great weekly specials like $1.50 off drafts for happy hour, trivia, karaoke, ladies night and live music. (http://www.brasstapbeerbar.com/wesley-chapel-weekly-specials.php) The live music Thursday - Saturday features some great local musicians if you like to have a drink and chill out. If you prefer a quieter environment come before 9pm any night of the week.

Came in here on a whim and was impressed.

Fantastic service -- staff was attentive and friendly. They also had all the games on which was awesome (came on a Sunday afternoon). They offer indoor and outdoor seating.

Pie Face Wrap was delicious and freshly made. Onion rings were really tasty also and paired well with the Blueberry Cider. Bf had the Bob-O Cobb-O and said it was great! We also ordered the wings, half apple honey BBQ and half lemon pepper. Also very tasty and recommend!

Wonderful decor. Smallish, basic bistro fare menu.  Service was polite - not fast or slow. I had eggs with vegetable sausage. That was new. Tasted a little like felafel with sausage extract. It wasn't terrible.  Husband liked his burger. Everything was very average. 
Come for the decor and the history of the Inn.

The food was just amazing. After a long day of driving we were ready for a good meal and a nice place to sit. The bartender Ben and the co-manager Clint took care of us for dinner. They were just so nice and helpful, and everyone in our party loved the food we ordered.

Buddha Bowls! So amazing! Our table had the hangover,Mac daddy and pizza bowl and were all very happy with them! Such a friendly staff and chill environment. Definitely a must if ever in Santa Barbara!

I went over lunch and was pretty disappointed.  The place was definitely half empty, and yet we still went 15 minutes at a time without being able to find our server.  I ordered the mushroom entree, which was ok.  It just seems to me that when you're so close to London Grill and Sabrinas, I'd choose differently if I had it to do over again.  The vibe was also pretty stuffy, the whole experience felt a little dated.

Good moderate priced food. Moderate size portions.
You have your choice to sit in bar/lounge or dinning room.
A great options to have if you're staying in hotel

My family and I visited TGI Fridays on Veterans in Metairie, LA on Sunday night March 12, 2017. We arrived later, after regular dinner times at 7:45 pm. They told us it would be 20 to 30 minute wait. We waited 37 minutes. There were many, many tables open an no one sitting at any of them. They had plenty of people waiting for tables and the wait was very slow. People were walking out. People were asking what was the problem with all the open tables. My family and I waited it out patiently. It seemed that TGI Fridays had not hired enough staff to work at dinner time since we only saw 3 waiters and waitresses. This was already turning out to not look so good. My elder parents were a tad frustrated from the long wait. We finally got a table and wanted to place a order. We came there specifically for the Baby Back Ribs. the waiter told us they were out of them for the night. This was a downfall for us and our experience with TGI Fridays for a Sunday night. They were also out of other items. Not looking good after getting seated now and ordering. The waiter was sick and working because I asked how she was feeling because she did not look well and looked exhausted and tired. I'm assuming she was overwhelmed with the lack of staff and the crowd the 3 waiters had to take care of. She was definitely not happy and perky. We waited a long time for our meal...just about 30 more minutes. My father asked where was our food. The waitress said "she'd check on it as the kitchen seemed to not be putting food out as quickly as they had in the past visits. The waitress came back with our food and without asking gave us side orders that we did not order or ask for because the kitchen ran out of the particular side orders we ordered from the start. There were items that we did not even eat on a normal bases. We could not understand why she would not ask us first before bringing out our food what other side item we would like until after giving us our entree's. We asked what were the choices and told her what we'd like instead of what the waitress chose. We didn't think it would take long to bring them out. We were just about finished our meal, after 15-20 minutes and the waitress brought out the side items. At this time we were done and would need a to go box. So that was another delay in not enjoying our meal or dine in at TGI Fridays. I ordered the Ribeye since the Ribs were out of stock and asked for it to be cooked medium. The steak was cooked well done and seemed like it was rubbery. Very awful dine in visit at TGI Fridays that night. 

We have ordered to go dinners before and the person that does to go orders always expects a tip without giving the change first. The impression I get is he'd rather keep the change than giving it back first and letting the customer decide if they would like to tip and what amount. If he was ever taught to give change first and in dollar bills instead of five or 10 dollar bills before expecting something in return, he'd probably get more tips. 

I'm giving only 2 stars because I've seen TGI Fridays serve better. I hope TGI Fridays in Metairie, LA improves, with food and having ordered enough, wait times, hiring more people who like to serve customers with a smile for the night crowds they get because we'd like to re-visit.

I had a weeks notice to plan and execute my daughters wedding and called Parkshore 3 days before to see if they could accommodate approx 14 people for a "reception"... let's just say that they came thru on such short notice and provided us with the best service and locale for our little celebration. Food was amazing, service from Heather was perfect and they made our day!  Can we talk about the scallop potatoes also?!?! 6 stars out of 5!!!

Brilliantly fun, hip with a beautiful crowd and good food to boot. The patio is killer and place I will enjoy spending Santa Barbara "winter" nights and beyond.

Beat salad- large and delicious. Well worth it
Deviled eggs- 3 that you will fight over. The hint of bacon is killer
Bone marrow on buttermilk biscuits- light and fluffy with a rich kick. Love in your mouth. Eat up!
Whole branzino- the least exciting of the night. Not a whole fish but a filet with a tail. The grill flavor is the best here and the kale is a massive filler. Compared to the rest, I'll pass on this this.

The timing of the dishes was poor. Our small table for two was filled with a filter water, jug that was rarely touched by the staff, side pates, wine and cocktails glasses and a cup of pop corn. Please stop bring out food. It's getting cold. No really. Every waiter who approached the table seemed to know the menu like they were assigned a section, less one who read off the menu and basically said everything was great. Slow down and let me enjoy the evening. That's the only negative here but not enough to bring me back...this time.

The dress is causal hip with many men in jeans & jackets and women in heels but it's Santa Barbara, come as you are. The bar is small and packed with all eaters. I did not see the causal drinker. You're here to chow down. No music to speak of and the lighting is mellow. A date night in the corner, friends out at a big top or Wednesday, it's all here. You can be too. Make a reservation through Open Table and the night is yours. 

The Lark is a place to share whether it's with friends in your group or people you just met at large table. If you don't have a relaxed, casual evening meeting new people or getting to know yours better, it's your fault. The Lark begs for conversation. I met a few lovely people and ran into a friend. Maybe I'll see you there too. You'll spend $80 for two with a couple of drinks so it's very reasonable. The wine list can set you back another $80 on average or MUCH more. All in good time.

This is Santa Barbara's next, best thing. Let's hope it sticks around.

Punch Burger is a great stop for lunch or dinner. I usually get the burnt cheese burger. I love it, and I've never come across anything else like it. The cheese gets just burnt enough to be crispy, but not enough to mask the taste. Absolutely delicious. I also love their waffle fries. Not that you'll have a lot of room left over for the fries after making your way through their giant burgers.

This location is fantastic because there is tons of seating, they have a variety of beers at very affordable prices, and the staff is super friendly.  The menu has tons of options for dressing your burger and multiple options for sides. Street and lot parking is available, and the restaurant is accessible from both the front and back doors.

Today I stumbled upon this gem of restaurant. I ordered the pork belly sandwich which was phaonominal. The service was nice and very attentive granted that had 20+ people on staff. Great place to eat.

I have eaten here a number of times and have never been disappointed.  It is truly a little gem in downtown Reno.  I like to go here for lunch before hitting the nearby antique shops.  

The soups are creative, filling and consistently delicious.  The prices are reasonable and portions are generous.  You also get a "bonus" cookie with your soup (oatmeal raisin, not my favorite, but a nice treat nonetheless).  My favorite is to split a grilled cheese with a friend and get a bowl of tomato bisque.  

The place is small and can easily get quite crowded at lunch.  So sometimes you need to share a table with someone you don't know.  

The place is unique for Reno and somewhere I would highly recommend.

Waited for awhile to collect my thoughts. Went here on Saturday for breakfast. 

My friend's fried oyster scramble being overcooked and under seasoned I could excuse as we're landlocked - and he decided to order oysters. My other friend's 'cathead' biscuit being tough I could excuse for being a unique option on the menu. 

My Big Bad Breakfast skillet being ice cold (including the cast iron skillet chilled) with dry eggs I cannot excuse. 

When we complained about the food - our server Loretta who previously called us "babe" and "love"  constantly  walked away without saying a word - not an apology or not even an acknowledgement that she heard us. Then dropped off our check and never spoke another word to us. 

There are enough tourists in Nashville that will accept this service and food, but as a local I will not be back

I visited New Orleans for the second time in November 2019. I intentionally chose to visit new restaurants. The concierge at the JW Marriott recommended this restaurant and it is located across the street.  The food and cocktails are delicious! I recommend Szarac and the Daiquiri Float for your drink selection. Their seafood gumbo is the best in New Orleans! The most impressive dish is the crawfish cheesecake and I will walk from Florida to the Palace Cafe to eat that again!!! If you have space for dessert, then order the Banana Foster! It's not only delicious but the fire presentation is impressive. In closing, I must commend bartenders Kathleen and Chad! They were the reason that I visited this restaurant twice during my short time in New Orleans. Their customer service is exceptional and their extensive knowledge of the city was welcomed! I will definitely return.

I have been back to Cooper's twice since my original review. Now that the bar is well-stocked I have really enjoyed it. They have an awesome range of beers including some good high gravity beers. I still haven't had a chance to have a full meal, but The dessert I did try was yummy and the food at the other tables looks great. I have heard from a friend that brunch is amazing. The servers are wonderful and attentive. I look forward to coming back more often in the future and hopefully it will soon be patio weather.
Talulas has the cutest atmosphere. Great ambiance, the food is Good - not out of this world- definitely good meals, very good service, just a tad pricey for the whole picture.

They took a reservation over the phone for 22 people 5 minutes after we walked in on Mothers day. We waited over 30 minutes and they called in the 22 group to take 8 tables. The whole place was packed!

Staying at the hotel and went here twice. Both nights Jere was the barkeep and our waiter. Whoever owns this place should give him a raise. He was tentative, helpful, and very friendly. Every request we had was handled perfectly. Well done Jere, thank you. As far the Triumph Grill it was pretty good too. We had the Penne Pasta with shrimp, it was really tasty. Decent beer selection as well. 
The decor here is really cool if you're into vintage motorcycles. Lots to look at!

Love the atmosphere - it's very chic and clean! Croissants are wonderful, ordered a biscuit and bacon, biscuit could have been baked a tad less, but still very good! Will be back! The selection of pastries is incredible!!

This is a five star burger joint. In particular I love the chili cheese burger and fries. Me my friends and family have probably eaten there 50 times and nobody has ever got sick like one of the whiny reviewers claims so don't believe it! His mommy should take him to Macdonalds. There is usually a crowd at this extremely popular place and there wouldn't be if the food wasn't great or if people were getting stomach cramps. I intend to take the wife and grandkids there for lunch tomorrow.

this place is to die for. The service was phenomenal, the food was to die for, the wine is great.

Beautiful place, great atmosphere and in the middle of downtown!

A must try!

Do you like beer and suck at making decisions? Then City Tap House is for you.

The one thing that they really do well here is their beer list.  Come in and you literally need a menu for the draught list.  Most places will give you a small menu with 5 or 10 bottles, but here they have 40 or 50 on tap all the time.  Any brew you're in the mood for they'll have something that will pique your interest.

The food isn't much to write home about, but if you're hungry it should satisfy you.  I've only eaten here a couple times, but regularly stop in for a beer or two.

The atmosphere also makes it easily the best bar in the UCity area.  You can't beat the roof top patio and the fire places when it's a bit chilly out. The inside can get a bit cramped at night and sometimes is a bit loud with the DJ, but no where near as bad as other near by bars.

If you want to stay around UCity and grab a few beers you can't go wrong with City Tap House.

YES YES YES YES.

I was in Philly for my anniversary over the summer, and the hotel AND yelp recommended this place for legit beer adventures. And they ABSOLUTELY NAILED IT HOLY HELL THIS PLACE ROCKS.

Great craft beers. Excellent tavern food. Warm bartenders who told my wife she was "the good kind of pregnant" and entertaining patrons. I was actually blessed to be there when a kid from tampa attempted to order a bud light, and I watched for the reaction. The bartender didn't explode or get snotty, but politely offered a selection that closely matched the type of lager he was looking for. VERY PROFESSIONAL.

Beer nerds unite, this place won't be touched for quality in Old City.

This is a must in Nashville. We were in town for Valentine's Day and our daughter made reservations. Best dinner I've ever had while in the city. Plates are shareable and the chef noticeably infuses flavors that being out the best in simple ingredients. Located in a historic church fellowship hall, the ambience is is not lost in the transformation to restaurant. The vision and staff are excellent.

Nice outdoor patio, dog friendly, nice friendly staff, good selection of beer. So far, so good. Service was a bit slow, maybe they were that busy I don't know, but it could have been better.

I give them Stars for the beer selections, affordable pricing, and laid back atmosphere. However, the food and service could use a step up.

On this visit we sampled one of the Cali bowls, and the chipotle chicken sandwich. This is where I lost my good vibe. On the Cali Bowl we asked for the blackened steak, so disappointing to receive tiny little nuggets of meat that you needed a spoon to pick up, not sure why they even asked "how do you want that cooked"? It was so overdone. On the chicken sandwich, the toppings were skimpy. Both of these items could have been so much better.

They have their own parking lot which helps in this area of Exton. Outdoor seating a plus. Yes I would return, but just for drinks.

Outside and in seating. The location is a bit too, hmmm, rich? (as meredith from the office would say) for me. I just wasn't impressed. It's not really my style of place. The prices were too much and the servers seem to be trying way too hard to be helpful. The food wasn't bad. I was probaby just in a shitty mood that night, and it was really hot outside.

This is a tiny place but well worth the wait. Had the pasta Jambalya and man it was so good and flavorful. The service is really good and the staff extremely friendly. A must if you are in the Quarter.

This place is very consistent... as in consistently horrible service. It's a dilemma for me because it is so close and a beautiful place. Great bar, some food decent, but don't sit in the restaurant. Sit at the bar and have a drink; anything else will leave you disappointed. They just don't get it when it comes to running a restaurant.

Hit and miss, the food is good but sometimes service is slow and waitresses seem to struggle with disorganization. Hubby liked his fish sandwich & I got prime rib. It was pretty good. Music was very loud so we had to shout at each other. Perhaps they will improve with time.

My usual place for office lunch. Lunch hour seems to be pretty busy but it doesn't take long time to get seated . Very good place for hanging out in a group . 
I have tried almost all the burgers they have. Five alarm burger and California style chicken burger if my favourite . Oh and another good thing about this place is that they have free fries refill . 
Would highly recommend this place for lunch .

Went to this place around 945 on a Sunday, and it was packed, so I expected the service to take a little while. The service was overall pretty good. My drink was never empty and they did not mess up anything on my order. The food to me was pretty average, nothing special. I got the basic breakfast of eggs, bacon, hash browns and toast. The one thing that got me though was my mother asked after we got our food if she could have a small sample of tuna to see if she would like to have the tuna salad sandwich on the next visit. She said she would pay the $1 or whatever to try it, and the waitress (who was very nice) said that the cooks would not do it.
       So needless to say we probably wont be back, since the wait time was high for average food. There are better places in Tucson (at least for breakfast food).

The Grand Lux Cafe has great food and fantastic service.  Matt did an excellent job taking care of us.  He explains any questions that you have and makes great recommendations. I love the pot roast and the donut sundae is so good! The people who work there are very, very nice. Keep up the great job. We have taken many people to the Grand Lux Cafe and continue to return every week!

Great beer and great service, all around pleasant atmosphere with chic interior design. Highly recommend for their food or beer! Special praise for Vanessa, friendly, relatable and helpful waitress. Will definitely come back!

Ate here not too long ago while I went to go visit a friend. I had never been to Anthony's so decided to give it a shot. The first time we ordered from them we got a simple large cheese pizza. That they managed to do fairly right, and despite people saying "pizza is pizza" they really do a good job on being generous with the cheese and not leaving the top slathered in grease. Nice for a cheese slice fix. 

However my downside happened when I came the second time and ordered spaghetti. It was fairly cold out and the pizza slice wasn't gonna be enough to hold me over. So my buddy and I decided to get a bite from Anthony's. I chose the spaghetti and the initial presentation of it was standard fair for many pizza/hoagie places - salad, bread, and the spaghetti. Presentation looked decent so I had good hopes for my meal. Paid $11.25 for it. The woman who took my order though was a little snippy, but I took it with a grain of salt. When we got home I opened the lid to discover three very average sized meatballs....

Disappointment. They tasted like they were grocery store freezer brand and just tossed in a pan with some sauce. Bland. No flavor. And the actual pasta didn't do it any justice at all. I could toss some Prego sauce in a pan at home and make better meatballs then this place. The salad wasn't at all all that good,  and if anything looked wilted. How do you mess up salad?

All in all I'll probably be sticking with my local pizza place Angelo's pizza. At least their spaghetti is a large portion, with meatballs covering the entire container, a good sized salad and garlic breadsticks to boot. 

If you come here, just stick with their pizza or sandwiches, which looked decent. Don't go the pasta route unless you really want too. For $11.25 of that price you could go to your nearest grocery and make a brimming pot of spaghetti that will taste better than what this place had to offer.
Good food. Limited brunch menu on Sunday. The banana milkshake is amazing. Must get it. Our server was very nice and helpful. 4 stars because of the small menu.

Love the food but my Jamaican shrimp and chicken is AlWAYS cold.... very good flavor though.   In response: I have let management know and they take my food and warm it up in microwave but I usually have to wait 10 minutes.... not worth the wait!

I was pleasantly surprised how great my sandwich was at this restaurant. Nice and clean inside. Decked out with all the Philly Decour including a Tastycake stand and RC soda machine. I got the roast pork with broccoli Rob and provolone cheese and it was on point. Will definitely make this a regular spot.
Delicious food and outstanding service! Our waitress Sara was on point and the hostess, Kendra was very accommodating. Highly recommend for superb food and service!

Had an appt nearby and thanks to fellow yelpers I found my way here for breakfast. It was getting crowded by 0900. I was able to snag a counter seat while others waited for tables or more counter seats. 

Shout out to Kitty for sharing the menus so I knew what I wanted when I arrived. 

It's a cute diner. Clean. Everyone was very friendly and the staff was working nonstop. They constantly were checking on everyone on the counter.  It's small so there can be a wait. At 0930 the line was outside. I overheard someone say it was worth the wait!!! 

Going in I knew I had to get the pancakes, hash brown, and biscuits and gravy. It seemed a bit much but I had faith. Got the blueberry pancakes crispy style. Wow!  These were great. This may have been the most blueberries I've seen in my pancakes.  And the crispy style was indeed unique, flavorful, and nice texture. It did seem to already have some butter in it. But I liked it. 

The hash browns were very crispy by not dry!  It was moist on the inside and some of the better ones I've had. 

The biscuits and gravy were also very good. Not too dense. Good amount of sausage (a few more pieces would've been ok too). Gravy was thick. But I do prefer thick vs too thin. Flavor was excellent. 

All that for $12.06!

Everything was steaming hot and tasty. Highly recommend. Can't wait to return!
Great meal at Black Powder Tavern tonight. Staff was excellent!!! Would recommend this place to anyone in the area to stop in for a meal.

Burger joints are a dime a dozen, so burger joints have to provide not only exceptional food but also service. I stopped in to grab dinner after coming from a show at the Convention Center. I love the menu here; high quality burgers and some have an interesting twist to them like the brunch burger (fried egg, bacon, and hash browns on it). 

I went with a straight up cheeseburger and a side of fries. You order and then if you're dining in, they give you a number and someone brings your food to you. Mayo and ketchup do not come standard on their burgers so there's a condiment station where you can hook it up the way you like. They serve select wines and beer here as well. They also have a few TVs here so it's nice to be able to watch a game here while you eat. 

Overall, I loved my burger; perfectly cooked and seasoned. The fries...THE FRIES! So good (I think they fry them in duck fat)! This place really has a ton of potential and I hope it sticks around for a long time.

This is my favorite place to go in Havertown for food, specialty drinks and beer! Everything on the menu is fantastic from the burger to the chicken sandwich to the apps. I would highly recommend to everyone!

Roast pork, what a sandwich.  It honestly doesn't look that appetizing, but you'll get past that REAL fast once you take your first bite.  I ordered mine with provolone and sweet peppers. The provolone has a very sharp taste, and the peppers were cooked perfectly.

I was confused in the line as everyone was ordering theirs with broccoli rabe (honestly I had no idea what they were saying until I read other reviews), which was not on the menu.  I enjoyed the sweet peppers but all those people must have known something that I, as a tourist, did not.
Went through the drive thru then pulled up, gave them my card, then they practically threw my bag of food at me with nothing said . Hire new employees, so rude and my food was cold .

In high school, my school had an exchange program with a school in England. We decided to take our British exchange students here. We thought they'd genuinely enjoy the food here. Instead, they spent the entire time taking pictures of everything like the portions at the Cheesecake Factory were some sort of American landmark like the Liberty Bell or the Statue of Liberty. They didn't actually realize that Americans genuinely eat at the Cheesecake Factory, accept that the portions are ridiculous,  and it's not really a novelty. 

But really, if you want gigantic portions of reheated, bland food that's about 4,000 calories a serving, without having to wait 45 minutes for a table, maybe try sticking a few sticks of butter in the microwave for a few seconds. It's basically the equivalent of the food at the Cheesecake Factory.

For a hot dog stand in an airport terminal, you can't go wrong with this one. 
The prices are reasonable (considering airport prices), the hot dog tasted amazing, and the service was okay. 
I got the Cajun sausage and my partner got the regular hot dog. Both tasted great! 
I loved that they have a few different topping options, but aren't over complicated. Just mustard, ketchup, onions, chili, and cheese.

Stopped by after a canoe trip at Northbrook (wonderful trip). We were seated outside under a canopy. Beautiful weather and quite comfortable. Our kids loved the dog customers that were lounging with their owners. Menu was varied and everyone enjoyed their choices. I particularly enjoyed he fish tacos. It was a busy Sunday afternoon but service was attentive and sharp. Definitely will return.

First time visiting Copia West County for Happy Hour.  Our server, Robert, made our experience so enjoyable. He was so attentive and accomodating! The wine was great and the appetizers were delicious! We will definitely be back! Pat J.

It had been a year since my last visit here and boy did I not remember how good these burgers were! As I was inhaling my cheeseburger with the works I couldn't stop thinking about the Five Guys that'll be 'opening soon' about 20 minutes closer to my house. Soon isn't soon enough!

This place was great. The beer selection was good and the food I had was amazing. I ordered the loaded fries appetizer which was meh. Fries were soggy and bland. However, when the sirloin and ribs arrived they were great. My only other concern was the seating. I had a guest from another table staring into my ear he was so close and it was very uncomfortable.

Super fun environment. It was busy but our server was super helpful and attentive throughout our time there. The parking across the street was a bit confusing so would recommend the garage parking which gives you an hour free. We went for brunch on a Wednesday and it was crowded but they turn tables quickly.

Went there today for the brunch.  The service was awful, the food not very good. I had a mushroom omelette and there was something very wrong with the mushrooms. They smelled and tasted awful. Not pleased at all.
This being my first visit to Philly, I can't tell a good cheese-steak sandwich from a bad one. But, this was a damn good sandwich period!!!

Let me be clear, this place is really good. I've gotten meals and loved it - and more often than anything, stopped in for dessert and loved it. 

The last time was a bit of an exception though. Not because they messed up the food, but instead because they messed up the price. 

Not quite feeling like a full dessert I opted for some coffee. They have espresso so I went for a triple espresso with some cream. It comes hot, strong, and tasty. All that I could have hoped for. The bill comes shortly after my friends and I finish.

3                          Espresso                         $9

So, if a regular espresso costs $3, a triple costs $9? 

Tasty coffee... but not quite enough to be the most expensive coffee of my life.

It's BJs, chanced are you have been to one before and as they do a good job as far as chains go.

Keep in mind that this particular restaurant gets particularly busy and you may have a wait. 

The BBQ chicken pizza is predictably good with a thick doughy style pizza and a BBQ sauce that is simple and a little overly sweet.

The seared ahi salad has a light Asian dressing with thin crunchy won ton style croutons. There is a small amount of fresh avocado. The ahi is cooked well but does not have much flavor. It was probably frozen and washed thoroughly and defrosted in water.

I am still soooooooooo disappointed with the food!

Yes, service was excellent and the decor and atmosphere was perfect, but our entrees were just waaaaay too salty and just seemed of low quality.

As you walk in, the hostess stand in directly in the middle with about 3 people working the desk.  There are 3 floors to the restaurant.  The elevator is located behind the hostess stand.

I had reservations for 5 ladies at 6:45pm and we were seated immediately.  Everyone was nice.  As we walked toward the elevator, the kitchen staff had to stop what they were doing and took a peak at me and my girls.  It was a nice little moment!

Anyways, on to the food.

Apps:
Crab cake - there was more bread crumbs than there was crab.  It came with a light corn maque choux which was good.
Mussels - they were steamed in a savory, buttery and light garlic sauce.  The mussels were plumb, tender and cooked perfectly.
Charbroiled oysters - they were charbroiled in a cast iron skillet that had 6 mini cups to hold the oysters.  The flavor was good, but I was hoping the oyster were still in their shell with the burnt charcoal look and taste.

This is where is gets bad:

Entrees:
Wood oven grilled crusted Drum - the breading/stuffing that came on top of the fish was waaaay too salty.  I just scraped it off and squeezed tons of lemon on it.  The dish came with string beans, pecans, potatoes and bacon...I killed that part of the dish!

Duck - it was tender and juicy, but the fat could have been rendered off a little bit more.  My gf liked it, so that's a plus.

My sis ordered the Drum as I did and she liked it and was okay with the breading on top of the fish.

My other two gfs ordered the Gumbo with Ham Hock and Sausage.  They said that there was no ham hock to be found and the gumbo was waaay too salty.  One gf ordered a side of the roasted potatoes and OMG.....the potatoes were parbroiled in salted water that was waaaaaay too salty.  I think the kitchen accidentally messed that up bc they should not serve something soooo salty....

Dessert:
We were so disappointed with our entrees that we just opted for something that cannot be screwed up - we ordered the creme brulee trio.
It was a vanilla creme brulee, coconut, and coffee.  Dessert came out looking gorgeous and tasted delicious.

You know, I would like to give this place another chance, but there are so many other restaurants nearby that have the same so-called reputation.....that I just would not go back......sorry Emeril!!

Had a great lunch yesterday. Small group from work. Fast service very attentive. I had to pizza and it was fantastic. My coworkers had sandwiches and although a bit messy they loved them also. Small place so get there early for lunch. Highly recommended.

I have eaten here a few times pretty much always the same..

Service is either good or non existent. 

Club sandwich is huge but all bread..

Chicken wings okay nothing special.  

Seems like the best food is v the burgers they try to do Asain but it is straight from the freezer and blah 

I recommend passing on this unless you are really hungry

I ordered a fried chicken sandwich, jalepeno Mac n cheese, and potato salad. The delivery was fast and friendly. The sandwich was great. The Mac n cheese is super fantastic, but if you have jalepenos at home just add your own. Potato salad tasted... Grainy for lack of a better word. 
My biggest issue is the portion sizes for what I paid. I got a small scoop of -disliked- potato salad and paid $5. $8 for a slightly larger side of Mac. The sandwich was appropriate to price (fries are delicious). 
This is a good place, just be prepared for small portions

A bit dirty inside but the atmosphere was great. Aside from the sticky tables the restaurant was a nice respite from the rain and served some very creative and delicious food. A cleaner restaurant would warrant 5/5 stars!

We had the famous french toast, it was OK. I actually liked the berry sauce. The crab cake with poached egg and potatoes was good. Again nothing special.
We also ordered the turkey sandwich, and biscuit and gravy as appetizer. the biscuit and gravy was kind of salty. the sandwich was OK. Didn't care much for the cinnamon apple appetizer. Way too much oily.
Also over priced for the quality of food.
The service was good.

Good food, good service, good atmosphere. You won't be disappointed here. My food was good, but my boyfriend's pork shoulder was amazing. Also, we started with the mac and cheese appetizer which was wonderful- the best mac and cheese I've ever had (sorry, mom.) They had a good selection of wines and a very romantic atmosphere :)

Great food! Good service. 

Give them a try, my son has gotten the Queso burger each time and has been beyond satisfied.

Same for me and all the appetizers and tenderloin!

Being from Texas I was skeptical about them calling it Texas style BBQ, but after getting the 3 meat plate with chicken wings, pulled pork, and the brisket burnt ends with the macaroni as a side. I was surprised when it was better than most barbecue I've had in the Dallas area! Will be back. Great old fashioned and whiskey selection as well.

Last night dinner at Texas Roadhouse was excellent! I had ribs that fell off the bone! The best sweet potato I've ever had! House salad, so cold and yummy! My hubs had Chicken Critters, very moist and flavorful! Tanya came and greeted us, too. The whole place was a wonderland of lights! It was beautiful!

Arrive early and call ahead for reservations. The happy hour menu is phenomenal and price cannot be beat. The drinks are good - skip the mojito - the white sangria is sweet and fruity. The speciality martinis arrive with some extra flare. I ordered the tuna kabobs and last time the mignon kabobs. Both of them were excellent. Service is good and great outdoor seating. Always visit when in FLORIDA.

This bar is well worth a visit I've never had a bad experience here the staff is friendly the services well above average on the place is clean you will not be disappointed by visit to this bar. Oh yeah and the food is pretty good to

Okay Philadelphia, WHY do you guys love this chain so much? Like, after I finally got a Pat's steak, I *got* the whole cheesesteak thing. But what's with your obsession with these crab fries? They're frozen crinkle cuts with old bay for like $8. Pass. That said, the peel and eat shrimp were large, and at a dozen for about the same price as the crab fries, I'd go back if I were in the terminal again for those. Bonus points for having a cocktail sauce that actually had a nice horseradish kick, too. Not a bad spot in the airport terminal, pretty decent service, but I'm still confused over the town's obsession with these fries.

Very good vibes and food.  When you walk in, to the right are the beer kegs i think they have over 100 beers on tap.  To the left, is their wine cellar with a large variation as well.  I went with a party of 4.  Our server wasn't very attentive but the managers reassurance and check up was great so maybe the server was new or it just wasn't their day.  I had the shrimp tacos,  which are fire !!!!! Everything inside of them just meshes together and creates so much flavor. Below are pics of our food. If I could add videos I would but everything was top tier.  Except the nachos. Don't get the nachos , they're fully loaded but bland (no flavor what so ever). My boyfriend had the spinach artichoke dip. The dip was cheesy but no seasoning. All of the dishes are large and well worth the price . Definitely will revisit and return.

Had to knock them down a star. We came here last Saturday and the service and server was not good at all. The food was good but unfortunately we didn't get the friendly and awesome service we did the other two times we've been here. I normally wouldn't be too harsh but the service was BAD. I truly hope this was just a one time thing.

This place reminds of Hopdoddy's Burger Bar in Austin, Texas, except it's not as good (haha sorry to burst ur bubble with that one). 

The burgers here are alright, it's nothing you can go wrong with! Its average, but I love the atmosphere here. 

You grab a menu, stand in line, and order at the register and they'll give you a number and bring your food to you. 

It was quite dead when we came one evening during the weekend, but the place is HUGE, so idk if it would fill up. 

I forgot how much our food was, but it wasn't expensive and if you're craving a burger, I'd totally recommend this lace

Clients took us here for a work dinner and I was pleasantly surprised. We sat in the front area because they had happy hour pricing in that section and not in the back restaurant. We arrived at 5pm and there was no wait, but by 7pm when we were leaving, the place was pretty packed. I got the grilled chicken with mushrooms and veggies and substituted mashed potatoes instead of rice. Everything was so delicious, but especially those mashed potatoes. The rest of the group got salmon, pot pie, and other dishes and everybody loved their food and cleaned their plates! I didn't have any beer but the rest of the group did and they enjoyed things. Service was good and food came out in a timely manner. Bathrooms were clean and the place looked well taken care of.

Went for breakfast and I really enjoyed the atmosphere. Ordered the Huevos Rancheros because I'm not a fan of breakfast but I'm huge fan of Mexican dishes. The server was super sweet and answered a boat load of questions and was very patient when explaining everything on the menu. The menu is short and sweet with very untraditional for breakfast. The coffee is bold and they even make their own non dairy milk. The chocolate chip cookies are some of the best cookies I've ever had (and I'm no fan of chocolate).  My entree came out missing a couple items but all in all the food was delicious and the server was super sweet about the oversight. I will definitely be back to try the chicken breakfast sandwich.

My girls and I love to go to BJ's! They have a wide variety of foods to chose from so even the picky eaters in my family can find something they like. The main thing I love about this place is they have so many really good deals. Ex- 1/2 price large pizza on Mondays. You can sign up to be a BJ's member and get deals emailed to you. ( I know what you are thinking..like I need one more thing to sign up for) but it is totally worth it! Today I got an amazing black and blue bacon burger and a free pizookie. Yum!

Annies has some of the best food in Lambertville if not the best. Saturday morning breakfast is a great place to grab a fast fresh made meal. But wanted to give a shout out to Annies because we needed lunch to feed 12 people last second and they made such an amazing platter which everyone in the office loved!! So happy they are apart of out community.
Good service, food was good, reasonably priced. Three of us had breakfast for $27.00. Easy to get into, easy to get out of. Pretty much what I would expect at Denny's or Ihop.
The food here was amazing! The tacos had the perfect amount of spice and sweetness from the pineapple was yummy! It was fun we came on trivia night and Shanauna was awesome!

After seeing this place on Man vs. Food I couldn't wait to try it. Went to the market the next day and was not impressed with the roast pork sandwich. Don't  get me wrong it was tender and juicy from all the au jus but I just didn't get what he was raving about. Wondering if I ordered it wrong and I definitely should have gotten the long hots and not just the broccoli rabe but I still think it would lack flavor. The best thing about the sandwich was the roll! 

Want a tasty sandwich? Leave it!

I have NEVER been so upset with an establishment.  I have been to xfinity a million times, and while I know covid has given restaurants many rules the staff was incredibly rude. We made our reservation for 6, and they did not let us sit at a table for 6, though we had more of our party coming. The woman rolled her eyes many times and shook her head while we just ate our meal. Service was awful. Will NOT be back even when things are normal, which upsets me because I have friends whom work there. Terrible, terrible experience. Whoever is hosting (Middle Aged woman, curly hair) deserves to be fired.

I have been to Kopper Kitchen an inordinate amount of times, due to the quality eats and the proximity to my work location. This is not a fancy-pants venue; it is a family owned diner with fresh ingredients, items made from scratch, and all of the friendly that you can handle.  The average age of the customers always seems to be about 72, so it makes me feel like a young whipper snapper. One of my all-time favorite sandwiches is located at Kopper Kitchen: The Veggie Reuben. It is a hot mess and oh-so-delicious. I am also a big fan of their salads.

Alway come here!
Great prices and fairly portion sizes!!!  Great please to go with family for breakfast lunch or dinner. 
Owners are so nice and truly place their customers as a priority

I'll keep this simple:

We were a bigger party than they could handle, even though they've known that we were coming for over 1 month now.  There was about 60 of us in all.

Appetizers:
Calamari - 6 out of 5
Chicken Sticks - 3 out of 5
Salad - 4 out of 5

Entrees:
Salmon - 4 out of 5
Supposedly Blackened Shrimp - 2 out of 5
Sirloin Steak - 2 out of 5
Crab Cakes w/Goat Cheese 4 out of 5

Won't go back.

We had a pleasant experience! We had some drinks and got some oysters. They were a bit small, but they seemed to be fresh and were good. The service was good as well, my wife had a drink she didn't enjoy and they replaced it without issues. The oysters were about $28, a bit pricey for their size, plus drinks and tip we ended at $70, not the best, but not too bad either, we enjoyed our visit overall.
Not bad at all. I was thoroughly impressed by the chicken tenders. They were ahem very tender. And flavourful. The sides were all fast food quality but ok.

We're always looking for breakfast places that open early in Philadelphia.  There aren't many....at least many worth venturing out for.

High Street on Market is worth every "ZZZ" I give up.  The pastry selection is pretty spectacular.  I shared a chocolate scone with my wife.  It was the perfect combination of butter and chocolate.  She had been craving a good bagel and selected a sesame seed version with cream cheese.  The High Street version is thin and crispy outside.  It received high praise.  I opted for The Forager.  This beautifully composed sandwich combines a soft egg, kale, red onions and the best cheddar cheese I've had.

Inside the beautiful, simple interior you can opt for a small counter, a communal table, or table seating.  The coffee is top-notch and frequently refreshed by one of the super-friendly servers.  We spotted brunch drinks such as mimosas and bloody marys on the menu as well (maybe next time).

We'll be back for lunch soon!  The options looked fantastic.

First Yelp review, so take my opinion as you will, but I can't comprehend the 3 Star overall rating for Dawson's Too.  Since moving to Brownsburg 3 years ago, this has been our spot on Friday night's. Love the server's (especially Donna), Prime Rib special and Ribeye's are best around (burgers/pastas/fish ALL GOOD). Their craft beer selection is amazing as well! Zero complaints, and it's always packed on the weekend, so business is good. So those of you with negative opinions aren't needed there anyway :)

My husband and I were in Mt. Vernon for a wedding and drove into St. Louis for the night to get a bite to eat. Salt + Smoke was very good, worthy of a 1.5 hour drive? Probably not, but if you're staying in the area and have multiple days and meals to dedicate to your trip then go for it. The brisket sandwich was very good, the hushpuppies were burnt, but good, they didn't come with nearly enough butter for how large they are. The mac and cheese was good, it is not as stellar as the reviews had lead me to believe it would be. I have eaten mac all over- if it's on the menu, I'm going to get it. If you like mac, get it, it's worthy of taking a spot on your plate as your "one side dish", but it's just not "oh my God, I have died and gone to heaven, this is slap yo mama good" kind of mac. The creamed corn on the other hand is phenomenal. Not traditional creamed corn by any means, but absolutely delicious. It reminded me of a corn and crab bisque that I have had before, without the crab obviously.
Burger was tasty but condiments were skimpy. Tomatoes were thin & yellow. The cheese on the fries was also skimpy especially for the price. Won't be going back.

Chuck A Burger you are the stuff dreams are made of! 

If you're looking for the el'cheapo burger that tastes like a slice of heaven this is the place! 
In-N-Out burger lovers craving a fix should check this out. Its a bit bigger burger than an In-N-Out but all the factors that make you love an In-N-Out are here. Fresh veggies, great tasting tomatoes, HOT buns and a great paddy of meat all on the cheap. 

Fries are actually really good here too! 

Chuck A Burger is on my list of my have food places. I might add this list is a pretty short list. 

I'll be back for another Bacon Jalapeno Single with some of that amazing good bacon.

The oysters used for the baked dish were too large. Those should have been used for raw ones. 
The green beans were soggy.

That service was fine, the atmosphere was nice. 


I just don't think I need to go back.

Best wings and best customer service I've ever experienced. Boyfriend and I went last night and ordered the 20 wing combo with four flavors (Parmesan, sweet chili, traditional hot, and sesame teriyaki). When we got our wings, all of the flavors looked suspiciously similar. As we ate, we quickly realized we had been given all BBQ wings. Boyfriend went to tell an employee, Edward, who made things right and then some! He let us keep the 20 BBQ wings and brought us our original order - double the wings!! He even gave us each a card to come back for 5 free wings. Long story short, Edward rules, the wings were suuuuper good, and we will DEFINITELY be back.

Wow! Found this place just looking for a place to eat with my husband and it was a delight. The food was yummy and the service was great. Maria was our server and she was such a doll. Will definitely be back.

It's been almost 3 years we have been coming here. The best thing is the taste of the food. But furthermore, we always ask for Brian. (the one with the food jokes) We are Brian's first customers from the first day he started. He is so friendly, he remembers everything about his customers so well. We also come here to see him and ask to be seated to one of his tables. I highly recommend him. Be one of his customers!
After a long sleepless night in Reno, nothing gets your day started like a great big breakfast from Millies. One of my favorites when I stay on the strip.

I dropped the ball guys, i had already ordered from her through doordash n i ate the fuck outa it before taking pictures lol so I didn't realize this business shared the same parking of Pearle vision n after my eye check I decided to try it out in person. Mind you my eyes were full one Dilated! I couldn't see the menu lol the tall handsome gentleman with the badass biker skull ring told me to look right, cuz there was the bigger menu. It was a blur!! P_P but I managed to see the smoke bbq one n hawaii flavors and winged it (ohh wing joke!). Went with the 10 pc combo n added the fried corn. As i waited i blindly wobble myself to the drink machine n filled it up with mystery drink. Cuz I can't see lol. It tasted good n that's what mattered. It took about less than 10mins n i was on my way out with a bag, drink n my cane. Fun stuff having to walk out like that but I'm stubborn n don't ask for help. I'll fight ya over it to lol. I think the corn vanished before getting home. I seriously love this corn!! It has spices n mildly hints of chili peppers nice burn but don't take my word for it, cuz I can't handle high spices. Im a mild lady. What's hot for me is mild for others. I had to wait to get home for the chicken and let me tell ya. I ate the fuck outa it. I love their wings! Nice and tender. Nice sizes to, pump and well cooked. I haven't braved trying all their flavors yet. I was supposed to come here with a man friend i met on the "sandwich" app, but he bailed on me. So i will definitely come back n sit down. Dunno if they do booze but i sure hope so. Cuz i would pair these delicious wings with a nice bitter ale. Something in the dark or amber category. This place would rock harder if it was a bar like the other wing place. I think they do have way to much sauce but if u take home? Put the extra in a jar n cook with it. Make like a mean sandwich with it. 
Place is big enough for a soup of store location, the parking will test you though. Inside they got one of those make your own drinks machine. 
Will definitely come back for more!

Forgot to mention: the bread rolls are great to, make samishes with the wings, i also trued their chicken strips! They are huge! Great value in the 10pc

I stayed at the hotel and happen to stumble into the bar when i heard the music coming from it. Most people wont want to stay in their hotels bar snd drink but after meeting the staff their i regret not doing it sooner. Let me start off by saying the bartenders their are very knowledgeable of their craft. Josh was our main server and after talking to him i understand why some other reviewers felt he wasnt a typical bartender that kisses your ass for tips and makes you a shitty drink. Josh takes his bartending seriously as i noticed since he was training a new girl from alabama lol. But this is a good thing because he made literally some of the best drinks ive ever had. Way better than all the tourist bullshit on bourbon street hands down. So when you need a drink and want  a good enviroment go here and tip well.

Nothing special. Was part of a private function. Staff was unattentive and seemingly unable to handle the event. Food was fair at best. Mashed potatoes would have had trouble passing for poorly prepared powdered mashed potatoes. Opt for Ruths Chris down the street.

I would conceded myself a regular here. Lizzie and Britney are incredible. Joey and Ronan are the nicest humans you'll ever meet. My only issue is the GM. I've never seen someone so rude to their employees and customers. He yelled at a customer right in front of me and usually I give people the benefit of the doubt so I paid no mind. THEN he yelled at his employees and one employee looked especially distraught from this. Overall, he seems like a jerk. It's a great restaurant and bar, but get a better general manager.

A coworker showed me this gem of a spot in Souderton about 6 months ago. Since then I have eaten lunch there at least two dozen times and dinner once but never for breakfast. The place is eclectic, friendly and consistent. During the warmer months you can sit outside on their patio which is very comfortable. I would however, recommend not showing up at noon during the work week as it gets packed. Try to go a half hour earlier or later to avoid the rush. On the weekends it never seems to be an issue.

As far as the food the blackened tilapia burrito is super good as well as the french dip and crispy chicken BLT but my favorite as of late is the orchard. I would highly recommend the sandwiches with a side of hand cut sweet potato fries although the regular fries are always very good.

It was funny to see a Ledo's here again in my backyard after growing up with them in MD my whole life. 

I stopped by because they had a Welcome to the Neighborhood coupon that came in the mail. 

Unfortunately as much as I love the one in MD, this was a disappointment. They were so unfriendly, the pizza was oily, and the restaurant just looked run down. 

I'll come back again sometime to see if they have good wings (which were some of my favorites in MD). I guess if I'm ever missing home I can stop by and reminisce at Ledo's.

Normally I love Red Robin. Had the worst experience at this location and won't be going back to the franchise again. Started when the hostess sat us at a table between the kitchen and the wait station, where servers were waking back and forth on both sides. Got up to move and the incompetent manager just stood there and watched. Tried to sit in the bar and was told that of the 80% empty tables, we were going to have to wait for a server to seat us. Whole time incompetent manager on duty just watched and did nothing. Left and won't be going back.

What a great place to watch sports.  The atmosphere here is awesome, it's small but laid out well.  They have very creative burgers and some of the best sweet potato fries I've had.  The JB sauce they give to dip them in is delicious.

They have a great beer selection and the service we received was the best we had while in Nashville. I would highly recommend this place.

Well normally I don't throw around 5 star ratings but here it goes...

THIS IS THE BEST BURGER IN ST. LOUIS!

Yeah, I said it. Prices were a little steep, however, everything is made from scratch. the onion rings were amazing and damn just was delicious. I will definitely go back before I have to move. 

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

Being from New Jersey (not Italian myself, though), I've eaten at a lot of Italian eateries, from the lowliest pizzeria to formal restaurants.  They've ranged from terrible to sublime, and this place, while not deserving of a one star, is barely passable as Italian.

My brother told me this place used to be a convenience store, which is apparent because the acoustics are terrible.  You can still see the fridges that probably used to house Red Bulls or eggs, which is kind of amusing in a diversionary sort of way.  The bathrooms are next to the kitchen's sinks, so it was sort of weird walking by a dishwasher while on my way to facilities.  It had tacky Italian stuff everywhere; in short, it needs more of makeover to hide the convenience store chic.

The place was PACKED for a Tuesday night though, and seems to double as the local Cheers.  Kinda cool.

The food was pizzeria food, with pizza, calzones, and standard pasta/meat combos.  Looks like most of the food was pre-made or pre-bought.  The red sauce was just...not good.  Not terrible.  But not great like a homemade gravy should be. The salad was decent, and the dressing was passable if a bit too acidic.  At least warm up the rolls, guys.

If you're the only game in town,  it can explain the mediocrity, but if another place decides to open that offers better atmosphere and food, they're in trouble.

I should've read the reviews before I called. Ordered by phone - I was told to pick it up 15 mins later. 20 mins later, it still wasn't ready. Floors were nasty. The crazy thing was, when I got the pizza, supposedly "fresh from the oven," it wasn't hot? She apologized for the wait, then offered me some of their nasty Caesar sauce for the wait... no thanks.

Beautiful space and I love the thought of brunch here. Today, I was reminded why this isn't a go-to spot for us. Service was slow and food was mediocre. We arrived on time for our reservation and ordered a cocktail immediately upon being seated. Then we waited. Twenty five minutes before receiving our first drink. Food took awhile as well (not as long as the drinks), and it was room temp when it arrived. New Orleans has too many good restaurants to settle for slow service and mediocre (expensive) food. Taking this one off our list.

I understand the menu says pepperoncinis on the pepperoni pizza, but didn't realize how many! We were unable to finish our pizza because of this. Would try a cheese with adding just pepperoni possibly.

I have been to District 611 twice now, and I have to say, I'm a fan.  

During my first visit, my table of 3 shared the hummus.  Just the right balance of flavor, and served with warm, soft flatbread (pizza crust?), I could easily order it every time I go.  For my main course, I ordered the scallops.  They were large and cooked just perfectly, served atop a heap of creamy butternut squash risotto.  Yum!  Also at my table was the chicken caesar salad (the pretzel croutons were a hit) and the pizza marinara, which my dairy-free pal enjoys every time she eats here.

Tonight, while trying to come up with a place for dinner with the fam that was mostly convenient for my husband and me, and only somewhat convenient for the rest of the people joining our party, I suggested District 611.

Our party of 5+highchair was seated at one of the large booths, but it was a little tight for three adults to squeeze in on one side.  No problem- they added a small 2-top to the end of our table.  Problem solved.

This time, in addition to the hummus (told you), I ordered the warm ricotta with honey and herbs de provence.  It was served with the same delicious flatbread, which had a little extra salt to compensate for the sweetness of the honey.  Oh, and the honey was BRULEED!!  My husband likes to tease me because of my tendency to order anything off a menu that has the words "ricotta" or "honey" in the description.  Well who's laughing now, suckaaa?  This appetizer was SO GOOD.  My entree this time was the papperdelle in pomodoro with grilled chicken.  All was cooked perfectly, and my side of apple cider brussels sprouts complemented it well.  There were three burgers ordered at my table, and everyone was happy with those.  My husband ordered his with the house made chips- thin, crispy, salty- perfect.  The crab cakes were also a hit.

Overall, I've enjoyed the food and service at this small town BYO.  I look forward to returning to try the pizza, too!

I came here with my Girlfriend to grab a bite to eat before the WMMR 50th Birthday Bash Bon Jovi Concert. 

They won the drawl of whichever establishment could seat us first. For the night of a concert, every venue seemed understaffed because every venue had open seats yet at least a half hour wait. This was annoying but it was what it was. 

My Girlfriend and I both used our half price appetizers ticket coupon and walked in with a beer and cider from the center bars at Xfinity Live. My Girlfriend ordered loaded fries she enjoyed and I ordered the nachos. I was not impressed with the nachos. The chips tasted stale and there wasn't much to the nachos. Also when I was finished they left my stomach a little uneasy for about 15 minutes, and I'm a slow eater. The other disappointment was their very limited draft list. We could not get what we ordered from the inside bars. My Girlfriend having celiac disease meant she could only get a cider and they didn't have it, as they did at the inside bars. Due to this we did not order a round of drinks from them. 

Our server was outstanding. She checked in regularly and was very pleasant. If it wasn't for her, I'd probably leave three stars instead of four. I'd say she was the best server I've ever had at Xfinity. She restored my faith in Xfinity Live a bit.
Wonderful lunch agaves enchiladas salsa bar and a glass of delicious white wine.  This is my second trip to this restaurant and they are sooo good.

This restaurant earned a solid 4 stars. The service was friendly and helpful, the decor is lovely and relaxing, and the food is very very good although the appetizers needed to wow me a little more to earn five stars. Also, I visited this restaurant with some folks with dietary restrictions and the restaurant was not willing to substitute anything to accommodate them. I ordered the griddle cakes which were only ok (a bit dry) and corn salad which was fresh and wonderful. I shared the grouper and the pork dish for dessert both of which were very good, but the snapper could have had a touch more flavor. I wish I had stayed to try the caramel cake for dessert but we were just too full. I also visited the Husk location in Charleston last year and thought that the two locations are very consistent with each other.

Great seafood, in an unassuming location, just down the way from the Crabby Bill's crowd. The grouper sandwich was one of the largest and best tasting I've ever had. Both the She Crab Soup and the Amberjack fish spread are standout dishes.
Really cool history and great southern cooking.  Feels like comfortable fit for just a casual sit down meal.  Waiter was great and helped with everything... several other things to try next time !

I took a grandson for a 25th birthday dinner.  I had made a reservation for 6:30 on a weeknight and we were seated at once. We both had iced tea - no Manhattan or Martini for me that evening - and so were soon ready to order. Grandson had the Steak & Fries and I had a special Fried Shrimp. Those little shrimp, and there were a lot of 'em, were delicious as were the fries and the slaw. Grandson seemed to enjoy his as well.

He had a Carrot Cake for dessert. It came with a candle, but was not free. I ate quite a bit of it and it was good. When we arrived the place was not at all crowded, but it soon filled up. Our waitress was good, but I had the feeling we were being rushed. I guess that a no-booze table needs to be turned quickly!

It a nice place with good atmosphere, but I continue to prefer the J. Alexander Redlands on West End.

Great beer- never ending IPA- delicious! 
Great Burger with sweet potato fries and most importantly- great service by Leo our fabulous waiter! Also got to watch some 
hockey.

Came here for the first time with my husband.  The wait was extremely long on a Sunday afternoon, luckily it was s nice day outside. Very corky and alternative-ish place. Finally got a table for 2 after a 40 minutes wait. I ordered the Fish Soft Tacos with coleslaw and chipotle mayo, served with pico de gallo and lime. That taco was amazing!! The veggies was so fresh and the fish was NOT fishy at all. I would've order another one but the wait for the dish was too long. I would definitely come here again, if I had all the time in the world.

Plenty of people at work rave about Fresh Kitchen, so I've given it several tries. My problem with the place is its lack of consistency. I've ordered the same items three times now, but while the first time was fantastic, my second two meals left a lot to be desired.

My coworker picked up my meal for me the first time I tried this place. I ordered the sweet potato noodles, the cauliflower mash, the chick peas, and the almond chicken. However, she called me and told me they were out of chick peas, and said I had to choose quickly because there was a line behind her. So I hurriedly said the sweet potatoes, knowing full well I already had the noodles and the mash there -- but I was under pressure. Well it turns out I didn't like the noodles at all, but the sweet potatoes were the best thing I had from that bowl. All in all I was fairly impressed: the mash had a good consistency that didn't scream cauliflower, the chicken was good, and the sweet potatoes were honestly fantastic. I told my coworker we could totally order from here again.

However, I drove to Fresh Kitchen the next time and ordered pretty much the same foods, this time getting the chick peas instead of the noodles. But the sweet potatoes were underdone, the mash had HUGE chunks of cauliflower in it and was much more bland than before, and the chicken tasted like it had been sitting out for hours. My third visit ended up being much like the second.

I'm going to give it another shot and hope for the quality I got from the first meal I had here -- but I know it'll be a gamble.

This is by far the best bbq joint outside of downtown Nashville. It's customer friendly, family oriented, and it's soaked in southern hospitality. The ribs are delicious as you can still taste the smoked wood chips and it's homemade bbq sauce fighting on your tongue. The pulled pork is cooked moist with flavored. And the Mac and cheese should be called creamy and cheesy...to die for. RECOMMEND!!

Craft cocktails in copper cups?  Need to know more?  

Great location in St. Phillips Plaza on the River/Campbell corner.  This is a very stylish restaurant with food and drink that match the great looks of the place.  

Enter into a circular bar with a wide array of beers on tap, solid wine list and as many modern or traditional cocktails as you can dream up.  Whiskey fan?  Stop by Wednesday nights to try things you have never even heard of... Of course, the Moscow Mule is a signature drink and is not to be missed.

The food is very good.  I am partial to the spinach salad with grilled chicken.  The greens are fresh, the pecans add a great spicy crunch.  But the best part is the goat cheese fritter. Come on, fried cheese!  That never misses.

The flatbread pizzas and burger are also solid options.  As is anything on the menu or special that has a Greek or Mediterranean flair. 

This is a great place for lunch, dinner or drinks.  Sunday brunch, after exploring the Farmer's Market, is also a solid choice.   The outdoor patio is a great place to relax and enjoy a meal.

It is also very family friendly and good for kids.  There is a (very reasonable) kid's menu.

Our family stumbled across this place while driving up 101 to the Bay Area.  What a find.

Calzone - great, 
Turkey sandwich on 9-grain with salad-great, 
Kids food: soup + noodles w/cheese and butter - great.

We enjoyed our delicious lunch outside on a lovely Santa Barbara day.  Will definitely stop at Fresco again when we are passing through.

Extreme mediocrity is what you come to expect from these chain, mass produced pizza places. What they call a "large" pizza is nothing more than a medium at any NON-chain Pizza place. Order on-line if you want the cheaper deals. If you're looking for a quick cheap pizza, this is your place, if you're looking for GOOD Pizza go somewhere else.

The hostess was absolutely a bitch. We waited 1.5 hours for a table for 10. Two people ran to the room and we were finally called. She almost kicked us out because we weren't all here, even though the ones who weren't were only next door.

Come here for a gross eating experience. Owner spends his time flirting with bar staff and on his phone while awkwardly circling the restaurant and making incredibly awkward conversation. DO NOT TOUCH YOUR UNWASHED IPHONE AND THEN GO TOUCH MY FOOD AND HAND IT TO ME. Will never be back. Looking forward to who will replace this awful restaurant.

First off, I try to avoid places like Waffle House because I have become a huge food snob. However, if fellow food snobs are hard up for a decent  breakfast off the highway on the way out of town, I highly recommend this particular WH. As others have posted, the staff here are top notch, and represent Nashville well. When's the last time you saw teenage boys at a grill, cooking their hearts out? They got 'em here, while the more mature staff tend to the satisfied customers. Food is straight ahead, no molecular gastronomy techniques being tried- but good.  This particular WH restored my faith in highway dining.

I have ordered from her for delivery and / or pick up many times as well as eaten in.
Last night I had a philly cheese steak and Onion rings.
First of all. Speedy delivery.
Next, cheesesteak on point, delicious and packed full.
Finally and most important.
The Onion rings were amazing.
Not the usual disgusting,breaded
 o rings.
These things looked and tasted like tempura dipped and fried o rings.
Crispy and stayed that way for a long time.
Tasty.
Fresh tasting and break off as I ate them instead of the entire onion pulling out of the breading.
I was shocked and pleased by this discovery.
Bravo Paris.
You are the best in Branmar area for sure.

We were there for lunch on a Friday. The food was good and we had attentive, gracious staff of Courtney and Josh. We ordered the Cornbread w Poirier's Cane Syrup for table appetizer. It was delicious. The entree's ordered were the Griddled Meatloaf with Tomato Jam on an onion roll, the BLTA sandwich and the Pork Sandwich. Large portion size sandwiched so we only ordered 3 and shared. All very good. We ordered the Peanut Butter Warm Bananna Pudding for dessert and shared. We all thought it would have been better without the Peanut Butter. Very pleasant afternoon and meal.

3.5 stars.  Cool place to go for a beer.  Love their microbrewery selection.  I didn't get a chance to try out more of their food.

We had a pretty big group and the service was pretty good to accommodate especially for a Friday night.  I wouldn't mind coming back.

Got the Big Brother Tray with two sides included.  Ribs were good. Brisket was great. The sides are small and the pinto beans are even smaller. Oddly, they didn't fill up the 6 oz. container.  Probably had 4 ounces. Must be a bean shortage in Tennessee.  Comes with a few slices if bread. Enough for 2-3 meals. Order by phone and skip the line! Crazy busy on weekend evenings after 5.

today my family and i went to the new cracker barrel in ridley for the first time. we had about a 30 minute wait, which was to be expected but it was well worth it. our waiters name was Mike and he was wonderful. he made the experience so easy with his knowledge and personality. he helped us navigate the menu and was very attentive! the breakfast food was very good. my favorite side i ordered was the hash brown casserole.. delicious!! overall the experience was great and i will definitely be returning to try some more menu options!

Buffa's is a diamond in the rough. In an area filled with gimmicky tourist traps, Buffa's is a breath of fresh air.  Perfect spot for a nightcap drink. Cozy, charming, and 24 hr food, what more could you want? The bartender (Mia) was such a sweetheart too! Haven't tried the food but everything else was 10/10.
One if the best steakhouses in the area.  Had the fried lobster appetizer and was very impressed. Took my best friend there for her birthday and they spoiled her. She was so happy.
Great bartenders, great beer, long bar with plenty of seats, fun for all your friends and drunks alike. Divebar so its not fancy, but effective.

We used Dom's Food Truck for our company employee appreciation lunch and it was perfect! It was a pretty large menu and the wait time was no more than 2 minutes to serve the food which was pretty impressive since it was a lot of employees ordering. It was our best luncheon yet and I'd highly recommend anyone to use the food truck!! Thanks Dominic's!!!

The food was good. The price was fair. The "scenery " was excellent!  Not suitable for youth ages 7-16 due to scantily clad wait staff. But servers were nice and I was pleasantly surprised. We will return.
Just had carry out for lunch. The chicken chimi with rice was very good. I live just 5 minutes away, order was ready when I arrived. Will definitely get again.

Ron's prides themselves in making everything on the menu from scratch, and the menu choices are ample with something for everyone. I've been to Ron's about a dozen times over the past few years, and each time I've gotten a good meal. Today was no exception from previous dining experiences, with a very good cheesesteak. My wife's cheeseburger hoagie was equally good, and the kids really enjoyed their chicken fingers. The cheese fries are served with real cheese whiz (what more could you ask for)! Not a huge fan of the crinkle cut variety as served here, but even so they tasted good. I've also had their pizza and strombolis in the past which I'm a big fan of, and their ovals are awesome as well. They have a very nice selection of rotating craft beers on draft, and it seems that they have drink specials at the bar every night of the week. The prices are fair, even for the well portioned dinner entrees. The decor is pleasing, and the service is pleasant. 

In summary: If you're looking for a casual place to get a good meal at a good price, you can't go wrong with Ron's.

This place is a game changer for the pizza and wings scene. My husband and I always end up at Ale Emporium (which we still love) but we decided to switch it up the other night and give this place a shot. It was a Friday night and we found a table right away. We ordered the honey bbq, sweet Asian, and hot garlic bone in wings and the club pizza. The wings were saucy, meaty, crispy, and the pizza was thin, crispy, and delicious. I think we found our new Friday night favorite spot. The waiter was on his own for the night and still did a great job!

We did an online order 2 times using their app in Feb and Mar 2021. We ordered a  8.99 2 can dine plus tax and then 6.00 3 tenders combo plus tax.
We received the order and the food was fine on both occasions however, the picture that they display shows all this food for 8.99 and 6.00.  They've got it all laid out in the picture like it might feed 2 people. We counted 17 short french fries in a mini mini-bag that is barely 2 inches wide and 16- gram tenders.... certainly does not compare well with the picture they have online.  Is this food for a 2 year old or for an adult ??  Real bad rip off. Won't go back.

We were so pleasantly surprised by this restaurant.  Very friendly staff.  Crowd was seniors, but we ate early.  I had the Friday all you can eat cod special, which was the best I have ever eaten.
