Great light and crispy batter.  The coleslaw was homemade and excellent, and i am not a huge coleslaw fan.  My husband got the meatloaf which was above par, though the gravy was average (bland). Mashed potatoes were real.   Ice tea was fresh and refilled often.  Clam chowder was homemade and amazing.  Reasonable prices.  Would like to go back and check out breakfast, but we w were just passing through town (stopped based on reviews).  A definite winner.

Wanted to take the family somewhere special and I'm so glad we went to Lenny's. We arrived at 9am on a Sunday and were told it would be a 20 minute wait. Five minutes later, they called our name! We were quickly seated and greeted by our server, Krison (sp?). She was extremely patient (we were dining with a 3 and 4 year old) and very attentive. She helped me order food for my husband and sons and even offered suggestions. We all ate so well. My boys had pancakes and bacon, hubby had the corned beef hash and I had the Reuben. And YES, we had the basket of danishes and they were so good! Tons of delicious hot food was served quickly and extremely reasonable at $40! 
The icing on the cake was Mark the ballon guy who made each of the boys a balloon hat which has kept them occupied for hours! 
Highly recommend trying Lennys if you are in the area.

We stopped here in Newark to rest after a day of driving through a wild New England snow storm, and ordered take-out from Michael's.  Maybe I was crazy hungry but they brought me the best burger I've had in quite a while, topped of with their sweet potato fries, and also got to sample a free pizza out of their brick fired oven.  
Way to go Michael's!

First time visiting this Cajun eatery and we weren't disappointed.

We split an incredible dish, the Drunken Angel with Burgundy angel hair pasta, shrimp, crawfish, lobster broth, saffron red pepper cream sauce, fresh parmesan.

It was sooooooo good.  We'll be back.

Brought my mom and grandmother for breakfast here for the first time. What I loved most was the service.  It's been a very long time that I've gone to a breakfast restaurant and received good service.  The food was delicious. I absolutely love their drinks menu.  Stop going to Denny's and iHop if you want to be treated well and enjoy a great breakfast.

Our first visit was on a busy Friday evening only two weeks after their initial "soft" opening and, although  was anticipating "new restaurant" hiccups, they exceeded our expectations.  We were seated immediately at our reserved time in their tastefully decorated dining room, away from the noise of the bar room (to be expected in a bar seating area with adjacent open kitchen area).  It was a full house, yet our server was attentive and knowledgeable in the specials of the day.  We started with craft cocktail selections which were terrific, and followed up with the house Pinot Noir for dinner which was also tasty at a good price point.  We ordered the shrimp and beet salad appetizer to split which was included jumbo shrimp over a delicious beet and greens salad.  My spouse ordered the Paella which was divine (just the right amount of saffron) and I ordered a 6 ounce filet, a perfect medium-rare with the Bearnaise sauce, true to recipe, and a side of broccoli rabe, tender and not over-cooked.  Our only regret was not saving room for dessert, which sounded wonderful in description.  We will return.  This is a terrific addition to the Medford restaurant scene, and with more personal touches in the menu than nearby Fleming's.  Be advised, if you are expecting an Outback menu, this is an a la cart menu, and higher price point, but your tastebuds will thank you for the dining experience :)

I support local businesses and appreciate good local restaurants (I do not eat at chain restaurants); therefore I am delighted with the first-rate restaurant the Tarpon Diner. Their menu has the typical breakfast and lunch selections, but deliciously served in gratifying sizes and portions, with yummy twists on the standard favorites - try the Eggs Benedict of the day, or Coque Madam or Creme Brulee French Toast, or a Special of the Day. An additional reason I gave the Tarpon Diner a five-star rating was the friendly and efficient staff. I felt at home the first time I ate there. 

I ordered breakfast - the "Small" Breakfast Combo: scrambled eggs of a perfect, fluffy large portion, a large portion of hash browns with a wonderful, browned and crisp top, one lovely thick-cut delicious bacon slice - crisp as I ordered, locally-baked homemade brown-wheat toast. I admit to polishing off the eggs (must have been a four-egg helping), the bacon, some hash browns (okay, half of them), and one slice of the homemade toast - who can resist homemade bread.

The Tarpon Diner's downtown location is convenient. We usually find a parking spot close by on Pinellas Ave. There is also a municipal parking lot north of the Tarpon Diner on the east side of Pinellas Ave.

This was a great stop for breakfast on my road trip through Nashville. It's located in a really cool co-working space. It feels modern, but homey. The food was ready really quickly. I got breakfast tacos and they were good.  My friend got avocado toast and really enjoyed it. I would recommend for a quick bite!
Best seafood in nashville, the food is aleays hot and the staff is friendly. The location is always neat and clean. If your looking for good seafood for a good price this is your spot.

We had my daughter in law's baby shower here. Brittney was wonderful to work with on everything. She was so accommodating and helpful. The food was very good. My friends really enjoyed the salmon and my chicken salad was good with very tender chicken. Highly recommend this place , especially for private parties.
Burger and fries were  delightful. Best I've had in a long time. Young lady at the counter was very polite and friendly. I will return.

Read the reviews and heed the warnings. I didn't think it could be quite as bad as all of the previous reviews indicated but I was WRONG. ZERO customer service. Actually zero because no one ever came to our table. We waited for 15 minutes and no one even made eye contact or said a passing "Hey, I'll be right with you." 100% unacceptable. I've been a waitress for many years and that's grounds for dismissal of employment.
We went there for brunch last week.  The service was super attentive.  The sausage and bacon were to die for.  The environment is funky and fun.  I am sure we'll be back.

What a great find! This place is amazing. I got the Chicago dog and my boyfriend got the buffalo chicken sandwich soooo good. We added stuff to our order too and they had no problem with that, they make it about you and what you want. Also, go upstairs if you love Star Wars, you will not be disappointed!!! David and Zac were amazingggggg at the bar! I'll definitely be coming back!
A must if you're looking for an affordable bar in Philly! Always have had awesome service and the best drinks. You can't beat $5 shots! Definitely worth the visit. You won't be disappointed!

We met with friends and planned for bite out dinner. and one of them recommended this restaurant. Very good place for outdoor dining. Roomy, comfortable, and great service. It was a great green place that I just fall in love at the moment we entered. I couldn't imagen to have heavenly delicious food in ambiance like heaven, totally out of my expectations.
So we ate and enjoyed some truly exceptional food. We are absolutely satisfied with the service and food. Their staff was also very professional and friendly. The place was very clean and organized. It was a remarkable experience!

Highly recommend this spot it really worth a visit, you will become a regular once you experience your first visit here.

MORE UNEVEN THAN THE ST CHARLES SIDEWALK
This is one of those places where an extensive ProTip Sheet is mandatory. The breakfast is really good, the lunch is just okay to abysmal. The service is 90% outstanding, and at least one server is horrid.

BEWARE! DON'T ORDER THE CHICKEN FRIED STEAK!
It's worse than institutional. It's Psych Ward institutional. That's where they send the really bad crap because the inmates are too bat sh#t crazy to notice. It's disgusting. In fact my friend who's a Betsy's fanatic was so grossed out he wants to join Yelp just to write a 1 star review!

BEWARE OF THE YOUNG CHICK THAT WAITS IN FRONT!
Either sit at he bar or ask for "the cat woman". Seriously that girl left us for 10-15 minutes before fetching water. Worse she has an incredibly annoying screeching sing song delivery. At one point we had no idea where she was. Come to find out she's in the back leisurely gorging on lunch with her buddies.

PRO TIPS: 
- Breakfast is really good if you stick to the basics like the Belgian waffle, pigs in blankets, and omelettes.
- If you're there at lunch, only order what other dedicated patrons are getting.

Perfection. 

We held our wedding banquet here on Saturday (August 23) and it exceeded our high expectations in every way possible. 

Our meetings with the owner/chef David and manager Apple were attentive, thorough, creative, and effortless. They designed (and revised) the menu until we had what we believed was the right combination of hors d'oevres, wines, and main course. 

The decor is wonderful. The Inn dates back to less than 40 years after the founding of our country. The surveyors Mason and Dixon dined in the very room where our reception was held. 

The menu received raves from every guest: oysters, charcuterie, cheese puffs, crispy chicken, filet mignon, scallops, au gratin potatoes, quinoa and fresh peas, pear salad, white gazpacho. 

The service was impeccable: discreet, attentive, prompt, cordial, efficient, anticipating our every need before we even knew we needed it! One had to barely glance at a wine glass before the staff was there. 

We regularly enjoy both the Inn and the 4 Dogs. They went above and beyond and made an already perfect day even more so (if possible.)

Thank you!!

We got a gift card to the Cheesecake Factory then the fun stoped it took45 minuets to get are food the staff  including the manager blamed everything else like; 11oz hamburger takes longer to cook and it's the cooks fault or there was a big party. Next time just apologize and make it right. Please Americans eat at local places chain food is bad.

The Good: 
Those rolls - not sure what they do to their rolls, but I could seriously eat an entire basket, and smother each roll with a whole container of the sweet butter they provide.
The service - fast and friendly

The Bad:
The wait - always, always a wait. 
Seasoned rice - more like sodium rice. It's like it was boiled in soy sauce.
Green Beans - they seem like they are canned. You want good green beans to go with your with meat plate? Go to Brushfire.
Prime rib - 10 oz prime rib had 2 oz of pure inedible fat

The Ugly:
Death - if you have a severe peanut allergy that is! (just a fair warning)

I'll still go here. They have those damn rolls.

Some things on the menu are fantastic and one of the best you can get. Others are so so. Stick with fried and tried in this restaurant. The fried chicken is the best I have ever had, hands down.  Other more mid-western items are just ok. Stick with "southern food" in this place and you can't go wrong.

The servers know when to talk and when to leave you alone. Dont ask for whipped cream on your mocha because it will ruin the artisan designs on the top of the drink. Just the right amount of hipster:uncool ratio.

My co-workers and I used to come here pretty often for lunch. The staff seems to have recently turned over, and things aren't quite the same. I was there for lunch on Saturday, and the place was a mess... Just dirty.  We were there for 30 minutes and the table next to us sat there with dirty dishes on it the whole time. Staff walked by time and time again and never bussed this 6-top table... And that wasn't the only one that needed to be cleared.  The old staff used to bus the tables right away. 

The food quality is still ok, although the portion size of the wraps seems to have declined. 

We'll give the place one more shot, but if it's the same as it was on Saturday it won't be worth another visit. Shame... Used to be a good place.

Best food ever !! I wish we had one of this restaurants in our town.. service was good , I had the crunchy French toast, eggs and fruit , and mi friend had enchiladas they were delicious as well, the waiting time was about 40 minutes because the place was packed, but it was worth waiting .

Yum -when you come a little late and you are a very nice a well liked customer and you tell the new server you will make their evening for them then things happen like order a dessert and a huge double size cheese cake comes YES! Other than that the ribs and I had the berry cocktail tonight (a light summer drink) with the famous sweet potato fries. I haven't had a poor meal here yet. We always bring home half the meal and nosh for another day or two. Always a personable staff if you make the time to discuss the beer or food with them.

Love the food. The waitresses are the worst, especially the red head. If she comes to serve you either move to another spot or go to obradys! Went there on Superbowl. Had signs all over saying drink n food specials. So we asked about them and were told they didn't have any? Huh!

After leaving another restaurant because we had bad service, one of the locals recommended we come here. We walked in and we were not greeted at all. We told a hostess we had a party of 6 and she grabbed menus. Another group  walked up and she proceeded to help them before seating us even though we were there and waiting already. We sat down and ordered food and drinks. I had the baked spaghetti and meatballs. The sauce was bland. I took a few bites and left it alone. A couple of people liked their meals enough to eat. The two sprites we ordered were more like carbonated water because the syrup ran out. The server did fix this though. My daughter ordered a hamburger and the server of course asked about cheese, which she did not want. But of course her burger came out with cheese. We sent this back and she ended up barely eating the burger once they brought it back out because she had to wait an extra 20 min for it while everyone else ate. The server just was not very attentive. I'm all about customer service so if it had been better I would've ignored the mistakes made and not bothered saying anything.

I love me some good BBQ and this place did not disappoint. The location has plenty of indoor and outdoor seating for whichever u desire. When u walk in you are greeted and given a sample rib to try "yes please" after that is kind of weird as the lay out is kind of strange and we stood there for about 10 mins waiting to place our order. Not sure what the issue was. Once someone was there to take out order it's pretty easy everything is ordered by the lb so just go for it. I got the brisket, tri too and ribs along with there smashed potatoes and a drink and it was a little over 30 bucks which isn't bad for 2 people and good BBQ. They bring everything on a huge platter covered in wax paper which is odd but works. They have a  good assortment of sauces for u to try. I went from everything from normal all the way to hot and wasn't disappointed. The food came out super fast and every bit was delightful. This is probably one of the best BBQ places around and will be going back for sure.

We live pretty close to O' Connor's but had not tried it since it became O'Connor's probably because we were not fond of the previous place.  In the last year we have been there quite a few times and have never been disappointed in either the food or the service.   Everyone is super friendly and attentive.  The food is good no matter you pick.  They have wonderful potatoes that are their version of french fries.  Prices are reasonable and the variety of beer on tap is great.   We were there recently when they had a "6 months to St Patrick's Day" celebration and I thought it as quite clever of them to do an event like that.  Full Irish buffet and discounted Irish beer plus live Irish music.   Fun all around.  Don't hesitate as it is worth it!    Bathrooms are nice and clean as well.

I love this place. Love the beer, love the food, have always gotten good service (for the short time they've been open). The family that owns the place is very involved in the community and are nice people who take a huge amount of pride in their restaurants and beers. 

The soups I've had are great, love the burgers, pizzas, and calzones, and my favorite is that beer cheese dip that you can get to dip your pretzels in. I'm a soft pretzel fiend. I'm also partial to the peel-and-eat shrimp and the mussels. They really do have "something for everyone" here. Really nice patio area with an outdoor bar and firepits too. 

Fun fact: they have a really fancy RO water system to ensure that their beer isn't affected by impurities in the water. The water that isn't good enough to be drank or used for beer is used to flush the toilets. :)

Can't really complain! Love the food, nice atmosphere, and they usually have some good music

Nothing amazing, but great for a change of pace or to just chill out with your friends
Was told about this burger joint while in New Orleans. Nothing to be excited about. Disappointed in the price versus the size of the burger.

Our dinner at Sylvain was amazing! The courtyard is gorgeous and tucked away, which felt like a welcome respite from the busy area. 

Our server was sweet, knowledgeable and so kind, she made excellent suggestions and pairings. 

Finally, the food was on point. We tried all the fish specials and they were out of this world. A bright, yet still subtle crudo starter and a red snapper main course did not disappoint and the same was true of the menu standard, the beef cheeks. Go. Here. Now. Yum.

Came for lunch during the Covid pandemic. Seating was outside and well spaced. We had the watermelon Bruschetta was very good. We also had the hush puppies and I guess they were fine but I'm not fans of hush puppies. The only negative was a young server and she must have been in drama class or something because of the animated voice she kept using!

Skip it.

Looks fancy now, but the food was below average.  Went in with a large group from work and they had one of those weird buffet/menu set-ups, which is always a red flag.  This is always a hallmark of new restauranteurs...trying to do too much too fast.  It was clear the kitchen was overwhelmed, and there weren't that many people dining.  We were a large party, and me and two other colleagues got our food 40 minutes after everyone else.  I ordered a prime rib sandwich, and it came out looking EXACTLY like the cheesesteak my colleague got (which she never ordered).  Tasted like a Wawa cheesesteak.  The most annoying part was the waiter literally said "Sorry, the kitchen is having problems and I really can't do much about that."  Way to own it, buddy.  I hope they can turn it around, but I would skip it until they do.
The food was ok, but all of it was lukewarm or cold. One in our party talked to our server about the temperature and she spoke to the manager. We were charged full price for cold dinners.

My fave place on St. Charles! Close to my house so I can walk home or Uber after a great dining experience there. Love the staff there. I've taken all friends & family there when they come to visit. Love it!

This is a place with the welcoming and friendly (pun intended) atmosphere. Never been there before and we were treated like family. The food had soul and heart and regulars rightly warned me that "if you leave here hungry then you didn't eat at all."  I will definitely have to stop by next time I'm in St.Louis.

Whatever you do - Get the Saucy Shrimp and Bang Bang Shrimp.
I can not emphasize how amazingly tasty the Saucy shrimp is.  Seriously - get it.
And oh - did I forget to mention that you get the most delicious free bread ever?!  Because they do!  I don't even like bread but I can't seem to get enough of this one for some reason.

This place is heavenly! Every . Single . Bite. Is delicious!! Great for date night or just any night. Service was excellent and oh did I mention the food was AMAZING! It's taking everything in my power to not order everything I just had AGAIN. Ambiance 5stars ,food 5 stars  and service 5 stars !! Go now!

My family has gone here for decades. This place has it all, good atmosphere, good people, great food. Get the fried chicken family style, they lay out all the fixins for you. Mashed potatoes, corn, green beans, beats, cottage cheese, chicken gravy and the best fried chicken in the world. Once you're done with that, you get a cute little sundae you dress with sauce yourself. Then you take home a doggie bag of chicken, and eat it happily for the next two days (because you won't be able to make it stretch longer)

Interesting decor (think mardi gras beads and tibetan prayer flags) in a warm, inviting restaurant. Went here for a birthday dinner and the service and food was impeccable. 

Will definitely go back again!

HUGE portions and huge menu. Came on a Saturday morning and got seated quickly. Waitress was super friendly and food came out quickly. Had the Greek omelette which was huge and delicious. Will be back!

A truly unique and memorable dining experience from start to finish. I dined here with a group of coworkers while in town for business. We shared small plates if appetizers to start: Brussel sprouts, corn bread and mussels in coconut milk (definitely try)! I ordered the Catch of the Day, which was a red fish but everyone's dish was equally as fresh, uniquely prepared and delicious. No one left disappointed. We finished the meal with the cookie skillet and bread pudding and the bread pudding was the table favorite. Ask your server about the cool history behind the building and the photos hanging in the restaurant. One of my favorite dining experiences on the road!

I got to experience another meal at the Abbey earlier this week and it was as wonderful as ever.  This is quickly becoming my favorite restaurant in Tucson.  My friend and I enjoyed the hushpuppies (a must get), the grilled cheese (more sandwiches should utilize the wonderful cheese that is brie), and the chef's salad.  The salad was Asian-inspired, with soba noodles, bell peppers, and lettuce doused in a peanut sauce.  Everything was delicious, the service was great, and the glass of wine we drank complimented the meal.  
My one complaint was that the grilled cheese came with a side of mixed greens, which was not listed on the menu, or stated by our server when we said we were going to share the salad and sandwich.  It would have been nice to have the option/knowledge to substitute a less redundant side.
Amazing although on weekends have an extended wait! But breakfast is worth the wait the French toast with million dollar bacon! The best! So great and fresh all the time.

A delicious spot on a beautiful street. Had the Chicken Fettuccini Alfredo and the Sunday special of Chicken Marsala. Both were a perfect portion and delicious. The menu is a little overwhelming so make sure to bring the reading glasses if you need them. Definitely worth stopping by for any meal of the day while strolling around downtown SB.

Bland, unimaginative food, slow service, and the restaurant lacks the resources to keep the bathrooms clean and working.  At first glance, it looks like a nice restaurant with a clean, modern inside area and an open outside eating area.  

It was freshman move-in night and we went for dinner.  Whether you give the restaurant a pass for it being freshman move-in day, that's your decision, but it's an annual event and you would think that every restaurant and business would be prepared and excited about the annual wave of customers.

Everything started fine and our party of 6 was seated within 5 minutes.  We placed our orders within 15 minutes and then the waiting began.  The waiter kept coming back and apologizing for it being slow and setting our expectations that the kitchen was way behind schedule because of lack of workers.  One hour later, we got finally got an order of onion rings and sweet potato fries delivered.  Then we had to ask the waiter to give us place settings - and he gave us napkins and forks.  Later we would have to ask him to give us knives.  The fried foods were greasy and nothing special.  The greasiness tells you that the food was probably frozen or reheated by tossing back into the fryer.

Now the waiting begins again for our entrees to arrive.  Some of the people at our table ordered salads.  The salads looked good, but there was barely any dressing and the salad dressings were bland and flavorless.  When our entrees arrived, there was nothing notable either positively or negatively about the entrees - I would call them uninspiring.  We had flat bread pizzas, mac and cheese, and a cheesesteak at our table.

Towards the end of the meal I visited the rest rooms.  The rest room was trashed!  There was paper all over the floor.  There was no soap to wash your hands.  The paper towel dispenser was empty and the air hand dryers were not working.  The restaurant obviously knew about the situation because someone had taken the time to put a small pile of the small bar/cocktail napkins by the sink to dry your hands.  I wonder, is that a health code violation to not have soap for kitchen workers to wash their hands before returning to work.

We skipped dessert because it was already past 2 hours for a simple meal and didn't want to wait any longer.  There was another table of 8 near us and they threatened to walk out after waiting so long, but their waiter convinced them to stay longer.  They were still waiting for their food when we left.  So do yourself a favor - go somewhere else.

Had a burger, fries and some "craft" cola.

Burger was a beautiful, messy burger.  Grass fed, but juicy...enough to use ALOT of the drink napkins...I sat at the bar for lunch.

Skinny fries like steak n shake but better.  Fry sauce on burger and side was outstanding.  Even craft cola was good.  Nice rehab space too.

Go here.

Solid breakfast place. I had the #13 which had eggs, breakfast potatoes, meat and a spinach and Swiss crepe. I ordered the fresh squeezed OJ which didn't taste like fresh squeezed to me. The food was well cooked and arraigned at our table hot.

I visited Talula's with a group from work.   The food was so tasty, so flavorful - wow!  
This restaurant is by far my all-around favorite dining establishment!

Very clean in there and the waitress I had was incredibly nice. Her name was Nikki she's so nice!! My friends and I were very complicated and had to do 3 seperate checks and she didn't mind or have an attitude. We made sure we left her a nice tip. The bathroom was pretty clean. And tgi Fridays is just a nice place to be with friends in general!

The owner can't decide on who is working or has to work because he forgot to tell someone. New owner to the industry seems lost. Only is fond of neighborhood friends who just stop by. Kitchen is open closed.....who knows when you walk in. Bartenders during the week hope for a crowd but only know how to beertend. Fridays are only good with who is working but a fresh paint job and 5 food menu....,fail. So many within a half mile are better.

SO far all I have had there was the custard! It's really good sweet creamy and delicious!  It's a great treat to have one these HOT days!  I treated a friend to one since she was having a bad day, and it made her smile!

Older lady behind desk did not care to greet us , did not even hear one word from her just stared us down while we looked at the menu. we just walked away. not sure how the food is but service sucks pretty sure the food would have also.

Ended up here for our regular monthly meet up only because the country club on cottman  was super busy .
Waitress was chatty and forgot an item but average food and less wait time than country club.
Standard menu , plus its dark inside but could see us going back again , but not as a first choice.
Super clean ladies room.
If I was on death row, I'd ask for two Joyland Impossible burgers, waffle fries, and a Mexican coke. Hands down best burgers in TN!

This place has amazing food! I had the chipotle chilaquiles dish and a drink. The mood of Sinema is cool and calm. I'd definitely come back here again for the food and drinks. I wasn't a fan of a valet fee, but it doesn't have anything to do with the ambiance of the restaurant.

Had a very Happy New Year's Eve dinner with friends.We were all very happy with our dinners.Filets &Prime Rib all cooked perfectly. The atmosphere was was also perfect....piano player in front bar was great...not too loud. We sat outside for a while with another group..always find the nicest people on the patio! Our server Kim was on the ball..great server and barmaid too!
Will definitely go back...

Not too many places in Philly that give you complimentary sticky buns with your brunch! It was an adventure finding this place but well worth it. Got the duck confit hash and the duck was cooked perfectly. Disclaimer: the biscuits could feed a family of 4. Proceed with caution. 

Their drink menu is huge and pricey but the bar is cozy. Perfect to drink beers on New Years Day and lament with the staff about your hangover (which may or may not have been our experience).

Great burger, mediocre service, perfect for people watching.

I ordered a medium rare burger with everything that it normally comes with and pickles. It was so good I ate it before realizing I didn't take a photo. 
Fries were ok, nothing really exciting.

Came here twice over the course of 2 years. I'm not sure if it was called Benchmark Eatery in 2017 but I remember that we sat at the bar and there was a super friendly bartender who brightened up my birthday 2yr ago. It was such a pleasant experience we went back here for lunch today. It sure was a busy day for them because it was a labor day weekend. The host and server(Ian, according to our receipt) were both friendly and nice. The server especially was very understanding and patient with me. The burger was cooked perfect medium temp and the fries were seasoned perfect.
Would definitely go back to this place. Love sitting at the patio enjoying their delicious food and friendly service.

Dinner entrees are a very small serving size & way overpriced!  $32 for 3 quarter to half dollar size scallops with no side & $19 for a 1/2 chicken which is more like a 1/2 Cornish hen.  Bristols would have been a better choice.  Stick to lunch menu, burger platter size looks better for $$ but still overpriced & just ok

On a very busy night, we were seated relatively fast. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable without being too overbearing. The food, beer, and price are very similar to other brewery chains like Granite City and Rock Bottom. You probably know what to expect when walking in the doors, and you won't be disappointed. You won't be wowed, but not let down.

Great atmosphere- great service - good food - very fresh - there not afraid of flavor - a lot of restaurants are neutral on flavor not enough so they don't upset - here they go for it - full of flavor

I wish there was the option to give no stars.  We had a terrible experience at brunch here recently.  Yes, I know that Saturday brunch is always crazy busy all over town.  BUT, many other restaurants in this price range and below still manage to deliver good food and at least passable service on the weekends.  This place provided neither. 

I had the Eggs Benedict with Pulled Pork and my dining companion had the Waffle Couchon (their take on chicken and waffles but supposedly with pulled pork and a chimichurri sauce).  My benedict was very disappointing.  First, the egg was not poached.  It was fried with no "runny" yolk.  There were maybe two bites of edible meat on the dish, with the remaining being a slab of inedible fat.   The cornbread served with this was hard enough to break a window, and flavorless.  This was better than the other dish though.  When my companion ordered the Waffle Couchon he was not informed that the sauce had been 86'd - nor was he ever so informed and given a chance to change his order before it arrived.  After a very long wait when the food was delivered, he tasted the chicken only to find it was very very dry, and flavorless.  So, he requested the sauce and was told there was no more sauce.  After he choked down the dry chicken with the pancake syrup offered as a replacement, some other sauce was brought to the table, but it was too late, the damage had been done.  

The service was also horrific.  Yes, it was Saturday morning but, yet again, many other places in town are able to provide good food and good service even when they're slammed.  This place did not.  When we arrived, we placed our name on the list outside.  When we did, we were #3 on the list.  However, 15-20 minutes after we had done so, we kept seeing people come in after us, not put their name on the list and be seated.  We ended up sitting at the bar where it was very crowded, as it's apparently also used as the waitstaff's serving station.  

We will not return.

After our first review last summer, we had problems with service. And we weren't the only ones to have problems.  We've seen people leave after having their orders repeatedly screwed up. 
Things seemed to have gotten better since the fall and we eat here twice a week.
Today was the lunch from hell.
It wasn't crowded but it took forever to take our drink orders. We waited for an interminable time only to get one wrong. 
Finally,  after waiting,  the waitress took our food order. Long wait until the order was brought out with it being wrong.
My wife asked for a refill on her coke, which took an inordinate time. 
I handed the waitress a coupon for a free drink which she brought. 
On Thursday,  a cup of matzo ball soup is included in all purchases. It's on the menu. 
We always get the matzo ball soup on Thursdays. And we eat there twice a week. 
This time,  the waitress,  after returning with my credit card said that the drink coupon wasn't good because we had matzo ball soup. This was new to us and the waitress mentioned nothing when we gave her the coupon. 
When I questioned her, she played the victim and tried to make us feel bad by saying she would pay for it out of her own pocket. 
I asked to speak to the manager but he was "too busy to come over".
It is always the responsibilty of a manager to speak directly to a dissatisfied customer,  not leave it to a harried, new waitress.
Long lines at restaurants don't always pay off. Biscuit Love does!  Do the line!  It moves fairly fast and the payoff at the end - Bronuts, Biscuits, and the rest - is really, really good food!
I ordered the ribs, my husband had the shrimp poor boy and we both loved our meals. The music was great and so was the service!
Jerk Chicken and crab and shrimp nachos are to die for!  The cheddar grits were also a special treat. Service excellent. Our server was very friendly and attentive.

Went to Water Springs for our first time tonight and were very impressed. The food was excellent, likely the best mexican food in Sparks right now. We also thought the staff was wonderful, very attentitive and polite. We will definitly be back!

I went on Valentines Day 2021 with my girl. I made reservations using the app and arrived perfectly on time and we were seated in about 2 minutes. The restaurant was packed! Everyone working was fast and efficient as possible. It seemed like they had systems in place for every situation. Everyone was super friendly from the host, busboys, and our server Shannon was fantastic and attentive to us. Definitely made our Valentines Day lunch a good and happy experience. We will definitely come back soon!

-Dave

I was pretty excited to finally get a Pizza Hut in the Santa Barbara area, but upon my first visit, I was sadly disappointed. I placed an online order, which is pretty difficult to mess up, but they managed to. I didn't go for any of their fancy new additions like the new crusts, sauces, drizzles, etc. but given this experience, I'm not confident they could even handle any of those. I simply ordered a meat lovers pizza with extra sauce, and the amount of sauce on my pizza was pathetic. It seemed like even less sauce than normal. Not only that, but the pizza just wasn't good. After a couple bites, I decided to forego eating the pizza altogether, and found a homeless man to give it to. Meanwhile, I was starving but went to Woodstocks and waited for a pizza actually worthwhile. 

In addition to the poor quality, the service also wasn't great. The pizza was nearly cold and the girl working there was kind of rude and basically suggested leaving a tip...for a take out order. When I got back into my car, I saw her ranting to her co-workers about something in rather animated fashion. I'm not conceited enough to think it had anything to do with me, especially since I was friendly and raised no issues, despite lacking customer service. However, it just didn't seem professional to me. Granted, how professional could one expect someone who works at Pizza Hut to be, but still. 

If this is how this location operates when it just opened, I can just imagine how the quality and service will decline over time. Hopefully, for their sake, it improves, but I'm not sure if I'll be going back there.

Decided to try this casual bistro with an eclectic mix of dishes, very limited wine list, and BYOB option. Restaurant was packed on this weekend night, with a brief wait if you walked in. With a reservation, seating was immediate.

The utilitarian kitchen is located in the middle of the restaurant where it seemed out of place. In nice weather, you can sit outside (best option). Otherwise, I suggest sitting upstairs, where it's a little quieter. 

Service was pretty limited. For example, our waitress who was quite friendly, opened the bottles of water we ordered and sat them on the table. We had to pour our own water. Ditto for the wine we brought. While they uncorked it without a fuss, we then had to ask for glasses, and once those were plunked down on the table, ended up pouring the wine ourselves. I had to ask for a knife when my entrée came. Although the staff was pleasant, it often felt as if we were at a self-serve diner. 

Food was passable, and the focus seemed to be very firmly on quantity over quality. Portions were truly ginormous! We opted for the arugula salad as an appetizer, and the penne a la vodka and a vegetable bowl with edamame and tofu over spaghetti squash for entrees. The arugula wasn't fresh! Blech! The vegetable bowl was surprisingly tasty, with nice hints of ginger coming through. Unfortunately, it was drowning in a large, deep swimming pool of  teriyaki sauce, which completely overpowered most of the other flavors in the dish. The massive bowl of penne a la vodka was bland although edible. 

Desserts were huge and very sugary. Biggest cake slice I had ever seen! Ditto for the creme brulee dish.

Not a horrible place if you are starving and just want to leave stuffed. Even then, there are far better options on either side of the bridge.

The steak frites were good.  Would have preferred the steak whole, rather than them cutting it, making it cold fast and losing all of the juices.  I might have given 3 stars because it was not bad at all.  The salad, while it's a bit oily, the pickled onion and other items were a good touch.

I came here a second round and had the fried mac n cheese, which turned out a bit dry on the inside.  To top it off, the double cheese burger pizza was a let down.  The sweet potato fries were burnt to black and the pizza was dry.  It was not moist at all.

This was an awful experience. I wish I could give ZERO stars. 

Let's start with the positive. 

We were sat immediately. Our server was nice.

Now onto the bad and worse:

The restaurant was absolutely dead and not busy whatsoever. This will play a part later in the review. So we order and all I asked was for non-breaded chicken and no flour or anything just baked chick tenders with sauce, pretty simple right? I also ordered a salad.

Literally, 30 minutes later after our order was take with not really anyone in the restaurant I finally get my salad. I also had to ask for it up front because I was starving.

Another 7~10 min later we get our food. Roughly 40 min total. So here is where it gets worse. Chicken tasted like rubber and the sauce was awful. Nothing special about the sauce at all. The salad was better then the chicken. Do the nice waitress comes over and asks how everything is. So I tell her the truth. She is shocked. So she initiated to engage her manager, which I didn't care I was just hungry and I finished my food and I wasn't asking for anything. She still went and told the manager at the time. So she comes back and says sorry we will take it off the bill. I didn't ask but ok. I'm so pissed off the manager doesn't have the decency to come and talk to me and has the server deal with it. That is absolutely piss poor leadership and management. No matter if you are at McDonald or a high end steakhouse. It doesn't matter, just support your employee and make it right for your customer. I don't even care about them taking it off the bill I ate my food. Your employees and customers deserve better. 

My friends food also had no taste, he just didn't say anything because he wanted to be nice I'm just choosing the truth. Fix this!!!

I will never come here again or any other establishment related to Native.

Best wings I've had since moving from NY state 21 years ago. Pizza was very good, ingredients were fresh & tasty. I would have given 5 stars but had to wait 25 minutes past my carry out time, it was a playoff weekend though! Good food, definitely recommend

Okay, so I just stopped into Hawthorne's Biercafe (at 11th and Fitzwater), which opened tonight, and I left pretty pissed off. I feel a little guilty reviewing, since I only experienced their takeout beer and not their food or service, but I feel the need to rant a bit. This cafe was opened by the people who run Bella Vista Beer Distributor, so, as you can imagine, their selection is pretty expansive. However, they don't give you a discount for takeout beer. Normally, the price of a takeout bottle is 40% off the bar price; since you're not drinking it at the bar, you don't have to pay the bar tax. Apparently, the people running Hawthorne want you to pay them the bar tax simply for selling you the beer.

Moreover, the growler prices are astronomical. They want $33.50 for a growler of the Founder's IPA (not including the glass, which will run you an extra $15). A growler is not even a six-pack's worth of beer!! I wouldn't ever consider paying $33.50 for a six-pack. I could just go to the Devil's Den (during normal hours) and order six pints for less money... or, better yet, buy a case of beer! I just don't understand what their deal is. Sorry for the rant, but I just came home with three 12-ounce bottles of beer for $17.50 and I am steaming. The prices of their single bottles aren't marked, so if you decide to go in there, just be careful. Rant over.

I never have problems at Buffalo Wild Wings unless the service isn't very good as usual but I enjoyed this location! It is conveniently located right off the Selmon expressway. The outside seating is great and you're allowed to bring your dog!

Like another reviewer noted...the food was great, but the staff was unfriendly. I also felt ripped off when the soup server asked if I wanted croutons. I said "Sure," not realizing this was a .69 add-on. I got 5 small croutons for .69. The soup girl also seemed irritated when I changed my mind about which soup I wanted, even though she hadn't started dipping into the soup yet. If the staff had been friendly and not so sneaky upselling something that should be included, I would have given them 5 stars.

Lots of vegetarian options, and veggie-packed options (super healthy and filling even for omnivores!) 

They are family-friendly and right off the Monon, but don't have a changing table for babies! When I asked about it, the manager came over to apologize and tell me they were working on installing one but were having trouble finding something that would fit on their wall given the size and arrangement of their bathroom. 5 stars for the apology and taking my suggestions into account to make the accommodations more friendly for guests with kids!

Like many likers of Big Juds, I was drawn here by the Man vs Food burger.  I split the competition meal with a friend and we barely finished (4.5lb burger, 1lb fries and a 32oz drink).  Now THAT was a tastey burger!  Where'd you say you got that?  Big Juds burger?  Yep,  that's right Mr. Jackson.  Or should I say Mr Bacon....16 strips worth.  

The normal sized burgers i saw there were, well, normal sized.  But the subset of burgers contained by a custom 10" bun were worth writing home about.  

Oh, and yes, they have tots instead of fries.  And you'll have plenty of tots to share with your classmates.

Next time I want breadsticks remind me of how bad the bread makes me feel, and maybe put it in the form of "you don't need that much saturated fat, fat-ass."

The online order form doesn't want to change the sauce options.  If you changed 1 marinara to 2 marinara, you may pay for 2 but you'll only get 1. 
I've had to call the store to make sure, and one time I didn't get any and after I called back (twice) it took an hour and a half for them to bring me my damn sauce. And by that time they had to cook my order again because it was old and gross. 

It's yummy and the managers are nice (I wouldn't know that except the above happened). But really?

The food is decent but so overpriced like all the other steakhouses in the city.  Although I will say, their pineapple martini is amazing.  They soak pineapples in vodka and use that to make the martini.  They're strong but taste great (and they should be strong for the $14 price tag)!  Their wedge salad is also really good too.  It's probably best to take in the decor and have a drink at the bar if you don't want to drop a few hundred dollars on dinner.

Not sure why this place only has 3 and a half stars. These are some of the best quick service burgers in town and I have a great experience every time we visit, which is at least several times a month. Great fries, great burgers... in my opinion this place far exceeds In n Out. Don't let the ratings deter you. This is a great burger!
We used to love it here but as the owners do not require proof of vaccination for indoor dining, we are no longer supporting this restaurant.

First Watch is always a good bet for a hearty, healthy and delicious breakfast.  This was no exception.  Four of us ordered different items.  My wife had scrambled egg whites with fruit and muffin, sister-in-law had an omelet (of which there are many), I had a frittata (of which there are several) and brother-in-law had the egg potato has bowl.  As usual, the service was very good and the food delicious and filling.  2-19-2020
All of three blacks  but the place is nice food is bomb service is good stuffed shrimp w lobster . Pork chop potatoes and veggies XX def recommend bomb ambience and strong ass wine

A gem in an industrial area!  We were a group of 4, with reservations, seated promptly, friendly staff. Our server, Zachary, was very attentive & knowledgeable of dinner menu & specials! 2 in our group opted for the prime rib special (8 oz about $21, 12 oz about $25)~Both meals came with soup or salad, choice of starch, seasonal veg & glass of house wine. Excellent prime rib, tasty sides! Diner 3 had the scallop special (about $23)~Salad,  cauliflower mash & 6 large seared scallops. Melt in your mouth scallops! Diner 4 ordered scampi (about $16) off the menu. 6 large scampi, with sauce, over pasta with seasonal veg. She loved it! We all agreed it is worth a return dinner!  The food was excellent, reasonably priced wine selection and some pretty good beer on tap! Great staff, thanks Zachary!

I created an account just to write a review for this place.. I've been here around a dozen times and have loved every minute of it! The owner is by far the nicest woman EVER!.. Every time we see her!.. :)

Besides her, great atmosphere, people watching, and very fairly priced wine! A definite recommend if you're looking for a relaxing wine drinking experience. 

Only SMALL negative is having to go to the bathroom.. You have to use a neighboring restaurant or public one person at a time bathroom, but you have the same problem at fancy carne chophouse next door, so can't judge.. I'll definitely be back!

Although I have been to Continental Midtown several times, on Monday September 12th I visited for the first time to the rooftop for Happy Hour.

We arrived at about 4:45 or so, and ordered one round and the next two were during happy hour.   

We only had drinks and no food this time; however, were extremely pleased with the quality of the drinks for the price offered. 

If you have never been on Continental's rooftop, it is a nice respite from the busy Center City streets below with a pretty awesome view of the surrounding high rises.  There is a indoor and an outdoor area of the rooftop.

We were definitely pleased and would return again.

Solid option for wings in Tucson.
I was really happy when I heard that a new restaurant was open in this location, as the previous one had a rough time and it's too prime of a spot to stay vacant. 
I've never eaten in, but my boyfriend and I have gotten takeout several times. We like to order on Tuesdays for the $.75 wing deal. I've tried the lemon pepper, ATL style (spicy and regular), and hot. The wings are nice and crispy, and usually a pretty decent size. They are dry, however, so if you like a saucier wing, you may want to order more sauce on the side. 
We've also tried the French fries, which are crispy and flavorful with the ATL seasoning. We gave the cheese fries a shot, but the cheese sauce is nothing special. 
The fried biscuits are a delicious end to an indulgent meal. I love them with powdered sugar and honey.

Literally 1 plate is enough for four adults.  We got there at 4:30 & were the only ones there. Great service, I had a cup of soup & it was really good, super fresh veggies & chicken. My son got the chicken & waffles & it was a ridiculous amount of food!!!! Literally a tower. I suggest ordering the half portion size unless you are a line backer in the pro-football league. Very reasonably priced. By the time we left the place was filling up fast, so get there early!

The burger is awesome! I don't even like goat cheese but it tastes incredibly with the burger meat! I ordered jambalaya as well and it was slightly burnt. I give the burger 5 stars, but take away two for the abysmal jambalaya.

My hubby and I had lunch here recently.    The charcuterie was very tasty and varied.   Will definitely have it again!    Side salads crisp and fresh.   Great wine list and full bar as well.  Service was good too.  

Hubby had crab cakes which were almost all crab...very little filling.   They were rich and delicious.   I had the bourbon "glazed" pork tenderloin.   I put glaze in quotations, because there was barely any.   I ordered pork med-well and it was way over cooked, even for well done.   Side green beans were tough.  Couldn't be cut with a knife.  Next time I'll try the jalapeño corn.  

Dishes come with sides, salads and bread, which makes a good value.   Booth seats are about 4" too short in the first booth.   I'm 5'4" and had to "perch".  No relaxing in that booth!!

Overall, we will come back and try something other than the pork.

Came here for dinner with family on our vacation! Our waiter Steve was absolutely awesome! Has great humor, polite, on top of things, and he took 12 of our orders without writing it down and got all of our orders right! We were blown away lol. The food was delicious and definitely will be making another visit here next time we are in town.

One of the best atmospheres for dining and drinks in Chestnut Hill.  Large open and nicely spaced area by the bar and also more secluded booths for dining with good lighting. The food is delicious and the staff is always friendly and helpful. Shoutout to Jo, Becky, Mark, Ben, Derek and Katie! Just a few of the great bartenders/ waiters I have met here :)

We LOVED everything we ate...and we are seafood snobs;) we loved that they served only fresh, wild caught seafood...not farm raised. And you can absolutely tell. The grouper bites, conch fritters, oysters, shrimp and the gumbo....all excellent. We had great service and can't wait to go back!

The food was good, the service was fine and yes the beer selection is huge, BUT wish they would serve some of the dishes they are known for instead of brunch only on Satuday.
You can't get any of the really good mussel dishes they offer, nor can you get the shortribs.
Burger was very good as its a blend of 3 cuts of meat put thru a grinder. Eggs benedict with crab instead of Canadian bacon came with a great Bernaise sauce. There is only one egg, but it is still a good dish. WIsh in the future they offer some of their other lunch items.

The grilled salmon I had was pretty good. I also had the fried crab rice and was amazed. My server could have been a little better when it came to service but no major complaints. Also I wish their desert menu had a larger selection.

There are few times in my life when I have bern do disappointed in a restaurant. This restaurant is not close to Bookbinders in quality of food. Downright terrible. Snapping Turtle soup about as good as a canned vegetable soup. Why call it turtle? The fish we had... inedible. The oyster sandwich? Lotsa bread, few oysters, nothing memorable. Dessert?.. didnt stay, ran out. 

What was memorable? A Japanese tourist family being taken on the $150.00 chefs choice seafood appetizer! 

Avoid this place at all costs! I'm buying bookbinders soup online!!!! Will likely get better servuce ascwell.
Interesting... Everything says it's open on Monday.. Except we showed up at 9am and it was closed.. No sign on the door. Was super excited to give this place a try but went to Crena instead

Not quite sure what to say here, I mean it's Chick-Fil-A chicken Tendies.. So of course they're going to get the 5 stars. Love ordering here when trying to get great platters for the office. Great service when stopping here in person.

I LOVE Angeline! I was just there last week and I can't wait to go back.

Because my friend L and I had happy hour elsewhere, we unfortunately did not get an appetizer. We did get a bottle of the Riesling and some great options for our main dish and were very happy with our experience.

L got the veal and I got the rabbit. I love rabbit and I love Angeline's rabbit. The greens that accompanied the rabbit were really good too, with a slight tanginess. I had a bite of the veal as well, and man, that thing just melts in your mouth.

Our server was great, and I ended up having a full-on conversation with him about Portland.

I am definitely going back and trying some hot appetizers (a good friend works in the kitchen) and other main dishes that I am sure are amazing.

You don't need a silver fork to eat good food-- Paul Prudhomme

97th reviewer. of Soup Kettle Grille. This is my 449th review.

I've been to this establishment about three times now. About two years ago I tried to go once. I went into the place 30 minutes before closing and I was told that I would have to eat in my car-- that didn't sit well with me and it took me all this time to go back, and I have twice now!

Food is food. Sure many places are better than others, but the people, the pricing, the ambiance, and did I mention people (yes, I did but it's worth a double mention) is all included in what makes a place good, right??? Well, Soup Kettle Grill (which seems backward to my poor brain) meets the top level of all of my criteria! The owner seems to always be here, you can tell she/they pour their heart and soul (wholeheartedly) into her work-- an amazingly nice woman who wants you to sample her/their works of art! She also makes suggestions, gets to know you, works hard and is overall friendly. 

The food is really, really tasty. Smallish portions, but just enough to get you satisfied. I recommend eating here and trying it. It's a no-frills, healthy comfort food alternative with super friendly hard-working people to meet.

On a Winter Saturday night we made a reservation at this small cozy, delicious restaurant.  Amazing food and delicious sangria. Small menu with a big variety. Brisket toasted ravioli,  spicy shrimp bowl, strawberry chocolate mousse cake. So delightfully flavorful!
The staff were friendly, attentive, accommodating, polite, and easy to talk to.  Thank you for a fantastic date night.

Probably the best pizza in the Horsham area. The sauce is great! I really like the burnt edges on the crust. Its different than brick oven pizza I'm used to, which is not necessarily a bad thing. I think the difference is in the crust. Its a bit thicker and chewier but really holds the flavor of the brick oven. The mozzarella was okay. The eggplant marino pie was really delicious, the plain was alright. Looking forward to trying their other pies!

A welcome addition to the neighborhood! Great food, great service, great atmosphere (especially the outdoor seating!).  The eggplant fries are awesome. I'm excited to do some outdoor drinking there when it gets a little bit warmer.

It's a family-run place, so it has a few quirks that could irk some people, but as long as you are a normal person who doesn't freak out if the food happens to takes a little long to arrive then there will be no issue. The people who run the restaurant are incredibly friendly and welcoming.
Not sure how we have missed this place for so long but it was great. Food, service and prices. We will definitely stop here again.

Ahhhhhh Dat Dog is so delicious!!!!

I ordered the Chicago dog and some chili cheese fries. Oh my goodness - this is exactly what I needed after not eating all day, traveling, and having a couple of cocktails. Despite being close to closing time, the girl at the cashier was super sweet and helpful when I was trying to figure out what I wanted to eat. You have to come here if you're in Nola - it will change your view of hot dogs. I wish I could eat at Dat Dog every day for the rest of my life.

Great place! Great lunch! If you find yourself near downtown Nashville make sure to visit Redlands Grill (formally J Alexander's). The food presentation is simple, but delicious and our server was very attentive and prompt! Overall a great experience!!

I came here Saturday around 1 for lunch with my boyfriend. There were so many great cheeses choices to pick from. (Healthy isn't really a word thrown around or used in their menu options so don't come looking for it.  ) this is the ultimate cheesy greasy place. 

We ordered mac and cheese bites that were huge, didn't expect them to be that big. I would suggest getting the small order. We also ordered a cheesesteak grilled cheese and a buffalo chicken mac and grilled cheese. Our sandwiches were cooked perfectly and we were stuffed by the end of it. We even had leftovers for dinner. Will be coming here plenty of times in the future. Especially for those late night visits.

We've been here several times, either for a fancy steak dinner or just for their great burgers. Not a cheap date spot, but definitely a solid tasty choice. My one gripe is that everything tends to be really salty. There's salt on the table but I can't imagine anyone ever needing it. That said, the meat is super fresh, always cooked perfectly. Also good: the fries, Brussels sprouts, and meat loaf sandwich.
Ate there yesterday definitely recommend signing up for the waitlist while you're walking over so you don't have to wait long. Hot chicken sandwich and the French Toast bites were delicious.

This place really IS as good as it gets!  Flapjack's is the best for breakfast with a friend, co-worker or the family.  They're always busy but are still able to turn over tables quickly making your wait short.  They serve very generous portions from their broad menu.  The staff has little turnover so you will see the same smiling faces time and time again giving you great service & always ready to refill your coffee cup.  I highly recommend this place to anyone wanting some good, down home tasting breakfasts.

I came here with a group of 4 for an impromptu dinner on a Wednesday night after a long day at the Convention Center. The restaurant was just getting busy & we had a 15 minute wait.

We were seated in the main area by the "main stage." There was a woman singing & hawking CDs up there, but judging by the faces of the diners around our table, I can assume that no one purchased her album. The speakers were so loud that we had to yell to each other & yell our orders to the server ...

... which is probably why our server kept forgetting our drink orders. His excuse for a beer taking 20 minutes? "I looked over at the bar, and I didn't see your drink there, so I assumed someone took it to your table already." A quick glance at our table would've solved that puzzle, sir. And when he brought the beer, I ordered a glass of wine ... which didn't come until I was halfway done with my entree. Asking if I wanted dessert & coffee when I still had half a glass of wine left? Awkward.

The food was good, which is Hard Rock's only saving grace. The service was slow & lazy, & the ambiance is just irritating. The proximity to the Convention Center would make you think that Hard Rock was all business ... but they were less than professional when we were there. Next time I'm in Philadelphia, I'd recommend taking the time to find a local restaurant instead.

They need to advertise their unlimited mimosa brunch!

Since it is hard to find information on their website about their unlimited mimosa brunch, I'm going to do them a solid and advertise it for them. $10 all you can drink mimosas! They also have a brunch menu. You can find the menu if you search Bar Louie brunch, but you can't find it on their main website. Also, when you go to the brunch menu, it doesn't say anything about their unlimited mimosas. I would think that this is a huge selling feature that they should advertise. They offer brunch on both Saturday and Sunday. For those of you who are huge Saturday brunch fans (raises hand), this is great, because the number of restaurants that offer Saturday brunch with unlimited mimosas in the Tampa Bay area is rather limited (I'm looking at you World of Beer who only offers brunch on Sunday).

The great thing about going here is you can order off their brunch menu or their regular menu. My husband is not a huge brunch person, so being able to get wings at 11 a.m. is a huge boon to him. On the other hand, I love brunch. I got the vegetarian omelet. The menu online says it comes with tater tots. I figured oh well, I won't be healthy, my hands are tied, but in the restaurant it comes with fresh fruit. It made me feel a tad guilty switching that fresh fruit to tater tots, but when I chomped down on that crispy, salty, goodness the guilt dissipated. Do yourself a favor and get the tots. It also comes with buttered multigrain bread. As far as the omelet goes, have you ever really had an amazing or disgusting omelet? Ok, yes I know it is possible, but most omelets taste like an omelet. It's hard to mess up. My friend didn't like her egg white omelet, but I thought mine was fine.

Service was on the slow side, which is surprising because they weren't that busy. When you have unlimited mimosas, you expect your glass to always be full. I'm a slow drinker, so mine was, but that's only because I was with quick drinkers. They had empty glasses about 1/3 of the time and mine just kept getting refilled when the server came over to refill their glass.

Overall I think this is a solid Saturday, bottomless mimosa brunch place.

Texas Roadhouse in Royersford is a weekly pick for my family. The wait staff is always friendly and helpful. They give off the impression that they really want you to enjoy your time spent there. The food is always delicious and flavorful. Only once out of the many, many times that I've dined there, was 1 of my sides brought out wrong. So, in my experience they have a 99.9% accuracy rate.

I've never had a bad dish at Roadhouse. I highly recommend trying their award winning ribs, which are truly fall off the bone. No need to worry about dirtying your hands on this meal. You can literally pull the meat off with your fork. The bbq sauce has a nice, sassy flavor to it. Also, the chicken fried chicken with white gravy is an inexpensive dish and definitely yummy.

The salads are always crisp and the most fresh tasting I have ever had anywhere. And a plus for me, I don't have to pick one thing out of their house salad. (I'm a VERY picky eater) Fresh iceberg, chopped tomatoes, hard boiled eggs, shredded cheese--a must have salad. A little tip-you can save yourself the $3 or $4 on this salad, if you get it as one your sides. If you get it as a side choice, it's the same size as ordering it as a separate item.

You can also pick out a larger steak before they seat you at your table. The steaks are grilled to perfection, whatever your choosing (rare, medium, well, etc.). The flavor is good enough you don't even need A1.

Another recommended choice from their appetizer selections would be the rattlesnake bites. A bit like a jalapeno popper, but sooo much better. So delicious! Or you can try their combo platter which comes with chicken fingers, potato skins, and rattlesnake bites and your choice of 3 dipping sauces.

Some other info: For parents, they do have a children's night once a week (Tuesday, I think??) and they offer a 2 meals for $20 deal from 4-6 P.M. at least Mon-Thur, maybe Friday too (not sure on that one).

Now to be fair, there are a few cons. They don't open until late during the week. So you can't go there for lunch. Even though this one attests to their good standing, it's still a con for some people. Depending on what time you go, the wait time can get ridiculous. However, they do have call ahead seating so really I guess this one isn't so bad if you remember to grab the number or have it in your phone or something for those spur of the moment times you want to head over and don't want to wait for a table. This place is ALWAYS packed, but it does show they really are that good.

All in all, I've been a customer of this establishment since it's opening and not once over the past few years have I had a bad experience or meal here. The best part, you don't need to like country music to enjoy your visit.  ;)

I was here right around Christmas with my dad.  We had been shopping at Barnes and Noble for quite awhile and got hungry.

I have only been to a Red Robin one other time which was in July of 2009 in Missouri...  

On this visit, it was pretty crowded, but I don't think we had to wait more than maybe ten minutes.  I like that they have vegetarian as well as vegan burger options, but dislike the GMO brands that they use.  My Boca burger was pretty decent, but I think I might opt for a salad if I go back.  I liked the pickle, lettuce, and tomato.  The fries were better than most fries elsewhere, and I had plenty to eat, but they did not ask us if we wanted a refill on them.

Our server was pretty good for the most part.  She was friendly, but disappeared a lot.  They WERE slammed, so I tried to give her some slack on that.  The only thing was that the beer I ordered didn't arrive until we were almost done eating so I pretty much had to down it and couldn't just enjoy it.  She blamed it on the bar.  I'm not sure if that was just a line or if it really was the bartender, but either way, it was a draft Stella Artois so how hard can it be?  I got a glimpse of the bartender on our way out.  She did look to be struggling a bit, but the bar was a lot less busy than the tables.  People have bad days and get sidetracked, but when I was in the same job,  this wouldn't have happened.

Dad had a Coke, I believe, and the price seemed pretty high for a fountain drink.  Some of the mixed drinks and specialty lemonades on their beverage menu seemed overpriced as well.  They did have a club with some benefits we signed up for, but I think my dad and sister had some sort of problems with that a month or two later at another location up north...

Overall, the atmosphere is nice and known for being kitschy.  My dad pointed out the portrait of George Costanza over the restroom entrance.  The noise level wasn't too extreme for being so full and I like the dim lighting.  There was a birthday or two going on and a lot of kids in there, but nothing too wild.  I don't especially like chains, but I might go back if I am back in the area.  I like Plainfield a lot more than most parts of Indy and it's closer to home.  I'd give more stars if I didn't have to wait so long for my beer.  I probably should have asked them to take it off the bill.  If it happens again, I'll open my big mouth!

We chose to eat here because it was right by our hotel without reading any reviews. From the beginning the service was very slow. It took about 5 minutes for anyone to take our drink order and then when she took our order it took her another 10 minutes to bring it to us. Thank goodness we never needed refills or that would have been another hassle. As for the food, it was just OK. Definitely not worth the wait. My friend's food came out cold.

Before we received our check, the table next to us had a simple problem on their bill. Instead of acting professional, the waitress was gone for 20 minutes "trying to go back into the system to fix the problem." The table asked to speak to the manager and instead of being reasonable, she stood there and defended the waitress of why it was taking her so long, COMPLETELY disregarding the customer's concerns of just wanting cash back to make it easier than having to go back into the system. 

So when our bill came I wasn't surprised that it was on one check after we had previously told her to put it on separate checks. When we gave her BOTH our cards, we then reminded her to split it AGAIN. Sure enough, she comes back to the table saying that she accidentally put it on one card and could not go back into the system to correct it. Since we had just witnessed what went on at the table next to us, we decided it wasn't worth the argument to be made fools of from the manager. 

After reading previous reviews, I see that the manager likes to respond to the negative ones attempting to justify the situation. I don't think there is ANY excuse for having bad customer service. What happened to the saying that the customer is always right?? I worked in the restaurant business in college at a much more popular place so I DO KNOW how it is. 

HANDS DOWN, my friend & I wish we would have saved our money and eaten at McDonalds. We would have been treated better there anyway.

This breakfast cafe is one of my mom and mine favorite places to go for brunch on the weekend. We almost always get the huevos rancheros and breakfast tacos. But the other menu items always look amazing as well.

This place has the best BBQ food in this area. The baby back ribs, and BBQ chicken are the best. The meat literally falls off the bone and tantalizes your taste buds. The last time I ordered from here, we called ahead and placed about 6 different orders and surprisingly the employee was fine with us placing so many different ones and there was no confusion as of whose was whose at pick up time. We opted to take out because although they have seating, there's not very many seats and its small inside. 

We ordered 3 bbq chicken meals with french fries and baked beans, and 1 baby back ribs combo and 2 chicken and ribs combo meals. The food boxes were so heavy and you can smell the aromas while taking the boxes to the car. Our mouths were watering as we drove about 20 minutes home to finally enjoy our meals. 

Everyone was chomping down on their meals and were raving about how tasty they were. I had the ribs and chicken combo and the meat tasted so fresh, the bbq sauce on top was so flavorful as well. I had a side of cole slaw and onion rings which were so tasty as well. 

Ive also had their bbq chicken wings in the past and they are also prob the best Ive had in Philadelphia with lots of meat and they filled you up.

I prefer mcfaddens because I'm not really into "southern" decors, but the mechanical bull in here is pretty cool. They also share a cover with mcfaddens, so you get two cool bars for a fair cover price!
This is a great place to go have drinks with friends at the bar or to sit down for a meal with family and friends. I've always had great food and drinks at the corner pub.

Went last night before his company Christmas jamboree and the food and service were wonderful!

This place was moderately busy on a Friday night, we were way overdressed because we had to do his party afterwards. The hostess was quick to greet us and super friendly.

We were led to a booth and our server was Katie, who was on the ball and incredibly charming. I ordered the scallops, subbed out mashed potatoes for the rice and my food was perfect. The scallops were perfectly cooked and succulent. The mash was tasty and even the vegetables were fantastic. The two drinks I had were really tasty and strong too, the bartender is on it! 

My date had the steak which comes with a killer marinade and was perfectly cooked and juicy. I was delighted with my scallops but the steak was so good! I wish they would do a surf and turf! 

Finished with cheesecake that was dense and creamy and it ended the night perfectly. 

Bathrooms were cute and clean with kitschy beach signs in the stalls. The crowd was upbeat and the staff were all smiles and laughter. 

Wonderful. We can't wait to go again!

We were cruising around late afternoon looking at prospective condo's and stopped by here for a drink.  The facility is small with very little parking.  The decor is kitschy tiki.  The ventilation was very good with noticeable convection to alleviate the humid heat from outside.

The bartender was perky and amiable.  She got us started with a belgian wit beer.  We moved on to some bloody mary's and chatted for awhile.  The menu is mostly seafood fares.  The she-crab soup and grouper was pretty good.

Overall, a pretty good spot for a meal and a chance to get out of the blistering sun.

This has been one of the worst experience I have ever had at IHOP. The men's bathroom was gross. It smells like very bad urine and the floor was all wet and the soap thing spraying soup at your pants but then they were out of handle towels. The crepes we ordered were burnt and the eggs were cold. Very disappointed.

We ordered two types of Mac and cheese and both were lack luster. The noodles were low quality and while the cheese was generous it was not worth finishing. Really disappointed. The people who love this place just have never had anything exceptional, but it is cool that it is in the loop.

I have enjoyed the previous  dinning experience and looked at it as a go-to until today. I want to start by saying the service was fine, nothing was wrong, they were nice and accommodating. Food came out correct and quickly. 
Now, to the reason for the low marking, the menu changes. The restaurant should be be called Nuggets not Wingers. Couldn't even find wings in their menu and accidentally ordered chicken nuggets. Never have I Ever paid almost $20 for chicken nuggets and I will never again. The happy hour menu has shrunk to.almost nothing and what was advertised as 3 pretzels with cheeses turned out to be about 6 pretzel bites, chips and queso. I understand times are hard for all business but that is more reason to spend my money in places that deserve it.   Unfortunately this is our last visit, hopefully they can survive but a restaurant counting on selling heavily breaded frozen and flavored chicken nuggets, I doubt it.

If I could give this place 0 stars I would.  

Eater beware this is a SYSCO food joint.  

  Went with the wife to grab some grub and we've always driven by only to find a line out the door.  Finally we catch it when it was not busy.  We ordered the chips and queso, Roasted Pear Salad for me and Half rack of ribs for the wife.
  The chips for the queso were stale and definitely mass produced and we kept commenting that we had been having much better and fresher chips at a few other locations recently.  When our food arrived, the wife's caesar salad that came with the ribs were absolutely flavorless.  How can you not have flavor on a caesar?  Just add pepper ya dummies.  
   My Roasted pear salad which I thought I would get some nice chunks of pear with it only had 4 wispy tiny pieces of canned roasted pear.  I said ok I can deal with it until half way through the salad I bite into a rotten cherry tomato.  No more dinner for me.
  The wife was tortured by her lukewarm microwaved ribs.  Thats right you read microwaved.  We can certainly tell the difference between the effort put forth on a grill  to something that comes from a frozen bag.  Especially when we get our food 10 minutes after ordering.
  Yes our server was a lovely lady who made the best of everything,  If I was you hon, I'd go and work for Smokey Bones which is where we wished we had gone instead.
  
 One last note.  I'm actually feeling sick after eating a salad.

We went in on a Friday evening for dinner as my son was craving fried chicken and it was the only place I could think of that served chicken and wasn't fast food. Imagine our disappointment when we discovered they no longer make fried chicken. Bummer. 

But we stayed anyhow and had some great wings. It was fairly quiet, so the waitress had time to chat and joke with us, which I love. Food was good, service was fast and efficient. 

All in all a nice dinner. We would easily return.

Omg was this an amazing experience! I truly do recommend to come here and really anything on the menu would be delightful. The waitress was one of the nicest and funniest I have ever met. The food was delicious5/5 recommended

After a long day in the cold, these hot dogs are the only thing needed to cheer a person up! The menu is crazy amazing-duck dogs, chicken dogs, beef dogs, you name it they had it- and it took quite a few minutes to chose what to order. I ended up getting the India dog (with samosa filling-yum!!) and French fries for the table. My goodness was that hot dog delicious!! The bun was a soft, toasted bread-not what you would expect for a hot dog- and the veggie dog was excellent, completely passing my standards. The toppings made it all that much more decadent, and added some extra flavor. Even the fries were delicious. And perhaps the best part? They're open super late! Need a midnight snack, head to destination dogs! This hot dog bar is amazing, and I hope to return soon

Family owned and operated, friendly employees, and great service. My favorite trashed wings in St. Louis. Pizza is definition of St. Louis style and in my opinion is better than Imos. Easily the best sports bar and grill on Telegraph.o
