Great spot for breakfast or lunch.  A hidden gem.  I originally was invited for a business breakfast.  They have a varied menu with specials which are outstanding.  It has become a regular spot for our family as well on weekends when our kids are visiting.

We came back 3 times while visiting. Go upstairs and eat on or near balcony for best NOLA view near charming square. Food? Fabulous. Crab claws in sauce to die for and order side of red potatoes too. Staff is like eating in their home. We could have moved in!! Hot tip: go there!

If you work here - please find another job soon.

The dining room is pretty clean, you know like when a place that's recently opened has a lot of staff and everyone is wiping mysterious things off pretend items.  Still, no one's thought about wiping the dusty divider wall between the booths.  There were at least 8 staff working there around 10 pm and three or four couples eating and yet, our fries were cold when served and after we sent them back, we knew they'd been double-dipped in the fryer.  Most of the soggy fries had dark spots on them; they may have been fresh potato since they had a bit of potato peel on them, but honestly, the frozen French fries at El Cap (just down the street) are a zillion times better. 

Prices are affordable If bland food is okay with you; but for a place that serves chicken you'd think that the chicken would actually be good.  The breading has some flavor, but the chicken itself is either salty or tasteless.  They may want to consider brining or marinating it before frying it.  The dipping sauces were equally bad, including the signature blueberry vinaigrette. Blueberry coleslaw is a crime against blueberries.
 
The salad was refrigerator cold, so cold that it was not pleasant to eat. My friend had the 3 tenders and felt that McDonald's mechanically-separated nuggets probably had more flavor.

The dining room is kept freezing cold so that the staff handling the fryers could be comfortable, but sitting outside would have meant sitting under misters near the street.

There was a guy in a chef's jacket, inexplicable for such an establishment, and I tried willing him over with my eyes so that I could complain in person, but he jibber-jabbered with a friend for a good 20 minutes and then turned away to handle more important chef matters in the back where another person emptied an industrial-sized can of goo into another container.  Maybe it was too much to hope for since it's just a glorified fast-food joint, but if someone sends food back the least the chef-jacketed guy can do is come to ask if everything was satisfactory.

Save your money people.  Go have a juicy burger at El Cap, drive a mile south and eat at Evo's, this place sucks.

Really loved their Wayne location! The food and service was pretty amazing and the decor really grabs your attention when you walk in. Wish there was one in Phoenixville!

My only disappointment was on the final course I had asked if the shortrib was a sandwich in which the server said it was not. However when it arrived it was pretty much an open face sandwich.
Close to my work and decently priced. They have amazing good food. Always comes out hot and fresh. Their staff has recently changed, but everyone is still really nice.

I have read others reviews about the slow service and I agree that this place is slow to give you your ordered items.  The burgers are not like the Lotaburger's in New Mexico.  They taste different and the buns taste stale.  If you order hatch chili you get such a small amount on the burger so why order it.  The only reason I gave 3 stars is because of the bacon breakfast burrito , but lately they have been putting less hash browns so I will try again to see if this is now the norm.

Service here is absolutely horrible. I walked in and it didnt appear to be too busy. I was with my 3yo son. The hostess asked if i didnt mind a high top. Mind you im with my 3 year old (as he could see). I politely requested a booth. He then states "oh well it'll be a wait" I ask how long "I don't know it'll be a wait". Now most restaurants will give you an expected timeframe. So rude i walked out and went to another restaurant. This is not the first time I've had an issue with this location. I will never go again

Finally tried this place after living here for years. Wait staff was very friendly with the exception of the hostess, she was inattentive and kind of rude. Other than that the food was good with large portions and good price, mixed drinks could be a couple bucks cheaper but they were well made. Great family friendly option compared to the majority of downtown's loud party scene.

Great little place with an amazing atmosphere.  Nice little find for an out of towner like me.  So many great places for food, but this one really stood out for me.  I love the feel of the old house turned into great restaurant.  Well worth the money spent, actually thought that for how much we enjoyed our dinner that it was very reasonable

Came here for a comedy show. Though we had to sit at a four top with another couple, was definitely worth it. The drinks were nice and the service was awesome. We didn't order any food (as we had already eaten and just came for the show), but other people seemed to enjoy their meal. Will return for dinner!

Was on jury duty and this restaurant was convenient for our lunch break. I live close to both Chris' Pancake and Bartolino's Osteria, so I thought this would be a good choice. It was just, okay. 

I'm a big fan of the Bartolino's Salad. I've had it at the Osteria and also at their South location, so when I saw it on the menu here, I wanted it for lunch. What they served me, was no where near the Bartolino salad that I love. It wasn't even a good salad. I would have better off ordering breakfast for lunch, because Chris always does breakfast right. 

Will I return? - If I get called back for Jury duty in 2 years

When: May 3, 2017
Why: Lunch at Jury Duty

We anxiously awaited the opening of Jackson, but were highly disappointed. The wait staff had infectious enthusiasm and really talked up the menu. But, alas, the food is average despite the above average pricing and the heady menu descriptions. With two domestic beers each and desert our meal of sandwiches and one small plate was over $70 before the well deserved tip (the wait staff is excellent). I wish we had gone across the street and bought a Safeway Boar's Head sandwich and a six pack. We would have had a better meal for a fraction of the cost. I'm glad we didn't spring for the $18 truffle burger! I have to agree with the folks who found the ambience lacking. But if the food is good, I'd happily overlook that. Sadly, neither was good. I think there will be improvement, as the chef owner seems to want to set a high bar for himself. We will try again after he's had a chance to bring things up to par for his pricing.

It is so worth the wait!!!

My boyfriend and I are visiting from dallas and we decided to try this place out. There was a long line outside and we were not too keen on it but, we decided to stay and wait. I AM SO GLAD WE DID! 

I ordered the truffle egg scramble and let me tell you... that was a taste of pure heaven. It came on top of a buttery toasted croissant with arugula. I'm going to be having dreams about this sandwich!!
The service is good , nothing exceptional. It's a good place to stop before catching your flight. Plus, the bartender is really easy on the eyes...

This place a pretty amazing! A little confusing to get into if you are entering from the back - which is also where the valet parking is located - but overall great little spot. Make reservations as best you can, its not a very big space, so it can fill up quickly. I was here on a weekday night, so it was not crowded at all and I think that also made for a really great experience for our 8-10 person group!
Now... the Food...it is an experiment and an experience! AND it constantly changes! I enjoyed the warm pork belly salad, and gelatinous bone marrow appetizer...moved on to the scallops and salmon plates and ended with the famed butter cake and raspberry chocolate dessert! oohhhh Yes! :)

*accessible entrance

Had a poor breakfast experience due to service. Over 30 minutes to get two egg dishes ; never got a requested extra item; server rarely seen. A shame since the food when we got it was good (the baked eggs and an omelet).

it's just your average diner but the food is pretty decent. there's nothing that jumps out at you but for a quick bite or something to satisfy you this place is go. it also has good portions so you'll leave full! i'd recommend more for lunch or dinner. try to avoid on sunday morning unless you like waiting 40 mins

We not for restaurant week. Service was good however the steaks offered were very tough. Tried the Rib eye and sent it back then tried the NY strip also very tough. I would think that with  restaurant week they would put their best foot forward.

Let me start by saying that The Cheesecake Factory is one of my favorite restaurants. When we arrived at the restaurant around 7pm, it was quite hectic and busy per usual. However, the bar area was pretty quiet and some tables were open, so we decided to sit at the bar and avoid the wait. I had the Chicken Madeira, which was recommended by our waitress, and it has easily become one of my favorite dishes now as it was so delicious. Customer service was impeccable. Our glass was never empty and were were tended to almost as soon as we sat down. Excellent location all around!!

Their outdoor patio is beautiful and the service here is lovely, very professional, attentive, and personable. 
But the food....I don't know, it's just not there for me! It could be what I order, last time I got the summer scramble- the whole thing tasted boiled and had very little flavor. I could tell the ingredients were fresh, just too... natural. I appreciate when a kitchen uses the unusual veggies too like leeks, but don't send them out there without any seasoning! 
Before that I tried the eggs Benedict, and didn't like that either because I don't like brioche, and brioche is trending *hard* right now. 
One thing I don't think could be my fault is being disappointed by the purple potatoes. They taste and look a little like ground? Like I used to want to eat healthy until I saw those potatoes. I tried to mask them with ketchup only to find the ketchup was some healthy off-brand too, so now I'm out here stranded with purple potatoes in Bloody Mary sauce, wet eggs and leeks, and a $100 bill. Hash browns next time would put me over the moon :)

Not sure what all the hype is. total slop.
We eat out often and finally caved and tried it. New Orleans  has no shortage of great restaurants. This is NOT one of them.
They appear to go cheap on ingredients. I'm guessing because they've gotten so "big" they've started buying bulk and cheap.
Food was AMAZING and SERVICE was SUPERB!!!! Arielle was so personable and attentive. I got the trifecta and was throughly impressed. The Ruby Slipper mimosa was  but the food made up for it!!!!!

I hadn't heard about it, so it was a complete revelation of brilliant and original flavors, with great staff, and exceptional bread (and olive oil with sea salt, small things that indicate good attention!). Everything our group had was outstanding: Appetizers of burrata, a very original and flavorful salad, and the octopus, a regular on many menus, but a stand out here, as well as the main courses of salmon, steak and duck, all creatively prepared and beautifully presented.  Could you tell? We all loved it! Go -- and enjoy, it was really terrific.

Well, my latest experience was not so great. I took my Girlfriend there for her Birthday. We were seated in the dining area and immediately informed of (at least four items on the menu that were "86'd")). We ordered house wine in a carafe for $21 that was not very good at all.  I picked an appetizer which(after checking again) was sold out, also. My Girlfriend picked an entree (which after checking Again - yes again) was now sold out. We were hungry and finally received a slice of bread each and some olive oil (about 20 mins into the meal).
 Everything was "ala carte".. A simple salad  was quite pricey. My Gfriend got a pasta dish which was a skinny dish with approx. 8 - 10 Raviolis). I settled on a burger which was not bad. We ordered creme brulee and bread pudding which were rather small portions but tasted good. I felt that they were expensive for what you received. 

Also, we were sat near the kitchen and the walls were quite dirty around the kitchen entrance. The ceiling tiles above were dingy and the place just looked outdated. I felt like I was eating @ an old diner.I spent over $120 in there and left hungry and dissatisfied.

Overall I was not impressed with the London Grille. I used to live in the Art Museum Area and always preferred Rembrandts.

Sat at the bar stool nice there was only 2 of us.  Vibe was decent.  Food was surprising good.  Bar staff was good at recommending drinks but was inattentive for everything else.  We ask for a minute to look at menu.  It took multiple attempts flag down someone.  Probably a lot of fun on game day.

I like this place, I do. The price is perfect for those not looking to do wallet damage on a quick lunch break, it's really convenient to both my weekday full time job and part-time weekend job, and the menu options are pretty much endless. I don't want three stars to scream "it's just middle of the road" because it's not if I could lean a little higher in the 3.5 range I would, to me it's literally the definition of A-Ok, not bad but not terrific.

I went in armed with the knowledge that these are big beefy hot dogs and offerings of other assorted types of sausage, also that the dogs here are boiled instead of grilled. I already know that my preference is a thin dog of the New York streetside variety, and I also know that I generally prefer a hot dog to be grilled; I wanted to give this its fair shot though and so on my lunch break over the weekend I headed over.

There are a ton of predetermined concoctions with a single dog running in the $3-4 area while the combo is somewhere in the $6-8 area, perfect for the wallet watchers. Many reviews talk about the Adonis which looked interesting enough, but I last minute decided to go with a "California Dreamin'"...a dog topped with avocado, tomato, and a lemon mustard vinaigrette. I went for the gold and made it a combo with fries and a malt vinegar aioli and a soda rounding out my total to less than $8. A trip to the in-house ATM remedied the fact that this is a cash only establishment and I took my to-go order back to work.

First thing I noticed, a mixed up soda order. While not a deal breaker, I was really hoping for that Dr. Pepper over the Root Beer...when you drink soda as infrequently as I do, these little treats and subsequent mishaps can make a heart sad. Second, the fries are pretty decent...certainly a dippable fry that can withstand a drag through a hefty dipping sauce, but nothing terribly exciting. Third, the hot dog itself? Well, you can't always sway a girl with a love for the grill, I wanted to love it but it was almost too meaty for a hot dog....is that possible? The avocado was nice and fresh, the tomato mixed in was a nice guac-like combination, but it seemed the lemon mustard dressing got a little lost. The presentation was nice, the gentleman at the counter (possibly the owner?) was very proud of the work that went into the dog as he made it a point to show me before closing up the box. Really nice employees, but in the end that didn't really salvage the so-so(ness) of my lunch.

Maybe I should have gone with the Adonis, maybe the lamb and chicken sausage is where it's at. For the price, I wouldn't mind giving it another shot, there are a number of sausage and veg friendly options that I can see myself venturing towards, I just don't think these are the hot dogs for me.

Went here for the first time on a first date (yikes, right!) but it was good! I read yelp reviews before coming, and I laughed when I saw the homeless guy in the parking lot, just like yelp told me. Thanks yelp! haha! Anyways, surprise number one: they have sushi! I was like whaaaa! who woulda thought! I got the chicken flat bread and it was so very good! Best part of the meal was the chocolate chip cookie & ice cream and I'd go back JUST to have that it was to DIE for. Service was great, loved the waiter, he was attentive and awesome. Not sure about price because my date paid, but I think my dish was $12.

This is hands down my new favorite steakhouse in town! The food was out of this world delicious and cooked to perfection! The staff was amazing and knowledgeable. Great rustic steakhouse feel paired with fine dining. Prices were competitive with other steakhouses in town. Shout out to Charlee and her staff!

Hey, it's a dark sports bar in a strip mall that serves pretty good bar food.  You can't go wrong with any of the hamburgers or chicken dishes.  Draft beer is fresh and tasty. and the service and people there are all friendly.

The only reason I order the Slipper Salad is for the panko crusted feta cheese balls.  Didn't receive those today with my take out salad.

Also I have to complain about it here since there is no direct line to the restaurant.  You have to use their voice mail hell (they think they're the bank or the phone co) to get through to the appropriate location.  Annoying for someone who works down the street and just wants to order take out.

I think this is location is par for the course with other Red Lobsters that I've been too.  Really busy but not special at all and kinda a mess.  I wouldn't have picked here by my bf was obsessed with the crabfest promotion they currently have.  

Our server John was nice and I felt for him because he said tonight was the fourth double shift in a row he had to work but he lagged on EVERYTHING.  I ordered a strawberry margarita and it wasn't until after our salads came out that he brought it.  Also, my boyfriend spilled his beer and we needed more napkins which we asked about and never got.  Finally my dad just asked the greeter if we could get more and she gave us a huge stack.  

The biscuits are amazing as I remembered and John did great in bringing us more when we needed it. The margarita was pretty tasty too.  The food was kinda bland, but then again I love seafood restaurants that do fresh seafood and have spoiled myself.

The decor is rad. However, the service is the worst I've ever experienced. After our first round of drinks our waitress disappeared for over 30 minutes, I had to approach the hostess stand to find out if her shift had ended or what. This was followed by a very confused look and a "....I'll go find out out." 15 minutes later a different waitress shows up saying ours had gone home for the evening. Okay moving on. At this point 4 more people had joined our table and had to get 2 rounds of drinks from the bar because we were waitress-less. (Side note there was only one bartender at 6 pm on Saturday when our friends attempted to order, later more showed up). Our food is dropped off by a runner, no sauces for our burger/fries, no offers for refills. Still no waitress. When the waitress Alexis does stop by she's curt and borderline rude. Instead of staying and having more drinks I've had it and ask for the check. Alexis comes back and has no idea what we ordered because she's not the original waitress, so we tell her and 2 couples check out and leave. We later find out from the rest of our group that after we left Alexis tried to approach them and claim that we had not paid for several items-that we had not ordered! 
All in all the idea is great but I will not be back until there are serious changes to the staff. There's other places in Tampa where you can get decent service. If I were you, I'd go there.
Edge Brewing is a hidden gem! I love the food and the prices aren't bad. The staff is usually great, and the atmosphere is wonderful. Definitely recommend giving this place a try.

What an amazing place. The decor, the food, the atmosphere, the staff...all of it was fantastic. I can't wait for the weather to break to experience their patio. They've got an excellent view of the city at night!

Yummmmm delicious! The chicken tenders were amazing...the batter for frying is thick so the chicken comes out with a nice, thick breading while staying moist. The fries also tasted very good. The best part about all of this is that this place is open until midnight, even on sunday! If you're looking for a late night treat, head to crown fried chicken. Oh yea, they have amazing slices of cake for sale as well :) :)

This was close to our place we were staying at for a week.Came in on a Wednesday night. One of the nicer local bars we have been in . Clean and a nice juke box . They serve food but we just had a couple of beers.A hour outside of closing though the bartender seemed like she was ready to go home early and seemed a little annoyed that we asked for another beer.

This place sucks. On one visit, out of the major sauces. On another visit, not open when they're supposed to be. On another try, gonna take 3 hrs for a to-go order. On the last visit, couldn't order online, called it in, didn't make it. Could not find my order. Did not offer any restitution.
Service is much better, everyone enjoyed their food. Mine was ok, not hot. Usually the pretzels are fresh and piping out. I think they were premade and sitting around .

We have been here multiple times and the food and the service is always good. The reason why I gave them 2 stars is because the sent an offer for a black Friday deal for eclub members. We live about 17 miles away and we planned our day to be able to take advantage of the advertised deal. When we arrived, they stated the deal was off. Nothing in the offer stated "limited quantities" or "while supplies last." I inquired about a rain check and I was told they weren't honoring the deal any longer. I sent emails to mgmt with no response. We still had dinner there  which was good but very disappointed in the customer service. We will think twice about driving across the bridge for dinner.

Bathrooms were thrashed, literally poop smeared on surfaces. No toilet paper and the hostess seemed uncaring when told about it. 
"Blackened Grouper" was just a filet in the middle of a plate with no garnish. I know just presentation but come on. The fish was slimy with a weird texture and it was not blackened like in some of the photos. It was browned but not in a good or pretty way. All the rest of the dishes was subpar for the prices. 
1 item of $200 worth of food was pretty good. The filet bites in the black and blue sauce was great. 
I say 2 1/2 stars.
Really nice staff and delicious fresh food.  I had the Crispy Chicken with the house made spicy sauce.  It was great.  The dill popcorn sample was a nice treat.

I have visited BC in the past during beer crawls, Bastille Day festivals & a few Happy Hours w/friends.  I have always felt the vibe was easy & chill...nice neighborhood bar.  

I like the craft beer & food oprions.  This visit I had some food..the chicken spring rolls and Old Bay fries.  It passes the test of good pub food.  In tbe past I have had the burger and it was tasty too.  The prices are reasonable and the staff are friendly- worth a visit.

Noontime at Cafe 615 is a wonderful way to get into a time machine,back to your Mom's kitchen.  Each weekday offering is different and leaves one more than satisfied.   The waiters are nice and helpful as to your possible selection.  I come here once or twice a week,   I get a notice on FB with photos of what I might like,  now if this smart phone could have smell that would be great!

I have been putting this off for several months now. My husband went out of his way made reservations at Ruth Chris for our 39th anniversary! We ordered the large steak that we both share it cost 90.00+ . When we received our steak we did not realize how bad it was. As we started to eat we started spitting out fat into a cloth napkin. As we proceeded to try to eat .
our steak we kept cutting off fat! The worst steak I have ever eaten in any place! We called the server over and explain to him it was under 39th Anniversary, I myself did not want to ruin it for my husband that worked so hard to make me happy and feel loved on our special day! I said very calmly to the server and showed him the fat in our napkins as well on our plates!  He said he would be right back. To my surprise he wouldn't give us a name who he talked to. He said he reported it to whoever and told them about the fat that he saw. The server told us that they apologize for it! We couldn't evev finish eating our dinner! We proceeded to try to talk to the server nicely. He came up with well I didn't tell them which table it was so you won't get embarrassed! Really who says and does this? I myself did not want to make a scene in the restaurant do to my husband look very sad that he brought me to the place I've always wanted to go and that was my first time going to make me happy and proud and loved. It turn to be a disaster!! Instead of going looking for management...I decided or I should say we decided just leave and not tell anyone that that place is worth to eat at! We just left the restaurant. Several of our friends and family asked, how our dinner was for our Anniversary. I was not going to lie to them. I told them everything! And they were surprised and they decided not to take the chance to go there to eat. As well as I'm assuming they probably told others . I know I should never assume! I will never ! never! Recommended this place to eat! I will go somewhere else and spend hundred plus dollars to eat like my husband I love doing..this Restaurant will always be out of the picture for us and family to have a dinner! My point is why couldn't somebody other than the server, come over and talk to us about our steak and see what we have on our plates and in our napkins that's all I wanted. If you decide to eat at Ruth Chris watch what you order. We may have just gotten a bad steak! I don't know because I'm never going back! Now several months down the road it'll be my 40th anniversary. That would have been a great place to have and celebrate our 40th anniversary with friends and family with the location and the beauty of everything.Thank you for NOT letting my husband and I to have special memory on our 39th Anniversary! Also it would be nice if I would get a text or email from management to explain what happened here to my husband and I .

3.5 stars. I felt that it was above average.  I really liked the sauce they had going for their burger.  Their chicken sandwich wasn't bad, either. You pretty much just walk in, place your order at the counter, and sit down. I liked how they offered alcoholic beverages here. The customer service was pretty good.
Every time we go the place is always full have not had a bad experience the food is always good and portions are large great value for your money!
Our server Pam aka Pamdenmic was so great!!! Great sense of humor and very friendly.  She was a breath of fresh air.  Great food also
Got the all american mac n chz for my first time here and it was SO CHEESY. Almost to cheesy! Wow! Definitely will be coming back in the future to try a different kind. Service was nice and fast

My husband and I drove by here one day and thought the place looked cool so we ended up coming back for dinner a few weeks later. There was no wait and we were promptly seated. 

I ordered the she crab soup. It tasted a little funky and was not as good as cream of crab soup that I'm used to and there was still crab shells in it. I ordered their "philly favorite" burger the second coming burger that was $15, it was way overpriced. The flavor of the burger itself was decent but the chopped tomatoes they put on it did not compliment the burger. I felt like the burger needed something else to it, and the roll was very greasy. My stomach also began to hurt as I was eating, and then I got heartburn/ acid reflux. I forced myself to finish my burger because it was so expensive, even though I felt like I wanted to throw up. My husband was not impressed with his either and it made him have to go to the bathroom all night. 

Like I said before, anytime I see the word "famous" or "favorite" or  "special" now, I think I'm just gonna consider that meaning overpriced, overated, and just order a different option instead. I knew I should have ordered the pour house deluxe burger instead. My friend told me she ordered that burger at PJ whelihan's and it was really good, but they took it off the menu. I am curious and almost want to give this place another try to try that burger, but I don't know if I can do it. 

Our waitress was very slow, and spent most of the time flirting with the guy's  table next to us, I guess she thought they would give her a huge tip. This isn't hooters. They do have alot of beers on draft. If we ever went back it would be just for beer not food, but probably not.
Took order of customers in front of us and then told us they were closing. Business operation is below cleanliness required for restaurant business and employees are disrepectful

Went to this restaurant PJs on vacation food was so-so but was very disappointed with the waiter they are very rude when he bring me the check and I paid and left a $10 tip which was was 13% he Brong back out the bill and circled the gratitude and put stars by it for 20% and was demanding be careful with the service here!!!!

Been to Liberty Bell a few times. a diner in the old tradition of diners in look and menu options with a good local following.  Basic diner food served in huge portions with soup and salad added on to boot.  Have never had breakfast, but definitely on our list of things to try.

Held a baby shower here recently for my daughter .  Marissa was very helpful in the planning and I think everyone enjoyed themselves.  We used the main dining room and bar area.  The brunch food we chose was plentiful and mostly yummy although the grits were a bit bland .  We had sampled the shrimp and grits which were very good when scouting the place but the cheesy grits I had on that date
Did not compare - however the rest of the food - including sausage , bacon , eggs and pancakes was yummy .  I wish their pastries included some kind of iced cinnamon roll mostly because that's a favorite of mine but also because it would have been more festive than the small muffins which were a
Bit dry - the glazed donut/ roll was good though .  The only real issue was that the drink station - serve themselves coffee and hot water in thermal vessels and juices plus champagne to make mimosas - was not out until about 30 minutes after guests arrived -- and the juice carafes were very small - almost like what you'd place on one table so kept needing refill ( I think when it appears like there is only a small amount guests will be influenced to not tAke much out of politeness so should look plentiful ) also twice when I went for coffee it was empty -- although they did refill it when asked .  
The staff was very pleasant - the bartender was helpful and good about our taking up his entire bar top .  
I'd highly recommend this as a party venue or just as a good brunch place

Tried LION'S HEAD BAR & GRILL in Milmont Park where Durty Nelly's used to be. All I can say is it was fantastic. Food was delicious, portions were huge and the staff was friendly, informative and attentive. We split as an appetizer the Chicken and Funnel Cake. It was fantastic! Fried chicken pieces coated in Thai chili sauce and funnel cake fries dusted in powdered sugar served with a side of sweet corn sauce and two small wheels of corn on the cob as garnish. Everything on this plate was awesome down to the corn garnish (yep ate that too!). It's a great twist on chicken and waffles and come on who doesn't like funnel cake??? The dipping sauce had a very subtle hint of corn not overpowering. The main dishes we ordered were the Apple Brie Grilled Cheese and Mac & Cheese with Pulled Pork. The grilled cheese was great. It was brie, cheddar, bacon, caramelized onions and sliced apples on toasted brioche. The flavor of everything melds together and it was huge. They have a bunch of sides to pick from. I chose the tater tots and got enough to feed a small family. The Mac and cheese was like everything else, huge and tasty. It's cavatappi pasta tossed with Parmesan, Monterey jack, cheddar, smoked mozzarella and brie cheese. You can get it plain, with chicken, pulled pork or bacon. When they add the meat to it they don't just plop it on top they actually mix it all in and I loved that. It was served with delicious garlic bread. Everyone we encountered was very pleasant and welcoming... Michelle our server, Pat the owner/manager and a hostess which I unfortunately did not get the name of. I'll definitely be back. Tons of great stuff on the menu to try. Sorry for being lengthy but I like details!

Don't be intimidated by the bar area up front, there is seating outside in the back which I preferred. Also know that there menu gets modified slightly, which is good because it appears they have a chef not a cook. But being a chef, like most artists,  modification requests were difficult, but they did combine the crawfish and gator in an appetizer for me. It was better with hot sauce. The Gumbo is excellent (wish I had ordered a bowl vice a cup) and red beans and rice also left me wanting more.

I recommend both the French Quarter Mule and the Mint Julep if you need a refreshment on a hot NOL day. 

And whatever you do get the bread pudding (no vile raisins ) to share, and ask for a scope of ice cream with it. 

Service was pleasant, professional, and honest

Highly Recommend. I would come again. Not 5 star because I can't say I would fly my wife just to eat here or eat here every night.

I had brunch here this past Saturday morning with dear friends during our visit for the Meharry Commencement and Alumni Reunion, and I absolutely loved it.  The service was great and the food was delicious.  They are located on the ground level of the Omni Hotel downtown and offer a brunch buffet and an a la carte menu.  I was really impressed with the pickled okra, which is one of my favorite vegetable snacks, which speaks to the city and country feel of this restaurant and Nashville in general--a little bit country and a little bit city.  Kitchen Notes is highly recommended for a delicious Saturday afternoon brunch with family and friends.  You will not be disappointed.
First and last time. Just finished breakfast. No biscuits or gravy in this market hard to believe. Potatoes were way too salty. My wife's fruit bowl-about half edible. Back to Cracker Barrel

I like Daisy Duke's on the whole, so I don't want my review to sound overly negative. I appreciate the convenience of their locations outside of the quarter, their hole-in-the-wall vibe that I dig for my morning coffee and breakfast, and that menu prices are reasonable. After hitting a number of pricier places during our stay in town, it's good to have a low-key, reasonable priced option when you just want to tuck into a hot breakfast and coffee. That being said, it's a meal, not a destination. Pretty much everything on the menu is a Waffle House clone, from the pancakes to the hash browns. Their biscuits taste homemade, but the pancakes are straight from a mix, thin, and somewhat rubbery. I need my coffee in the morning and was so disappointed to see my only option for cream was artificial non-dairy stuff on the tables. To complete the array of synthetic condiments, the jellies and syrup are all of the artificial variety made from corn syrup, not the real stuff. The butter may actually be butter tho, but I was so bummed about the fake coffee creamer and corn syrup based pancake syrup that I didn't bother to look. They stay packed, so clearly as long as the food tastes ok despite what they're made from, the location is convenient, and funds are running low after eating at other higher quality establishments during a stay, this is good spot to hit when you just need to wake up and get some food in you.  (Three stars for the waitress telling me they do have real half and half for my coffee, going to get it for me, but never returning with it. Had to drink my coffee black.)

My youngest son used to work at one of their locations and I was was impressed with their menu. It was on my way to my wife' temporary abide in a medical facility and decided that I was tired of fast food for breakfast so I stopped in. Glad I did.  
I was about to order eggs Benedict with one of their umpteen flavors of hollandaise sauce when I returned to the front page of the menu and saw the liege waffle combo. I had the strawberry and whipped cream version with ham and hash browns. The order came quickly and it was delicious.

One of the best icecream stands in the area. Definitely worth a stop... whether you are passing by on your way to the shore or looking for something sweet on a humid jersey summer evening, this is your spot.  Love the icecream, my husband gets the milkshakes and they are amazing! There is a giant local produce stand next door that has flowers, veggies, fruit and canned goods (not to mention seasonal peach or apple cider).  We like to grab our groceries for the week and wander over to the stand for a post-shopping treat.  Enjoy!

I must not understand the hype about this joint. Ok, it's pretty decent for fast food - but really? Nothing special except maybe the box of peanuts to grab. Their 1/4lb burgers were satisfying enough and I can't imagine what the original burgers looked like. It's not In-N-Out, that's for sure. Maybe I went in with too high of an expectation. 

However, my family seems to really enjoy this place so maybe it'll grow on me. I'll give it another shot!
Love their rolls!!! Peanuts to snack on and their filet melts in your mouth!!!! I got a sweet potato instead of baked and it was yummy too!!

Where do I start, I ordered the southwestern omelette. It came out slightly warm and when I opened it there was a glob of picante sauce on one end. It tasted like it came out of a jar. The entire omelette was soaked in grease, I could not eat it.

Our waitress never refilled my coffee and my girlfriend's tea was never refilled.

Very disappointed and a place I would never recommend.

Took a day trip to philly during COVID (blah blah) Went to the zoo and had brunch at Sabrina's! Let me say, Philly is one of my favorite cities to visit/dine! I am also a lover of chicken and waffles! 
We ate outside due to the panoramic lol 
It was mouthwatering! Cannot wait to come back soon!

Just moved to the Vincentown area. Good food, ive come here for breakfast several times and been very satisfied with the service, food and atmosphere. Everything ive ever tasted has been great. Love the pancakes and pie.

The pros: 
Our waitress was fantastic. Explained the menu, offered suggestions, checked in at the right times but not too often. 
Food was great. I had shrimp that were cooked perfectly. My rice was a little underdone. 

The cons:
Made a reservation for 8:30pm. Arrived at 8:25, to a hostess who simply stared at us. We gave our name for the reservation but the hostess wasn't able to use the iPad until someone came to help her. We were given a buzzer & had to wait for 15 minutes- don't know why we bothered with a reservation. Another hostess came over asking what number our buzzer was because they'd been buzzing us "for a few minutes." Our buzzer never buzzed. We were the only ones in the waiting area by this time. Why didn't they ask us sooner?!  Throughout the dinner we swatted at gnats or fruit flies-not sure which. And unfortunately a family with a baby was seated in the booth behind us (I'm fine with babies!!). But they kept him occupied with kid shows with incredibly annoying, LOUD music--also ok keeping kids occupied in a restaurant but not ok with the disregard for other diners. We didn't say anything because we figured at least the child was quiet & content. Why anyone would take a one year old to a 9pm dinner is a mystery to me. I wish our waitress or management has said something to them. We were clearly not the only ones bothered. 

In summary: I'd give it another try. Ultimately things within the staff's immediate control get a 3.5 out of 5. The experience as a whole gets a 3.

Went to eat here since it was attached to our hotel. They messed up our order I ordered a well done burger and got my boyfriends medium well and vice versa. Waitress sucked therefore no tip for her. Wasn't impressed.

While waiting to order tonight, I noticed the cook was wearing his mask below his nose as he spoke with his coworkers while preparing food. When I pointed it out to a supervisor, the cook put the mask over his nose. I left, because I don't want to eat the cook's droplets; and if he could feel comfortable wearing his mask like that, it shows that management doesn't truly care about food safety during this dangerous time. I left without ordering anything. Dine at your own risk.

We had reservations this evening expecting to hear the piano player.  The hostess apologized after we had ordered to tell us that there was not a piano player this evening. The food was marginal.  I had the ribeye it was cooked to order but NOT flavorful.  I must say I am a bit disappointed.  The server and staff were great.  

Thanks Emeril's... but no thanks. I will not be back nor will I recommend.

Food was Applebee's quality... Very chain like and blah. Beer selection was good but expensive (20oz for $7.50) . Wait staff was decent. Average response times and typical banter with formulaic check ins. Atmosphere was good to watch sports in. Won't be visiting again. With what's close by I would recommend "the pub" if you were looking for a chill place with better service, food and beer.

Love the Chicago feel, they have ample seating, and a kids area. The food comes out quick! The wings are huge and meaty. We ordered the medium mega meat, talk about mega meat! The chucks of bacon were thick the meat was just piled on. The  crust was thick with the right amout of crispness to the bottom. We got a Pizookie for Desert, you cant go wrong with an oversized chocolate chip cookie nice and warm out of the oven drizzled chocolate and melted ice cream!

Stopped by for lunch after a morning of showing houses. It was busy at 11:30a, likely because it was Veterans Day. We were seated right away. The menu is perfect. If you can't find something you're not hungry. I had the Gyro and fries. The meat was tender and there was the perfect amount of tzatziki and red onion. French fries were perfect. My table mates had a BLt and the Greek Platter. No one was disappointed. I had sangria, yes at 11:30, lol and it was as good as I have had or made. We will definItely be back

I saw other reviews before going here for Mother's Day. Well, the food at the buffet was pretty decent and our waiter, Keith, was pretty courteous. 

Now for the bad stuff. Two things that I didn't like:

1. When you go here, tip them at least $20 or they'd likely blacklist you. I saw Keith and another waiter talking bad about this woman with a young son leaving them a $5 tip when she left before we did. It doesn't matter how much your primary bill is, if you don't tip them well, they will get upset.
2. The bathrooms were dirty as sin. I'm surprised there wasn't a mouse gnarling on some cheese while I was using the bathroom.

Had a reservation for dinner here last night... My husband and I were going to the Merriam Theater and wanted to eat somewhere close by. EVERYTHING WAS AMAZING! The restaurant itself is beautiful. Our waiter was attentive, friendly, and had great recommendations on what to order. The food was incredible! Appetizers, entrees and deserts -- all delicious! Will definitely be back again for specials occasions!

This is the best little bar I've ever been to. At first we couldn't find it because it was on the front side of the plaza but with a little determination we found it. It is really small on the inside but the ambiance and music makes the atmosphere inviting. The lighting was perfect and the waitstaff was very friendly and courteous. I had no idea what to order from the creative drink menu so the waitress suggested a drink. It turned out to be very good. Hubby had a house drink...well three. Let's just say he enjoyed his as well. We were expecting a full menu so we went with our appetites. The menu was more of a appetizer menu but we ordered three and we were not disappointed. Everything was delicious but the bacon wrapped figs were the best. 

I wouldn't say it's a place to hang out or go to every weekend but if you're looking for a great specialty drink and a great appetizer this is the place.

Why is it that restaurants feel no need to cut lettuce up for their salads?  You're not supposed to have to use a KNIFE on your salad, but at most places, you do.  I had the Seafood Salad and chose the Pear Tree Vinaigrette for my dressing.  It tasted GREAT.  Just really HATE that the lettuce could touch each ear on the way into my mouth.
Good food for the money. It's the one place that my picky family can go and no one complains. Great breakfast. Sometimes you can luck up and skip the wait but it's worth it.

Came here on a Friday afternoon. No place to park downtown. It was a NIGHTMARE - stay away, way over priced average food that just isn't worth the pain in the ass that parking is. Very misrepresented from triple D

Ugh. Was craving a salad after a Saturday AM work-out, but after perusing the menu at Prep and Pastry, I decided to get the poutine. Which is like, the opposite of a salad. Well it's kind of a salad except you substitute greens for french fries, feta cheese for a large layer of melted cheese curds, and balsamic vinaigrette for gravy made from duck fat...

But this poutine was worth every calorie. I've had poutine before in Quebec and while this isn't exactly authentic, it's so delicious that it makes me not care that it's not authentic. There are two interesting twists: bits of pork belly and over-easy eggs, both of which enhance the dish. The fries are freshly cut and perfectly crisp, and the duck fat gravy...  man, I could just take a bath in it. My only complaint is that instead of the cheese curds being separate squeaky little bites, they end up all melted together as one thick layer of cheese under the eggs.

And they serve up quality coffee from Exo, a swift kick in the face for your Saturday morning (that's a good thing, if you can't tell!). They encourage you to get cocktails but I was still suffering a minor hangover from the night before (what's new?) so I abstained.

My friends got the pork belly breakfast sandwich and the Monte Cristo (a savory sandwich with french toast as the bread, yum!) and there were 0 complaints there.

Decor is rustic but also trendy, down to the glassware they use. Service is attentive. Some minor negatives: not enough room in the parking lot for the typical Saturday AM (ended up parking on the street) and a 20 minute wait turned into a ~30 minute wait. But whatever, neither of these will prevent me from bringing all of my friends here again and again and again.

We came here on a whim not knowing what to expect and were very impressed. Vegetables were fresh and crunchy, plate presentations were appetizing and colorful, they cooked my steak perfect to order, local beers on tap with a decent selection overall, and prices rivaled chain restaurants. We'll be back with friends and family.
Just a fantastic place with great food all day every day, friendly service and cool owners! They also have freshly made pies daily that are Awesome!! Love this place!!

Excellent food. Upscale Southern take on comfort food. Highly recommend the BL and Green Tomato app. It would be a fine main plate with a side. Only downside is that the joint is pretty loud during peak hours. Not a great intimate conversation restaurant. Perfect for a 3rd date, not a first if you know what I mean.

I am currently sitting here with my family, after waiting almost an hour and a half, and we still don't have any food. If it wasn't for the manager, we wouldn't even have drinks. And if it wasn't for Eric, we probably wouldn't have even seen anyone to put our food order in (which was ordered almost an hour ago). We haven't even met a waitress yet, and other people just keep coming, eating, and leaving. It's very frustrating, I would not recommend this Dennys at all
Our pizza had clearly been dropped that we ordered Friday... very disappointed. If we hadn't had plans to leave right after I would have called right away but we were literally heading to an event

Excellent Italian restaurant next to our hotel West Beach Inn. Make a reservation!! We were there on Sept 30, 2020. Due to Covid we were on the side walk down a bit from the entrance, but it was still a pleasant experience. The Mai Tai Spritzer drink was amazing. Great service, served bread and butter sprinkled with pink sea salt. Even though it was loud with traffic driving by, they still made the ambiance a nice experience. Another couple being seated near us and asked to be moved closer to the restaurant, we didn't mind being down the sidewalk. They had to adapt for Covid, which is understandable. Seating was well spaced,   Well cleaned and staff were all masked. Food, excellent! Try the lasagne and roasted chicken. Won't be disappointed! Servers were fun with great personalities!!

Had a terrific lunch with friends at this place. Everyone was very happy with their choices...a few had been there before. Helen had the Potato Empanadas and loved them and several had the pear and chicken sandwich. I had the Champagne Mushroom Fondue and it was delicious! 

I would definitely go there again and highly recommend it to anyone.

Let's get it out of the way: Sky Blue Cafe is a hipster nightmare. If you're averse to a certain segment of the city, you may be a wee bit uncomfortable here. Walking in, prepare to see plastic glasses of various thickness and color, facial hair of various lengths, jeans tighter than men should ever want to wear, and various other accoutrements of the hipster battle armor. It's true. But if you can get past all of that, you'll discover one of the better breakfasts and lunches in the metro area. For food this good, you can put up with uncombed hair. You can.

I say all this and recognize that my opening moments at the Cafe were rough. I was meeting a friend for lunch and to talk shop and things were unnecessarily tense from the beginning. Because we were there for a late(r) lunch on a Friday, there was no wait and, surprisingly, there were multiple available seating arrangements. Despite this, we were seated in the doorway. It was a particularly cold early spring day and the constant 'whoosh' of frigid air wasn't doing it for me, so I asked if we could move to the center/communal table or to a four top (the ones in the corner were being used by parties of 2).

"I can't move you."

"Oh? But there's open seating."

"We have a party coming in that's going to sit there."

(internally) "Where's 'there'? The communal table? The four top?" (externally) "Oh, so you accept reservations now?"

"No, but a large party is coming in."

... "So, it's not first come, first served... ?"

"Ugh. Let me ask."

I was ready to leave. This entire exchange was an example of doing entirely too much. A new waitress came to greet us and sat us at the communal table. Whereas the former was curt and dagger eyes, this one was smiles and warmth. It made all the difference. I could understand if the dining room was at capacity but there was no need for any of the drama we went through to change seats. In case it wasn't obvious, we were there to spend money. Asking to be comfortable whilst doing so in a room that wasn't full shouldn't have been too much to ask.

Ahem. Had to get that out.

Once we changed seats and waitresses, the dining experience couldn't have been more pleasant. Despite planning on eating breakfast, I was seduced by the promise of the Beastwich. The name is not misleading. This is a massive beast of a sandwich. Come hungry. Come very hungry. Between two pieces of thick bread lay blackened chicken breast, bacon, carmelized onions, spinach, tomato, colby cheese, and hummus. This was a two-hand, take breaks, set it down for a little while sandwich... and I loved every bite. The sandwich came with a choice of side and since I was already clogging my arteries for the day, I decided on the chili cheese tots. Yep. It's true. I'm not embarrassed. In an effort to balance my gluttony, I made my own smoothie with banana, blueberry and strawberry. It came in a large glass and was filled to the top. It, like my sandwich and side, was very satisfying.

Coming to SBC on a weekend in search of food is a f00ls errand. Perhaps even coming here in the morning in the warmer months isn't the smartest of tasks. Definitely don't plan on coming here with a large group. All of the above paths lead to frustration and ruin. But if you can come by yourself or one other (tops) on an off-time, you'll be rewarded with kitsch comfort that will stick to your bones and live in your memory for quite a while. Even in light of the bumpy start, I'd gladly return for more of what the kitchen's putting out and recommend others do so as well. Just know what you're getting into.

I have 5 words to start off my review of Prime Stache and they are:
Strawberry Pineapple Vanilla Infused Vodka. 

If you're not a fresh fruit infused vodka fan (for whatever reason..), the beer selection is amazing and the other handcrafted cocktails are major wins.

The food is delicious and has a unique twist to it that makes this place a fresh stop in Old City. The atmosphere is perfect for everything from a first/second/third/whenever there's still a chance for awkwardness date to a get together with friends or an ever growing office dinner party. 

The wait staff is very knowledgeable, patient (with large groups) and efficient!
Great Bloody Mary and omelettes...black bean eggs Benedict wonderful ...but very sad to see their plantation pepper sauce has high fructose corn syrup...especially in New Orleans!

This place is great! Not only is it delicious but it benefits the community! And I have never once had a poor experience there.

I most frequently visit for their amazing Sunday brunch deal - unlimited french toast that is hot and fresh every time (not crappy buffet line food that sits there and gets cold) and is less than $4!! The french toast itself is almost always perfect (occasionally the crust is a bit tough for my personal preference but it has never bothered my husband or other people we dined with), and features a nice cinnamon sugar sprinkle. 

The mimosas are a great deal compared to many brunch spots - $3 each for a tall glass and they are usually pretty bubbly, often with a strawberry on the rim (see my picture - these were stiff and the strawberries were gigantic!). They also have a couple of beer options for only a buck if that is more your preference!

When I have tried lunch it was fantastic too! I had the pot roast dip and it was perfectly cooked, the combination of toppings was excellent and the au jous was tasty! I also tried a bite of my friend's sandwich and that was great too (not sure which it was though). The prices may seem a little steep for a sandwich, but not really when you see the portion size and consider that your purchase just donated a whole sandwich to a local shelter!

Went for a brunch while visiting Tampa for spring break. We made reservation just in case it was crowded based on the other Yelp review, so we had no problem being seated.  We ordered their daily special, Cali Eggs Benedict, southern burrito, and egg breakfast. The eggs benedict was excellent. Fresh vegetable and hollandaise sauce was perfect and delicious. My husband had the burrito and said it was one of the best he had. Even my daughter who is usually very picky said it was really good. Loved the atmosphere and everyone there were very friendly and accommodating.

I loved it in Lafayette Hill and frequent less since the Conshy move but the times I have been were overall a good experience.  Variety menu, large portions and good food.  Wine selection could improve.  Have dined for lunch, dinner and at the bar all consistently good.  Love the main dining room during the holidays - so fun & festive.  Server staff has been great.  The bar experience depends on who you get, few times it has been poor with attitude.  Large Bar with several large tvs & a good place to watch games.

Can't go wrong with this place. Food has always been great and consistent. 
The staff is very polite and that goes a long way with me.

Just had lunch with a group of six ladies with lots of special requests which our server handled mostly with ease; the kitchen fouled her up with only one! My fave, and others, Wedge Salad is now called a BLTA Chopped Salad--same delish ingredients, slightly different presentation. Three of us ordered extra blue cheese and extra blue cheese dressing because we are blue fanatics, many would find it a delight as on menu. Burger, mushroom ravioli, and interesting special of the day salad rounded out our orders. We shared the totally amazing, delicious, unusual, satisfying, awesome and creative TAMAL DE CHAMPIÑONES! Try the new menu choices is my recommendation to all regular (old?) customers and new, you will not be disappointed! I'm trying the lamb gnocchi on my next happy hour visit! Oh, and the Renegade Rosé is really nice!!

Came for lunch on a Thursday. We were literally the only table until almost the end of our meal when one other table came in. It looks very fancy inside and has nice waterfront views. We were able to choose whichever seat we wanted. 

The server and manager were both extremely friendly and attentive. 

There is no valet parking because it isn't really necessary at lunch time so you can just park out front. The valet parking sign is still displayed though which I found confusing but my Dad didn't think it was a big deal and he knew to pay no attention to the sign. If you are a first timer, though, I think it's confusing. 

There were a lot of lunch specials. We had buffalo mozzarella with arugula and a balsamic glaze. It was ok. It was kind of bland and the arugula was pretty bitter. I've had better elsewhere. They served a basket of breadsticks and they were literally burnt so I was surprised they served them to us. Also pretty flavorless. I got the classic Regina pizza which was very delicious. Light and thin so it didn't bog me down and make me feel super full. The crust had good flavor. My Dad got Veal which he enjoyed. We did not get dessert. 

I would return!

This is literally the best restaurant in Doylestown! The only thing consistent about MOM's food & drink menu is that it is delicious. The Salads, Flatbreads, & OMG Fried Chicken is so good I could eat here everyday. Be sure to ask your server what they recommend, because you might not be in the mood for a Braised Short Rib or Pan Fried Pork Chop, but you will certainly be glad you ordered it!

Gosh, I really want to increase the number of stars for Fords but after several visits - and tvery good meals with exceptional service - I've got to say, the music is just too loud.

Love the food, and I've never had a service issue.  But maybe turn down the music just a notch.

The service here was very good! Our server was on top of everything, brought out extra fries without asking and even gave us strawberry lemonade in to go cups for the road.

I opted for the Keep it Simple Veggie Burger and it was good. Next time I'll probably opt for cheese or mayo or something as it was very "simple." Hence the name. Some jalapenos would have made this excellent instead of good! That's not their fault though as that's what I ordered.

Pro tip: It's a bit off Irvington toward the back of the new shopping complex, right across from Hobby Lobby.

All in all I had a good experience and the food was good. I'll be back!

Visiting from Nebraska and SO excited to experience this gem!  Incredible food (we had the omelette) and the service was spot on. The unique setting and decor were a prefect fit for the whole experience!

Really awesome lunch menu!

I have to caveat this review with the fact that I learned that we were under mandatory evacuation for Hurricane Irma right before we got here for lunch. Therefore, the meal tasted like hopelessness and despair. (I kid, I kid, but it definitely put a damper on this meal!) The fact that this place still gets five stars is a testament to its awesomeness!

Yes, you can spend an arm and a leg at dinner, but at lunch the prices are beyond reasonable! My husband got a personal pizza (which was $11) and I got the lobster roll (at market price it was $21 which was definitely one of the most expensive things on the menu. Everything else was in the $10-$15 range). 

Testament to the service is the fact that I was on my phone for half the meal talking to my dad about booking a flight to Houston (what irony to escape Irma by going to Houston which was just devastated by Harvey) and the waitress never batted an eye about my exceptional rudeness. It didn't even deter her from doing the normal waitress things like checking in on us. 

The lobster roll was overflowing with lobster. The $21 price tag was entirely justifiable. I thought the bun was perfectly buttered and the apple slaw was a great complement. 

I think this place is great for lunch! Best thing is, you can make reservations on Yelp. Definitely do that! We went at 12:45 p.m. and it was moderately full. (This was also on a day that everyone should have been preparing for a hurricane so the fact that it was still pretty full makes me wonder how packed it is on a normal day). 

This is one of my new favorite lunch places.

The Lester's in CWE is a great place to catch a Cards, Rams, SLU Billikens, or Blues game and enjoy fairly cheap beer and good food.  I've been impressed with both the buffalo chicken wrap and the BBQ nachos, while the spinach-artichoke dip left me a little disappointed.  They have a really cool rooftop terrace that not many people know about. They also have outdoor seating on the sidewalk in front of the restaurant. The service is usually decent, but they always seem to be understaffed.  

Though Lester's isn't exactly the hip place to go on the weekends, it's a great place to enjoy a cheap drink -- they have a late night happy hour on Friday and Saturday nights ($1 off drafts and $4 wells/wines).  Like every other place in the CWE, they have last call around 1-1:15. 

Pros: good food, late night happy hour, tons of TV's
Cons: usually understaffed, not too exciting of a place on weekend nights

Today was the first time I tried this place. I have to say, it was an excellent experience. The service staff was extremely attentive, especially our server, Mike. The menu has so much variety and is comprised of all fresh ingredients. The drink menu is great, too! They use all fresh juices! I will definitely be coming back!!

Arrived by water, seated outside, but waited 20 minutes for a server on a Friday afternoon. Fast food , scallops ok, better places to visit on the same stretch of Gulf Blvd. nice docking ...

Enhance menu to include king crab, better choices of premium seafood. We do live in Fl.

I am completely perplexed by the horrible reviews on this place. We went in Monday 2/16 and had a late lunch. Went with my BF mother and myself. We were in town visiting with her. 

We had experienced a lot of places in just that short time there but I have to say I was immediately impressed with the decor inside and the place is HUGE! So yea the wait staff was a little off that day, the one girl was training someone new and the accuracy for the order taking was a little hit and miss but not enough for me to give anything negative. 

I liked the food  I only had the fries but they were good. BF had a the Big ASS tuna and mom had the Ruben sammy and was supposed to get soup but got a salad instead. We did tell the staff about that later but reassured them we didn't need one to go or to make up for it as mom would not have eaten it. 

Overall good food and drinks, I would go back again. I tend to go and check places out despite reviews, since we all have an opinion on what happens on any given day. In conclusion a great experience and I would  go back!

Still a winner with craft brews, smiling faces and killer burgers. 

Today I popped in for Happy Hour (daily from 2-6 and again from 9-lights out) thinking I wanted some Osso Buco Riblets for $5 along with with $1 off excellent draft. I was persuaded by the guy next to me after seeing his big, juicy, capable of a super model sliding around the hood of a white Jag while being sprayed down with water advert, burger. And the winner is the Pearl Street Blues burger with onion, mushrooms and blue cheese. Medium rare as it should be, it's liquid of love requiring multiple wipes from the cotton napkin. Lust at first bite. So it was good is what I'm telling you. 

My second brew was a choice pick from Great Divide, their Hercules Double IPA. Not my first time partying with this hulk of hops. Delicious.

With great selections of beers (love that the chick next to me tried to order a Corona) and scrumptious burgers, why would you now what to be the Duke, or Duchess, of Eureka!?

Jump and the deep end and get wet. 
Cheers

This place has several kinks to work out service wise. We walked in and sat down 9:45 on a Saturday night and immediately were told they'd already had last call. We clearly looked confused. Then the hostess handed us a drink menu. Again, we were confused. I then asked if she meant the kitchen had stopped serving food and she said yes. (Maybe say that instead of "we already had last call," as we had no intentions of ordering food anyway.) Next we noticed a nicer table than the two seater that just faces a wall had opened and we asked if we could move to after it was cleaned.  The waitress cleared the table for us, but it was never wiped down. Another bartender approached our table and asked if our order had been taken. My boyfriend had gotten up to see what beers were on draft and so I began to say "I think my boyfriend is going to do the draft beer and I'll have..." But before I could order anything the sever was gone to find my boyfriend and sell him a card, never taking my order. Later the waitress came back and took my order. In the mean time my boyfriend used his card to get a 14 oz pour, but it came out maybe 4 oz. Beer and the rest foam. The bartender told him he poured it wrong. My boyfriend has 14 years of bartending experience. This bar is very neat and has a great concept, the service staff is just needs more training.

I love this place. This was my second visit. The music is absolutely great. It is a minimum of one drink per set. It is a bit loud so if you want to chat, I would advise you to sit further in the back. Service was excellent. We did not eat but the food looked like basic pub food.

Hey! P J Clark's has reopened and serving great food. This is a good place for seafood dishes. The drinks are generous and you get a good pour.
They had been shut down for several months during the pandemic. If you're looking for a nice outdoor table overlooking the Independent Mall parks, this place is perfect. 
Make sure you get a table atop the patio steps.

My favorite place to grab a drink.  Can't say enough good things about the nighttime bartenders (Scotty, Gabe and Efrem).  

Love the nachos and the beignets.  It's a great bar to sit and hangout with your friends.

I will start with the negatives first as it is always nice to end with the positives. Service was chaotic and very slow. The time between our meal order and delivery was 45 minutes for a few burgers and a sandwich. The order came out wrong and was missing parts of what the menu said came with the meals. My son ordered no salt as he has a low sodium tolerance and you can guess what happened. My wife's burger was just cheese and bacon where it was supposed to come with the normal accoutrements. 
Now on to the positives. We were seated quite rapidly and our beverage order was taken and filled. Nice selection of beers. When the waitstaff did finally come by to check on us we explained the errors to which she apologized and comped a slice of chocolate torte. Still for what the meal cost and the amount of time it will be a while before we return.

I ate lunch here the other day and boy was I happy I did. The atmosphere is not quite a diner, but it's nice. The menu has a lot of great things on it and I felt a bit overwhelmed about what to try! I ended up with the truffled onion soup and boy was the good! It was thick and hearty and so very yummy! It was big enough that I was full after, but I went on the eat my strawberry ricotta salad since I ordered it. I had high expectations for the salad, but it failed to succeed. Although not awful, it wasn't great. I felt the dressing wasn't quite right maybe. 

My dining partner got the meatloaf which he thought was yummy. The potatoes that came with it and the chicken corn chowder was also yummy. They bring out a bread basket before dinner with whipped butter and fresh bread baked locally. I like that as well.

I loved the fact that they have a loyalty club card. I loved the fact that they utilize local goods!  I found the service pretty fast and attentive. I will return to try more food!

My husband and I took my parents here over the Labor Day weekend.  The food was good.  Lobster bisque was delicious.  My mother loved her grouper dinner.  Lobster special was a little overcooked and dry.  

I'm giving this three stars primarily for the valet who left us standing for several minutes and had the nerve to pass us by when a young couple walked up and cut in front of us and the valet picked up their car ahead of ours.  The valet clearly saw us standing in the hot sun for several minutes and completely ignored us.  What makes matters worse is my Dad walks with a cane and is not able to stand for stretches of time.  Two thumbs down for the valet service and the rude way the valet ignored us.

8/17/20 first time there.  We had a party of 3, we ordered shrimp poboy, fried shrimp platter and shrimp and grits.  Service was fast, efficient, and everyone had on a mask even the kitchen staff we saw.  The food was delicious, plentiful and piping hot.  Kirsten was our server, very friendly and prompt service.  We live close by and will be going back often.
Ate here twice during our trip and loved it! We tried so many dishes and all were a hit. Next time we're back in town, we will definitely be eating here again

Yum!  Dry Dock Cafe is a must on restaurants to visit while in NOLA.  I am in love with their shrimp bisque!  Their cajun fries are good, and their Crawfish Maureenica is amazing (and it's also a huge serving!).  The couple of times that I have been, there has only been 1 - 2 servers, so the service can be slow.  However, the food is worth the wait!

If you are going with a large group of friends, they do not split checks (like most places in NOLA), so bring cash.

I'm a teeny person and normally teeny things suit me pretty well.  But this restaurant sadly did not.  I was seated upstairs with a friend and with the way the tables were set up, it was difficult not to get in and out without bumping into nearby tables.  I ordered the smaller crab cake plate and although I expected small I couldn't believe I was paying $20 for 3 potatoes, and a crab cake I could eat in one bite!  Yes, one bite.  I'm normally not someone who fusses over paying more for good food but I just felt silly paying that much for what I got.  Crab cake and potatoes were good, but sort of just okay.

The decor was also...odd.  I will admit I'm an aesthetics person so I'm probably being harsh but the decor could be defined as christmas lights, mirrors, and draped fabric.  And if you want to use the bathroom - oh my word.  So small.  

Based on my experience, it's not necessarily somewhere I'd recommend to another person immediately, but the people around me seemed to enjoy the food.

Not quite sure what happened to this restaurant. We used to come here a couple of times per month but haven't been here for about 6 weeks. My husband's meal was okay. He ordered the ribeye. There are better places to get a ribeye for the same price. Hence the two stars; his food was edible. Mine was a completely different story. I ordered the lobster and filet. On the positive side, the veggies were well prepared and well seasoned. Lobster was a bit fishy and things got worse from there. The filet, not sure it was a filet, was completely inedible. 1st it came out with gravy, ordered gluten and gravy free. 2nd time it came out looking like it had been wrung out to dry. Yuck! The fresh mashed potatoes took the cake though. I have never flat spit something out at the table but they were so gross I had to use my napkin. I didn't think it was possible to turn something so simple into a disgusting, watery, salty, and garlicky mess. Handed the plate to my spouse so he too could verify the disgusting nature of this, he smelled it and said no way am I putting that in my mouth. My vote-give this restaurant some time to focus on food quality before you stop by.

I'm being generous based my friends' experiences here and not my own.  

I had a literal cup of gumbo, which, while very tasty, cost $6!  There was plenty of shrimp and sausage, and it was just spicy enough for my liking, but the cup was tiny and should have been priced around $3.  Thankfully I had an orange in my bag to satisfy my hunger while my friends finished eating.  

Obviously I should have ordered breakfast between 6 and 9 am (huge portions for $4 what??!!), or possibly anything else on the menu, but c'mon, shouldn't everything be up to par?

Good spot to grab some beers and snacks. The truffle popcorn is great when you just want something to munch on. Trust me, the bowl won't last long. The crab dip and cheesesteak egg rolls are also solid choices.

Who doesn't love the chicken coop?

A million sauces to choose from, free ice cream, greasy fried chicken indulgence... there's really nothing else you could ask for.

I love the big patio, and the interior is very eclectically decorated.  The place has personality, for sure. 

The portions are big, so don't get anything bigger than the small basket unless you're planning to share.  I always think I can tackle it myself, but it always wins. 

The location is great and it's usually pretty easy to find parking.  It's just far enough off of Hillsboro not to be a cluster, but close enough to be near the action.

Breakfast!! Pulled pork or brisket on your egg and cheese sandwich, your omelet, or just on your plate with the usual breakfast stuff. And it's very good BBQ. FrIendly, comfortable, and filling. Now I have to come back for dinner.
MJ is an awesome bartender always makes solid drinks.  Place is clean and has a good atmosphere. Drinks are really fun and creative and food is super good!

I will save you the trouble: absolutely do not go here for a full meal. The view is awesome and I would be back for drinks and mayyyybe and appetizer, but my food experience was terrible. I'll start with the appetizers we got (not pictured). The baked brie was cold and solid at the core, with only the outsides being warm and gooey like a baked brie should be. The crab cakes we had weren't bad, but they were nothing special either. If I had to do it again, I'd have them bring out more of the sauce that comes on them, as that had pretty good flavor to spice up an otherwise pretty bland crab cake. 

The entrees are where things went from bad to ugly. I can make a steak at home better than what I had prepared for me with the filet mignon, and at a price of $45, the manager should be thrown in jail for theft. No flavor, poor meat quality, and to top it off, the brussel sprouts served on the side were so undercooked that they had a solid crunch to them like you were almost eating it raw. The mashed potatoes were the only thing I rather enjoyed in the meal, and you could even tell that the potatoes had been plated and had been sitting under a heating lamp while my steak was being prepared. We also had the macaroni and cheese as a side dish, and to call it a "truffle" mac n cheese is laughable. There was no truffle flavor in this side at all! My girlfriend said her prime rib was "good", but I think she was just saying that to be nice because of how much money I was spending on her birthday dinner here. 

On top of the poor food experience, our waitress was very unfriendly. As I mentioned before, the best strategy to employ with the Eagle's Nest is to go for a drink to enjoy the view, but get out before spending over a hundred dollars on piss poor food you can make at home.

Took the wife here for her birthday in December 2013. It was fantastic as advertised. Coming from DC, I wanted to show her wannabe foodie self just how much of a great food city my hometown is. 

Thanks to Vernick for truly representing the range of amazing food options this city has to offer. I don't remember the specific dishes (will edit later if I do), but literally everything we had was enough to induce a brain hemmorhage from total sensory overload. 

We will be most definitely be coming back, and will gladly deal with the drive to get there. 

Vernick is a near-perfect restaurant experience. Compared to the super trendy DC restaurant "Range", which she took me to for my own birthday a month earlier, Vernick wins that contest with its eyes closed. 

Last thing, I wouldn't take the "$$$" too seriously. Have a look at the menu. Range had the same designation when we went, and it was almost twice as much.

So glad that I discovered this place. Very fun and chill atmosphere. The food was delish and the servers awesome. I had the duck and my husband had the steak croissant. They make everything fresh, including pastries. If it's not hot I recommend eating outside.

I'll start off by saying the atmosphere in this restaurant is very nice. We had a reservation for 6 and were seated quickly.  The crab and artichoke dip and bacon wrapped shrimp are very good and worth a try. However the experience went down hill after that point. 

One steak plate was brought out cold, two medium steak plates came out rare, were sent back for review and came out medium rare instead of medium. We asked for the manager, who never introduced herself, thought coming to the table and making a joke would be a good idea.  Unfortunately, when 3 people out of 6 have issues with their food it is not a good time for jokes.  I guess the 3rd time is the charm because they finally did come out correctly. 

We were comped for the two plates and we were also offered desserts which was very nice. I would also like to add that my medium rare steak and crab cake Were cooked perfectly and tasted amazing. 

The food when cooked correctly is easily a 4 out of 5, but the manager's overall attitude towards our table was a 1.5 out of 5.
