Always loved this place, and it's even better since they rebuilt it! We decided to have our rehearsal brunch here before our wedding, and Churchville Inn did not disappoint. The staff was friendly, pleasant, and helpful, and the food was great! I highly recommend the chicken and waffles.

Kind of a frantic place. You wait in line to order, pay and even tip before you are seated. Servers were hustling and stomping around. 

We got two iced lattes which were tasty but nothing magical. Then we got the classic Benedict and the lobster Benedict.

The lobster Benedict was pretty good. No complaints about it.

The classic Benedict was not very good. The Canadian bacon was very tough to chew through. The hollandaise was very thick also. 

They both came with fruit which was tasty.

I placed a fairly simple carry out order.  On arriving home I found the chicken and fries were cold, sauce had been omitted, and the ranch dressing smelled rancid.  Plain, cold fried chicken strips and excessively salted fries... Yum...

Best restaurant we've been to since moving here this fall. Just wow. We ordered the bread and seaweed butter to start which, as every review says, is very necessary. Then our server pointed is towards the sweet potato, which I would not have chosen, but dang...One of the best, most interesting dishes I've had in awhile. We then got the chicken and a pasta to share, both of which were excellent. We loved the vibe and the fact that they leave seats open for locals to drop in. We'll be back often!

This is the worst restaurant I have ever been to
The food is not fresh the service is even worse 
When I spoke to the owner he did not even care told me what can I do in his broken English , there was not even soap in the bathrooms ,everybody do yourself a favor and skip this one , save yourself from the belly ache and the dirty place
There are plenty of good places on Ewing to eat
They should be shut down by the health dept.

I was here last night with a party of 12 for my birthday.  We ordered a bunch of appetizers including the tater tots, the crab fritters and the duck potine.  Everything came out in a timely manner and was delicious.  The tater tots were huge and more potatoey.  We ordered two of each and it was enough to get around for all of us to try.  For our entrees, the majority of the table got the fried chicken which was pretty good.  And it was a lot of chicken.  I got the filet tips which didn't really impress me.  But it was okay. We were the only table inside for a Saturday night and service was great.  Our server was very friendly and the bus boy was also great with refilling our waters and giving us ice buckets.  Then they cut our cake for us and that was delish also.  But I wish I had room in my belly to try the batter fried Nutella brownie bites.  Maybe I'll try it another time. I'd like to go back and try their brunch.

Meh not impressed.  Only ordered 2 things and waitress got one of them wrong.

Chickens tacos were so so and fish tacos didn't even seem cooked.  Didn't bother to try to eat them.

With so many good taco places out there this place is not worth your time.

We did the office party here at it was a great experience. Service was excellent drinks were flowing. Beer selection wasn't amazing but was decent enough. The food was soooooo good. Cute place tucked away on a side street. Would definitely go back.
Very poor staff! Not too Brite! I ordered 15 classic they can only count to 11. Shorted me. Check your order! They not the smartest staff!

I like the atmosphere here, energetic and cozy. I used to get the pizza here often and I eventually stopped, it's just not impressive to me, looks better than it tastes. I eventually switched to the sandwiches which I find are more 'special'. Recently came back for pizza and wasn't disappointed or impressed.
Great spot for Sunday brunch but get there early and be prepared to wait. But it's worth it. Wait crew is very polite and are adhering to COVID restrictions.  We will definitely go there again.

This place is delicious! My fiancé and I are here for a little getaway and we've been to Lisa cafe every day for breakfast. I had the spinach and feta omelette, and the corned beef hash and eggs. My fiancé had the biscuits and gravy and the cinnamon French toast. Let me just say that everything we had was fresh and homemade! One of the best breakfasts I've ever had! The service was great as well! Thank you for your hospitality, we will be back the next time we are in town!

We were in Clearwater Beach for a week in late February... had breakfast every morning at Speggtacular! Princess Crepes covered in bananas, blueberries and strawberries drizzled in English creme! Great senior menu! Waffles, crepes, pancakes and eggs oh my!!! Back in Austin one day and having withdrawal symptoms! And greatest staff ever!

Can't go wrong with Fireside Grill. I've been coming here for about 10 years now and have never had a bad meal or service. It does get crowded but hey, that's what happens when the food is good! 

They do have some outdoor seating but it's right at the parking lot area so I'm not really interested in sitting out there unless there's absolutely no where else to sit. 

 There is also a bar area with plenty of seating and TVs (a few TVs in the restaurant area as well) for sports. They also have happy hour specials as well as daily drink specials. 

On our last visit, we came specifically for the prime rib as it's only served Thursday thru Saturday and it's eat in only (not sure why but I'm going to ask next time). Last time we were here, we were about an hour early and my hubby was disappointed so I had to make it up to him. He had the Dutchesa cut (18oz) prime rib, sautéed spinach and onion rings and he added shrimp (since I was paying tonight lol). I had the garden pizza, well done. The pizza was done as requested and it was delicious. I would say it does need some seasoning on the veggies, like garlic just to ramp it up a bit. His prime rib was huge and it was like butter. He loved the spinach  and the onion rings were really battered well and were a little sweet.  Wish I had taken some pictures of it before he started eating it 

Our waitress was really nice and friendly.  

We will definitely be back for more!

So, we went here because last year as we were watching Tennessee Crossroads, this place was featured and then a week later, a Groupon came out for this place. So, yes it took us 6 months to finally get there. 

We went on a Wednesday night right when it opened. We started out with the Spinach Dip, then my husband had the chicken pot pie and I had the Half Chicken. The food was good but a bit heavy for my taste. It's great if you like country style food. My husband loved the Chicken Pot Pie and it definitely lived up to his taste. 

The environment was eclectic. They do have music nightly but we were on a time constraint so couldn't stay too long. 

It's a local Nashville place that if you are in East Nashville, would be a good place to go.

Don't set your expectations too high people.  After all, this is a Waffle House.  Staff is engaging and easy to talk to.  Also, every WH I go to there is ALWAYS, always, always some sort of drama behind the counter.  Servers getting catty or getting gossipy.  I had a front row seat to this and it's like the staff doesn't understand the customers can watch all this take place.

Triple order hash browns scattered and two eggs overhard.  Nothing like a gut bomb before getting on the plane going home.

Two stars for the simple, fast breakfasr.  Another for the excellent people watching behind the counter with the sweet-as-molasses-Southern Drawl.

Right down the street from the airport!  Winning!

Arrived at 5 PM, received a warm welcome, and were seated immediately in a very nice, quiet booth in the back.  Our waiter, Gary (I think), was tremendous -- attentive, friendly, and checked on our needs consistently. He was great. My wife had the New Zealand lamb chops which were good but the Yukon Gold mashed potatoes were too salty for her (I loved them!) Young, tender, slender green beans were very good.  I had Steak Diane which was spectacular!  Well worth the money.

Now, let's get to the Caesar Salad with the chef's special dressing -- awesome!!! Not liquid, almost paste-like, garlic-loaded, wonderful!

Other than a loudmouth seated behind us, it was a great dinner. Great food, great service. After 5 years of eating in Manhattan, this was the equal of most in NYC. Thanks much, folks.
Great, fast service and good food. Perfectly scrambled eggs and the waffles are always good. It was crazy busy and loud in there this morning but the staff all seemed happy and friendly!

Great Pub and tavern set up.  Food is excellent Italian influenced fare.  Different far areas to move around make it a fun place.  I took the second Half of my special sandwich and green beans  to work and was the envy of the office.
I go to Kristina's café all the time and it is one of the best breakfast lunch and dinner places I've ever been to it has a nice family atmosphere

I recently moved to Glenside and like the neighborhood for its walkability and proximity to Center City.  My biggest gripe is the appalling lack of restaurant options, but Roberts Block is a beacon of hope in what is otherwise a food desert.  Inventive menu, great decor, delicious food, attentive service.  I don't have a bad thing to say about the place.  For the many who say Roberts Block is expensive, they must be dining at fast food joints or not have been to a restaurant in the last decade, as the burger is $10 and most entrees in the low $20s.  This place is operated by the team behind Leila's Bistro, Flora, Forcella-- some of the only other decent restaurants in the area.  Three cheers for this awesome new addition to Glenside!  I hope it encourages the development of other good eats in a town that sorely lacks them.

I went with my friend to visit my sister who goes to Villanova and we decided to go to brunch here. The food took almost an hour to come out and when it finally did, all of our meals were cold. I paid $13 for Eggs Benedict with Smoked Salmon and it was a very small portion that was nearly flavorless. The service was slow and when they asked how it was and I said it was kind of cold they nodded and handed me the check. I'm not going back...
Amazing Hamburgers for only $8!!!!  And the bar tender was very nice. The music was good, too bad it was cold outside because their sitting area is pretty nice.

Just stopped here for the first time, and my wife and I weren't really sure what we were walking into. Short story is, you're going to pay a little more here, but the food is really good. My wife and I each had a double cheeseburger, an order of fries, and shared a drink and dessert. We walked out with a bill around $30, which is more than I would want to spend at a burger joint. However, it felt good knowing at least some of the food was organic, and all was well prepared. If we are back in the area in our travels, we would likely stop again.

A friend and I were in Philly for the evening and decided to grab dinner here after some menu-comparison while walking around the neighborhood. Quite frankly it blew our minds and I would come back in a heartbeat next time I'm in the city, and I suggest it to anyone who tells me they're headed up.

They have a really impressive selection of craft beers on draft, a quick way to win me over. As for the menu... I don't think there was a single thing on there I wouldn't like to try some day. The friend I was with grew up in Texas and told me this is probably the best barbecue she's had in her life if that tells you anything.

Service was super friendly and appropriately attentive. We split the sampler (two or three meats and two sides) with the pulled pork, ribs, and brisket with onion rings and smoked cheddar fries. I too have had my fair share of barbecue fare and it was just... so perfect. As the older gentleman who raved about it to us outside the door for quite some time said, you don't need teeth to eat the brisket. Onion rings were without a doubt the best I've had, perfectly light batter yet you won't drag the whole onion out of its shell on the first bite. Everything was tender but not gristly and flavorful and oh god if I ever moved to Philadelphia living within walking distance of Khyber Pass Pub would be a non-negotiable.
Some friends took us here and it was the best burger I've had in awhile... Interesting location and I want to come back and sit outside and listen to the trains go by... Will definitely be back.

I was truly hoping for a different experience at Del Frisco's Grille, had heard really good things about the food and service. However, as it was quite easy to obtain a reservation on a Friday night, that should have probably been a red flag.  We were seated promptly and greeted immediately by the hostess, but service went a bit south after that point. Our waiter seemed a bit rushed and did not obtain our complete order, returning to the table to update and then delivering the wrong side items with our entrées.  It was a manager who then checked on our meals and as I had finished the entrée, declined the replacement of the side item. The steak itself was seasoned and cooked well and I would identify this as the highlight of the meal. We tried two different dessert items and both were subpar.  I would find it difficult to recommend as there are multiple other steak houses nearby that provide far better service.

Tried to eat here but waitress wouldn't even give us menus. Waited 30 mins, she made at 3 complete rounds. Talked to manager and was offered a free drink, too late over it. This restaurant group is mismanaged to say the least. First issues with cross contamination at one of the restaurants. Then can't even get served at one of their other restaurants with the comp they gave us. What a joke !

We just started coming here around the holidays. I avoided originally because of some reviews. Now I regret that. We've been to two - Oro Valleys and Catalinas. Both good, but we prefer the Oro Valley. It's closer and cute. The food is good, but the five stars is for their staff. Best wait staff in the area. Always friendly, efficient. I've never had to wait for them or need anything because they're so effective. 

They're probably tired of seeing us. Lol

Husband ordered the chicken fried steak one time. It's ginormous.
Hit this place up before the NCAA tournament games. Live music was great and the bartenders were on top of it despite the large crowd.

We stopped in for a mid afternoon dinner on the weekend before Valentines Day.  The fried pickles are probably the best we've ever had.   We both chose pasta dishes with me having the mussels.  Exelent meal but the service today was excellent.  Probably had the best server we've had there if not at most restaurants we've been in. Ray was outstanding, very very attentive and so helpful with our take home leftovers.  Kudos to Ray and Bluff City.

Someone said to me, Ruth's Chris is a franchise, they have a cookie cutter approach and they do not deviate.  I replied - if it ain't broke! 

Ruth's Chris is MAGIC - that 500 degree sizzling steak makes me happy every time. I never thought I would be so lucky as to have one move into Reno. YEAH! 

We went there the first weekend they were open. Friday night - hustle and bustle - but we felt like we were the only patrons in town. They treated us like old favorites - people who come back week after week and tip well. ;-) 

I had called for a reservation and they said they were completely booked, but if we were lucky - we could get a seat at the bar. We felt lucky and got lucky. Two seats at the bar opened up as we entered. 

Cocktails - they have a great list of crafted cocktails, we tried a couple of them and they were SO well balanced and tasty. I would come back just for the Lemon Ginger Drop! LOVE! 

We also brought a bottle of wine from our cellar. It was rather old and needed to be enjoyed soon. They quickly took care of our request to open it and let it breathe. 

Appetizers - we tried the Veal Osso Buco Ravioli - and it was amazing! We shared these and a Chopped Salad - which was also great.. maybe too much red onion in the salad - but I'm not a red onion fan. 

Steak - We decided to share the Porterhouse - Medium Rare. It came to us sizzling and already cut into easily shared pieces. SO YUMMY! 

Sides - we only tried one side - which was the Lyonnaise Potatoes and they were GREAT! 

Desserts - we had to try the Bread Pudding - I thought it was a custardy masterpiece, he thought it wasn't bready enough. You make the call. We also tried the Chocolate Duo - and I have to say the Chocolate Mousse was the best I've ever had. SO GOOD! 

I would be remiss if I didn't mention our smashing bartender/waiter - Neal. He made the entire evening feel special and his knowledge of the menu, drinks, etc. really set this night apart for us. Thank you, Neal! 

We will be back. We will be spreading the news of this fine add-on to the great steakhouses in the Reno/Sparks area - but for that sizzling goodness -- it's gotta be Ruth's!

We visited Milktooth because we sat near a local on the plane to Indy that told us this was "the spot" for brunch. Being huge brunch fans, we knew we had to visit! Our visit took place on a Saturday morning around 10:30 am and there was an HOUR wait, not ideal, but luckily it was just the boyfriend and myself. While waiting, we were allowed to visit the bar to order drinks and pastries; this made the process much more enjoyable. 

Once seated, the service was impeccable.  Every single bite was incredible. For appetizers we enjoyed the sour cream biscuits and sorghum glazed bacon; the biscuits were paired with a wonderful jalapeno jelly and a cultured butter and the bacon was incomparable to any bacon we have ever had; it was so thick and glazed perfectly. For entrees, we chose the spicy nduja & shishito frittata, and the cranberry walnut with gouda & raclette grilled cheese; the frittata was spicy, but topped with a great slaw that helped to neutralize the spiciness. The grilled cheese was incredible as well; from the sharp cheddar to the sweet cranberry flavor, the flavor was perfect. Even after experiencing all this wonderful food, we felt the need to have a pecan roll for dessert and it was a piece of heaven; we could not even finish it, but it was the best tasting pastry I have had.
foos looks good but it's not. the food has no flavor, bland taste, & the chicken in my sandwich was raw. don't get why people hype it up so much please don't waste your time.
I you want amazing bbq in a relaxed environ sold by a great guy who just happens to cook like a champ then this is the place! Skip the chains, go to Peg Leg Porker!!!

Read some of the past reviews and nothing changed.  Very bad service and management is weak.   I can help.  Fire the manager,  train the staff to bring utensils to the table within five minutes of food being served, when customer ask for ice don't forget and then talk to next table for ten minutes, manager shouldn't sit down at front and look at floor and say nothing to customer as they Maeve restaurant,  coleslaw shouldn't taste like creamed apple sauce, hooters should get world record for smallest wings and the celery was even weak.  How do you screw up celery??

Only one tv had ufc and the manager came over and changed the tv to a game that was showing on a tv right next to it within 1 foot away.

The fries were god and the beer was good.

Oh boy. Where do i start...
Atmosphere... typical hotel restaurant and bar. Clean functional. Nothing out of the ordinary.

Drinks...some creative mixed drink specials. Basic beer options on draft and bottled. Saw no mention of wine selection. 

Food... below average. Fries were soggy and mushy. Ordered also a quesadilla that i had to remind the waiter about. I waited so long at that point i asked for it to go. He finally brought it reporting "sorry i forgot it, it was just sitting there. I didnt see it". Quite appetizing to know my food has sat under a heat lamp for 20ish minutes.

Service... lacking. Several times my group attempted to get up from the table and go to the bar in order to get refills, simply or order, or to check on my quesadilla situation. Waiter was extremely inattentive, and it was not crowded. It was a saturday at 3pm. Even if youre staying at the attatchdd hotel, walk the extra minute to the many local restaurants right near there.

who really wants to plunk down $6 for a gourmet hot dog? I do. 

yes, i can buy all the ingredients for the hot dog for less than $6 at the grocery store. but you wouldn't have their quality ingredients. (trust me, i've tried doing it myself to save some money). Their sourdogh bun (steamed and grilled) is delicious. the sourkraut is the perfect blend of sour and crunchy. I've had several of their dogs, mmm... 

$2 for a drink is a little pricey, but i'm one of those people who walk around with a bottle of water, so whatev. They only have bottled water there. 

I do like that you can either sit inside or outside. They keep the door closed to keep the air in, but a quick glance at the window, and if the shade is up, it's open, down, closed. I don't like that they have the trash cans right outside next to your table. 

I think their neighbor is a little peeved at the customers because they have a sign that says "do not lock bike to fence." oh well, this is an in and out kinda place, so if you lock your bike up outside and not to anything, you should be fine. 

CASH ONLY

Very poor customer service, told me and my girlfriend it would be a 30 minute wait and made me wait over an hour until i reminded him, he acted like he forgot, then still made me wait over 30 minutes before even taking our order so we left, highly unrecommended, verrrry poor customer service, -10 /10

I visited The Egg & I on Sunday for brunch w/a girlfriend. It was super busy so the wait was 20 min. Once seated, our waitress took or drink orders. She was very friendly. I ordered the wheat pancakes w/fresh berries on top and scrambled eggs with cheese and  mushrooms and I subbed the home fries for the Mises fruit because it contained melon in it which I don't like. My order came and the mixed fruit was with it. I alerted my waitress and she apologized and promptly had home fries made for me. The food was very, very good. This place is very similar to First Watch, but a little better in food and you'll spend slightly less. Overall I had a wonderful time eating at The Egg & I.

The CHICKEN SHACK RANCH sandwich ($6.25) wasn't the best sandwich I have ever tasted but it was pretty delicious. Yes, the sandwich was savory. Yes, the chicken was fresh and moist. However,  I don't think there was enough dimension in it for me to label it number one. I also tried the MIKE'S SPICY BEEF N' CHEDDAR ($6.50) which I think is better than the famous chicken shack ranch. There was tons of dimension in that one. They also stack the roast beef so you get a lot of meat with that one. I really like how affordable the sandwiches are. Six bucks for a decent size sandwich where they don't jip you on the meat? Sweet!

Expect a long line for lunch on the weekends since they seem to have a cult following on yelp and with the locals.  Blues City Deli is a small little place (hence the name) but they try to accommodate the huge number of patrons by offering outside seating - picnic tables line the sidewalk and in their back patio. I still couldn't find a seat and decided to take my lunch elsewhere to-go.

This place is a classic exhibition of St. Louis culture new and old. I enter, see and hear live bluegrass country music echoing through the walls, the guitarist/singer playing by the window while the waitress pressures everyone for tips, and a baseball capped guy waiting for his food while holding a beer in one hand, a bag of chips in the other. And everyone is excited, tapping their feet to the rhythm of the music. Blues City Deli is most definitely entertaining and a great experience for those who wish to see STL in all it's glory.

I give 2 stars as, the food is fairly good, not bad but, at these prices it just doesn't add up. Some things were very good, others not reasonably fulfilling when considering the prices. They really should do considerably better for pushing $200 for 2. I don't say this lightly and prefer to not speak badly but, feel it's fair to comment in this way all things considered.

Owned by some Greeks...I didn't find the chicken dinner that great..
So stick to the Greek dishes,,
Hospitality was typically very Greek...very friendly..the help work very hard and very accommodating.
It's a very popular place here in Z- Hills....always packed..
I usually just eat breakfast there..you get a lot of food for the buck!

Second time I went and second time I walked out! Dirty, understaffed and just unpleasant. Sat at the dirty bar, server/bartender was as not very friendly and apparently couldn't handle it alone. There will be no 3rd time. Very disappointing, it used to be good.

I can't wait to get a CFA near us in Michigan! My kids are super picky but will always eat the chicken bites and lemonade from there. The CFA sauce is amazing on nearly anything and you can't go wrong with tenders, sweet tea and waffle fries.

Feast has delicious food, beautiful caring people  all with huge caring hearts.  They deliver food around the city and take food to front line workers in hospitals.  To support them in this time is also to support their work to people in the hospitals who are taking care of our loved ones.   

The food... Can you imagine the flavors when you first put lobster bread pudding in your mouth that transported me out of my "safe place" into a world where my feet dangle in the water. Chard sweet potatoes that make me wonder why all I've ever done is roast them. Salad so fresh you think you've jjust picked them out of your garden. Each dish comes with its own unique touch.

Feast is a bundle of mouth watering, mouth tingling flavors.  Feast is a restaurant with a heart so big they donate meals to the people in hospitals on the front line. Feast is a great place.  Besides there are   great emails from Feast.

The first place that I will never try again 
Everything taste like old oil .. fries. wings ( whatever flavor ) all taste the same OLD FRYING OIL

I went to Merchant's with a group of my future coworkers. Yes, future. I think this was the "breaking bread" together part of my experience with them. There was no bread, but there was complimentary sour cream and onion popcorn. 

To share, we ordered the duck fat tater tots. I have never had anything fried in duck fat before, and I did not notice a difference in taste between the duck fat tater tots here and the tater tots I've had fried in vegetable oil. The tots were shared among our group of 9 coworkers, and it was plenty to share. They were not greasy, and they came with 2 dipping sauces: ketchup and chipotle mayo. The mayo is the star of this dish. I liked the presentation of the tots in a cast iron skillet, too. 

We also shared 2 orders of the fried green tomatoes (5 patties in each order). The tomatoes were lightly breaded and fried. They were nothing out-of-this-world, though. If you're ever in the Ann Arbor, MI, area, try the fried green tomato sandwich at Sava's on State Street. 

I opted to get the Southern Fry instead of the main entrees. Catfish, okra, shrimp, and  pickles. The catfish was wonderful, nice and tender. The other fried goods were good, too, but again, nothing out-of-this-world. My coworker got the jambalaya, which looked very hearty and had a deep red broth base. She wasn't very impressed with it. Another coworker ordered the chicken fried chicken, which she shared with another coworker due to the large portion size. The gravy on the chicken was nice and creamy, and the potatoes were as well. 

The atmosphere here is very hip and trendy-wait staff in bow ties and suspenders, white tiling. There were 3 screens showing the Tigers-Rangers game and the Vanderbilt game. The service is slow, though. Each table gets a bottle of water to be poured and refilled as you would like. Unfortunately, the bottles empty fast when you have 5 people at a table. And, finding your server to ask for a refill is difficult as this place is very busy due to its location on Broadway near other tourist attractions.  

For me, the highlights of this experience were the company of my coworkers and the dates my coworkers brought from Saudi Arabia. Overall, Merchant's is a good place for a casual night out on the town.

Holy disappointment!! After the many excellent reviews we tried this place last Saturday for breakfast. Our party of two adults and three children completely threw them for a loop. When we got there at 10 am there were three other tables present. The servers were nice and friendly. 

We ordered three orders of scrambled eggs and bacon and my husband got the Mexican breakfast. Then...we waited. And waited. And waited. After 20 minutes we were the only ones left there. We still waited. Then two new sets of customers came in, ordered, and were SERVED their food. Still, we waited. This is unacceptable service. 

After 45 minutes I said they had 5 minutes to get our food or we would walk. A cook literally screamed from inside the kitchen, "Sorry!! Sorry!!"

Sadly, when the food finally came (at the 50 minute mark) it was bland, and even worse, canned. The Mexican plate was under seasoned eggs, a scoop of cold, canned, refried beans and 4 taco chips. Awful. The eggs had NO salt or pepper...at all. The bacon is absolutely, 100%, undisputed, heat-and-serve, Oscar Mayer. The home fries seemed like mashed potatoes heated slightly on the grill and completely unseasoned. 

Our entire experience here was dreadful. Bad food. Bad service. Bad everything. Never again.

This had been one of my favorite Tucson downtown restaurants until tonight. The restaurant wasn't particularly busy which makes it even more disappointing. I ordered the braised lamb shank and when it was finally served, it was nearly room temperature. It was also very dry. The waiter never inquired about the food or I would have mentioned it. I can't see returning with so many good options available now in Downtown Tucson.

Just Ehhh. Sometimes I just try a local casino coffee shop and they are great, after pushing through the cigarette filled casino. Today it wasn't worth it. Although Baldinis does have a door right next to this cafe, but all the parking near this door is exclusively handicapped. Canned biscuits are dry, canned gravy is well canned gravy no sausage in it or anything. Requested eggs scrambled well and that was done . Waitress was great. Wait was long and lots of tables were open so this place is just ehhhhh for breakfast anyway.

Sedition is conduct that encourages acts of rebellion against the state. If a failure it is a serious crime; if successful, an act of revolutionary heroism. In times like these that try the souls of patriots, when it is difficult to differentiate between the criminals and the righteous, it is understandable that a subterranean public house would choose "Sedition" as its identity. No doubt the dark bricked, grottoed, underground tavern evokes an epoch when such weighty matters were discussed in hushed tones by serious people. 

Chose a side or stand aside, but at least here you can do so with quality drinks and kitchen. We stopped in after visiting Penn Med a few blocks away. The basement felt cool in the dim light of reimagined industrial fixtures. We walked through coved rooms until taking a booth rather far from the bar. Yet, the friendly bartender found us with menus in hand. There were good beer choices, but having to return to see the medical staff after lunch, our libations were strictly water. We ordered the Philbano and Beer Braised Brisket sandwiches, and settled in. 

Both were very good, as were the accompanying fries. The "Philly Cubano" was made up of smoked Berkshire pork butt, provolone, peach BBQ sauce and pickled long hots, all stuffed into a fresh Parker House roll. Simply put, it was a great pulled pork sammy. The combination of ingredients played well together and it was fun to identify the flavors as they announced themselves to the tongue.  First rate. The brisket was not quite as entertaining, but was tender and slathered in horseradish and coleslaw between the semi spheres of a brioche bun. Satisfying. Both were substantial enough to bring half home. 

Whether you intend on sedition or will wait the next act out from the sidelines, be sure to enjoy life and stop in to Sedition for drinks and grub before deciding.

Came here with a group of friends for brunch before a Rams game on Sunday. The place wasn't that busy at all so we were seated right away. Overall the atmosphere seemed nice.

Everything on the menu looked great and we were told we could order either breakfast or lunch. Everyone opted for breakfast at our table because that's obviously the meal of choice for brunch, or really any meal of the day for that matter.

I got the eggs benedict which was just ok. The hollandaise sauce was very thin and lacked flavor and the ham was thin and chewy. The egg was poached nicely though. Side of fruit was a nice option but had way to much bland melon.

Everyone else seemed to have similar sentiments about their food. Two people got the slinger which was their biscuits and gravy with sausage and cheese. They both said it definitely was not the best biscutis and gravy they had and in fact said the gravy was super bland and some of the biscuits looked burnt. Mixed together with everthing the dish was ok because cheese does save all.

I was also lessed than impressed with the service. Like I said it was very slow so there was a group of waitresses just standing aganist the wall talking and playing on their phones. You think having less to do would make them more attentive but that seemed to be the complete opposite. At one point I literally had to glare over at them and wave my hand just to get our order taken which is absolutely ridiculous.

On the plus side was the bloody mary bar. You pick your vodka and salt rim then are left with a vast array of mixes, toppings, and condiments. It was a bit overwhelming and hard not to overdo it. Though the price was pretty steep and it was a shame that is wasn't unlimited. 

Probably the highlight of this visit was the gooey butter cake. Definitely one of the best I've had. Perfectly moist and gooey and sweet. Makes me wonder how this place is in the evenings as a wine and dessert bar. I'm guessing that it is probablty better suited for that than brunch.

Overall this was an ok experience. I probably won't come back for brunch or lunch again when there are so many better places to go downtown for that but may try again in the evening for a nice dessert and glass of wine.

Love this place! I love craft beer but I also want yummy food. This place has really good food! I have never had anything bad here to eat or any problems for that matter. Also they have parking around back!

I'm not gonna sugar coat it or write an essay. Daily eats is a great stop on a shopping day or if you're craving a specific dish they make. I'm in love with the Captain crunch crusted french toast and eggs. I drive 25 mins to ge that dish. Always recommend.
Great food with good ambiance. Carry out is a convenient option as well. Biscuits and gravy with fried chicken is good. Ask for some jam for the biscuits. The monte cristo is very good too!
my favorite milkshake stop. the nana-moomoo will always be my go-to. oh & the root beer floats! can you say unlimted?!? great late night treat with the unending garlic fries

Solid solid po boy choice. Mahoneys poboys right off of magazine busy sector so parking is hard to find.  That means you'll need to scout.

From the outside it's cute and quaint. There's seating in the front which is a plus when it's beautiful. We were seated as soon as we entered and staff were attentive and helpful in choices!  

We got the shrimp poboy, shrimp remoulade salad, and onions rings. 

If you don't get a shrimp poboy then you didn't do it right!! Stuffed to the brim fully dressed! So good and filling.

Shrimp remoulade salad such a treat gosh that sauce puts me in a daze!

Those shoe string onions is just the perfect treat as well!!

Sure it's oddly dated. Like a cross between my moms early 70's Colonial living room set and a 50's diner. I mean this in a nice nostalgic way. The service was pleasant and the owner has a really cute dog. The food was spot on. Crispy  grilled cornbread, friend had a perfectly cooked omelette and I had bacon crispy and eggs with hash browns. It was all delicious . It's on the expensive side but breakfast is cheap even when it's expensive. Right by Valley Forge park so you can stop before or after.
Had the spicy sausage po boy with American cheese. Perfection. The ambiance isn't much to look at. But the folks are friendly and the food is good. What more do you need?

I've driven by snooze a number of times since it opened but hadn't had the chance to check it out. My wife went with my son and they came back with rave reviews so we went to check it out last week.

The servers were very friendly and helpful. We went on a weekday morning before school and were seated right away. I like the option of I side or outside. Everything looked clean and sanitized. 

The food was reminiscent of a greasy spoon diner, but classed up a notch. There aren't many diners where you can get puff pastry with sausage gravy and a runny egg on top for under $12. 

The kids loved the pancakes and French toast. We got the French toast OMG'd and they were tasty. The corned beef was cooked well and they were generous with the corned beef. Pro tip from our kids. If you ask you can get a blend of juices for the kids meal. Pineapple/ grapefruit was our family favorite. 

The portions are large enough to satisfy without making you waddle out the door with food coma and regret. The prices were around $10 a plate which we felt was reasonable. You can find places to eat for less, but we liked the throw back retro feel without the grease that accompanies the classic diner. Definitely recommend checking this place out. Get here early on the weekends.

We visit this super-high class restaurant on top of the new spaceship-style JW Marriott for the bar.  The views are amazing and you will be in the company of the elite.  Make sure to wear your Christian Louboutins and be ready for a good time.

My husband and I had dinner here one night while we were visiting Santa Barbara. The food was fantastic. We both loved everything we ate the waiters were so friendly. If you are only in Santa Barbara for a short time you should definitely check this place out.

Came here for brunch after barre3 class.  We had signed up for barre3 and brunch. What a great experience to try two new things: barre3 & deacons. 
Deacons is so stinking cute! The decor and open feel is great. I was kind of weary to try brunch because there weren't that many options. I saw the bonuts and knew I had to get an order. We got an order to split and I ordered the omelet. 
Oh my gosh. Both dishes were DELICIOUS. The omelet was good and the donuts were AMAZING. 
Strawberry and chocolate. Oh, did I mention the mimosas were great too?!  
I would love to come back and try some more dishes and drinks.

This place is AMAZING!!!

Very simple menu with a nice selection to choose from. My girlfriend and I visited Reno for the weekend and promised that every time we're in town we must stop by here to eat!

I ordered the corned beef sandwich. I don't think I've ever had a corned beef sandwich so good before! The bread was toasted perfectly, the corned beef was so flavorful but not over salty and the Swiss cheese topped it off delicately! 

You must try this place when you're in town!

Came for a painting and vino event so only had appetizers and wine. The food was great, they're generous with the freshly cut veggies in the hummus platter - not just carrot sticks. The service staff and owners are fantastic. Everyone was friendly and attentive. Lots of large windows with outdoor seating make for a great environment. Highly recommend!

The food is "okay". My Brussel sprouts were not cooked all they way & my boom boom shrimp were over salted. 

The service is great. 

Maybe that why they always have a crowd there. 

The frosè is fantastic!

I would love to meet the chef here. I can see and taste the love he/she puts into every dish. I've never been disappointed and always impressed by this museum cafe. Everything is made from scratch, is absolutely amazing in flavor, the menu is inspired and presentation mouthwatering. I also love the ease of service here. It's not complicated in any way and I enjoy the peaceful outside patio especially in downtown Indy!! If you've never been I definitely recommend this hidden gem. Many are unaware of this place and you do not have to pay a museum admission to eat in the restaurant/cafe. I work across the street, but sure wish I could grab my laptop and work right here from this relaxing setting.

Pretty decent food in a very cool setting with great service.  Big fan of the Ahi Poke starter, which is large enough to be an entree.  Simple but incredibly fresh tasting (big fan of quinoa in a poke).  Friend had the corned beef sandwich which was way too fatty and not very good, would not recommend that dish.  Finished with a pistachio baclava ice cream which was unique and pretty darn delicious.

Never had a problem coming here. Wait times are long on the weekends, but I don't have a problem with that because the service and food are always great. Bread is one of the best rolls around and I love the cinnamon butter. 

I usually get a margarita and it is always good which is hard to come by for a chain restaurant.

I either get the sirloin or the bacon burger. Sirlion is always cooked to perfection and the sides are good. Burger isnt the best around but has good flavor. 

All in all, have never had bad service. Never waited long after order was taken, and the food and drinks are always great. We come back often.

Went this weekend and tried to like it, however service was slow and the waitress looked run-down which reflected in the service. She was a mess and did not seem to care about the table or costumer which to me makes it seem like she didnt care if she was tipped or not. The food came out and there was hair in it, it was on the plate not cooked into the food so I didnt send it back. However since the restuarant is extremely small , you can see right into the kitchen and not only were hairnets not being used neither were gloves ! Several times I saw the cook using their phone and then cooking , yikes! The food was nothing more than what is served at a sub-par diner, nothing to write home about. The small place was a little too cramped and a little dirty. Not an appealing atmosphere, sitting with the strangers next to you, no privacy at all to even have a conversation. Terrible service. Average food with the other options in the area and in the city.

I ate a grilled chicken salad here yesterday for lunch, which resulted in food poisoning. I hadn't eaten at an Applebee's in several years, and only did so because I was given a gift card for here. Definitely the worst gift I've received. Won't be back, and am throwing away the gift card that still has a balance.

I'm not quite sure who Maggie is but she makes a mean salad and a great Cuban

Missing some gluten-free bread but other than that the place is clean and a good selection

This place is awesome great food, great service, and very reasonably priced!!! 
The food is fresh my husband and I had the Stella Fish fry AMAZING!!!! The boys had steak and chicken strips! Very clean and great atmosphere!!

The butter lettuce, apple, pear salad is amazing! It had dried figs and some sort of bacon vinaigrette. I asked to swap the Stilton cheese for another type of cheese and the waitress was very accommodating.

Diner perfection. Got freaked out at first because of the smoking next to the restaurant that made the place smell horrible, but we sat far away from it so it wasn't too bad. This place should not be missed. It a blast from the past of diners and the food, although not healthy, was awesome. My daughter had the tri tip and it was incredible and I highly recommend that. I had the roasted turkey platter and it was also super great. Super place!

This is my favorite place to go. Period. It's one of the only places in Philly/Manayunk that makes me feel at home. 

Let's get down the brass tax. MONDAY AND TUESDAY. Come here. Come here while the wing deal is in effect. I have gone here with a couple of buddies for an hour or two, eaten 20+ wings (which are actually quality despite the price), had a couple beers, and then looked down at my sub $15 meal. Incredible. 25 cent wings and $2.50 Miller Lites is heaven on earth here.

Went to Poppy's (that's the name of the lobster on the sign) and it was a great experience.  This time we got half Greek and half Italian charbroiled oysters.  They were wonderful.  Didn't get the po'boy this time but instead got broiled crawfish -- it comes with corn on the cob and broiled potatoes.  Crawfish were very good as well. 
The waiter was kind enough to bring us everything we asked for (extra stuff) and brought us a "discard" plate unprompted!  He was our best server yet!

Had an early dinner. Shared plates since not that hungry. Grilled shrimp with French bread to sop up the sauce (wonderful, fresh, cooked perfectly - with heads & shell, so be prepared to dig in), swamp fries ( pedestrian fries in standard cheese-wiz like cheese, but flavorful beef gravy elevated this dish), and medium-rare rib eye (perfectly seasoned, perfectly done, tender - one of the best I have ever had.)
We highly recommend!

Don't even think about going to this particular Outback on Baltimore Pike.  The worst thing about this steak house is that they don't know how a steak is made.  The whole staff is rude as it get, that's including a manager.  When they serve you under cooked steak they just take it back and burn the steak and reserve it to you.  WORST RESTAURANT EXPERIENCE EVER!!!  Go eat a McDonald's.  You are guaranteed to get better service and food there.  I would give them a ZERO STARS if I was able to do this.

I had a short layover and just wanted something quick to eat. Everywhere in the terminal was packed, but I was able to grab a seat at the high top here. It really wasn't much to write home about. Service was ok... I had the pretzels and cheese dip, they were ok. If you just want a quick drink and snack, come here, but don't expect anything over the top.

Ok you all can begin to blast me but had no plans for Valentine's Day.  Jessica E and I are not always a fan of huge crowds. So while running some errands we decided to get something to eat.  We discussed the options and chose Square 1. We had been here once before and thought it was good so here we go. Turns out we walked in and were taken to a booth right away. Our server Tracy shows right up and we start having fun.  Jessica ordered the Bacon Fried Mac n cheese. Oh my very good! The panko was great around the sharpness of the cheese.

I had a Juicy Lucy burger. It is advertised as knife and fork burger. It sure is. Very messy but oh my so juicy. The carmelised onions went great with this hunk of beef.  The Bacon Bleu Burger is what Jessica E grazed upon. Here review was just nodding her head and going yum.  She also had some x=rated mudslide milkshake which she raves about.

They had a very good promotion going on for the day. Take a picture of you smooching and post it to Twitter, Facebook or Instagram and tag them in.  Show it to your server and BAM! BOGO burgers. It was fun and and nice surprise when the tab came.

The service was outstanding.  Tracy gets a huge Thanks.  I left my jacket in the booth. As I was returning in the front door to retrieve the manager was going out the back and handing my jacket to Jessica over the little fence for outside dining. Great job Square 1!

The decor is a but funky and the burgers a little bit different but I sure had a great time.

Oh yeah and the beer is cold!

Curbside Pick Up:  Very poor curbside service from the call-in order taker to the actual pick up which has required me to get out of my car and walk inside to let them know I am here the past couple of times.

A-OK is Ten Stone in a nutshell. I'm probably not going to say no if someone suggests we go here, but I'm also not going to travel more than 4 or 5 blocks for this place. The free darts and pool table in the back room are a huge plus, especially because of their magical ability to smooth over any awkward lulls in conversation if you're meeting a bunch of new people at once. Because it's not an incredibly special bar, Ten Stone never gets really crowded, which I actually don't mind because it's a good place to talk amongst a sizeable group of people and still be heard across the table. 

The beer list is pretty decent as well despite the limited happy hour specials. The food is kind of disappointing though. I got a veggie burger from here almost 2 years ago and I remembered it being REALLY good (I eat a ton of veggie burgers, so it's remarkable that the burger was a standout). However, I had it again recently and it was kind of a bummer. Everything on the plate was lukewarm, but while the burger had the texture of an undercooked microwave meal, the fries seemed like they had been cooked properly a while ago and were left sitting around. The waitress was kind of inattentive and I was so hungry, that by the time the food came, I just went with it instead of sending it back. The complete "meh"-ness of the meal had me wondering if maybe I had had one too many beers that night when the burger was miraculous. The flavors this time were just fine; I was just surprised at the lazy execution and presentation. Despite that culinary shortcomings, I always manage to have a good time here and I would still come back for drinks any time I'm in the neighborhood.

So delicious! I lived in Tampa for 3 years and never went but made sure I did on a trip back. Great coffee and even better service. I will always order the biscuits and gravy if that's an option and it was delicious. You get so much for your money and I will absolutely be going back!

Ate upstairs -- Solid restaurant with solid but not memorable food.  I really enjoyed my trout but the oysters were a little bland.   Nice place for a business dinner but wouldn't consider it a must try.

We ordered for an office delivery in Clayton, it arrived still HOT and the delivery man was nice enough to make small talk. Chese ology wholeheartedly appeals to the little kid in me the best thing one the menu being Spinach and Artichoke Mac. They have several vegetarian options and even a vegan option!

Don't be fooled though, they also have salads, desserts, and drinks - the perfect way to start or end a date night in the Loop.
The food was amazing! The owner was super nice and wanted to make sure we had a great experience. Will be coming back soon. I want to try that lobster roll!

I have dined at Tohono Chul Bistro many times. This was breakfast on a beautiful day in a beautiful place in the shade with Cousine. We arrived at about 9:15 am and did not wait. She eats GF and we were both pleased that star waiter Zach had no hesitancy describing how easily selections could be modified to suit. I ordered coffee and an omelet with avocado, roasted poblano chile and chorizo with a side dish of fruit. She selected hot water (she BYO'ed her tea) and a variation of huevos rancheros with the same side dish. We were both happy with our eggs but the real feature was the fresh fruit. Lovely tasty berries (blue, rasp and straw) grapes with flavor and good texture, decent sliced (not cubed and bagged) melon, and very flavorful orange slices. Hats off to the chef there. Made a tremendous difference. The only tweak I'd suggest is the quality of the coffee, which could, I think, be "upped", especially for the price.
Service was excellent and the food was great. I will take a star off for the drink I got it was a little strange for my taste but I will say everything else was perfect to par

It was a little busy the Friday evening we stopped in...it's only been open two weeks so we were expecting some service or kitchen kinks. We sat at the bar to avoid the 30 min wait...it's small but we had enough space and the bartenders were super cool. The kitchen and service were stellar.. nothing to work out there. I like the simple classy decor. The strip mall feeling was not present. The menu is small...a few starters, a few salads...grilled meat and fish options. We got their vegetable posole...a rich stew with greens and root veggies, queso, and a citrus salad. Soooo good! Five star food and service. We'll be back.

Good food and drinks, good service  and the live music was excellent !!! Can't ask for more.
Got the grouper sandwich and half dozen of raw oyster, everything tasted good and fresh.
The view and environment it's great, pool party and everything, definitely coming back .

Have been here many times,  and it just keeps getting better and better.  Couldn't ask for friendlier staff and owners. Cafe is beautifully designed and comfortable. Coffee, which you serve yourself, is wonderful. Variety of menu choices is abundant. Try it, you'll love it. 

Rivercat is closing the end of Sep due to a error in licensing created by the Boro Counsel and Zoning Commission of New Hope. These technicalities are forcing a wonderful, viable establishment to close depriving downtown New Hope of the friendliest, most delicious food in the area.

Went with my ladies for some dinner and drinks! Inside is simple but gorgeous... love the windows! Our server was on pointe. He was very knowledgeable and made everything sound like I had to try. Wish I would have remembered his name! ‍ I order the Rosè Sangria... 2 actually! We had the Shrimp with some spicy-ish mustard for an appetizer. I had the New York strip and shared the potatoes and Brussels sprouts, all were equally delicious. I will say it was all worth it but be prepared to spend some cheese!

Came in with a large group (about 16) and the service was outstanding!  I had a Tito's Peach Lemonade that was amaaaaazing and then tried a Whiskey Fritter that was WAY good too!  And there's so many more I want to try!!!  Hubby ordered the Fish Tacos and they were just perfect:  the fish wasn't fried, but grilled and the jalapeno cheese was SO flavorful.  I had the Grilled Glazed Salmon sandwich and it was pretty good too (but the last couple of bites where I stole some of hubby's leftover jalapeno cheese were even BETTAH).  Would love to get back here to try more menu items.  And like I said, the service was really good!!!  What more could ya ask for???

It's Cheddars- you get what is expected. Decent food, oversized portions to help is all get and stay fat and ok service. 
It's decently run and the wait staff is average.
Prices are good

Who would've thought a national chain restaurant could be this good!! Our server Cameron was exceptional, but this review is all about the food ! My wife had the shrimpers net which was cooked to perfection, I had the Bubba's ribs and they were to die for. We left nothing on our plates and the portions were huge. We had shopped the store for years but were skeptical about eating there, that was our mistake. Amazing dining experience. Left arguing whose meal was better.

The food was ok. The environment was worn down , bland, and felt dirty. The service was mediocre. While the server was nice enough, we waited for a long time while the servers stood at the counter talking and counting money. Then while we waited, our server and another server went out for a cigarette while we waited...and waited some more. The prices were higher than expected. I won't be returning, although the grilled cheese was pretty good. Disappointing...

I've ordered from here before a couple times but will no longer order or use DoorDash to order there. I spent over $40 on DoorDash only to have my doordasher tell me "the manager said someone else came and picked up your order." Which didn't make sense because the order never said it was picked up and on the way. So I had to cancel the order that I spent money on and never got, and was never refunded the money. 
So whoever got the free food, you're welcome.

We were told by a few people to come here for breakfast and it does not disappoint!! The wait was long, but totally worth it. Our server was very welcoming and fast. Food was amazing. We will definitely come back for more!
Stopped off here before heading into the French Market. My wife and I split the corn beef hash. It was enough for two people.  Wonderful!  Great service. We will be back again.

Cunningham Group restaurants never disappoint!Each of us in our group thoroughly enjoyed our entrees and cocktails. They have gluten free options marked on the menu. This restaurant is in a cool old building and is walking distance to the theater on Mass Ave. Service was very attentive and mindful of what time we needed to leave in order to make it to our show in time. I'd like to go back in warmer weather to have dinner on their nice patio!

Love the ambiance of the place and the customer service there was good. We got seated right away despite it being pretty crowded on a Sat evening. 4/5 Star since I didn't think their selection of beer was super impressive .

Tons of salad choices,  very happy with their herb vinaigrette dressing. .yum! Tried the pick two combo and since I'm super picky about soup,  I opted for the crab & avocado sandwich and protein salad..both delish,  I'll be back and might even try the soup next time!
Super lowkey breakfast/lunch dinner, the outside doesn't look too nice but it's got a cool theme inside and the people are sooo nice! Awesome food that's reasonably priced

I'm not going to focus on the food for this review, it's excellent at all the Fox restaurants. Plenty of reviews will tell you that.

I've done curbside pickup at both Wildflower and Zin Burger and the entire process was efficient and pleasant. I know a few restaurants have had bumps along the way, but the Fox restaurants are way ahead of the curve adapting to these unforeseen times so kudos to the back room computer geeks and management for getting it done.

Place your order online, choose your pickup time, arrive, call the posted number (Wildflower) and out comes your food. EZ-PZ.

BTW, we had the salmon and chicken dinners - love those smashed potatoes.

Had a great meal here. Short Rib Sandwich was excellent with hand cut fries. Nice beer selection with an extremely knowledgable and down to earth server named Bryan. First time here. I am definitely going back.

Ohhh Sam-Sam-Sam, whatever it was that made you famous, it wasn't your wings.   Being a connoisseur of wings,  and liking them HOT, I asked how hot they make'm.  Nuclear was the reply.  So I got them.  

Got home, opened the lid, and I see all wings, no drumsticks.  That's weak sauce in itself.  The weakest sauce came when I bit into the first wing.  Nuclear is mild.   And it's definitely not because I can eat them hot either, they're just weak.  I'd say they were pretty greasy as well.  

They do seem to have some good drink specials if you're on a budget.  And you can bet on horses or dogs as they have races on overhead when you walk in, that could be your cup of tea.

As for the atmosphere:  If you wear overalls,  worked in the mill in Pittsburgh, smoke 2 packs a day, on your third marriage, wear outdated T-Shirts, or just simply down and out on your luck, this may be the place for you.  Not saying any of the above is bad, but it is who goes there.

Stopped in for a beer after seeing the BOGO sign out front. The bartender was rude. Asked if everything on tap was beer or if anything was a cider or seltzer. She gave me a funny look like I was stupid and she said no just beer. My husband and I each had one,  they were ok, nothing to write home about. The bartender never checked back in on us and seemed to be rude to other customers too.

Okay, so, I'm not saying the food here is good. It's not.

BUT...

The pad Thai at Elephant Bar? The best Pad Thai I've EVER HAD!!!

Go here just to eat the Pad Thai. Don't order anything else. Then tell me you didn't like it.

I don't know exactly why it's so good. But it is loaded with veggies. And it's consistently good...and it's just awesome. And I've had Pad Thai at tons of Thai places, so I'm ashamed to say Elephant Bar's is the best. But it is.

It's not that spicy though so if you want spicy, you might want to go elsewhere.

Cherrys never disappoints!  Fast, consistent, food and service. Always have a daily special that is really good. If you are looking for a really good meal and are in a hurry, Cherrys is the best around. If you want to sit back and pick up a game and have a cold beer, Cherrys is the best around!  Can't miss spot!

came here on vacation! loved the view but the food was horrible. the shrimp i got was cold and gross and the waitress was stressing me out. i hated the fries and i didn't like literally any part of my meal except my coke. wouldn't recommend unless you want to watch a football game.

The food is good for the price you pay. I was very disappointed with a bartender who had little or no care when it came to him eating his dinner (purchased from subway) standing up behind the bar. Okay if you're on break cool take it to the back, but to eat with mayo and lettuce dripping from your mouth while bar tendering is gross. Several of his coworkers conversed with him and not one expressed the unprofessionalism or how unsanitary it is for him. It only made me wonder if one the food here isn't good enough for their workers to eat or two I wonder if the cooks are just as sloppy as the bartenders unsanitary actions in front customers.

When this place first opened everything was good, everybody talked about this place. Thinking everything was still good I ordered  fish sandwich with 1/2 dozen shrimp, the fish was overcooked, I asked for pepper n hot sauce they completely ignored my request and gave me dry azz food, I paid $37 for order that was nasty as hell. Never again in my life will I order anything from this place. And I will never recommend this place to anyone

The ambience is good and really cool environment being seated outdoors. We literally came for the doberge cake but that's too sweet for us, especially the sugar coating. The melting chocolate cake is actually better than that. You can tell that the chocolate they use is upscale. The service is alright.

Had the hot turkey sandwich daily special on my last visit. The meat wasn't lunchmeat style, but chunks of turkey breast pulled off a roasted bird.  The coleslaw is homemade and tasty but the best part of any meal here is the pineapple cake...moist, amazing and delicious enough to make me come for a meal just for the dessert!
Was not impressed.   Had a big party but waitress was surly, out of many of the beers on menu, and one meal was messed up twice.   Won't be back. ..

The environment was wonderful and very enjoyable.  The mixed green salad was a delight.  A great blend of flavored.  The lamb shank just fell off the bone with rich flavors.  The grits are creamy and with a sauce which bring together rich flavor of the lamb.  My wife had the trout and it was prepared to perfection.  The service was wonderful.

The beer selection is great as they have roughly 75-100 beers, so they are not far behind HopCat in broad ripple.  The beer is also very cold, much colder than you would generally have.  In regards to pricing expect to pay $5-8 per beer.  In regards to the food, the food was reasonably priced, I compare the food pricing to any other nice casual restaurant at roughly $10-20 per entree.  I had the Peppered Gorgonzola Burger with Truffle Fries which were very tasty and the burger was cooked perfectly.  My fiancée had the chicken bowl and raved about it.  For 2 people to have 2 beers and 2 entrees, it was roughly $65 with tip.

Nice and cozy ambiance.  Food was good soup tomatoe bisque was fantastic!  Lemon drop wasn't as good as I normally have them.  WAiter was super nice and attentive.
Definitely coming back.

We stopped by for lunch this past Friday for a quick lunch. We arrived around 1:00 and it was dead. Over the years this place has changed hands numerous times. I think Momma Mia's could make it though. The staff were very friendly and the food was good. We went with fries and a large half white with ricotta and Margherita. The fries were good, typical frozen with skin on. They were crispy and hot. The cheese whiz was real but it didn't taste fresh, the color was a bit off and wasn't very creamy. Easily overlooked though. The pizza was very good. Everything tasted fresh. The pizza had a nice crunchy crust and it was thin, just like we prefer. The sauce was spot on! Not too sweet but not overly acidic. Just the right amount of sauce too. My only complaint would be the menu listed basil with the white, it didn't come with it. Also, I would have preferred more ricotta. 

Overall though it was a very good pizza for a good value. Hopefully they get a fountain machine! Lol We will for sure stop back in! 4 stars.

Great beer and wine selection, friendly staff, and amazing service. My wife and I stopped in on a whim and grabbed a couple beers and split the Pig Wings. One of the wings came out a little smaller than the rest and neither of us paid it much attention. Two minutes later our waitress brought out another wing and said "One of those was a little small so we made you an extra." That is stellar service!

It's worth mentioning that I noticed one small potential issue and the manager on duty quickly addressed it. Props to him also!

Cool atmosphere with both outdoor and indoor seating in addition to a small 6-seater counter top. The staff were great. I had to try the grilled cheese based on others' recommendations and it was a very delicious choice. However, my friend's lox wasn't very desirable. The lox was served on fresh-baked bread  and it just didn't allow for the lox to be the main star of the dish. 
The cronut is delicious! Am looking forward to more flavor combinations to come out! My friends and I are anxious to head here for a true brunch with mimosas or whatever they end up having on the beverage menu once the liquor license is approved. 
Would have given it 5 stars but because of the lox dish, just marked it down slightly.
Great service at the bar. Great cocktails- Some Like it Hot is spicy indeed. Had the Saturday menu tartare, sea bass, & chick pot pie. All delish - or someone else ate them before us

the BEST food in the area! We've been coming here for years! Everything from the seasoned steak fries to the pork chops is amazing. 
The daily specials are where the creativity of the chef seems to really shine. You can never go wrong ordering off the blackboard. 
The cheesesteak and pulled pork egg rolls are my favorite for a appetizer and the burgers on potato rolls are great too.

A great set of new flavors in Tucson. I enjoy the gumbo, hush puppies, and drunken angel dish they are all fantastic and will surely improve your day. Prices are reasonable. The bar and cocktails are top notch they have a wide variety of house infused alcohols that are delicious. Clearly a lot of though was put into the layout and building of this establishment. The atmosphere is fantastic and it's a great place for casual dining or dates.
Great place! A lot of food and not too pricey definitely enjoyed coming here for our trip from Jersey. The pancakes were amazing. I didn't need syrup. Pouched eggs weren't the best but still good.

Omg! This place is amazing. Great selection of beers. Looks like a dive bar inside but the food is awesome! This place is a great spot to spend a Friday or Saturday night. We got the burger, fish, and hummus plate. Fancier names I can't remember but wow delicious. Food took over an hour but they warned us before hand. I don't drink a lot of beer but I had yummy great fruit beer. I'm more of a liquor kind of gal. Place gets busy! Great spot for drinks!

Very yummy, quaint and pretty on the inside. I would always rather be served than order at a counter, but there was no wait on a Monday afternoon, so that was nice. Had the Princess, the hot chicken was to die for, as was the biscuit and the honey was a nice touch. Enjoyed the lemonade too. Also added a side of potatoes, which were nothing to write home about, and were not very fresh. The only major complaint would be the prices and the hours, $32 for two topped biscuits, one side, and two drinks seems a bit steep, especially for Nashville. Would also be happier if they were open a bit later. Will return, next time for breakfast.

Im not able to judge the actual pizza, because I never got it.  I had a large group of people and we ordered a bunch of food online.  My email confirmation told me it would be there between 26-36 minutes. Almost an  hour later, I called to ask where my order was, only for them to tell me they cancelled it.  Their reason? My phone number was wrong.  Sooo I got a confirmation email, my address is valid, and they already sent me that email so we know that's working. I asked them why they would just randomly cancel my order and not inform me. They didn't have an answer. I told them we all still want our food, so please send it. They told me no, it's now too late to send it.
WORST delivery experience I've had anywhere, ever. Horrible customer service.

I went here for a date in account of a group on.  I'm so glad I had that group on after seeing the full menu.  The Kobe beef sliders and our meals were top notch.  The decor was great considering this restaurant is a docked boat, make sure to reserve weeks ahead for outdoor or riverside seating.

Best Breakfast Spot in Town Not to be Missed. Ruby Slipper was recommended to us by our hotel and did not disappoint.  Great menu with a wide variety of delicious options for both those looking to indulge in a decadent meal and those looking for more health conscious choices.  The place was hopping, but we had not trouble getting a table and never felt rushed to leave.  Gina, our server, was fantastic - attentively refreshing our coffee before we could even notice a need.  Joe, the general manager, checked-in to make certain everything was to our liking.  Could not ask for better service.

Fantastic selection of vegan and vegetarian options! They also have a phenomenal beer list. Plenty of TVs which allowed us to watch the Yankees game while in Indianapolis, that's a bonus. I will be going back tonight knowing I can get some good vegan food there.

This place is SO good. Made a reservation and we were able to be seated almost immediately when we came in. Food was amazing and Sarah W. went above and beyond on our service! Highly recommend this place. :)
Made multiple trips to Guppy's on the Beach during a weeks vacation. Everything we ordered was delicious. I highly recommend the Scallops, the Lobster tail, and the Filet.

First time here.  Fanatic find.  They are a Southern themed restaurant,  so I had to try the Shrimp & Grits.  Winner!
Then we had a special of Veal chop.  Like Butter!!!
Endless Bourbon list ... Wow, rhis is my new Fav.

I love this place, our second time here and I can't wait to be back.  The food is delicious the portions are great size I always have a take home
Box and most importantly the staff!!!! They are amazing, the chef is funny, and so nice to the customers, they really try their best to make you super satisfied!

Clearly, the people who eat here aren't writing reviews. Every time I come here it is busy and people are enjoying their wings in house or carrying it out by the huge brown bag full. I also enjoy the boneless wings here thoroughly. I will even admit that I now crave their wings. You could say I've been here a few times. 

I am a fan of the boneless wing and am not a fan of the super hot. The original hot was too hot for me. However, the mild is just as it is described "For those who want the flavor, without the fireworks." It is very flavorful and goes perfect dipped in their ranch. Their fries are not my favorite, but that's because I don't like steak cut fries. My roommates love the regular bone-in wings, the fries and the ranch. They usually order the Lemon Pepper and the Louisianan Rub. 

Like Terence said, this place does take a little longer than you would think. However, this is actually a good thing. They cook the wings once your order them, hand toss them, and serve them up for you. The first time I went to leave, I was pretty confused because there is not a trash can like you would find at most counter service places. The staff pics up after you and cleans the table in between each customer, and they aren't slow about it, which means there is never a dirty table.

Melvin was great! Genuinely nice guy - easy going and took great care of us! We took advantage of the online waitlist and were seated quickly after we arrived at our quoted time. Great food! The restaurant was very busy but everyone was working hard and made it great! Awesome way to start the day!

In town for our first visit and my boss suggested this place for dinner. Awesome location right on the Riverwalk in Tampa. We had reservations which was great because walk-in quotes were 60+ mins. 

Menu is available online but ranges from steak to fish and everything in between.  Wine list is not to be missed. The owners don't believe in jacking up their bottle prices, wow was that refreshing!

Only knock on the place is the servers were a little too eager to clear plates and glassware. At first it was comical but by the end of the meal it was frustrating.

Bonefish Grill is a regular stop for me, it's right by my house and consistently has good food. Of course they're known for their seafood, but their steaks are good, and the Fontina Chop is the best pork chop I've ever had.

I love the fresh fish selections, the sauces you can choose from, and all the sides! The au gratin potatoes are to die for, and the succotash is delicious too. They make a mean corn chowder that they put fresh crab on, they have awesome salads, and one of my favorite appetizers - bang-bang shrimp.

BTW, they also do take-out well. They take care of you while you wait and everything is packed away nicely.

I highly reccomend!

Have been looking for fresh, local, and organic options in Nashville. The SIlly Goose was on the top of the list to try and it did not disappoint. I was hoping for a few moe vegetarian options and from that list was a bit picky. 

They are great about updating menus and announcements via facebook and their ice cream looks divine. 

Will definitely be returning in the future.

We went there on a Tuesday night while we were around and my husband wanted the chicken & waffles, but unfortunately that's only for brunch. We tried the gnocchi, and the brussel sprouts for appetizer. The gnocchi was okay, a little salty for me. The brussel sprouts were really good!! Totally recommend. 
Since there was no waffle & chicken, my husband settled for the southern fried chicken and it was a good portion definitely but not amazing. We got the Mac and cheese with it, and I thought it was okay. Nothing special in my opinion. We also got the bianca pizza and I was not impressed. It was kind of bland in my opinion. 
Idk if we'd go back for dinner, although it was really nice outdoor seating. We would come for the brunch to give it a shot.

We went back for brunch and I'm going to stick to my first rating. The fried chicken is very dry, waffle was hard, the biscuit was too small for the size of the chicken. We did enjoy the appetizer, which was the deviled eggs and the tomatoe appetizer. Nice vibe, great outdoor seating, but don't know if we'll be going back to this place or recommend it to anyone.
The Sunday brunch was really good and they have a nice selection. Our waiter was nice too. We had of about 20 or more ppl too, we made sure he was tipped well too.

Nice bar, went for dinner tonight.   Good beer selection.    Service was average as was the food.    Meat and three was ok, but not worth the price.    Sandwich was on grocery store buns, also average.    Overall, good atmosphere with average food.

Hey. I'm from east coast. Out here for a meeting. Saw bad reviews and questioned coming here. Did anyway. It was 6 star. They turned 3tvs to our game. Bartender carrie kept our beers  beers full and us entertained.

Ruby's is another one of my absolute favorite '50s diners (and from reading my reviews of Nifty Fifty's, Back 2 The 50's, etc., you all very well know how much I LOVE '50s diners and anything from that decade) and being there inspires me as to how I want to decorate my kitchen when I have my own house--lots of red, vinyl, chrome, and best of all, Coca Cola paraphernalia adorns the diner's walls.  The best part--the food is great and satisfies my cravings very well.  Haven't had one of their milkshakes in a very long time but that is one of their signature menu items and there are tons of different flavors.  Unfortunately, it's not very often that I go to King of Prussia (only once or twice a year if I'm lucky) so consequently I don't get to go to Ruby's as much as I'd like to...I just wish they'd open one closer to Philly!

The service was good, but the food was meh.  Surf and turf was way over-cooked from veggie to crab, shrimp and steak.  There are way too many lights on for dinner time.  And the decore is so 80's that a dimmer switch would definitely add a half star.

Great ambiance, but the bartender was pretty much useless if you wanted anything not on her menu of six classics. How can you work in a bar that specializes in classic cocktails and not know how to make a sazerac?

4 stars = for the cheese pizza that was delicious
3 stars = for the service towards the end of our visit

We went here Friday night after the Sixers game and had a happy hour. The waitress was happy to take care of us even with the Happy Hour options. We all ordered food, drinks, and shots. We were there for over an hour. But I had asked for her to split the bill between a few people because we had a large group and she had such an attitude about it. I think such an attitude that she put predetermined gratuity on it. Which I get, there was 8 people sitting at the table. But only 5 people ordered food, drinks, and shots. I was the only one that paid cash and she didn't even give me my change back. It was only $2, but that's not the point. Be honest, waitress... BE HONEST.

We've also gotten their cheesesteak egg rolls a dozen times and they are pretty tasty. You only get 4 pieces and it's $11 so it's overpriced but I guess when you've been drinking, it doesn't matter!

Great wings and many flavors to choose from.  The buffet is never really anything great.  Just something to fill up on but they usually offer 3 different flavors to choose from. Wednesdays are bike nights and it gets very crowded.

Candles light the entire place - and by that, I mean there are mason jars hanging down throughout the restaurant lighting the entire bar and restaurant.  Of course, this makes for a low level of light, but it's perfect for what they're trying to do, I think.
