You step in and are greeted by well dressed men and women waiters and service is the key element of the experience.  We stood near the bar and expected to have to go to the bar to get drinks.  However, within two minutes of showing up, a server came by to ask about our drinks and food - which were served promptly.  

I had the Kolsch beer and others tried the cocktails and Pilsner - all were incredible.  The bar itself has well dressed bar tenders and all the drinks are written on chalk boards.  It definitely creates a vibe that is more to the speakeasy vibe than the traditional Philadelphia Bar experience.  This is a great variety to add and encouragement for this great city to be claiming its place in the Top 5 most populated U.S. cities with the nightlife to match.

Since it was Saturday, there was a band.  It was retro 20s and was a full-on brass band complete with over-the-top witty songs.

Definitely a great spot and highly recommend checking it out.

this is not the most gourmet restaurant, but if you want awesome burgers and good cold beer this is the place.  Their sausage and beef burger is to die for.  Great wait staff and depending on the weather eating on the patio is wonderful. Highly recommended for a casual nigh out.

When cake bake opened it's first location we had just moved to Boston. I was very excited to have a girls day with my friends and our babies now that we moved back to Indiana and get to see what all the hype was about. 

The ambiance was gorgeous and felt like an Alice in wonderland vibe. The staff were very friendly and attentive to us. 

The food prices were steep and were more comparable to east coast prices for lunch. The food was average and just ok. My chicken salad sandwich only has a thin smear of actually chicken salad and was mostly croissant, which was disappointing. 

But, I knew they were known for their cake and not their food. So I was excited to order some cake and take some home to my family to enjoy. One of the pieces I ordered was the pixie cake. When my husband, who has never turned down sweets in his life, tried the cake he took one bite and said he couldn't possible eat another bite because it was the driest cake he had ever had. The cake tasted very old and like it was left uncovered and out for a long time. The icing and cake itself had zero flavor. 

When I called to let the restaurant know, they said they would pull the cake from the line so no one else would be served it and then hung up on me before I could ask for my credit card to be refunded. The prices are too high for the cake to not be edible. 

My husband called them right back and asked to speak to a manager. The manager was very professional and said they would mail us a gift card. So we will see if we get it in the mail.

So I can see by the latest Reviews that a much needed tune up by Management and possibly by the Owner is needed. So apparently my Cashier, Raeisha is not aware of Yelp or the fact that she gives you a receipt encouraging feed back. Apparently she was having a very bad day, or week, or month and possibly a very bad year. Absolutely the worst attitude I have seen in some time. No smile, no, "May I help you"  "Next in line" not even a "Next". We just looked at each other to see who would blink first. She won. I ordered asking her how's hey day was going? Not a thing. "Don't want to be here huh"  I asked? Nothing. Now normally I would just keep on going until she said something but I decided that I would take them up on the free Sandwich giving my honest opinion. Good Service and obviously good Employees are hard to find since Raeisha still has a job working the register of all places. I think I'm done with this location for a while. If I were to go back and had the displeasure of seeing Raeisha at the register I would about face and head home to eat Top Ramen. To Management, "The customer may not always be right but they are always the customer". Deuces.

Executive Chef, John Adams has done it again! By 'tweaking' the menu at Salt, he has elevated the food to the next level. The chowder is outstanding with so many layers of flavors and the lobster orrechetti may be the best ever?!  Thank you!

This is the best bbq ever. Their chef is a bbq artist. Although I have to admit I have only had the ribs and wings. I men, what else do you need? They have a variety of sauces that are tasty but I'm telling you that this meat will not need it. Dry rubbed (ribs can be opted sauced), perfectly smoked, falls off the bone and just plain PHENOMENAL. They also have amazing vinegar slaw (there is a creamy option but I have not tried it) and potato salad. They have $2 bbq taco Tuesdays and the 2nd Sunday of every month they do a seafood boil, (broil?) It's a casual little southside pub with a great back patio and you can play washers while enjoying their patio bar. They also do shuttles to games. I feel I should mention the service. It seems to be a little spotty. Things can get slow and you may have to go hunt down a server but it's really not that big of a deal. Mos def not enough to keep me away. This place is all around awesome. Check it out. You will not be disappointed!

Ok I'm mixed in my opinions here. I've always had the food to go, and it's been good. We decided to eat in the restaurant today. We got the 30-pack with original, BBQ, and teriyaki, all in boneless. They were out of blue cheese dressing, which is a huge BOO because I love it with my wings. But ranch will do in a pinch. 

The wings were good. I mean... Besides the teriyaki which is my son's favorite for whatever reason- I think that flavor is terrible! I like their fries and the BBQ wings are my favorite. 

So we are just eating our way through all this food and all of a sudden I bite into a BBQ wing and there's a big green weird clump in it. I don't know what this is, I spit out my mouthful before I have a chance to even chew it once I see the green. Upon really close inspection, it looks a little like a piece of artichoke? Imbedded in chicken though? So weird. I still have no idea what it could have been.  

But huge kudos to the manager, whose name my husband cannot remember. My husband brought the offending wing to the front counter and the manager was summoned. He apologized profusely and offered to buy our next meal here. He explained that the boneless wings come pre-breaded and frozen, which makes sense. 

So we will be coming back again. The weird chicken wing was a fluke and he handled it gracefully.

The waitress took her sweet time looking at us and taking 10 minutes to get us our drink order. Keep in mind that is AFTER we flagged some guy down to get us a server. Horrible service. The prices aren't bad, but the food is definitely not worth the prices... For a cocktail place, they don't have much of a selection.... Mediocre atmosphere.

LOVED IT!!!! Seriously, we enjoyed the whole experience. The staff was friendly, the restaurant seemed super clean and the food was amazing! Rumor has it they are taking the Beat Claw French Toast off of the menu: that would be a travesty. It was wonderful. One of the best things I've ever had for breakfast and I am not exaggerating. I highly recommend the Black Bear Diner and I recommend they open one in Memphis!

My sister had been raving about a certain tofu dish she ate here a few months ago, so when I came for a visit we had to check it out.  We started out our meal with an apricot sour and a winter sazerac off the cocktail menu, though I will note Mesh does seem to have a sizable wine list.

Moving forward, we decided to split two appetizers and one entree between the two of us.  We chose the calamari with red pepper aioli (which she had before and enjoyed), the tuna with cold mango soba noodles, and the aforementioned tofu entree.  The calamari was served with a lettuce salad and tossed in the aioli, which very possibly was a sriracha mayo.  It was tasty, but I'd expect more from a restaurant of this caliber.  The tuna was also delicious and served with a bit of sriracha on the side.   The  chef is really loves that stuff.  I love it too, but not in every dish!

For our entree, the staff was attentive enough to bring me a fresh knife as well as plate the tofu on two separate dishes. The tofu was grilled nicely and the accompanying asparagus, tomatoes, balsamic sauce, and four-mushroom strudel were all very good.  It was a savory, earthy dish (and no sriracha!).  

Mesh seems to want to be perceived as a fancy fine dining establishment but doesn't quite make it in several categories.  However, the prices reflect what they do, so I left satisfied.

Got stuck into going to this restaurant on 2 nights  since it was closest to hotel.  Not by choice did I return!
Food was all bland and blah.  Salads were very disappointing and the 2nd night my mom couldn't even eat her steak.  I told her to return it but she didn't.
Somehow on the 2nd night, the food got wayy worse than on the first night we were there (again, not that it was good the first visit).

Surprisingly we had much better food at our hotel restaurant.

But if you want a drink and to sit outside on their nice patio with great views, this place is certainly great for that.

The place may be over-rated, I would like to give a 3 star (4/4/2015). We ordered Tugboat with tomato and Yolo with soft egg on the top. The bread part of Tugboat was very good, though I personally felt the overall dish was too creamy, especially with non-veggie topping (I'm glad I chose tomato). Soft eggs for both dishes came out too hard. Yolo was also a tad too fatty for me. A good thing was that even though it is more like a fast food place, a staff came out and check if we were happy with the foods. Points for friendly service!

Absolutely fantastic! You have to ask for the daily specials! $5.95 for 3 eggs, 3 huge strips of bacon, toast and extra crispy sliced potatoes! Best breakfast I've had this close to the beach.  Quick service.

I LOVE this place. The vibe is great, couch are comfy, and staff is sweet. I came one last semester to grab some coffee, but this semester have spent a good deal of my funds on this place. All of their smoothies are amazing and are my go to, so I can't say much about the food but my friend has gotten their Grilled Cheese on a Croissant and loved it. The only negative comment I will make is one day I saw there was a curly-haired African American girl intimidating/belittling/ making smart comments to the tiny white girl ringing people up. She was being rude right in front of a line of customers and loud to the point where I was on the couch with headphones and had to turn around and look. Really unprofessional, I understand if the girl made a mistake by not putting the name on the persons cup but seriously pull it back. (Also want to notate this is an unbiased review not race related as well as I am African American myself). But other than that, both the tiny white girl, and the AA woman have been great in all other experiences.

Went for brunch and I don't have a bad thing to say.  Portions were generous, food was cooked to perfection and delicious, service was great, and my mimosa was strong.  Everyone in the group all agreed that their food was delicious.  4 entrees, 5 drinks cost $75.00.  Good deal!   We will be back!
This location has probably the best customer service of any restaurant I've ever been to. Bill was our waiter and he is such a kind person.

Holy MOLY!!! I can't believe we waited so long to eat here. My partner and I have been in Philly for a year and a half and we've always passed this place, never stopping, but always wondering. Well, today was the day!!! On this rainy day with a chill in the air, this place was the perfect spot for a coma inducing brunch... but of the good kind!!! 
The Breakfast Bomb with chorizo and a side of home fries was INCREDIBLE!!! And my honey got the Honey Cristo... WOW!!! Just all together great flavor combinations!!!!! Will definitely be returning again and putting friends and our Air BnB guests on to this place.

One of my favorite places to eat, not just at International Mall but in Tampa! The food is always delicious, and as a gluten free diner there are several g free options and they are always more than happy to accommodate me with any food changes/substitutions. This past visit I started with the French onion soup sans bread, it was still just as tasty and was loaded with melty gooey cheese. For my main entrée I had the nicoise salad, which is absolutely delicious and includes perfectly seasoned and cooked salmon. Of course I can't come here without ordering the fries, the best in town! They come with a kalamata olive aioli that I could eat with a spoon. Although I didn't order any cocktails on this visit, their wine and cocktail is list is impressive and quite yummy! In addition to the superb food, the service here is outstanding. Even during the busy lunch hour we received our meals quickly and were checked on frequently. Our server Michael took great care of us and even made sure to bring my one year old's kid's meal to the table as soon as it was ready.

Co worker recommended we try this and now that we have he says we are part of the club. When you first walk in it seems run down but don't let that stop you!!  The food was sooooo good and you will not leave hungry!!  My husband ordered the chef salad and for the money with the size definitely worth it.  He wanted the beef and noodles but they didn't have any so he settled for the Salisbury steak. The meat patties were just your ordinary patties but the gravy made the meal.  He got the Mac and cheese and fries with it. I loved the fried pork chops. I got the green beans, mashed potatoes and an extra side of Mac and cheese. The pork chops were so thick and moist. There was enough there that I had full portions for lunch the next day and just as yummy warmed up.  My husband ordered extra pork chops (accidentally ordered 2 portions, so 4 chops) to go for his lunch.  All of that food for less that $40 and it was worth every penny!!

Wow, this place is nothing but extraordinary! The food was amazing! The service was spectacular the delivery was on point thanks to Zach! They literally went above and beyond expectations, if you're hungry or have munchies this is the "it". Had a good experience would definitely do business at this place.

This was my husband and I's first yelp event, and we had a wonderful time! I'll let him post his own thoughts :) But, for myself I thoroughly enjoyed the experience. I love Blind Onion pizza so I was thrilled to be able to try Wild Garlic, and at such a fun event. 
First off, I absolutely love the location! I have always found that little area next to the pioneer center very inviting, especially for places such as Wild Garlic. When I walked in, I was surprised at how many people were present, but excited because I know it's good for the business. Our group had a table off to the side and it was perfect for us. We were joined by a fellow yelper we hadn't met and conversation flowed nicely. 
Michael and the Yelp team were extremely kind and welcoming, answering any questions we had. They did a wonderful job setting up the event. The only downside was that there wasn't enough seating for everyone to sit down at once, so we were all shuffling and switching back and forth while we ate. 
Owner Dean was a pleasure to have at the event and did a wonderful job at hosting and informing the guests of his story of how Wild Garlic came to be. It was thrilling to hear the story of the Honey, because I personally never understood it, but love it! Now, I will enjoy it even more! His staff at Wild Garlic were also very kind and friendly. They did an excellent job of keeping the food stocked and guests happy. The only suggestion there would be perhaps a double-sided serving station and labels on what food was what. 
It was extremely fun having all of the yelp swag on the tables and rummaging through it, we also had the experience of coloring the Wild Garlic logo and it was exciting to see how everyone had a different perspective of it. 
The food was excellent! The garlic knots were definitely my favorite! But, it was wonderful that we got to sample everything: wings, salad, knots, pizza, & paninis. Each item was absolutely delicious!

The onion rings. The onion rings. Oh my god, THE ONION RINGS. Nothing can prepare you for these crispy, crunchy, razor-thin, just-greasy-enough little salty pieces of heaven. Even if you aren't normally a fan of onion rings, you have got to try them at least once. And certainly if you're turned off by the usual thick-cut, overly-battered ones that end up falling apart, these will be a revelation to you. Do be advised: the two of us got a large order, because we love onion rings in general, and were sure a small wouldn't be enough to share without resentments. But the basket she brought out was gigantic, and even after freaking out over how amazing they were and being quite gluttonous (they arrived before the poboy), we had barely made a dent. I couldn't bare to let the rest go to waste, so we packed them to go, thinking to recrisp them later in the oven. But when we tried them straight out of the fridge that night, some sort of fried food miracle had apparently occurred - they were even crispier, and possibly even better than before.

And oh yeah, they serve poboys here too ;) We got the 12" French fry, cheddar cheese, and roast beef gravy poboy to split, and I guess it was because of all the fillings, but that thing was kind of a train wreck - tasty, but I think in the future I'd prefer not to have to eat a bunch of my sandwich in salad form, using a fork to get the fillings from where they'd fallen all over the paper wrapper. Other customers nearby with more modest poboys didn't have this problem, so next time I think I'll leave out the fries (which didn't add anything to write home about, anyway) and have a more manageable experience.

Yummy! We had the Chilean Sea Bass! Don't be afraid to order anything here! Last call for inside the restaurant is 12 am. Outside bar is open until 2am!
This is an Eclectic Global restaurant! Fabulous!

Worst experience ever!!!!!  Came here for Christmas dinner everyone got their steaks and I sit here with nothing. After 10 min everyone is eating and I received half my dinner. My lobster tail is missing and my steak is the small not the large I ordered. This place is has always been bad this is the ultimate crappy place. No one has been back to find out if we need anything. My husband had to get up and go into the kitchen to find our waitress along with the rest of the wait staff in back having a party.  After my husband went back I finally got my lobster tail and it was cold.  I sent everything back because everyone is done eating and I just got my food. The manager came over and kept repeating everyone makes mistakes. Yeah people do but everyone ate and after 20 min they bring my food.  Omg. Please save yourself the aggravation and BAD service.   I will NEVER come here again and will be telling everyone I know about this place.

First of all, I checked out this place before I looked at its reviews.  Frankly, I was quite surprised at the reviews I read...

Expensive? LMAO!  I have a family of six, four kids, myself and my wife.  We spent LESS than $40 on our entire meal.  Not only that, we were given large portions.

Honestly, I dont care about the fact that the place was featured on Diners Drive-ins and Dives.  That doesn't make the restuarant.  What makes the restaurant  great is the people, the atmosphere and the food and The Gold-N-Silver has all three.  On top of all of that, its LOCALY OWNED AND OPERATED!  With times like these we should be doing MORE to support our local businesses.

I will come back here to support it and enjoy its food until I move away.  I'll support this place over Denny's or IHop ANY day.

We have been wanting to come here for awhile now, but it seems every time we try it's on a Friday night and this place is too packed to get a seat for at least half an hour (but that led me to believe this place must be greeeeeat!).  

This past Saturday, it was a beautiful day outside, which meant a quick Yelp search for a place nearby with a patio--and lunch at TCB it was!

We started with the artichoke dip (which honestly, I was a little skeptical about because I feel like I've had it a million times before).  But somehow, someway Thunder Canyon seems to have revamped your standard artichoke dip.  And I love how it comes with loads of veggies, while the dip is served in a bread bowl...GENIUS! We then split the pork schnitzel. And I will preface this by saying, along with a lot of movies people think I should like, but do not, there are also certain foods people think I should like, but do not.  And lo & behold pork schnitzel is one of those foods.  I'm sure any "normal" human being would absolutely love it (as my boyfriend did) but it just wasn't my cup of tea.  But with that being said, pretty much everything else was (shout out to the $3 house margs on Saturdays and delicious IPA). We will definitely be back soon!

I was really skeptical about Reno. They're not exactly known for the food, and IMHO, any city that calls itself the "biggest small city", or something like that is not to be trusted. 

I really didn't know what to expect from my first restaurant in Reno, the Twisted Fork, but at least I can get a good sandwich. The menu is a good mix of tried-and-true and old favorites with a twist. There's a traditional Short Rib Grilled Cheese with melty cheddar and soft meat with a creamy hint of horseradish, but there is also a memorable Tiger Shrimp Tamal. I love tamales, and this one would have been great even without the tender jumbo shrimp. The corn is so finely-ground, and it finishes sweet over a lake of garlic cream that I can only describe as liquid crack.

A sweet, pretty restaurant serving food that makes me smile. My first meal in Reno, and what a great way to start!

I recently went to Edgehill for dinner for the first time and was welcomed with an updated, fresh, and welcoming atmosphere. The recent renovation made it feel very comfortable for a casual meal or dress up a bit for a nice dinner. The newly inspired dinner menu by a hot new Nashville chef in town did not disappoint! I had shark for the first time and it was cooked perfectly with a fabulous squash purée that had me wanting to lick my plate clean. Definitely opt for the side of brussel sprouts to share for the table. One of my favorites was the Kentucky Fall coffee drink at the end of my meal. I am eager to return for their updated brunch menu soon!

Wow, This place rocks!  There is always a line, but it moves fast and the roast pork is delicious. I liked it so much I went twice in two days.  I got take out for me and some friends.  The sandwiches are very large and we had them cut in half and split sandwiches with adults, the portions are large enough.  We were staying at the hotel next door, so it was easy to grab a bite to go and eat in the hotel bar.  

I wish they had beer to go, but alas I found another spot in the Terminal that has this, so life was much better!

I don't think I'll be going back here-unless I just want some beer and fries. They DO have a great selection of microbrews at reasonable prices and have their own brew made by Tempe's Fourpeaks. Their food is slightly above average, but you get smaller portions at higher prices. My burger was not exceptional...dry bread...and it's one of those places you pay for add-ons....I think I'd rather try something new than to return here.

Stumbled upon this place in search of dessert - it was a busy Saturday night, but everyone was welcoming and friendly even though we didn't have reservations. We tried the blue cheese flan and bread pudding-both were excellent. Duck fat rye is . Our servers even worked to accommodate a last minute brunch reservation for Sunday morning. Will definitely become a regular spot here in NOLA.

Disappointing, these days. Many servers standing around while we waited, spoiled wine served that tasted as if it had been sitting out open in the sun for hours, and thick heavy bread on a sandwich that used to have light crunchy toasted bread in a previous incarnation. The number of fake smiles on the servers is growing. It doesn't look as if the people enjoy working there. Food was still pretty decent, as the cooks are the same since we started going there, but the servers keep changing. Service, once they noticed us, was good enough, but it does appear to be slipping in quality.

Baxter's is a "Cheers" type bar and restaurant. Everybody knows everybody. Patrick and Patrice are the Friday night team that give great service. The food is consistently good. On Friday night they even put out free pizza after the kitchen closes for the bar crowd. We go several Friday's a month and always have a great time.
Used to be a great place. Shame to see what it's become. Absurd, arbitrary price jumps and a sudden loss of creativity. Martha - wtf happened to you?

I have been here multiple times and I must implore you to try it if you are ever in the area. The food is spectacular!  I recently had an amazing risotto which was just too perfect. I love their hummus and baked macaroni and cheese. Service is top notch and they have events during the week which you should check out at-least once. Price is 100& justified by the quality of the food, the beautiful presentation and the overall dining experience at Karla's!

My husband and I went here one rainy Friday night, hoping against hope that we'd get a table and be able to have a beer without too much of a hassle. It is NoLibs, and it was a Friday night....

I guess the rain was our reprieve because this place was nearly empty. Some peopel at the bar, and a table of the owner's friends in the corner, and us. 

I was impressed with their beer list, and the server (Can't remember her name: blonde, glasses) was awesome, attentive, and gave good reccomendations.

I was admiring a plate of...something...the table behind us had ordered. The server told us it was a special order b/c they were the owner's friends. "Fried pickles." My husband and I commented on how good they looked and smelled and we continued drinking our beer. 

5 minutes later, here comes the chef to our table with our own plate of fried pickles. On the house. They were awesome. Big thick slices of tart pickle with a just-thick-enough golden brown coating. THere was a honey-mustard type sauce that went with them. It tasted very home made to me. 5 stars for the fried pickles and 10 stars for the "you didn't have to do that" niceness of the staff.

We got food to go because I believe firmly in judging a restaurant's food by its reheatability :) I got the lamb sliders. He got the cheeseburger. We both got stuffed with awesome food that if it tasted that good at room temperature 2 hours later, I can't imagine how awesome it must've tasted fresh out the kitchen.

The lamb sliders were perfectly cooked. I know sliders...and you tend to either get a raw meatball on a bun, or a hockey puck. These were perfectly charred on the outside and nice and pink inside. The buns were tasty and golden brown. The fries were good and the burger...well, let's say I wish my stomach could hold twice its capacity.

Awesome first time experience here. We will definitely come again. Staff was great and outstanding and out of their way nice without being hokey or fake about it. Food is delish, beer list is extensive. Want to eat more of their food....

If I can give zero stars I would. My family and I just went in there and ordered a large pizza and the tower of wings. We wanted to get an appetizer and the waitress said "to be honest with you , you guys ordered a lot of food, you don't need an appetizer) We were in absolute disbelief that it literally left a bad taste in our mouths. The lady brings us the pizza, it was thin crust. Wings were so soggy. We asked for them extra crispy. The waitress was absolutely so rude after we sent the food back. They were not going to make fresh wings. They were just going to re fire them with the sauce already on it. How disgusting. She said that they could put it under a heat lamp until the pizza almost done but she highly doubt that we wanted that. She just kept making assumptions of what we would want. She had an attitude and we told her to forget it, we're leaving. She should not be a waitress at all. We told her that we didn't appreciate her attitude towards us and the comment she made. She responded "OK that's fine, I was trying to save you guys money". The amount of disrespect this place has serving is so unreal. So unprofessional. Do not eat here. Waitress has green/blue hair in the ponytail.

Completely offended by the management and staff here. Was refused service because we were not dressed according to their "business casual" attire which is clearly NOT stated anywhere on their premises. Of course we were told about this dress code after they gladly accepted our $10 for valet parking. Would not recommend to anyone.

Had a great time with friends.....The food was great as were the drinks.  My favorite dish of night were the sprouts.   Really tasty? It was busy but the servers were really nice and friendly and kept things moving along.

This is a place off the beaten path but once you find it you will want to keep coming back! It feels very warm and cozy inside, full bar, perfect for a date night out or hanging out with friends. Prices for dinner are a little more expensive than the average bar but the food is that of fine dining. The sandwiches and appetizers are where its at!! The burgers are to die for. This is where I take all my friends when they come to visit!

Great food and service. We dined upstairs w/c was more quiet and the ambiance is great. I had the chicken & my wife had the braised beef. We were both happy with what we ordered. Another plus going for them is the free valet service.

this wouldn't be a fair review since it's only based on their HH (4-6pm). and I will update my review accordingly after I come back here again for dinner options. (and I WILL BE BACK! their dinner menu looks amazing!!)

with that being said, I came here solely for the happy hour during the weekday for a quick bite. 

It's a beautiful place inside very upscale and luxurious looking (It would be great for a date night).
Service was GREAT and our server made sure he came back right before 6 pm (end of HH) to make sure we got everything we needed. 

Here's what we got from their HH menu:
Smoked chicken tacos - very good seasoning but chicken was very very dry
Local tomato salad - not bad but nothing special. good size though
Boundary Burger - average burger
one-buck oysters - this alone I would give 5 stars. It was very fresh and delicious. 
they do have $5/glass for wine which is always nice.

I would give 3 stars for their HH menu but their AMAZING oysters brings it up to 4 stars, otherwise, food was a-Ok.

I would come back again for HH for the oysters + good wine, also It's nice to be able to do HH everywhere in the restaurant not just the bar area. and it was not crowded at all. 

however, they do seem to have very nice menu for dinner / cocktails and I'm a huge seafood fan so I'll be back to update my review on this place again.

Food is a four but parking is a one
Sam's Goleta totals out to a three. Unless you can walk then it's a five since you'll burn off the yummy sandwich on the way back to the office.

Very friendly family serving up great sandwiches made to order. I lean toward a medium #11with cotto salami, mortadella, genoa, capicola and provolone. 

Service with a big smile while the TV is usually on soccer 
On a business lunch, enjoy a very limited selection of beer in the bottle.
Parking in the back is limited and full at lunch. I usually double park and run in. 

My advice is to get Sam's To Go and roll to the beach. Relax with your good food and enjoy life. You deserve it.

Best wings ever! And pizza! And burgers. Lol. You get the point. The happy hour specials are good and service is always friendly! It's a nice sit at the bar, have a conversation on a Sunday afternoon type of place.
